Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶחָ֜ד מִן־הָרָמָתַ֛יִם צוֹפִ֖ים מֵהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וּשְׁמ֡וֹ אֶ֠לְקָנָ֠ה בֶּן־יְרֹחָ֧ם בֶּן־אֱלִיה֛וּא בֶּן־תֹּ֥חוּ בֶן־צ֖וּף אֶפְרָתִֽי׃
Translated: There was a man from Ramathaim of the Zuphites, in the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Elkanah son of Jeroham son of Elihu son of Tohu son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.
Transliteration: vayehiy iysh echad min-haramatayiim tsvofiym mehar eferayiim ushemvo elekanah ven-yerocham ven-eliyhu ven-tochu ven-tsuf eferatiy

Hebrew: וְלוֹ֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֔ים שֵׁ֤ם אַחַת֙ חַנָּ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית פְּנִנָּ֑ה וַיְהִ֤י לִפְנִנָּה֙ יְלָדִ֔ים וּלְחַנָּ֖ה אֵ֥ין יְלָדִֽים׃
Translated: He had two wives, one named Hannah and the other Peninnah; Peninnah had children, but Hannah was childless.
Transliteration: velvo shetey nashiym shem achat chanah veshem hasheniyt feninah vayehiy lifeninah yeladiym ulechanah eyn yeladiym

Hebrew: וְעָלָה֩ הָאִ֨ישׁ הַה֤וּא מֵֽעִירוֹ֙ מִיָּמִ֣ים <small>׀</small> יָמִ֔ימָה לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֧ת וְלִזְבֹּ֛חַ לַיהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת בְּשִׁלֹ֑ה וְשָׁ֞ם שְׁנֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עֵלִ֗י חׇפְנִי֙ וּפִ֣נְחָ֔ס כֹּהֲנִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: This man used to go up from his town every year to worship and to offer sacrifice to G<small>OD</small> of Hosts at Shiloh.—Hophni and Phinehas, the two sons of Eli, were priests of G<small>OD</small> there.
Transliteration: vealah haiysh hahu meiyrvo miyamiym <small></small> yamiymah lehishetachavot velizevocha layhovah tsevavot veshiloh vesham sheney veney-eliy chׇfeniy ufinechas khohaniym layhovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וַיִּזְבַּ֖ח אֶלְקָנָ֑ה וְנָתַ֞ן לִפְנִנָּ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ וּֽלְכׇל־בָּנֶ֛יהָ וּבְנוֹתֶ֖יהָ מָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: One such day, Elkanah offered a sacrifice. He used to give portions to his wife Peninnah and to all her sons and daughters;
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom vayizevach elekanah venatan lifeninah ishetvo ulekhׇl-vaneyha uvenvoteyha manvot

Hebrew: וּלְחַנָּ֕ה יִתֵּ֛ן מָנָ֥ה אַחַ֖ת אַפָּ֑יִם כִּ֤י אֶת־חַנָּה֙ אָהֵ֔ב וַיהֹוָ֖ה סָגַ֥ר רַחְמָֽהּ׃
Translated: but to Hannah he would give one portion only—though Hannah was his favorite—for G<small>OD</small> had closed her womb.
Transliteration: ulechanah yiten manah achat afayiim khiy et-chanah ahev vayhovah sagar rachemah

Hebrew: וְכִעֲסַ֤תָּה צָרָתָהּ֙ גַּם־כַּ֔עַס בַּעֲב֖וּר הַרְּעִמָ֑הּ כִּֽי־סָגַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּעַ֥ד רַחְמָֽהּ׃
Translated: Moreover, her rival, to make her miserable, would taunt her that G<small>OD</small> had closed her womb.
Transliteration: vekhiasatah tsaratah gam-khaas vaavur hareimah khiy-sagar yehovah vead rachemah

Hebrew: וְכֵ֨ן יַעֲשֶׂ֜ה שָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֗ה מִדֵּ֤י עֲלֹתָהּ֙ בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה כֵּ֖ן תַּכְעִסֶ֑נָּה וַתִּבְכֶּ֖ה וְלֹ֥א תֹאכַֽל׃
Translated: This happened year after year: Every time she went up to the House of G<small>OD</small>, the other would taunt her, so that she wept and would not eat.
Transliteration: vekhen yaasheh shanah veshanah midey alotah veveyt yehovah khen takheisenah vativekheh velo tokhal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָ֜הּ אֶלְקָנָ֣ה אִישָׁ֗הּ חַנָּה֙ לָ֣מֶה תִבְכִּ֗י וְלָ֙מֶה֙ לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְלִ֔י וְלָ֖מֶה יֵרַ֣ע לְבָבֵ֑ךְ הֲל֤וֹא אָֽנֹכִי֙ ט֣וֹב לָ֔ךְ מֵעֲשָׂרָ֖ה בָּנִֽים׃
Translated: Her husband Elkanah said to her, “Hannah, why are you crying and why aren’t you eating? Why are you so sad? Am I not more devoted to you than ten sons?”
Transliteration: vayomer lah elekanah iyshah chanah lameh tivekhiy velameh lo tokheliy velameh eira levavekhe halvo anokhiy tvov lakhe measharah vaniym

Hebrew: וַתָּ֣קׇם חַנָּ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֛י אׇכְלָ֥הֿ בְשִׁלֹ֖ה וְאַחֲרֵ֣י שָׁתֹ֑ה וְעֵלִ֣י הַכֹּהֵ֗ן יֹשֵׁב֙ עַל־הַכִּסֵּ֔א עַל־מְזוּזַ֖ת הֵיכַ֥ל יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: After they had eaten and drunk at Shiloh, Hannah rose.—The priest Eli was sitting on the seat near the doorpost of the temple of G<small>OD</small>.—
Transliteration: vatakׇm chanah acharey ׇkhelahֿ veshiloh veacharey shatoh veeliy hakhohen yoshev al-hakhise al-mezuzat heykhal yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִ֖יא מָ֣רַת נָ֑פֶשׁ וַתִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּבָכֹ֥ה תִבְכֶּֽה׃
Translated: In her wretchedness, she prayed to G<small>OD</small>, weeping all the while.
Transliteration: vehiy marat nafesh vatitefalel al-yehovah uvakhoh tivekheh

Hebrew: וַתִּדֹּ֨ר נֶ֜דֶר וַתֹּאמַ֗ר יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אִם־רָאֹ֥ה תִרְאֶ֣ה ׀ בׇּעֳנִ֣י אֲמָתֶ֗ךָ וּזְכַרְתַּ֙נִי֙ וְלֹא־תִשְׁכַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְנָתַתָּ֥ה לַאֲמָתְךָ֖ זֶ֣רַע אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וּנְתַתִּ֤יו לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֔יו וּמוֹרָ֖ה לֹא־יַעֲלֶ֥ה עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: And she made this vow: “O G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, if You will look upon the suffering of Your maidservant and will remember me and not forget Your maidservant, and if You will grant Your maidservant a child like the others have, I will dedicate it to G<small>OD</small> for all the days of its life; and no razor shall ever touch its head.”
Transliteration: vatidor neder vatomar yehovah tsevavot im-raoh tireeh vׇoniy amatekha uzekharetaniy velo-tishekhach et-amatekha venatatah laamatekha zera anashiym unetatiyv layhovah khׇl-yemey chayayv umvorah lo-yaaleh al-roshvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּ֣י הִרְבְּתָ֔ה לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעֵלִ֖י שֹׁמֵ֥ר אֶת־פִּֽיהָ׃
Translated: As she kept on praying before G<small>OD</small>, Eli watched her mouth.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy hirevetah lehitefalel lifeney yehovah veeliy shomer et-fiyha

Hebrew: וְחַנָּ֗ה הִ֚יא מְדַבֶּ֣רֶת עַל־לִבָּ֔הּ רַ֚ק שְׂפָתֶ֣יהָ נָּע֔וֹת וְקוֹלָ֖הּ לֹ֣א יִשָּׁמֵ֑עַ וַיַּחְשְׁבֶ֥הָ עֵלִ֖י לְשִׁכֹּרָֽה׃
Translated: Now Hannah was praying in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice could not be heard. So Eli thought she was drunk.
Transliteration: vechanah hiy medaveret al-livah rak shefateyha navot vekvolah lo yishamea vayachesheveha eliy leshikhorah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ עֵלִ֔י עַד־מָתַ֖י תִּשְׁתַּכָּרִ֑ין הָסִ֥ירִי אֶת־יֵינֵ֖ךְ מֵעָלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Eli said to her, “How long will you make a drunken spectacle of yourself? Sober up!”
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha eliy ad-matay tishetakhariyn hasiyriy et-eiynekhe mealayiikhe

Hebrew: וַתַּ֨עַן חַנָּ֤ה וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֲדֹנִ֔י אִשָּׁ֤ה קְשַׁת־ר֙וּחַ֙ אָנֹ֔כִי וְיַ֥יִן וְשֵׁכָ֖ר לֹ֣א שָׁתִ֑יתִי וָאֶשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And Hannah replied, “Oh no, my lord! I am a very unhappy woman. I have drunk no wine or other strong drink, but I have been pouring out my heart to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vataan chanah vatomer lo adoniy ishah keshat-rucha anokhiy veyayiin veshekhar lo shatiytiy vaeshefokhe et-nafeshiy lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־אֲמָ֣תְךָ֔ לִפְנֵ֖י בַּת־בְּלִיָּ֑עַל כִּֽי־מֵרֹ֥ב שִׂיחִ֛י וְכַעְסִ֖י דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: Do not take your maidservant for a worthless woman; I have only been speaking all this time out of my great anguish and distress.”
Transliteration: al-titen et-amatekha lifeney vat-veliyaal khiy-merov shiychiy vekhaesiy divaretiy ad-henah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן עֵלִ֛י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְכִ֣י לְשָׁל֑וֹם וֵאלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל יִתֵּן֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣לָתֵ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁאַ֖לְתְּ מֵעִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Then go in peace,” said Eli, “and may the God of Israel grant you what you have asked.”
Transliteration: vayaan eliy vayomer lekhiy leshalvom velohey yisherael yiten et-shelatekhe asher shaalete meimvo

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר תִּמְצָ֧א שִׁפְחָתְךָ֛ חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וַתֵּ֨לֶךְ הָאִשָּׁ֤ה לְדַרְכָּהּ֙ וַתֹּאכַ֔ל וּפָנֶ֥יהָ לֹא־הָֽיוּ־לָ֖הּ עֽוֹד׃
Translated: She answered, “You are most kind to your handmaid.” So the woman left, and she ate, and was no longer downcast.
Transliteration: vatomer timetsa shifechatekha chen veeyneykha vatelekhe haishah ledarekhah vatokhal ufaneyha lo-hayu-lah vod

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣מוּ בַבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲווּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּשֻׁ֛בוּ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־בֵּיתָ֖ם הָרָמָ֑תָה וַיֵּ֤דַע אֶלְקָנָה֙ אֶת־חַנָּ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַֽיִּזְכְּרֶ֖הָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Early next morning they bowed low before GOD, and they went back home to Ramah.
Elkanah knew his wife Hannah and GOD remembered her.
Transliteration: vayashekhimu vavoker vayishetachavu lifeney yehovah vayashuvu vayavou el-veytam haramatah vayeda elekanah et-chanah ishetvo vayizekhereha yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ לִתְקֻפ֣וֹת הַיָּמִ֔ים וַתַּ֥הַר חַנָּ֖ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמוֹ֙ שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁאִלְתִּֽיו׃
Translated: Hannah conceived, and at the turn of the year bore a son. She named him Samuel, meaning, “I asked G<small>OD</small> for him.”
Transliteration: vayehiy litekufvot hayamiym vatahar chanah vateled ven vatikera et-shemvo shemuel khiy meyehovah sheiletiyv

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַל הָאִ֥ישׁ אֶלְקָנָ֖ה וְכׇל־בֵּית֑וֹ לִזְבֹּ֧חַ לַיהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־זֶ֥בַח הַיָּמִ֖ים וְאֶת־נִדְרֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when this man Elkanah and all his household were going up to offer to G<small>OD</small> the annual sacrifice and his votive sacrifice,
Transliteration: vayaal haiysh elekanah vekhׇl-veytvo lizevocha layhovah et-zevach hayamiym veet-nidervo

Hebrew: וְחַנָּ֖ה לֹ֣א עָלָ֑תָה כִּֽי־אָמְרָ֣ה לְאִישָׁ֗הּ עַ֣ד יִגָּמֵ֤ל הַנַּ֙עַר֙ וַהֲבִאֹתִ֗יו וְנִרְאָה֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיָ֥שַׁב שָׁ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Hannah did not go up. She said to her husband, “When the child is weaned, I will bring him. For when he has appeared before G<small>OD</small>, he must remain there for good.”
Transliteration: vechanah lo alatah khiy-amerah leiyshah ad yigamel hanaar vahaviotiyv venireah et-feney yehovah veyashav sham ad-volam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהּ֩ אֶלְקָנָ֨ה אִישָׁ֜הּ עֲשִׂ֧י הַטּ֣וֹב בְּעֵינַ֗יִךְ שְׁבִי֙ עַד־גׇּמְלֵ֣ךְ אֹת֔וֹ אַ֛ךְ יָקֵ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־דְּבָר֑וֹ וַתֵּ֤שֶׁב הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ וַתֵּ֣ינֶק אֶת־בְּנָ֔הּ עַד־גׇּמְלָ֖הּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Her husband Elkanah said to her, “Do as you think best. Stay home until you have weaned him. May G<small>OD</small>’s word be fulfilled.” So the woman stayed home and nursed her son until she weaned him.
Transliteration: vayomer lah elekanah iyshah ashiy hatvov veeynayiikhe sheviy ad-gׇmelekhe otvo akhe yakem yehovah et-devarvo vateshev haishah vateynek et-venah ad-gׇmelah otvo

Hebrew: וַתַּעֲלֵ֨הוּ עִמָּ֜הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר גְּמָלַ֗תּוּ בְּפָרִ֤ים שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ וְאֵיפָ֨ה אַחַ֥ת קֶ֙מַח֙ וְנֵ֣בֶל יַ֔יִן וַתְּבִאֵ֥הוּ בֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה שִׁל֑וֹ וְהַנַּ֖עַר נָֽעַר׃
Translated: When she had weaned him, she took him up with her, along with three bulls, one ephah of flour, and a jar of wine. And though the boy was still very young, she brought him to the House of GOD at Shiloh.
Transliteration: vataalehu imah khaasher gemalatu vefariym sheloshah veeyfah achat kemach venevel yayiin vateviehu veyt-yehovah shilvo vehanaar naar

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁחֲט֖וּ אֶת־הַפָּ֑ר וַיָּבִ֥אוּ אֶת־הַנַּ֖עַר אֶל־עֵלִֽי׃
Translated: After slaughtering the bull, they brought the boy to Eli.
Transliteration: vayishechatu et-hafar vayaviu et-hanaar el-eliy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י חֵ֥י נַפְשְׁךָ֖ אֲדֹנִ֑י אֲנִ֣י הָאִשָּׁ֗ה הַנִּצֶּ֤בֶת עִמְּכָה֙ בָּזֶ֔ה לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: She said, “Please, my lord! As you live, my lord, I am the woman who stood here beside you and prayed to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vatomer viy adoniy chey nafeshekha adoniy aniy haishah hanitsevet imekhah vazeh lehitefalel el-yehovah

Hebrew: אֶל־הַנַּ֥עַר הַזֶּ֖ה הִתְפַּלָּ֑לְתִּי וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֥ה לִי֙ אֶת־שְׁאֵ֣לָתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁאַ֖לְתִּי מֵעִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: It was this boy I prayed for; and G<small>OD</small> has granted me what I asked.
Transliteration: el-hanaar hazeh hitefalaletiy vayiten yehovah liy et-sheelatiy asher shaaletiy meimvo

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אָנֹכִ֗י הִשְׁאִלְתִּ֙הוּ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כׇּל־הַיָּמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֔ה ה֥וּא שָׁא֖וּל לַיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ שָׁ֖ם לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: I, in turn, hereby lend him to G<small>OD</small>. For as long as he lives he is lent to G<small>OD</small>.” And they bowed low there before G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vegam anokhiy hisheiletihu layhovah khׇl-hayamiym asher hayah hu shaul layhovah vayishetachu sham layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וַתִּתְפַּלֵּ֤ל חַנָּה֙ וַתֹּאמַ֔ר עָלַ֤ץ לִבִּי֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה רָ֥מָה קַרְנִ֖י בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה רָ֤חַב פִּי֙ עַל־א֣וֹיְבַ֔י כִּ֥י שָׂמַ֖חְתִּי בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
And Hannah prayed:
My heart exults in GOD;
I have triumphed through GOD.
I gloat over my enemies;
I rejoice in Your deliverance.
Transliteration: vatitefalel chanah vatomar alats liviy vayhovah ramah kareniy vayhovah rachav fiy al-voyevay khiy shamachetiy viyshuatekha

Hebrew: אֵין־קָד֥וֹשׁ כַּיהֹוָ֖ה כִּ֣י אֵ֣ין בִּלְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאֵ֥ין צ֖וּר כֵּאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
There is no holy one like GOD,
Truly, there is none beside You;
There is no rock like our God.
Transliteration: eyn-kadvosh khayhovah khiy eyn viletekha veeyn tsur kheloheynu

Hebrew: אַל־תַּרְבּ֤וּ תְדַבְּרוּ֙ גְּבֹהָ֣ה גְבֹהָ֔ה יֵצֵ֥א עָתָ֖ק מִפִּיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י אֵ֤ל דֵּעוֹת֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה (ולא) [וְל֥וֹ] נִתְכְּנ֖וּ עֲלִלֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Talk no more with lofty pride,
Let no arrogance cross your lips!
For the ETERNAL is an all-knowing God,
By whom actions are measured.
Transliteration: al-tarevu tedaveru gevohah gevohah eitse atak mifiykhem khiy el devot yehovah (vl) [velvo] nitekhenu alilvot

Hebrew: קֶ֥שֶׁת גִּבֹּרִ֖ים חַתִּ֑ים וְנִכְשָׁלִ֖ים אָ֥זְרוּ חָֽיִל׃
Translated:
The bows of the mighty are broken,
And the faltering are girded with strength.
Transliteration: keshet givoriym chatiym venikheshaliym azeru chayiil

Hebrew: שְׂבֵעִ֤ים בַּלֶּ֙חֶם֙ נִשְׂכָּ֔רוּ וּרְעֵבִ֖ים חָדֵ֑לּוּ עַד־עֲקָרָה֙ יָלְדָ֣ה שִׁבְעָ֔ה וְרַבַּ֥ת בָּנִ֖ים אֻמְלָֽלָה׃
Translated:
The sated are hired out for bread;
The starving hunger no more.
While the infertile woman bears seven,
The mother of many is forlorn.
Transliteration: sheveiym valechem nishekharu ureeviym chadelu ad-akarah yaledah shiveah veravat vaniym umelalah

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵמִ֣ית וּמְחַיֶּ֑ה מוֹרִ֥יד שְׁא֖וֹל וַיָּֽעַל׃
Translated:
GOD deals death and gives life,
Casts down into Sheol and raises up.
Transliteration: yehovah memiyt umechayeh mvoriyd shevol vayaal

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה מוֹרִ֣ישׁ וּמַעֲשִׁ֑יר מַשְׁפִּ֖יל אַף־מְרוֹמֵֽם׃
Translated:
GOD makes poor and makes rich,
Casts down, and also lifts high—
Transliteration: yehovah mvoriysh umaashiyr mashefiyl af-mervomem

Hebrew: מֵקִ֨ים מֵעָפָ֜ר דָּ֗ל מֵֽאַשְׁפֹּת֙ יָרִ֣ים אֶבְי֔וֹן לְהוֹשִׁיב֙ עִם־נְדִיבִ֔ים וְכִסֵּ֥א כָב֖וֹד יַנְחִלֵ֑ם כִּ֤י לַֽיהֹוָה֙ מְצֻ֣קֵי אֶ֔רֶץ וַיָּ֥שֶׁת עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם תֵּבֵֽל׃
Translated:
Raising the poor from the dust,
Lifting up the needy from the dunghill,
To set them with nobles,
Granting them seats of honor.
For the pillars of the earth belong to GOD,
Who has set the world upon them.
Transliteration: mekiym meafar dal meashefot yariym eveyvon lehvoshiyv im-nediyviym vekhise khavvod yanechilem khiy layhovah metsukey erets vayashet aleyhem tevel

Hebrew: רַגְלֵ֤י חֲסִידָו֙ יִשְׁמֹ֔ר וּרְשָׁעִ֖ים בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ יִדָּ֑מּוּ כִּי־לֹ֥א בְכֹ֖חַ יִגְבַּר־אִֽישׁ׃
Translated:
[God] guards the steps of the faithful,
But the wicked perish in darkness—
For none shall prevail by strength.
Transliteration: rageley chasiydav yishemor ureshaiym vachoshekhe yidamu khiy-lo vekhocha yigevar-iysh

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֞ה יֵחַ֣תּוּ מְרִיבָ֗ו עָלָו֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם יַרְעֵ֔ם יְהֹוָ֖ה יָדִ֣ין אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְיִתֶּן־עֹ֣ז לְמַלְכּ֔וֹ וְיָרֵ֖ם קֶ֥רֶן מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
GOD’s foes shall be shattered—
Thundered against from the heavens.
GOD will judge the ends of the earth—
Giving power to the king,
And triumph to the anointed one.
Transliteration: yehovah eichatu meriyvav alav vashamayiim yareem yehovah yadiyn afesey-arets veyiten-oz lemalekhvo veyarem keren meshiychvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ אֶלְקָנָ֛ה הָרָמָ֖תָה עַל־בֵּית֑וֹ וְהַנַּ֗עַר הָיָ֤ה מְשָׁרֵת֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י עֵלִ֥י הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: Then Elkanah [and Hannah] went home to Ramah; and the boy entered the service of G<small>OD</small> under the priest Eli.
Transliteration: vayelekhe elekanah haramatah al-veytvo vehanaar hayah mesharet et-yehovah et-feney eliy hakhohen

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י עֵלִ֖י בְּנֵ֣י בְלִיָּ֑עַל לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Now Eli’s sons were scoundrels; they paid no heed to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: uveney eliy veney veliyaal lo yadeu et-yehovah

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים אֶת־הָעָ֑ם כׇּל־אִ֞ישׁ זֹבֵ֣חַ זֶ֗בַח וּבָ֨א נַ֤עַר הַכֹּהֵן֙ כְּבַשֵּׁ֣ל הַבָּשָׂ֔ר וְהַמַּזְלֵ֛ג שְׁלֹ֥שׁ הַשִּׁנַּ֖יִם בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: This is how the priests used to deal with the people: Whenever anyone brought a sacrifice, the priest’s boy would come along with a three-pronged fork while the meat was boiling,
Transliteration: umishefat hakhohaniym et-haam khׇl-iysh zovecha zevach uva naar hakhohen khevashel havashar vehamazeleg shelosh hashinayiim veyadvo

Hebrew: וְהִכָּ֨ה בַכִּיּ֜וֹר א֣וֹ בַדּ֗וּד א֤וֹ בַקַּלַּ֙חַת֙ א֣וֹ בַפָּר֔וּר כֹּ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲלֶ֣ה הַמַּזְלֵ֔ג יִקַּ֥ח הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בּ֑וֹ כָּ֚כָה יַעֲשׂ֣וּ לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַבָּאִ֥ים שָׁ֖ם בְּשִׁלֹֽה׃
Translated: and he would thrust it into cauldron, or the kettle, or the great pot, or the small cooking-pot; and whatever the fork brought up, the priest would take away on it. This was the practice at Shiloh with all the Israelites who came there.
Transliteration: vehikhah vakhiyyvor vo vadud vo vakalachat vo vafarur khol asher yaaleh hamazeleg yikach hakhohen vvo khakhah yaashu lekhׇl-yisherael havaiym sham veshiloh

Hebrew: גַּם֮ בְּטֶ֘רֶם֮ יַקְטִר֣וּן אֶת־הַחֵ֒לֶב֒ וּבָ֣א ׀ נַ֣עַר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְאָמַר֙ לָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֹּבֵ֔חַ תְּנָ֣ה בָשָׂ֔ר לִצְל֖וֹת לַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְלֹא־יִקַּ֧ח מִמְּךָ֛ בָּשָׂ֥ר מְבֻשָּׁ֖ל כִּ֥י אִם־חָֽי׃
Translated: [But now] even before the suet was turned into smoke, the priest’s boy would come and say to the party that was sacrificing, “Hand over some meat to roast for the priest; for he won’t accept boiled meat from you, only raw.”
Transliteration: gam veterem yaketirun et-hachelev uva naar hakhohen veamar laiysh hazovecha tenah vashar litselvot lakhohen velo-yikach mimekha vashar mevushal khiy im-chay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו הָאִ֗ישׁ קַטֵּ֨ר יַקְטִיר֤וּן כַּיּוֹם֙ הַחֵ֔לֶב וְקַ֨ח־לְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּאַוֶּ֖ה נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְאָמַ֥ר ׀ [לֹא֙] (לו) כִּ֚י עַתָּ֣ה תִתֵּ֔ן וְאִם־לֹ֖א לָקַ֥חְתִּי בְחׇזְקָֽה׃
Translated: And if the response to this was, “Let them first turn the suet into smoke, and then take as much as you want,” he would reply, “No, hand it over at once or I’ll take it by force.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv haiysh kater yaketiyrun khayyvom hachelev vekach-lekha khaasher teaveh nafeshekha veamar [lo] (lv) khiy atah titen veim-lo lakachetiy vechׇzekah

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י חַטַּ֧את הַנְּעָרִ֛ים גְּדוֹלָ֥ה מְאֹ֖ד אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י נִֽאֲצוּ֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֵ֖ת מִנְחַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The sin of the young men against G<small>OD</small> was very great, for those men treated G<small>OD</small>’s offerings impiously.
Transliteration: vatehiy chatat haneariym gedvolah meod et-feney yehovah khiy niatsu haanashiym et minechat yehovah

Hebrew: וּשְׁמוּאֵ֕ל מְשָׁרֵ֖ת אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה נַ֕עַר חָג֖וּר אֵפ֥וֹד בָּֽד׃
Translated: Samuel was engaged in the service of G<small>OD</small> as an attendant, girded with a linen ephod.
Transliteration: ushemuel mesharet et-feney yehovah naar chagur efvod vad

Hebrew: וּמְעִ֤יל קָטֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ אִמּ֔וֹ וְהַעַלְתָ֥ה ל֖וֹ מִיָּמִ֣ים <small>׀</small> יָמִ֑ימָה בַּֽעֲלוֹתָהּ֙ אֶת־אִישָׁ֔הּ לִזְבֹּ֖חַ אֶת־זֶ֥בַח הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: His mother would also make a little robe for him and bring it up to him every year, when she made the pilgrimage with her husband to offer the annual sacrifice.
Transliteration: umeiyl katon taasheh-lvo imvo vehaaletah lvo miyamiym <small></small> yamiymah vaalvotah et-iyshah lizevocha et-zevach hayamiym

Hebrew: וּבֵרַ֨ךְ עֵלִ֜י אֶת־אֶלְקָנָ֣ה וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ וְאָמַר֙ יָשֵׂם֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לְךָ֥ זֶ֙רַע֙ מִן־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את תַּ֚חַת הַשְּׁאֵלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁאַ֖ל לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְהָלְכ֖וּ לִמְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife, and say, “May G<small>OD</small> grant you offspring by this woman in place of the loan she made to G<small>OD</small>.” Then they would return home.
Transliteration: uverakhe eliy et-elekanah veet-ishetvo veamar yashem yehovah lekha zera min-haishah hazot tachat hasheelah asher shaal layhovah vehalekhu limekvomvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־פָקַ֤ד יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־חַנָּ֔ה וַתַּ֛הַר וַתֵּ֥לֶד שְׁלֹשָֽׁה־בָנִ֖ים וּשְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֑וֹת וַיִּגְדַּ֛ל הַנַּ֥עַר שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל עִם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: For G<small>OD</small> took note of Hannah; she conceived and bore three sons and two daughters. Young Samuel meanwhile grew up in the service of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: khiy-fakad yehovah et-chanah vatahar vateled sheloshah-vaniym ushetey vanvot vayigedal hanaar shemuel im-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וְעֵלִ֖י זָקֵ֣ן מְאֹ֑ד וְשָׁמַ֗ע אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשׂ֤וּן בָּנָיו֙ לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֵ֤ת אֲשֶֽׁר־יִשְׁכְּבוּן֙ אֶת־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים הַצֹּ֣בְא֔וֹת פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: Now Eli was very old. When he heard all that his sons were doing to all Israel, and how they lay with the women who performed tasks at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,
Transliteration: veeliy zaken meod veshama et khׇl-asher yaashun vanayv lekhׇl-yisherael veet asher-yishekhevun et-hanashiym hatsovevot fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם לָ֥מָּה תַעֲשׂ֖וּן כַּדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֤י שֹׁמֵ֙עַ֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵיכֶ֣ם רָעִ֔ים מֵאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָעָ֥ם אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: he said to them, “Why do you do such things? I get evil reports about you from the people on all hands.
Transliteration: vayomer lahem lamah taashun khadevariym haeleh asher anokhiy shomea et-divereykhem raiym meet khׇl-haam eleh

Hebrew: אַ֖ל בָּנָ֑י כִּ֠י לֽוֹא־טוֹבָ֤ה הַשְּׁמֻעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י שֹׁמֵ֔עַ מַעֲבִרִ֖ים עַם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Don’t, my sons! It is no favorable report I hear G<small>OD</small>’s people spreading about.
Transliteration: al vanay khiy lvo-tvovah hashemuah asher anokhiy shomea maaviriym am-yehovah

Hebrew: אִם־יֶחֱטָ֨א אִ֤ישׁ לְאִישׁ֙ וּפִֽלְל֣וֹ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְאִ֤ם לַֽיהֹוָה֙ יֶחֱטָא־אִ֔ישׁ מִ֖י יִתְפַּלֶּל־ל֑וֹ וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁמְעוּ֙ לְק֣וֹל אֲבִיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־חָפֵ֥ץ יְהֹוָ֖ה לַהֲמִיתָֽם׃
Translated: If someone sins against another person, God may grant a pardon; but if someone offends against G<small>OD</small>, who can obtain a pardon?” But they ignored their father’s plea; for G<small>OD</small> was resolved that they should die.
Transliteration: im-yecheta iysh leiysh ufilelvo Elohim veim layhovah yecheta-iysh miy yitefalel-lvo velo yishemeu lekvol aviyhem khiy-chafets yehovah lahamiytam

Hebrew: וְהַנַּ֣עַר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל הֹלֵ֥ךְ וְגָדֵ֖ל וָט֑וֹב גַּ֚ם עִם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְגַ֖ם עִם־אֲנָשִֽׁים׃ {פ}
Translated: Young Samuel, meanwhile, grew in esteem and favor both with God and with other people.
Transliteration: vehanaar shemuel holekhe vegadel vatvov gam im-yehovah vegam im-anashiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אִישׁ־אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־עֵלִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲנִגְלֹ֤ה נִגְלֵ֙יתִי֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יךָ בִּֽהְיוֹתָ֥ם בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם לְבֵ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: An agent of God came to Eli, and he said to him, “Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Lo, I revealed Myself to your father’s house in Egypt when they were subject to the House of Pharaoh,
Transliteration: vayavo iysh-Elohim el-eliy vayomer elayv khoh amar yehovah hanigeloh nigeleytiy el-veyt aviykha viheyvotam vemitserayiim leveyt fareoh

Hebrew: וּבָחֹ֣ר אֹ֠ת֠וֹ מִכׇּל־שִׁבְטֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל לִי֙ לְכֹהֵ֔ן לַעֲל֣וֹת עַֽל־מִזְבְּחִ֗י לְהַקְטִ֥יר קְטֹ֛רֶת לָשֵׂ֥את אֵפ֖וֹד לְפָנָ֑י וָֽאֶתְּנָה֙ לְבֵ֣ית אָבִ֔יךָ אֶת־כׇּל־אִשֵּׁ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and I chose them from among all the tribes of Israel to be My priests—to ascend My altar, to burn incense, [and] to carry an ephod before Me—and I assigned to your father’s house all offerings by fire of the Israelites.
Transliteration: uvachor otvo mikhׇl-shivetey yisherael liy lekhohen laalvot al-mizevechiy lehaketiyr ketoret lashet efvod lefanay vaetenah leveyt aviykha et-khׇl-ishey veney yisherael

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה תִבְעֲט֗וּ בְּזִבְחִי֙ וּבְמִנְחָתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי מָע֑וֹן וַתְּכַבֵּ֤ד אֶת־בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ מִמֶּ֔נִּי לְהַבְרִיאֲכֶ֗ם מֵרֵאשִׁ֛ית כׇּל־מִנְחַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְעַמִּֽי׃
Translated: Why, then, do you maliciously trample upon the sacrifices and offerings that I have commanded? You have honored your sons more than Me, feeding on the first portions of every offering of My people Israel.
Transliteration: lamah tiveatu vezivechiy uveminechatiy asher tsiviytiy mavon vatekhaved et-vaneykha mimeniy lehaveriyakhem mereshiyt khׇl-minechat yisherael leamiy

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן נְאֻם־יְהֹוָה֮ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ אָמ֣וֹר אָמַ֔רְתִּי בֵּֽיתְךָ֙ וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֔יךָ יִתְהַלְּכ֥וּ לְפָנַ֖י עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וְעַתָּ֤ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָה֙ חָלִ֣ילָה לִּ֔י כִּֽי־מְכַבְּדַ֥י אֲכַבֵּ֖ד וּבֹזַ֥י יֵקָֽלּוּ׃
Translated: Assuredly—declares the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel—I intended for you and your father’s house to remain in My service forever. But now—declares G<small>OD</small>—far be it from Me! For I honor those who honor Me, but those who spurn Me shall be dishonored.
Transliteration: lakhen neum-yehovah elohey yisherael amvor amaretiy veytekha uveyt aviykha yitehalekhu lefanay ad-volam veatah neum-yehovah chaliylah liy khiy-mekhaveday akhaved uvozay eikalu

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֙ יָמִ֣ים בָּאִ֔ים וְגָֽדַעְתִּי֙ אֶת־זְרֹ֣עֲךָ֔ וְאֶת־זְרֹ֖עַ בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ מִֽהְי֥וֹת זָקֵ֖ן בְּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: A time is coming when I will break your power and that of your father’s house, and there shall be no elder in your house.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym vegadaetiy et-zeroakha veet-zeroa veyt aviykha miheyvot zaken veveytekha

Hebrew: וְהִבַּטְתָּ֙ צַ֣ר מָע֔וֹן בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵיטִ֖יב אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹא־יִֽהְיֶ֥ה זָקֵ֛ן בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: You will gaze grudgingly at all the bounty that will be bestowed on Israel, but there shall never be an elder in your house.
Transliteration: vehivateta tsar mavon vekhol asher-eiytiyv et-yisherael velo-yiheyeh zaken veveytekha khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ לֹֽא־אַכְרִ֤ית לְךָ֙ מֵעִ֣ם מִזְבְּחִ֔י לְכַלּ֥וֹת אֶת־עֵינֶ֖יךָ וְלַאֲדִ֣יב אֶת־נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְכׇל־מַרְבִּ֥ית בֵּיתְךָ֖ יָמ֥וּתוּ אֲנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: I shall not cut off all your offspring from My altar; [but,] to make your eyes pine and your spirit languish, all the increase in your house shall die as [ordinary] men.
Transliteration: veiysh lo-akheriyt lekha meim mizevechiy lekhalvot et-eyneykha velaadiyv et-nafeshekha vekhׇl-mareviyt veytekha yamutu anashiym

Hebrew: וְזֶה־לְּךָ֣ הָא֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָבֹא֙ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֣י בָנֶ֔יךָ אֶל־חׇפְנִ֖י וּפִֽינְחָ֑ס בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָ֖ד יָמ֥וּתוּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And this shall be a sign for you: The fate of your two sons Hophni and Phinehas—they shall both die on the same day.
Transliteration: vezeh-lekha havot asher yavo el-sheney vaneykha el-chׇfeniy ufiynechas veyvom echad yamutu sheneyhem

Hebrew: וַהֲקִימֹתִ֥י לִי֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן נֶאֱמָ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר בִּלְבָבִ֥י וּבְנַפְשִׁ֖י יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וּבָנִ֤יתִי לוֹ֙ בַּ֣יִת נֶאֱמָ֔ן וְהִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ לִפְנֵֽי־מְשִׁיחִ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: And I will raise up for Myself a faithful priest, who will act in accordance with My wishes and My purposes. I will build for him an enduring house, and he shall walk before My anointed evermore.
Transliteration: vahakiymotiy liy khohen neeman khaasher vilevaviy uvenafeshiy yaasheh uvaniytiy lvo vayiit neeman vehitehalekhe lifeney-meshiychiy khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כׇּל־הַנּוֹתָר֙ בְּבֵ֣יתְךָ֔ יָבוֹא֙ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֣ת ל֔וֹ לַאֲג֥וֹרַת כֶּ֖סֶף וְכִכַּר־לָ֑חֶם וְאָמַ֗ר סְפָחֵ֥נִי נָ֛א אֶל־אַחַ֥ת הַכְּהֻנּ֖וֹת לֶאֱכֹ֥ל פַּת־לָֽחֶם׃ {פ}
Translated: And all the survivors of your house shall come and bow low to him for the sake of a money fee and a loaf of bread, and shall say, ‘Please, assign me to one of the priestly duties, that I may have a morsel of bread to eat.’”
Transliteration: vehayah khׇl-hanvotar veveytekha yavvo lehishetachavot lvo laagvorat khesef vekhikhar-lachem veamar sefacheniy na el-achat hakhehunvot leekhol fat-lachem {f}

Hebrew: וְהַנַּ֧עַר שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל מְשָׁרֵ֥ת אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י עֵלִ֑י וּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה הָיָ֤ה יָקָר֙ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם אֵ֥ין חָז֖וֹן נִפְרָֽץ׃ {ס}
Translated: Young Samuel was in the service of G<small>OD</small> under Eli. In those days the word of G<small>OD</small> was rare; prophecy was not widespread.
Transliteration: vehanaar shemuel mesharet et-yehovah lifeney eliy udevar-yehovah hayah yakar vayamiym hahem eyn chazvon niferats {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וְעֵלִ֖י שֹׁכֵ֣ב בִּמְקוֹמ֑וֹ וְעֵינָו֙ הֵחֵ֣לּוּ כֵה֔וֹת לֹ֥א יוּכַ֖ל לִרְאֽוֹת׃
Translated: One day, Eli was asleep in his usual place; his eyes had begun to fail and he could barely see.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hahu veeliy shokhev vimekvomvo veeynav hechelu khehvot lo yukhal lirevot

Hebrew: וְנֵ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ טֶ֣רֶם יִכְבֶּ֔ה וּשְׁמוּאֵ֖ל שֹׁכֵ֑ב בְּהֵיכַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם אֲר֥וֹן אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The lamp of God had not yet gone out, and Samuel was sleeping in the temple of G<small>OD</small> where the Ark of God was.
Transliteration: vener Elohim terem yikheveh ushemuel shokhev veheykhal yehovah asher-sham arvon Elohim {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> called out to Samuel, and he answered, “I’m coming.”
Transliteration: vayikera yehovah el-shemuel vayomer hineniy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רׇץ אֶל־עֵלִ֗י וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הִנְנִי֙ כִּֽי־קָרָ֣אתָ לִּ֔י וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לֹֽא־קָרָ֖אתִי שׁ֣וּב שְׁכָ֑ב וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁכָּֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: He ran to Eli and said, “Here I am; you called me.” But he replied, “I didn’t call you; go back to sleep.” So he went back and lay down.
Transliteration: vayarׇts el-eliy vayomer hineniy khiy-karata liy vayomer lo-karatiy shuv shekhav vayelekhe vayishekhav {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣סֶף יְהֹוָ֗ה קְרֹ֣א עוֹד֮ שְׁמוּאֵל֒ וַיָּ֤קׇם שְׁמוּאֵל֙ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אֶל־עֵלִ֔י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הִנְנִ֔י כִּ֥י קָרָ֖אתָ לִ֑י וַיֹּ֛אמֶר לֹא־קָרָ֥אתִֽי בְנִ֖י שׁ֥וּב שְׁכָֽב׃
Translated: Again G<small>OD</small> called, “Samuel!” Samuel rose and went to Eli and said, “Here I am; you called me.” But he replied, “I didn’t call, my son; go back to sleep.”—
Transliteration: vayosef yehovah kero vod shemuel vayakׇm shemuel vayelekhe el-eliy vayomer hineniy khiy karata liy vayomer lo-karatiy veniy shuv shekhav

Hebrew: וּשְׁמוּאֵ֕ל טֶ֖רֶם יָדַ֣ע אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְטֶ֛רֶם יִגָּלֶ֥ה אֵלָ֖יו דְּבַר־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Now Samuel had not yet experienced G<small>OD</small>; the word of G<small>OD</small> had not yet been revealed to him.—
Transliteration: ushemuel terem yada et-yehovah veterem yigaleh elayv devar-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨סֶף יְהֹוָ֥ה קְרֹֽא־שְׁמוּאֵל֮ בַּשְּׁלִישִׁת֒ וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אֶל־עֵלִ֔י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הִנְנִ֔י כִּ֥י קָרָ֖אתָ לִ֑י וַיָּ֣בֶן עֵלִ֔י כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה קֹרֵ֥א לַנָּֽעַר׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> called Samuel again, a third time, and he rose and went to Eli and said, “Here I am; you called me.” Then Eli understood that G<small>OD</small> was calling the boy.
Transliteration: vayosef yehovah kero-shemuel vasheliyshit vayakׇm vayelekhe el-eliy vayomer hineniy khiy karata liy vayaven eliy khiy yehovah kore lanaar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵלִ֣י לִשְׁמוּאֵל֮ לֵ֣ךְ <small>׀</small> שְׁכָב֒ וְהָיָה֙ אִם־יִקְרָ֣א אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ דַּבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י שֹׁמֵ֖עַ עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב בִּמְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Eli said to Samuel, “Go lie down. If you are called again, say, ‘Speak, G<small>OD</small>, for Your servant is listening.’” And Samuel went to his place and lay down.
Transliteration: vayomer eliy lishemuel lekhe <small></small> shekhav vehayah im-yikera eleykha veamareta daver yehovah khiy shomea avedekha vayelekhe shemuel vayishekhav vimekvomvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ וַיִּתְיַצַּ֔ב וַיִּקְרָ֥א כְפַֽעַם־בְּפַ֖עַם שְׁמוּאֵ֣ל ׀ שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ דַּבֵּ֔ר כִּ֥י שֹׁמֵ֖עַ עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> started communicating, calling as before: “Samuel! Samuel!” And Samuel answered, “Speak, for Your servant is listening.”
Transliteration: vayavo yehovah vayiteyatsav vayikera khefaam-vefaam shemuel shemuel vayomer shemuel daver khiy shomea avedekha {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל הִנֵּ֧ה אָנֹכִ֛י עֹשֶׂ֥ה דָבָ֖ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁר֙ כׇּל־שֹׁ֣מְע֔וֹ תְּצִלֶּ֖ינָה שְׁתֵּ֥י אׇזְנָֽיו׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Samuel: “I am going to do in Israel such a thing that both ears of anyone who hears about it will tingle.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-shemuel hineh anokhiy osheh davar veyisherael asher khׇl-shomevo tetsileynah shetey ׇzenayv

Hebrew: בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ אָקִ֣ים אֶל־עֵלִ֔י אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ הָחֵ֖ל וְכַלֵּֽה׃
Translated: In that day I will fulfill against Eli all that I spoke concerning his house, from beginning to end.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu akiym el-eliy et khׇl-asher divaretiy el-veytvo hachel vekhaleh

Hebrew: וְהִגַּ֣דְתִּי ל֔וֹ כִּֽי־שֹׁפֵ֥ט אֲנִ֛י אֶת־בֵּית֖וֹ עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם בַּעֲוֺ֣ן אֲשֶׁר־יָדַ֗ע כִּֽי־מְקַלְלִ֤ים לָהֶם֙ בָּנָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א כִהָ֖ה בָּֽם׃
Translated: And I declare to him that I sentence his house to endless punishment for the iniquity he knew about—how his sons committed sacrilege at will—and he did not rebuke them.
Transliteration: vehigadetiy lvo khiy-shofet aniy et-veytvo ad-volam vaavon asher-yada khiy-mekaleliym lahem vanayv velo khihah vam

Hebrew: וְלָכֵ֥ן נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לְבֵ֣ית עֵלִ֑י אִֽם־יִתְכַּפֵּ֞ר עֲוֺ֧ן בֵּית־עֵלִ֛י בְּזֶ֥בַח וּבְמִנְחָ֖ה עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Assuredly, I swear concerning the house of Eli that the iniquity of the house of Eli will never be expiated by sacrifice or offering.”
Transliteration: velakhen nishevaetiy leveyt eliy im-yitekhafer avon veyt-eliy vezevach uveminechah ad-volam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֤ב שְׁמוּאֵל֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־דַּלְת֣וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּשְׁמוּאֵ֣ל יָרֵ֔א מֵהַגִּ֥יד אֶת־הַמַּרְאָ֖ה אֶל־עֵלִֽי׃
Translated: Samuel lay there until morning; and then he opened the doors of the House of G<small>OD</small>. Samuel was afraid to report the vision to Eli,
Transliteration: vayishekhav shemuel ad-havoker vayifetach et-daletvot veyt-yehovah ushemuel yare mehagiyd et-hamareah el-eliy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א עֵלִי֙ אֶת־שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֣ל בְּנִ֑י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: but Eli summoned Samuel and said, “Samuel, my son”; and he answered, “Here.”
Transliteration: vayikera eliy et-shemuel vayomer shemuel veniy vayomer hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ אַל־נָ֥א תְכַחֵ֖ד מִמֶּ֑נִּי כֹּ֣ה יַֽעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֤ אֱלֹהִים֙ וְכֹ֣ה יוֹסִ֔יף אִם־תְּכַחֵ֤ד מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ דָּבָ֔ר מִכׇּל־הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And [Eli] asked, “What did [God] say to you? Keep nothing from me. Thus and more may God do to you if you keep from me a single word of all that was said to you!”
Transliteration: vayomer mah hadavar asher diver eleykha al-na tekhached mimeniy khoh yaasheh-lekha Elohim vekhoh yvosiyf im-tekhached mimeniy davar mikhׇl-hadavar asher-diver eleykha

Hebrew: וַיַּגֶּד־ל֤וֹ שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א כִחֵ֖ד מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר יְהֹוָ֣ה ה֔וּא הַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינָ֖ו יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: Samuel then told him everything, withholding nothing from him. And [Eli] said, “G<small>OD</small> will always do what is right.”
Transliteration: vayaged-lvo shemuel et-khׇl-hadevariym velo khiched mimenu vayomar yehovah hu hatvov veeynav yaasheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֖ל שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַֽיהֹוָה֙ הָיָ֣ה עִמּ֔וֹ וְלֹא־הִפִּ֥יל מִכׇּל־דְּבָרָ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Samuel grew up and G<small>OD</small> was with him—not leaving any of his predictions unfulfilled.
Transliteration: vayigedal shemuel vayhovah hayah imvo velo-hifiyl mikhׇl-devarayv aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙דַע֙ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִדָּ֖ן וְעַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע כִּ֚י נֶאֱמָ֣ן שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל לְנָבִ֖יא לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: All Israel, from Dan to Beer-sheba, knew that Samuel was trustworthy as a prophet of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayeda khׇl-yisherael midan vead-veer shava khiy neeman shemuel lenaviy layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥סֶף יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהֵרָאֹ֣ה בְשִׁלֹ֑ה כִּֽי־נִגְלָ֨ה יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל בְּשִׁל֖וֹ בִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> continued to appear at Shiloh—G<small>OD</small> being revealed to Samuel at Shiloh with the word of G<small>OD</small>;
Transliteration: vayosef yehovah leheraoh veshiloh khiy-nigelah yehovah el-shemuel veshilvo videvar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דְבַר־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּצֵ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵל֩ לִקְרַ֨את פְּלִשְׁתִּ֜ים לַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ עַל־הָאֶ֣בֶן הָעֵ֔זֶר וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים חָנ֥וּ בַאֲפֵֽק׃
Translated:
and Samuel’s word went forth to all Israel.
Israel marched out to engage the Philistines in battle; they encamped near Eben-ezer, while the Philistines encamped at Aphek.
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-shemuel lekhׇl-yisherael vayetse yisherael likerat felishetiym lamilechamah vayachanu al-haeven haezer ufelishetiym chanu vaafek

Hebrew: וַיַּעַרְכ֨וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֜ים לִקְרַ֣את יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַתִּטֹּשׁ֙ הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַיִּנָּ֥גֶף יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לִפְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּכּ֤וּ בַמַּֽעֲרָכָה֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה כְּאַרְבַּ֥עַת אֲלָפִ֖ים אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The Philistines arrayed themselves against Israel; and when the battle was fought, Israel was routed by the Philistines, who slew about four thousand men on the field of battle.
Transliteration: vayaarekhu felishetiym likerat yisherael vatitosh hamilechamah vayinagef yisherael lifeney felishetiym vayakhu vamaarakhah vashadeh khearevaat alafiym iysh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א הָעָם֮ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֒ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָ֣מָּה נְגָפָ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה הַיּ֖וֹם לִפְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים נִקְחָ֧ה אֵלֵ֣ינוּ מִשִּׁלֹ֗ה אֶת־אֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיָבֹ֣א בְקִרְבֵּ֔נוּ וְיֹשִׁעֵ֖נוּ מִכַּ֥ף אֹיְבֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: When the [Israelite] troops returned to the camp, the elders of Israel asked, “Why did G<small>OD</small> put us to rout today before the Philistines? Let us fetch the Ark of the Covenant of G<small>OD</small> from Shiloh; thus [God] will be present among us and will deliver us from the hands of our enemies.”
Transliteration: vayavo haam el-hamachaneh vayomeru zikeney yisherael lamah negafanu yehovah hayyvom lifeney felishetiym nikechah eleynu mishiloh et-arvon veriyt yehovah veyavo vekirevenu veyoshienu mikhaf oyeveynu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח הָעָם֙ שִׁלֹ֔ה וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ מִשָּׁ֗ם אֵ֣ת אֲר֧וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֛ה צְבָא֖וֹת יֹשֵׁ֣ב הַכְּרֻבִ֑ים וְשָׁ֞ם שְׁנֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עֵלִ֗י עִם־אֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים חׇפְנִ֖י וּפִֽינְחָֽס׃
Translated: So the troops sent a message to Shiloh; there Eli’s two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were in charge of the Ark of the Covenant of God, and they brought down from there the Ark of the Covenant of G<small>OD</small> of Hosts Enthroned on the Cherubim.
Transliteration: vayishelach haam shiloh vayisheu misham et arvon veriyt-yehovah tsevavot yoshev hakheruviym vesham sheney veney-eliy im-arvon veriyt haElohim chׇfeniy ufiynechas

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּב֨וֹא אֲר֤וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיָּרִ֥עוּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּרוּעָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וַתֵּהֹ֖ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: When the Ark of the Covenant of G<small>OD</small> entered the camp, all Israel burst into a great shout, so that the earth resounded.
Transliteration: vayehiy khevvo arvon veriyt-yehovah el-hamachaneh vayariu khׇl-yisherael teruah gedvolah vatehom haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֤וּ פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַתְּרוּעָ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֶ֠ה ק֣וֹל הַתְּרוּעָ֧ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֛ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה הָעִבְרִ֑ים וַיֵּ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֚י אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה בָּ֖א אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: The Philistines heard the noise of the shouting and they wondered, “Why is there such a loud shouting in the camp of the Hebrews?” And when they learned that the Ark of G<small>OD</small> had come to the camp,
Transliteration: vayishemeu felishetiym et-kvol hateruah vayomeru meh kvol hateruah hagedvolah hazot vemachaneh haiveriym vayedeu khiy arvon yehovah va el-hamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיִּֽרְאוּ֙ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כִּ֣י אָֽמְר֔וּ בָּ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ א֣וֹי לָ֔נוּ כִּ֣י לֹ֥א הָיְתָ֛ה כָּזֹ֖את אֶתְמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֹֽׁם׃
Translated: the Philistines were frightened; for they said, “God has come to the camp.” And they cried, “Woe to us! Nothing like this has ever happened before.
Transliteration: vayireu hafelishetiym khiy ameru va Elohim el-hamachaneh vayomeru voy lanu khiy lo hayetah khazot etemvol shileshom

Hebrew: א֣וֹי לָ֔נוּ מִ֣י יַצִּילֵ֔נוּ מִיַּ֛ד הָאֱלֹהִ֥ים הָאַדִּירִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה אֵ֧לֶּה הֵ֣ם הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים הַמַּכִּ֧ים אֶת־מִצְרַ֛יִם בְּכׇל־מַכָּ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Woe to us! Who will save us from the power of this mighty God—the same God who struck the Egyptians with every kind of plague in the wilderness?
Transliteration: voy lanu miy yatsiylenu miyad haElohim haadiyriym haeleh eleh hem haElohim hamakhiym et-mitserayiim vekhׇl-makhah vamidevar

Hebrew: הִֽתְחַזְּק֞וּ וִֽהְי֤וּ לַֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים פֶּ֚ן תַּעַבְד֣וּ לָֽעִבְרִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָבְד֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם וִהְיִיתֶ֥ם לַאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וְנִלְחַמְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: Brace yourselves and be resolute, O Philistines! Or you will become slaves to the Hebrews as they were slaves to you. Be resolute and fight!”
Transliteration: hitechazeku viheyu laanashiym felishetiym fen taavedu laiveriym khaasher avedu lakhem viheyiytem laanashiym venilechametem

Hebrew: וַיִּלָּחֲמ֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיִּנָּ֤גֶף יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיָּנֻ֙סוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ לְאֹהָלָ֔יו וַתְּהִ֥י הַמַּכָּ֖ה גְּדוֹלָ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וַיִּפֹּל֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף רַגְלִֽי׃
Translated: The Philistines fought; Israel was routed, and they all fled to their homes. The defeat was very great, thirty thousand foot soldiers of Israel fell there.
Transliteration: vayilachamu felishetiym vayinagef yisherael vayanusu iysh leohalayv vatehiy hamakhah gedvolah meod vayifol miyisherael sheloshiym elef rageliy

Hebrew: וַאֲר֥וֹן אֱלֹהִ֖ים נִלְקָ֑ח וּשְׁנֵ֤י בְנֵֽי־עֵלִי֙ מֵ֔תוּ חׇפְנִ֖י וּפִֽינְחָֽס׃
Translated: The Ark of God was captured, and Eli’s two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.
Transliteration: vaarvon Elohim nilekach usheney veney-eliy metu chׇfeniy ufiynechas

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤רׇץ אִישׁ־בִּנְיָמִן֙ מֵהַמַּ֣עֲרָכָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֥א שִׁלֹ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וּמַדָּ֣יו קְרֻעִ֔ים וַאֲדָמָ֖ה עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: A certain Benjaminite ran from the battlefield and reached Shiloh the same day; his clothes were rent and there was earth on his head.
Transliteration: vayarׇts iysh-vineyamin mehamaarakhah vayavo shiloh vayyvom hahu umadayv keruiym vaadamah al-roshvo

Hebrew: וַיָּב֗וֹא וְהִנֵּ֣ה עֵ֠לִ֠י יֹשֵׁ֨ב עַֽל־הַכִּסֵּ֜א (יך) [יַ֥ד] דֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ מְצַפֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־הָיָ֤ה לִבּוֹ֙ חָרֵ֔ד עַ֖ל אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְהָאִ֗ישׁ בָּ֚א לְהַגִּ֣יד בָּעִ֔יר וַתִּזְעַ֖ק כׇּל־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: When he arrived, he found Eli sitting on a seat, waiting beside the road—his heart trembling for the Ark of God. The man entered the city to spread the news, and the whole city broke out in a cry.
Transliteration: vayavvo vehineh eliy yoshev al-hakhise (ykh) [yad] derekhe metsafeh khiy-hayah livvo chared al arvon haElohim vehaiysh va lehagiyd vaiyr vatizeak khׇl-haiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע עֵלִי֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַצְּעָקָ֔ה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מֶ֛ה ק֥וֹל הֶהָמ֖וֹן הַזֶּ֑ה וְהָאִ֣ישׁ מִהַ֔ר וַיָּבֹ֖א וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לְעֵלִֽי׃
Translated: And when Eli heard the sound of the outcry and asked, “What is the meaning of this uproar?” the man rushed over to tell Eli.
Transliteration: vayishema eliy et-kvol hatseakah vayomer meh kvol hehamvon hazeh vehaiysh mihar vayavo vayaged leeliy

Hebrew: וְעֵלִ֕י בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה וְעֵינָ֣יו קָ֔מָה וְלֹ֥א יָכ֖וֹל לִרְאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Now Eli was ninety-eight years old; his eyes were fixed in a blind stare.
Transliteration: veeliy ven-tisheiym ushemoneh shanah veeynayv kamah velo yakhvol lirevot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הָאִ֜ישׁ אֶל־עֵלִ֗י אָֽנֹכִי֙ הַבָּ֣א מִן־הַמַּעֲרָכָ֔ה וַאֲנִ֕י מִן־הַמַּעֲרָכָ֖ה נַ֣סְתִּי הַיּ֑וֹם וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מֶה־הָיָ֥ה הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּנִֽי׃
Translated: The man said to Eli, “I am the one who came from the battlefield; I have just fled from the battlefield.” [Eli] asked, “What happened, my son?”
Transliteration: vayomer haiysh el-eliy anokhiy hava min-hamaarakhah vaaniy min-hamaarakhah nasetiy hayyvom vayomer meh-hayah hadavar veniy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן הַֽמְבַשֵּׂ֜ר וַיֹּ֗אמֶר נָ֤ס יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לִפְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְגַ֛ם מַגֵּפָ֥ה גְדוֹלָ֖ה הָיְתָ֣ה בָעָ֑ם וְגַם־שְׁנֵ֨י בָנֶ֜יךָ מֵ֗תוּ חׇפְנִי֙ וּפִ֣ינְחָ֔ס וַאֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים נִלְקָֽחָה׃ {פ}
Translated: The bearer of the news replied, “Israel fled before the Philistines, and the troops also suffered a great slaughter. Your two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the Ark of God has been captured.”
Transliteration: vayaan hamevasher vayomer nas yisherael lifeney felishetiym vegam magefah gedvolah hayetah vaam vegam-sheney vaneykha metu chׇfeniy ufiynechas vaarvon haElohim nilekachah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כְּהַזְכִּיר֣וֹ ׀ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים וַיִּפֹּ֣ל מֵֽעַל־הַ֠כִּסֵּ֠א אֲחֹ֨רַנִּ֜ית בְּעַ֣ד ׀ יַ֣ד הַשַּׁ֗עַר וַתִּשָּׁבֵ֤ר מַפְרַקְתּוֹ֙ וַיָּמֹ֔ת כִּֽי־זָקֵ֥ן הָאִ֖ישׁ וְכָבֵ֑ד וְה֛וּא שָׁפַ֥ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: When he mentioned the Ark of God, [Eli] fell backward off the seat beside the gate, broke his neck and died; for the man was old and heavy. He had been a chieftain of Israel for forty years.
Transliteration: vayehiy khehazekhiyrvo et-arvon haElohim vayifol meal-hakhise achoraniyt vead yad hashaar vatishaver maferaketvo vayamot khiy-zaken haiysh vekhaved vehu shafat et-yisherael arevaiym shanah

Hebrew: וְכַלָּת֣וֹ אֵשֶׁת־פִּֽינְחָס֮ הָרָ֣ה לָלַת֒ וַתִּשְׁמַ֣ע אֶת־הַשְּׁמוּעָ֗ה אֶל־הִלָּקַח֙ אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּמֵ֥ת חָמִ֖יהָ וְאִישָׁ֑הּ וַתִּכְרַ֣ע וַתֵּ֔לֶד כִּֽי־נֶהֶפְכ֥וּ עָלֶ֖יהָ צִרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: His daughter-in-law, the wife of Phinehas, was pregnant, about to give birth. When she heard the report that the Ark of God was captured and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she was seized with labor pains, and she crouched down and gave birth.
Transliteration: vekhalatvo eshet-fiynechas harah lalat vatishema et-hashemuah el-hilakach arvon haElohim umet chamiyha veiyshah vatikhera vateled khiy-nehefekhu aleyha tsireyha

Hebrew: וּכְעֵ֣ת מוּתָ֗הּ וַתְּדַבֵּ֙רְנָה֙ הַנִּצָּב֣וֹת עָלֶ֔יהָ אַל־תִּֽירְאִ֖י כִּ֣י בֵ֣ן יָלָ֑דְתְּ וְלֹ֥א עָנְתָ֖ה וְלֹא־שָׁ֥תָה לִבָּֽהּ׃
Translated: As she lay dying, the women attending her said, “Do not be afraid, for you have borne a son.” But she did not respond or pay heed.
Transliteration: ukheet mutah vatedaverenah hanitsavvot aleyha al-tiyreiy khiy ven yaladete velo anetah velo-shatah livah

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֣א לַנַּ֗עַר אִֽיכָבוֹד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר גָּלָ֥ה כָב֖וֹד מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֶל־הִלָּקַח֙ אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְאֶל־חָמִ֖יהָ וְאִישָֽׁהּ׃
Translated: She named the boy Ichabod, meaning, “The glory has departed from Israel”—referring to the capture of the Ark of God and to [the death of] her father-in-law and her husband.
Transliteration: vatikera lanaar iykhavvod lemor galah khavvod miyisherael el-hilakach arvon haElohim veel-chamiyha veiyshah

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר גָּלָ֥ה כָב֖וֹד מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֥י נִלְקַ֖ח אֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: “The glory is gone from Israel,” she said, “for the Ark of God has been captured.”
Transliteration: vatomer galah khavvod miyisherael khiy nilekach arvon haElohim {f}

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּים֙ לָֽקְח֔וּ אֵ֖ת אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיְבִאֻ֛הוּ מֵאֶ֥בֶן הָעֵ֖זֶר אַשְׁדּֽוֹדָה׃
Translated: When the Philistines captured the Ark of God, they brought it from Eben-ezer to Ashdod.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym lakechu et arvon haElohim vayeviuhu meeven haezer ashedvodah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֤וּ פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיָּבִ֥אוּ אֹת֖וֹ בֵּ֣ית דָּג֑וֹן וַיַּצִּ֥יגוּ אֹת֖וֹ אֵ֥צֶל דָּגֽוֹן׃
Translated: The Philistines took the Ark of God and brought it into the temple of Dagon and they set it up beside Dagon.
Transliteration: vayikechu felishetiym et-arvon haElohim vayaviu otvo veyt dagvon vayatsiygu otvo etsel dagvon

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֤מוּ אַשְׁדּוֹדִים֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וְהִנֵּ֣ה דָג֗וֹן נֹפֵ֤ל לְפָנָיו֙ אַ֔רְצָה לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־דָּג֔וֹן וַיָּשִׁ֥בוּ אֹת֖וֹ לִמְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Early the next day, the Ashdodites found Dagon lying face down on the ground in front of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>. They picked Dagon up and put him back in his place;
Transliteration: vayashekhimu ashedvodiym mimׇchorat vehineh dagvon nofel lefanayv aretsah lifeney arvon yehovah vayikechu et-dagvon vayashivu otvo limekvomvo

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣מוּ בַבֹּ֘קֶר֮ מִֽמׇּחֳרָת֒ וְהִנֵּ֣ה דָג֗וֹן נֹפֵ֤ל לְפָנָיו֙ אַ֔רְצָה לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֑ה וְרֹ֨אשׁ דָּג֜וֹן וּשְׁתֵּ֣י ׀ כַּפּ֣וֹת יָדָ֗יו כְּרֻתוֹת֙ אֶל־הַמִּפְתָּ֔ן רַ֥ק דָּג֖וֹן נִשְׁאַ֥ר עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: but early the next morning, Dagon was again lying prone on the ground in front of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>. The head and both hands of Dagon were cut off, lying on the threshold; only Dagon’s trunk was left intact.
Transliteration: vayashekhimu vavoker mimׇchorat vehineh dagvon nofel lefanayv aretsah lifeney arvon yehovah verosh dagvon ushetey khafvot yadayv kherutvot el-hamifetan rak dagvon nishear alayv

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֡ן לֹֽא־יִדְרְכוּ֩ כֹהֲנֵ֨י דָג֜וֹן וְכׇֽל־הַבָּאִ֧ים בֵּית־דָּג֛וֹן עַל־מִפְתַּ֥ן דָּג֖וֹן בְּאַשְׁדּ֑וֹד עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: That is why, to this day, the priests of Dagon and all who enter the temple of Dagon do not tread on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod.
Transliteration: al-khen lo-yiderekhu khohaney dagvon vekhׇl-havaiym veyt-dagvon al-mifetan dagvon veashedvod ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַתִּכְבַּ֧ד יַד־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־הָאַשְׁדּוֹדִ֖ים וַיְשִׁמֵּ֑ם וַיַּ֤ךְ אֹתָם֙ (בעפלים) [בַּטְּחֹרִ֔ים] אֶת־אַשְׁדּ֖וֹד וְאֶת־גְּבוּלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small>’s hand lay heavy upon the Ashdodites, wreaking havoc among them—striking Ashdod and its territory with hemorrhoids.
Transliteration: vatikhevad yad-yehovah el-haashedvodiym vayeshimem vayakhe otam (vflym) [vatechoriym] et-ashedvod veet-gevuleyha

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֥וּ אַנְשֵֽׁי־אַשְׁדּ֖וֹד כִּי־כֵ֑ן וְאָמְר֗וּ לֹֽא־יֵשֵׁ֞ב אֲר֨וֹן אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עִמָּ֔נוּ כִּֽי־קָשְׁתָ֤ה יָדוֹ֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְעַ֖ל דָּג֥וֹן אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: When the people of Ashdod saw how matters stood, they said, “The Ark of the God of Israel must not remain with us, for his hand has dealt harshly with us and with our god Dagon.”
Transliteration: vayireu aneshey-ashedvod khiy-khen veameru lo-eishev arvon elohey yisherael imanu khiy-kashetah yadvo aleynu veal dagvon eloheynu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֡וּ וַיַּאַסְפוּ֩ אֶת־כׇּל־סַרְנֵ֨י פְלִשְׁתִּ֜ים אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ מַֽה־נַּעֲשֶׂ֗ה לַֽאֲרוֹן֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ גַּ֣ת יִסֹּ֔ב אֲר֖וֹן אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּסֵּ֕בּוּ אֶת־אֲר֖וֹן אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: They sent messengers and assembled all the lords of the Philistines and asked, “What shall we do with the Ark of the God of Israel?” They answered, “Let the Ark of the God of Israel be removed to Gath.” So they moved the Ark of the God of Israel [to Gath].
Transliteration: vayishelechu vayaasefu et-khׇl-sareney felishetiym aleyhem vayomeru mah-naasheh laarvon elohey yisherael vayomeru gat yisov arvon elohey yisherael vayasevu et-arvon elohey yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ הֵסַ֣בּוּ אֹת֗וֹ וַתְּהִ֨י יַד־יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ בָּעִיר֙ מְהוּמָה֙ גְּדוֹלָ֣ה מְאֹ֔ד וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֣י הָעִ֔יר מִקָּטֹ֖ן וְעַד־גָּד֑וֹל וַיִּשָּׂתְר֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם (עפלים) [טְחֹרִֽים]׃
Translated: And after they had moved it, G<small>OD</small>’s hand came against the city, causing great panic—striking the inhabitants, young and old, so that hemorrhoids broke out among them.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey hesavu otvo vatehiy yad-yehovah vaiyr mehumah gedvolah meod vayakhe et-aneshey haiyr mikaton vead-gadvol vayishateru lahem (flym) [techoriym]

Hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֛וּ אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עֶקְר֑וֹן וַיְהִ֗י כְּב֨וֹא אֲר֤וֹן הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ עֶקְר֔וֹן וַיִּזְעֲק֨וּ הָעֶקְרֹנִ֜ים לֵאמֹ֗ר הֵסַ֤בּוּ אֵלַי֙ אֶת־אֲרוֹן֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַהֲמִיתֵ֖נִי וְאֶת־עַמִּֽי׃
Translated: Then they sent the Ark of God to Ekron. But when the Ark of God came to Ekron, the Ekronites cried out, “They have moved the Ark of the God of Israel to us to slay us and our kindred.”
Transliteration: vayeshalechu et-arvon haElohim ekervon vayehiy khevvo arvon haElohim ekervon vayizeaku haekeroniym lemor hesavu elay et-arvon elohey yisherael lahamiyteniy veet-amiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֨וּ וַיַּאַסְפ֜וּ אֶת־כׇּל־סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ שַׁלְּח֞וּ אֶת־אֲר֨וֹן אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לִמְקוֹמ֔וֹ וְלֹא־יָמִ֥ית אֹתִ֖י וְאֶת־עַמִּ֑י כִּֽי־הָיְתָ֤ה מְהֽוּמַת־מָ֙וֶת֙ בְּכׇל־הָעִ֔יר כָּבְדָ֥ה מְאֹ֛ד יַ֥ד הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים שָֽׁם׃
Translated: They too sent messengers and assembled all the lords of the Philistines and said, “Send the Ark of the God of Israel away, and let it return to its own place, that it may not slay us and our kindred.” For the panic of death pervaded the whole city, so heavily had the hand of God fallen there;
Transliteration: vayishelechu vayaasefu et-khׇl-sareney felishetiym vayomeru shalechu et-arvon elohey yisherael veyashov limekvomvo velo-yamiyt otiy veet-amiy khiy-hayetah mehumat-mavet vekhׇl-haiyr khavedah meod yad haElohim sham

Hebrew: וְהָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־מֵ֔תוּ הֻכּ֖וּ (בעפלים) [בַּטְּחֹרִ֑ים] וַתַּ֛עַל שַֽׁוְעַ֥ת הָעִ֖יר הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: and those who did not die were stricken with hemorrhoids. The outcry of the city went up to heaven.
Transliteration: vehaanashiym asher lo-metu hukhu (vflym) [vatechoriym] vataal shaveat haiyr hashamayiim {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י אֲרוֹן־יְהֹוָ֛ה בִּשְׂדֵ֥ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים שִׁבְעָ֥ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: The Ark of G<small>OD</small> remained in the territory of the Philistines seven months.
Transliteration: vayehiy arvon-yehovah vishedeh felishetiym shiveah chodashiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים לַכֹּהֲנִ֤ים וְלַקֹּֽסְמִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַֽה־נַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה לַאֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֑ה הוֹדִעֻ֕נוּ בַּמֶּ֖ה נְשַׁלְּחֶ֥נּוּ לִמְקוֹמֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the Philistines summoned the priests and the diviners and asked, “What shall we do about the Ark of G<small>OD</small>? Tell us with what we shall send it off to its own place.”
Transliteration: vayikereu felishetiym lakhohaniym velakosemiym lemor mah-naasheh laarvon yehovah hvodiunu vameh neshalechenu limekvomvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אִֽם־מְשַׁלְּחִ֞ים אֶת־אֲר֨וֹן אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אַל־תְּשַׁלְּח֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ רֵיקָ֔ם כִּי־הָשֵׁ֥ב תָּשִׁ֛יבוּ ל֖וֹ אָשָׁ֑ם אָ֤ז תֵּרָֽפְאוּ֙ וְנוֹדַ֣ע לָכֶ֔ם לָ֛מָּה לֹא־תָס֥וּר יָד֖וֹ מִכֶּֽם׃
Translated: They answered, “If you are going to send the Ark of the God of Israel away, do not send it away without anything; you must also pay an indemnity. Then you will be healed, and he will be made known to you; otherwise his hand will not turn away from you.”
Transliteration: vayomeru im-meshalechiym et-arvon elohey yisherael al-teshalechu otvo reykam khiy-hashev tashiyvu lvo asham az terafeu venvoda lakhem lamah lo-tasur yadvo mikhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ מָ֣ה הָאָשָׁם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָשִׁ֣יב לוֹ֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ מִסְפַּר֙ סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים חֲמִשָּׁה֙ (עפלי) [טְחֹרֵ֣י] זָהָ֔ב וַחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה עַכְבְּרֵ֣י זָהָ֑ב כִּֽי־מַגֵּפָ֥ה אַחַ֛ת לְכֻלָּ֖ם וּלְסַרְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: They asked, “What is the indemnity that we should pay?” They answered, “Five golden hemorrhoids and five golden mice, corresponding to the number of lords of the Philistines; for the same plague struck all of you and your lords.
Transliteration: vayomeru mah haasham asher nashiyv lvo vayomeru misefar sareney felishetiym chamishah (fly) [techorey] zahav vachamishah akheverey zahav khiy-magefah achat lekhulam ulesareneykhem

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶם֩ צַלְמֵ֨י (עפליכם) [טְחֹרֵיכֶ֜ם] וְצַלְמֵ֣י עַכְבְּרֵיכֶ֗ם הַמַּשְׁחִיתִם֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּנְתַתֶּ֛ם לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כָּב֑וֹד אוּלַ֗י יָקֵ֤ל אֶת־יָדוֹ֙ מֵֽעֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וּמֵעַ֥ל אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם וּמֵעַ֥ל אַרְצְכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall make figures of your hemorrhoids and of the mice that are ravaging your land; thus you shall honor the God of Israel, and perhaps the burden upon you and your gods and your land will be lightened.
Transliteration: vaashiytem tsalemey (flykhm) [techoreykhem] vetsalemey akhevereykhem hamashechiytim et-haarets unetatem lelohey yisherael khavvod ulay yakel et-yadvo mealeykhem umeal eloheykhem umeal aretsekhem

Hebrew: וְלָ֤מָּה תְכַבְּדוּ֙ אֶת־לְבַבְכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר כִּבְּד֛וּ מִצְרַ֥יִם וּפַרְעֹ֖ה אֶת־לִבָּ֑ם הֲלוֹא֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר הִתְעַלֵּ֣ל בָּהֶ֔ם וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֖וּם וַיֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: Don’t harden your hearts as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts. As you know, when he made a mockery of them, they had to let Israel go, and they departed.
Transliteration: velamah tekhavedu et-levavekhem khaasher khivedu mitserayiim ufareoh et-livam halvo khaasher hitealel vahem vayeshalechum vayelekhu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה קְח֨וּ וַעֲשׂ֜וּ עֲגָלָ֤ה חֲדָשָׁה֙ אֶחָ֔ת וּשְׁתֵּ֤י פָרוֹת֙ עָל֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־עָלָ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם עֹ֑ל וַאֲסַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־הַפָּרוֹת֙ בָּעֲגָלָ֔ה וַהֲשֵׁיבֹתֶ֧ם בְּנֵיהֶ֛ם מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם הַבָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: Therefore, get a new cart ready and two milch cows that have not borne a yoke; harness the cows to the cart, but take back indoors the calves that follow them.
Transliteration: veatah kechu vaashu agalah chadashah echat ushetey farvot alvot asher lo-alah aleyhem ol vaasaretem et-hafarvot vaagalah vahasheyvotem veneyhem meachareyhem havayetah

Hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֞ם אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֗ה וּנְתַתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ אֶל־הָ֣עֲגָלָ֔ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כְּלֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֲשֵׁבֹתֶ֥ם לוֹ֙ אָשָׁ֔ם תָּשִׂ֥ימוּ בָאַרְגַּ֖ז מִצִּדּ֑וֹ וְשִׁלַּחְתֶּ֥ם אֹת֖וֹ וְהָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: Take the Ark of G<small>OD</small> and place it on the cart; and put next to it in a chest the gold objects you are paying as indemnity. Send it off, and let it go its own way.
Transliteration: ulekachetem et-arvon yehovah unetatem otvo el-haagalah veet kheley hazahav asher hashevotem lvo asham tashiymu vaaregaz mitsidvo veshilachetem otvo vehalakhe

Hebrew: וּרְאִיתֶ֗ם אִם־דֶּ֨רֶךְ גְּבוּל֤וֹ יַֽעֲלֶה֙ בֵּ֣ית שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ ה֚וּא עָ֣שָׂה לָ֔נוּ אֶת־הָרָעָ֥ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את וְאִם־לֹ֗א וְיָדַ֙עְנוּ֙ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָדוֹ֙ נָ֣גְעָה בָּ֔נוּ מִקְרֶ֥ה ה֖וּא הָ֥יָה לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: Then watch: If it goes up the road to Beth-shemesh, to this territory, we will know that he has inflicted this great harm on us. But if not, we shall know that it was not his hand that struck us; it just happened to us by chance.”
Transliteration: ureiytem im-derekhe gevulvo yaaleh veyt shemesh hu ashah lanu et-haraah hagedvolah hazot veim-lo veyadaenu khiy lo yadvo nageah vanu mikereh hu hayah lanu

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֤וּ הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ כֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְח֗וּ שְׁתֵּ֤י פָרוֹת֙ עָל֔וֹת וַיַּאַסְר֖וּם בָּעֲגָלָ֑ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם כָּל֥וּ בַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The Philistines did so. They took two milch cows and harnessed them to the cart, and shut up their calves indoors.
Transliteration: vayaashu haanashiym khen vayikechu shetey farvot alvot vayaaserum vaagalah veet-veneyhem khalu vavayiit

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֛מוּ אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־הָעֲגָלָ֑ה וְאֵ֣ת הָאַרְגַּ֗ז וְאֵת֙ עַכְבְּרֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב וְאֵ֖ת צַלְמֵ֥י טְחֹרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They placed the Ark of G<small>OD</small> on the cart together with the chest, the golden mice, and the figures of their hemorrhoids.
Transliteration: vayashimu et-arvon yehovah el-haagalah veet haaregaz veet akheverey hazahav veet tsalemey techoreyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשַּׁ֨רְנָה הַפָּר֜וֹת בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ עַל־דֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ בֵּ֣ית שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ בִּמְסִלָּ֣ה אַחַ֗ת הָלְכ֤וּ הָלֹךְ֙ וְגָע֔וֹ וְלֹא־סָ֖רוּ יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול וְסַרְנֵ֤י פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ הֹלְכִ֣ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם עַד־גְּב֖וּל בֵּ֥ית שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: The cows went straight ahead along the road to Beth-shemesh. They went along a single highroad, lowing as they went, and turning off neither to the right nor to the left; and the lords of the Philistines walked behind them as far as the border of Beth-shemesh.
Transliteration: vayisharenah hafarvot vaderekhe al-derekhe veyt shemesh vimesilah achat halekhu halokhe vegavo velo-saru yamiyn ushemovl vesareney felishetiym holekhiym achareyhem ad-gevul veyt shamesh

Hebrew: וּבֵ֣ית שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ קֹצְרִ֥ים קְצִיר־חִטִּ֖ים בָּעֵ֑מֶק וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֗ם וַיִּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אָר֔וֹן וַֽיִּשְׂמְח֖וּ לִרְאֽוֹת׃
Translated: The people of Beth-shemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley. They looked up and saw the Ark, and they rejoiced when they saw it.
Transliteration: uveyt shemesh kotseriym ketsiyr-chitiym vaemek vayisheu et-eyneyhem vayireu et-haarvon vayishemechu lirevot

Hebrew: וְהָעֲגָלָ֡ה בָּ֠אָה אֶל־שְׂדֵ֨ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בֵּֽית־הַשִּׁמְשִׁי֙ וַתַּעֲמֹ֣ד שָׁ֔ם וְשָׁ֖ם אֶ֣בֶן גְּדוֹלָ֑ה וַֽיְבַקְּעוּ֙ אֶת־עֲצֵ֣י הָעֲגָלָ֔ה וְאֶ֨ת־הַפָּר֔וֹת הֶעֱל֥וּ עֹלָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The cart came into the field of Joshua of Beth-shemesh and it stopped there. They split up the wood of the cart and presented the cows as a burnt offering to G<small>OD</small>. A large stone was there;
Transliteration: vehaagalah vaah el-shedeh yehvoshua veyt-hashimeshiy vataamod sham vesham even gedvolah vayevakeu et-atsey haagalah veet-hafarvot heelu olah layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם הוֹרִ֣ידוּ ׀ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֗ה וְאֶת־הָאַרְגַּ֤ז אֲשֶׁר־אִתּוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֣וֹ כְלֵֽי־זָהָ֔ב וַיָּשִׂ֖מוּ אֶל־הָאֶ֣בֶן הַגְּדוֹלָ֑ה וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י בֵֽית־שֶׁ֗מֶשׁ הֶעֱל֨וּ עֹל֜וֹת וַֽיִּזְבְּח֧וּ זְבָחִ֛ים בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and the Levites took down the Ark of G<small>OD</small> and the chest beside it containing the gold objects and placed them on the large stone. Then the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh presented burnt offerings and other sacrifices to G<small>OD</small> that day.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim hvoriydu et-arvon yehovah veet-haaregaz asher-itvo asher-vvo kheley-zahav vayashimu el-haeven hagedvolah veaneshey veyt-shemesh heelu olvot vayizevechu zevachiym vayyvom hahu layhovah

Hebrew: וַחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה סַרְנֵֽי־פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים רָא֑וּ וַיָּשֻׁ֥בוּ עֶקְר֖וֹן בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: The five lords of the Philistines saw this and returned the same day to Ekron.
Transliteration: vachamishah sareney-felishetiym rau vayashuvu ekervon vayyvom hahu {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ טְחֹרֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵשִׁ֧יבוּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֛ים אָשָׁ֖ם לַיהֹוָ֑ה {ס} לְאַשְׁדּ֨וֹד אֶחָ֜ד {ס} לְעַזָּ֤ה אֶחָד֙ {ס} לְאַשְׁקְל֣וֹן אֶחָ֔ד {ס} לְגַ֥ת אֶחָ֖ד {ס} לְעֶקְר֥וֹן אֶחָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: The following were the golden hemorrhoids that the Philistines paid as an indemnity to G<small>OD</small>: For Ashdod, one; for Gaza, one; for Ashkelon, one; for Gath, one; for Ekron, one.
Transliteration: veeleh techorey hazahav asher heshiyvu felishetiym asham layhovah {s} leashedvod echad {s} leazah echad {s} leashekelvon echad {s} legat echad {s} leekervon echad {s}

Hebrew: וְעַכְבְּרֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֗ב מִסְפַּ֞ר כׇּל־עָרֵ֤י פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ לַחֲמֵ֣שֶׁת הַסְּרָנִ֔ים מֵעִ֣יר מִבְצָ֔ר וְעַ֖ד כֹּ֣פֶר הַפְּרָזִ֑י וְעַ֣ד ׀ אָבֵ֣ל הַגְּדוֹלָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִנִּ֤יחוּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֵ֚ת אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה עַ֚ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה בִּשְׂדֵ֥ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בֵּ֥ית הַשִּׁמְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: As for the golden mice, their number accorded with all the Philistine towns that belonged to the five lords—both fortified towns and unwalled villages, as far as the great stone on which the Ark of G<small>OD</small> was set down, to this day, in the field of Joshua of Beth-shemesh.
Transliteration: veakheverey hazahav misefar khׇl-arey felishetiym lachameshet haseraniym meiyr mivetsar vead khofer haferaziy vead avel hagedvolah asher hiniychu aleyha et arvon yehovah ad hayyvom hazeh vishedeh yehvoshua veyt hashimeshiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֞ךְ בְּאַנְשֵׁ֣י בֵֽית־שֶׁ֗מֶשׁ כִּ֤י רָאוּ֙ בַּאֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּ֤ךְ בָּעָם֙ שִׁבְעִ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִ֑ישׁ וַיִּֽתְאַבְּל֣וּ הָעָ֔ם כִּֽי־הִכָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּעָ֖ם מַכָּ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: [G<small>OD</small>] struck at the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh because they looked into the Ark of G<small>OD</small>—striking down seventy from among the people [and] fifty thousand. The people mourned, for a great slaughter had been inflicted upon the population.
Transliteration: vayakhe veaneshey veyt-shemesh khiy rau vaarvon yehovah vayakhe vaam shiveiym iysh chamishiym elef iysh vayiteavelu haam khiy-hikhah yehovah vaam makhah gedvolah

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י בֵֽית־שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ מִ֚י יוּכַ֣ל לַעֲמֹ֔ד לִפְנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֧ה הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים הַקָּד֖וֹשׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וְאֶל־מִ֖י יַעֲלֶ֥ה מֵעָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: And the people of Beth-shemesh asked, “Who can stand in attendance on the E<small>TERNAL</small>, this holy God? And to whom shall this go up from us?”
Transliteration: vayomeru aneshey veyt-shemesh miy yukhal laamod lifeney yehovah haElohim hakadvosh hazeh veel-miy yaaleh mealeynu

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־יוֹשְׁבֵ֥י קִרְיַת־יְעָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵשִׁ֤בוּ פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה רְד֕וּ הַעֲל֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: They sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kiriath-jearim to say, “The Philistines have sent back the Ark of G<small>OD</small>. Come down and take it into your keeping.”
Transliteration: vayishelechu maleakhiym el-yvoshevey kireyat-yeariym lemor heshivu felishetiym et-arvon yehovah redu haalu otvo aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אַנְשֵׁ֣י ׀ קִרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֗ים וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּבִ֣אוּ אֹת֔וֹ אֶל־בֵּ֥ית אֲבִינָדָ֖ב בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה וְאֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֤ר בְּנוֹ֙ קִדְּשׁ֔וּ לִשְׁמֹ֖ר אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The inhabitants of Kiriath-jearim came and took up the Ark of G<small>OD</small> and brought it into the house of Abinadab on the hill; and they consecrated his son Eleazar to have charge of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayavou aneshey kireyat yeariym vayaalu et-arvon yehovah vayaviu otvo el-veyt aviynadav vagiveah veet-eleazar venvo kideshu lishemor et-arvon yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִיּ֞וֹם שֶׁ֤בֶת הָאָרוֹן֙ בְּקִרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֔ים וַיִּרְבּוּ֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וַיִּהְי֖וּ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיִּנָּה֛וּ כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אַחֲרֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: A long time elapsed from the day that the Ark was housed in Kiriath-jearim, twenty years in all; and all the House of Israel yearned after G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy miyyvom shevet haarvon vekireyat yeariym vayirevu hayamiym vayiheyu esheriym shanah vayinahu khׇl-veyt yisherael acharey yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל אֶל־כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִם־בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֗ם אַתֶּ֤ם שָׁבִים֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה הָסִ֜ירוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֧י הַנֵּכָ֛ר מִתּוֹכְכֶ֖ם וְהָעַשְׁתָּר֑וֹת וְהָכִ֨ינוּ לְבַבְכֶ֤ם אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ וְעִבְדֻ֣הוּ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וְיַצֵּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיַּ֥ד פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: And Samuel said to all the House of Israel, “If you mean to return to G<small>OD</small> with all your heart, you must remove the alien gods and the Ashtaroth from your midst and direct your heart to G<small>OD</small>, who alone you should serve. Then you will be delivered from the hands of the Philistines.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-khׇl-veyt yisherael lemor im-vekhׇl-levavekhem atem shaviym el-yehovah hasiyru et-elohey hanekhar mitvokhekhem vehaashetarvot vehakhiynu levavekhem el-yehovah veiveduhu levadvo veyatsel etekhem miyad felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיָּסִ֙ירוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הַבְּעָלִ֖ים וְאֶת־הָעַשְׁתָּרֹ֑ת וַיַּעַבְד֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְבַדּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: And the Israelites removed the Baalim and Ashtaroth and they served G<small>OD</small> alone.
Transliteration: vayasiyru veney yisherael et-havealiym veet-haashetarot vayaavedu et-yehovah levadvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל קִבְצ֥וּ אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הַמִּצְפָּ֑תָה וְאֶתְפַּלֵּ֥ל בַּעַדְכֶ֖ם אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Samuel said, “Assemble all Israel at Mizpah, and I will pray to G<small>OD</small> for you.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel kivetsu et-khׇl-yisherael hamitsefatah veetefalel vaadekhem el-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ הַ֠מִּצְפָּ֠תָה וַיִּֽשְׁאֲבוּ־מַ֜יִם וַֽיִּשְׁפְּכ֣וּ ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיָּצ֙וּמוּ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ שָׁ֔ם חָטָ֖אנוּ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֧ט שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: They assembled at Mizpah, and they drew water and poured it out before G<small>OD</small>; they fasted that day, and there they confessed that they had sinned against G<small>OD</small>. And Samuel acted as chieftain of the Israelites at Mizpah.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu hamitsefatah vayisheavu-mayiim vayishefekhu lifeney yehovah vayatsumu vayyvom hahu vayomeru sham chatanu layhovah vayishefot shemuel et-veney yisherael vamitsefah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים כִּֽי־הִתְקַבְּצ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַמִּצְפָּ֔תָה וַיַּעֲל֥וּ סַרְנֵֽי־פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּֽרְא֖וּ מִפְּנֵ֥י פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: When the Philistines heard that the Israelites had assembled at Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines marched out against Israel. Hearing of this, the Israelites were terrified of the Philistines
Transliteration: vayishemeu felishetiym khiy-hitekavetsu veney-yisherael hamitsefatah vayaalu sareney-felishetiym el-yisherael vayishemeu veney yisherael vayireu mifeney felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל אַל־תַּחֲרֵ֣שׁ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ מִזְּעֹ֖ק אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְיֹשִׁעֵ֖נוּ מִיַּ֥ד פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: and they implored Samuel, “Do not neglect us and do not refrain from crying out to the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God to save us from the hands of the Philistines.”
Transliteration: vayomeru veney-yisherael el-shemuel al-tacharesh mimenu mizeok el-yehovah eloheynu veyoshienu miyad felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל טְלֵ֤ה חָלָב֙ אֶחָ֔ד (ויעלה) [וַיַּֽעֲלֵ֧הוּ] עוֹלָ֛ה כָּלִ֖יל לַיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּזְעַ֨ק שְׁמוּאֵ֤ל אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ בְּעַ֣ד יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Samuel took a suckling lamb and sacrificed it as a whole burnt offering to G<small>OD</small>; and Samuel cried out to G<small>OD</small> on behalf of Israel, and G<small>OD</small> responded to him.
Transliteration: vayikach shemuel teleh chalav echad (vylh) [vayaalehu] volah khaliyl layhovah vayizeak shemuel el-yehovah vead yisherael vayaanehu yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י שְׁמוּאֵל֙ מַעֲלֶ֣ה הָעוֹלָ֔ה וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֣ים נִגְּשׁ֔וּ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּרְעֵ֣ם יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּקוֹל־גָּ֠ד֠וֹל בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֤וּא עַל־פְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ וַיְהֻמֵּ֔ם וַיִּנָּגְפ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: For as Samuel was presenting the burnt offering and the Philistines advanced to attack Israel, G<small>OD</small> thundered mightily against the Philistines that day, throwing them into confusion; and they were routed by Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy shemuel maaleh havolah ufelishetiym nigeshu lamilechamah veyisherael vayareem yehovah vekvol-gadvol vayyvom hahu al-felishetiym vayehumem vayinagefu lifeney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִן־הַמִּצְפָּ֔ה וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֖וּ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּכּ֕וּם עַד־מִתַּ֖חַת לְבֵ֥ית כָּֽר׃
Translated: The men of Israel sallied out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, striking them down to a point below Beth-car.
Transliteration: vayetseu aneshey yisherael min-hamitsefah vayiredefu et-felishetiym vayakhum ad-mitachat leveyt khar

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל אֶ֣בֶן אַחַ֗ת וַיָּ֤שֶׂם בֵּֽין־הַמִּצְפָּה֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַשֵּׁ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ אֶ֣בֶן הָעָ֑זֶר וַיֹּאמַ֕ר עַד־הֵ֖נָּה עֲזָרָ֥נוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Samuel took a stone and set it up between Mizpah and Shen, and named it Eben-ezer: “For up to now,” he said, “G<small>OD</small> has helped us.”
Transliteration: vayikach shemuel even achat vayashem veyn-hamitsefah uveyn hashen vayikera et-shemah even haazer vayomar ad-henah azaranu yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּכָּֽנְעוּ֙ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְלֹֽא־יָסְפ֣וּ ע֔וֹד לָב֖וֹא בִּגְב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַתְּהִ֤י יַד־יְהֹוָה֙ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: The Philistines were humbled and did not invade the territory of Israel again; and G<small>OD</small>’s hand was set against the Philistines as long as Samuel lived.
Transliteration: vayikhaneu hafelishetiym velo-yasefu vod lavvo vigevul yisherael vatehiy yad-yehovah vafelishetiym khol yemey shemuel

Hebrew: וַתָּשֹׁ֣בְנָה הֶעָרִ֡ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָֽקְחוּ־פְלִשְׁתִּים֩ מֵאֵ֨ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל <small>׀</small> לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵעֶקְר֣וֹן וְעַד־גַּ֔ת וְאֶ֨ת־גְּבוּלָ֔ן הִצִּ֥יל יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֣ד פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיְהִ֣י שָׁל֔וֹם בֵּ֥ין יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וּבֵ֥ין הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: The towns that the Philistines had taken from Israel, from Ekron to Gath, were restored to Israel; Israel recovered all her territory from the Philistines. There was also peace between Israel and the Amorites.
Transliteration: vatashovenah heariym asher lakechu-felishetiym meet yisherael <small></small> leyisherael meekervon vead-gat veet-gevulan hitsiyl yisherael miyad felishetiym vayehiy shalvom veyn yisherael uveyn haemoriy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֤ט שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽיו׃
Translated: Samuel judged Israel as long as he lived.
Transliteration: vayishefot shemuel et-yisherael khol yemey chayayv

Hebrew: וְהָלַ֗ךְ מִדֵּ֤י שָׁנָה֙ בְּשָׁנָ֔ה וְסָבַב֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל וְהַגִּלְגָּ֖ל וְהַמִּצְפָּ֑ה וְשָׁפַט֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַמְּקוֹמ֖וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Each year he made the rounds of Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah, acting as judge over Israel at all those places.
Transliteration: vehalakhe midey shanah veshanah vesavav veyt-el vehagilegal vehamitsefah veshafat et-yisherael et khׇl-hamekvomvot haeleh

Hebrew: וּתְשֻׁבָת֤וֹ הָרָמָ֙תָה֙ כִּֽי־שָׁ֣ם בֵּית֔וֹ וְשָׁ֖ם שָׁפָ֣ט אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּבֶן־שָׁ֥ם מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then he would return to Ramah, for his home was there, and there too he would judge Israel. He built an altar there to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: uteshuvatvo haramatah khiy-sham veytvo vesham shafat et-yisherael vayiven-sham mizevecha layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר זָקֵ֖ן שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַיָּ֧שֶׂם אֶת־בָּנָ֛יו שֹׁפְטִ֖ים לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When Samuel grew old, he appointed his sons judges over Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher zaken shemuel vayashem et-vanayv shofetiym leyisherael

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י שֶׁם־בְּנ֤וֹ הַבְּכוֹר֙ יוֹאֵ֔ל וְשֵׁ֥ם מִשְׁנֵ֖הוּ אֲבִיָּ֑ה שֹׁפְטִ֖ים בִּבְאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: The name of his first-born son was Joel, and his second son’s name was Abijah; they sat as judges in Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: vayehiy shem-venvo havekhvor yvoel veshem mishenehu aviyah shofetiym viveer shava

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־הָלְכ֤וּ בָנָיו֙ בִּדְרָכָ֔ו וַיִּטּ֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַבָּ֑צַע וַיִּ֨קְחוּ־שֹׁ֔חַד וַיַּטּ֖וּ מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ {פ}
Translated: But his sons did not follow in his ways; they were bent on gain, they accepted bribes, and they subverted justice.
Transliteration: velo-halekhu vanayv viderakhav vayitu acharey havatsa vayikechu-shochad vayatu mishefat {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְקַבְּצ֔וּ כֹּ֖ל זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל הָרָמָֽתָה׃
Translated: All the elders of Israel assembled and came to Samuel at Ramah,
Transliteration: vayitekavetsu khol zikeney yisherael vayavou el-shemuel haramatah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו הִנֵּה֙ אַתָּ֣ה זָקַ֔נְתָּ וּבָנֶ֕יךָ לֹ֥א הָלְכ֖וּ בִּדְרָכֶ֑יךָ עַתָּ֗ה שִֽׂימָה־לָּ֥נוּ מֶ֛לֶךְ לְשׇׁפְטֵ֖נוּ כְּכׇל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: and they said to him, “You have grown old, and your sons have not followed your ways. Therefore appoint a king for us, to govern us like all other nations.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv hineh atah zakaneta uvaneykha lo halekhu viderakheykha atah shiymah-lanu melekhe leshׇfetenu khekhׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רַע הַדָּבָר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽמְר֔וּ תְּנָה־לָּ֥נוּ מֶ֖לֶךְ לְשׇׁפְטֵ֑נוּ וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Samuel was displeased that they said “Give us a king to govern us.” Samuel prayed to G<small>OD</small>,
Transliteration: vayera hadavar veeyney shemuel khaasher ameru tenah-lanu melekhe leshׇfetenu vayitefalel shemuel el-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל שְׁמַע֙ בְּק֣וֹל הָעָ֔ם לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמְר֖וּ אֵלֶ֑יךָ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אֹֽתְךָ֙ מָאָ֔סוּ כִּי־אֹתִ֥י מָאֲס֖וּ מִמְּלֹ֥ךְ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: and G<small>OD</small> replied to Samuel, “Heed the demand of the people in everything they say to you. For it is not you that they have rejected; it is Me they have rejected to rule over them.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-shemuel shema vekvol haam lekhol asher-yomeru eleykha khiy lo otekha maasu khiy-otiy maasu mimelokhe aleyhem

Hebrew: כְּכׇֽל־הַמַּעֲשִׂ֣ים אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֗וּ מִיּוֹם֩ הַעֲלֹתִ֨י אוֹתָ֤ם מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ וְעַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיַּ֣עַזְבֻ֔נִי וַיַּעַבְד֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים כֵּ֛ן הֵ֥מָּה עֹשִׂ֖ים גַּם־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Like everything else they have done ever since I brought them out of Egypt to this day—forsaking Me and worshiping other gods—so they are doing to you.
Transliteration: khekhׇl-hamaashiym asher-ashu miyyvom haalotiy votam mimitserayiim vead-hayyvom hazeh vayaazevuniy vayaavedu Elohim acheriym khen hemah oshiym gam-lakhe

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקוֹלָ֑ם אַ֗ךְ כִּֽי־הָעֵ֤ד תָּעִיד֙ בָּהֶ֔ם וְהִגַּדְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֔ם מִשְׁפַּ֣ט הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִמְלֹ֖ךְ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Heed their demand; but warn them solemnly, and tell them about the practices of any king who will rule over them.”
Transliteration: veatah shema vekvolam akhe khiy-haed taiyd vahem vehigadeta lahem mishefat hamelekhe asher yimelokhe aleyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶל־הָעָ֕ם הַשֹּׁאֲלִ֥ים מֵאִתּ֖וֹ מֶֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Samuel reported all G<small>OD</small>’s words to the people, who were asking him for a king.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel et khׇl-diverey yehovah el-haam hashoaliym meitvo melekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר זֶ֗ה יִֽהְיֶה֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣ט הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִמְלֹ֖ךְ עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֣ם יִקָּ֗ח וְשָׂ֥ם לוֹ֙ בְּמֶרְכַּבְתּ֣וֹ וּבְפָרָשָׁ֔יו וְרָצ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י מֶרְכַּבְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He said, “This will be the practice of the king who will rule over you: He will take your sons and appoint them as his charioteers and riders, and they will serve as outrunners for his chariots.
Transliteration: vayomer zeh yiheyeh mishefat hamelekhe asher yimelokhe aleykhem et-veneykhem yikach vesham lvo vemerekhavetvo uvefarashayv veratsu lifeney merekhavetvo

Hebrew: וְלָשׂ֣וּם ל֔וֹ שָׂרֵ֥י אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֣י חֲמִשִּׁ֑ים וְלַחֲרֹ֤שׁ חֲרִישׁוֹ֙ וְלִקְצֹ֣ר קְצִיר֔וֹ וְלַעֲשׂ֥וֹת כְּלֵֽי־מִלְחַמְתּ֖וֹ וּכְלֵ֥י רִכְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He will appoint them as his chiefs of thousands and of fifties; or they will have to plow his fields, reap his harvest, and make his weapons and the equipment for his chariots.
Transliteration: velashum lvo sharey alafiym vesharey chamishiym velacharosh chariyshvo veliketsor ketsiyrvo velaashvot kheley-milechametvo ukheley rikhevvo

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיכֶ֖ם יִקָּ֑ח לְרַקָּח֥וֹת וּלְטַבָּח֖וֹת וּלְאֹפֽוֹת׃
Translated: He will take your daughters as perfumers, cooks, and bakers.
Transliteration: veet-venvoteykhem yikach lerakachvot uletavachvot uleofvot

Hebrew: וְאֶת־שְׂ֠דֽוֹתֵיכֶ֠ם וְאֶת־כַּרְמֵיכֶ֧ם וְזֵיתֵיכֶ֛ם הַטּוֹבִ֖ים יִקָּ֑ח וְנָתַ֖ן לַעֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: He will seize your choice fields, vineyards, and olive groves, and give them to his courtiers.
Transliteration: veet-shedvoteykhem veet-kharemeykhem vezeyteykhem hatvoviym yikach venatan laavadayv

Hebrew: וְזַרְעֵיכֶ֥ם וְכַרְמֵיכֶ֖ם יַעְשֹׂ֑ר וְנָתַ֥ן לְסָרִיסָ֖יו וְלַעֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: He will take a tenth part of your grain and vintage and give it to his eunuchs and courtiers.
Transliteration: vezareeykhem vekharemeykhem yaeshor venatan lesariysayv velaavadayv

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־עַבְדֵיכֶם֩ וְֽאֶת־שִׁפְח֨וֹתֵיכֶ֜ם וְאֶת־בַּחוּרֵיכֶ֧ם הַטּוֹבִ֛ים וְאֶת־חֲמוֹרֵיכֶ֖ם יִקָּ֑ח וְעָשָׂ֖ה לִמְלַאכְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He will take your male and female slaves, your choice young men, and your donkeys, and put them to work for him.
Transliteration: veet-avedeykhem veet-shifechvoteykhem veet-vachureykhem hatvoviym veet-chamvoreykhem yikach veashah limelakhetvo

Hebrew: צֹאנְכֶ֖ם יַעְשֹׂ֑ר וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּֽהְיוּ־ל֥וֹ לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: He will take a tenth part of your flocks, and you shall become his slaves.
