Transliteration: tsonekhem yaeshor veatem tiheyu-lvo laavadiym

Hebrew: וּזְעַקְתֶּם֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא מִלִּפְנֵ֣י מַלְכְּכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּחַרְתֶּ֖ם לָכֶ֑ם וְלֹא־יַעֲנֶ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: The day will come when you cry out because of the king whom you yourselves have chosen; and G<small>OD</small> will not answer you on that day.”
Transliteration: uzeaketem vayyvom hahu milifeney malekhekhem asher vecharetem lakhem velo-yaaneh yehovah etekhem vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֲנ֣וּ הָעָ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֖עַ בְּק֣וֹל שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֹּ֔א כִּ֥י אִם־מֶ֖לֶךְ יִֽהְיֶ֥ה עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: But the people would not listen to Samuel’s warning. “No,” they said. “We must have a king over us,
Transliteration: vayemaanu haam lishemoa vekvol shemuel vayomeru lo khiy im-melekhe yiheyeh aleynu

Hebrew: וְהָיִ֥ינוּ גַם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ כְּכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם וּשְׁפָטָ֤נוּ מַלְכֵּ֙נוּ֙ וְיָצָ֣א לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ וְנִלְחַ֖ם אֶת־מִלְחֲמֹתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: that we may be like all the other nations: Let our king rule over us and go out at our head and fight our battles.”
Transliteration: vehayiynu gam-anachenu khekhׇl-hagvoyim ushefatanu malekhenu veyatsa lefaneynu venilecham et-milechamotenu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַֽיְדַבְּרֵ֖ם בְּאׇזְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: When Samuel heard all that the people said, he reported it to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayishema shemuel et khׇl-diverey haam vayedaverem veׇzeney yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵל֙ שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקוֹלָ֔ם וְהִמְלַכְתָּ֥ לָהֶ֖ם מֶ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְכ֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ לְעִירֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to Samuel, “Heed their demands and appoint a king for them.” Samuel then said to the representatives of Israel, “All of you go home.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-shemuel shema vekvolam vehimelakheta lahem melekhe vayomer shemuel el-aneshey yisherael lekhu iysh leiyrvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי־אִ֣ישׁ (מבן ימין) [מִבִּנְיָמִ֗ין] וּ֠שְׁמ֠וֹ קִ֣ישׁ בֶּן־אֲבִיאֵ֞ל בֶּן־צְר֧וֹר בֶּן־בְּכוֹרַ֛ת בֶּן־אֲפִ֖יחַ בֶּן־אִ֣ישׁ יְמִינִ֑י גִּבּ֖וֹר חָֽיִל׃
Translated: There was a man in Benjamin whose name was Kish son of Abiel son of Zeror son of Becorath son of Aphiah, a Benjaminite, a man of substance.
Transliteration: vayehiy-iysh (mvn ymyn) [mivineyamiyn] ushemvo kiysh ven-aviyel ven-tservor ven-vekhvorat ven-afiycha ven-iysh yemiyniy givvor chayiil

Hebrew: וְלוֹ־הָיָ֨ה בֵ֜ן וּשְׁמ֤וֹ שָׁאוּל֙ בָּח֣וּר וָט֔וֹב וְאֵ֥ין אִ֛ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ט֣וֹב מִמֶּ֑נּוּ מִשִּׁכְמ֣וֹ וָמַ֔עְלָה גָּבֹ֖הַּ מִכׇּל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He had a son whose name was Saul, an excellent young man; no one among the Israelites was handsomer than he; he was a head taller than any of the people.
Transliteration: velvo-hayah ven ushemvo shaul vachur vatvov veeyn iysh miveney yisherael tvov mimenu mishikhemvo vamaelah gavoha mikhׇl-haam

Hebrew: וַתֹּאבַ֙דְנָה֙ הָאֲתֹנ֔וֹת לְקִ֖ישׁ אֲבִ֣י שָׁא֑וּל וַיֹּ֨אמֶר קִ֜ישׁ אֶל־שָׁא֣וּל בְּנ֗וֹ קַח־נָ֤א אִתְּךָ֙ אֶת־אַחַ֣ד מֵֽהַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְק֣וּם לֵ֔ךְ בַּקֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־הָאֲתֹנֹֽת׃
Translated: Once the donkeys of Saul’s father Kish went astray, and Kish said to his son Saul, “Take along one of the servants and go out and look for the donkeys.”
Transliteration: vatovadenah haatonvot lekiysh aviy shaul vayomer kiysh el-shaul venvo kach-na itekha et-achad mehaneariym vekum lekhe vakesh et-haatonot

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ר בְּהַר־אֶפְרַ֛יִם וַיַּעֲבֹ֥ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־שָׁלִ֖שָׁה וְלֹ֣א מָצָ֑אוּ וַיַּעַבְר֤וּ בְאֶרֶץ־שַֽׁעֲלִים֙ וָאַ֔יִן וַיַּעֲבֹ֥ר בְּאֶרֶץ־יְמִינִ֖י וְלֹ֥א מָצָֽאוּ׃
Translated: He passed into the hill country of Ephraim. He crossed the district of Shalishah, but they did not find them. They passed through the district of Shaalim, but they were not there. They traversed the [entire] territory of Benjamin, and still they did not find them.
Transliteration: vayaavor vehar-eferayiim vayaavor veerets-shalishah velo matsau vayaaveru veerets-shaaliym vaayiin vayaavor veerets-yemiyniy velo matsau

Hebrew: הֵ֗מָּה בָּ֚אוּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ צ֔וּף וְשָׁא֥וּל אָמַ֛ר לְנַעֲר֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֖וֹ לְכָ֣ה וְנָשׁ֑וּבָה פֶּן־יֶחְדַּ֥ל אָבִ֛י מִן־הָאֲתֹנ֖וֹת וְדָ֥אַג לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: When they reached the district of Zuph, Saul said to the servant who was with him, “Let us turn back, or my father will stop worrying about the donkeys and begin to worry about us.”
Transliteration: hemah vau veerets tsuf veshaul amar lenaarvo asher-imvo lekhah venashuvah fen-yechedal aviy min-haatonvot vedaag lanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִנֵּה־נָ֤א אִישׁ־אֱלֹהִים֙ בָּעִ֣יר הַזֹּ֔את וְהָאִ֣ישׁ נִכְבָּ֔ד כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יְדַבֵּ֖ר בּ֣וֹא יָב֑וֹא עַתָּה֙ נֵ֣לְכָה שָּׁ֔ם אוּלַי֙ יַגִּ֣יד לָ֔נוּ אֶת־דַּרְכֵּ֖נוּ אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֥כְנוּ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: But he replied, “There is an agent of God in that town, and the man is highly esteemed; everything that he says comes true. Let us go there; perhaps he will tell us about the errand on which we set out.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo hineh-na iysh-Elohim vaiyr hazot vehaiysh nikhevad khol asher-yedaver vvo yavvo atah nelekhah sham ulay yagiyd lanu et-darekhenu asher-halakhenu aleyha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל לְנַעֲר֗וֹ וְהִנֵּ֣ה נֵלֵךְ֮ וּמַה־נָּבִ֣יא לָאִישׁ֒ כִּ֤י הַלֶּ֙חֶם֙ אָזַ֣ל מִכֵּלֵ֔ינוּ וּתְשׁוּרָ֥ה אֵין־לְהָבִ֖יא לְאִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים מָ֖ה אִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: “But if we go,” Saul said to his servant, “what can we bring the man? For the food in our bags is all gone, and there is nothing we can bring to the agent of God as a present. What have we got?”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul lenaarvo vehineh nelekhe umah-naviy laiysh khiy halechem azal mikheleynu uteshurah eyn-lehaviy leiysh haElohim mah itanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤סֶף הַנַּ֙עַר֙ לַעֲנ֣וֹת אֶת־שָׁא֔וּל וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה֙ נִמְצָ֣א בְיָדִ֔י רֶ֖בַע שֶׁ֣קֶל כָּ֑סֶף וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ לְאִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְהִגִּ֥יד לָ֖נוּ אֶת־דַּרְכֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated: The servant answered Saul again, “I happen to have a quarter-shekel of silver. I can give that to the agent of God and he will tell us about our errand.”—
Transliteration: vayosef hanaar laanvot et-shaul vayomer hineh nimetsa veyadiy reva shekel khasef venatatiy leiysh haElohim vehigiyd lanu et-darekhenu

Hebrew: לְפָנִ֣ים ׀ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר הָאִישׁ֙ בְּלֶכְתּוֹ֙ לִדְר֣וֹשׁ אֱלֹהִ֔ים לְכ֥וּ וְנֵלְכָ֖ה עַד־הָרֹאֶ֑ה כִּ֤י לַנָּבִיא֙ הַיּ֔וֹם יִקָּרֵ֥א לְפָנִ֖ים הָרֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: Formerly in Israel, such a person who went to inquire of God would say, “Come, let us go to the seer,” for the prophet of today was formerly called a seer.—
Transliteration: lefaniym veyisherael khoh-amar haiysh velekhetvo lidervosh Elohim lekhu venelekhah ad-haroeh khiy lanaviy hayyvom yikare lefaniym haroeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֧וּל לְנַעֲר֛וֹ ט֥וֹב דְּבָרְךָ֖ לְכָ֣ה <small>׀</small> נֵלֵ֑כָה וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ אֶל־הָעִ֔יר אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Saul said to his servant, “A good idea; let us go.” And they went to the town where the agent of God lived.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul lenaarvo tvov devarekha lekhah <small></small> nelekhah vayelekhu el-haiyr asher-sham iysh haElohim

Hebrew: הֵ֗מָּה עֹלִים֙ בְּמַעֲלֵ֣ה הָעִ֔יר וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ מָצְא֣וּ נְעָר֔וֹת יֹצְא֖וֹת לִשְׁאֹ֣ב מָ֑יִם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לָהֶ֔ן הֲיֵ֥שׁ בָּזֶ֖ה הָרֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: As they were climbing the ascent to the town, they met some young women coming out to draw water, and they asked them, “Is the seer in town?”
Transliteration: hemah oliym vemaaleh haiyr vehemah matseu nearvot yotsevot lisheov mayiim vayomeru lahen haeish vazeh haroeh

Hebrew: וַתַּעֲנֶ֧ינָה אוֹתָ֛ם וַתֹּאמַ֥רְנָה יֵּ֖שׁ הִנֵּ֣ה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ מַהֵ֣ר ׀ עַתָּ֗ה כִּ֤י הַיּוֹם֙ בָּ֣א לָעִ֔יר כִּ֣י זֶ֧בַח הַיּ֛וֹם לָעָ֖ם בַּבָּמָֽה׃
Translated: “Yes,” they replied. “He is up there ahead of you.”—“Hurry, for he has just come to the town because the people have a sacrifice at the shrine today!”—
Transliteration: vataaneynah votam vatomarenah yesh hineh lefaneykha maher atah khiy hayyvom va laiyr khiy zevach hayyvom laam vavamah

Hebrew: כְּבֹאֲכֶ֣ם הָעִ֣יר כֵּ֣ן תִּמְצְא֣וּן אֹת֡וֹ בְּטֶ֩רֶם֩ יַעֲלֶ֨ה הַבָּמָ֜תָה לֶאֱכֹ֗ל כִּ֠י לֹֽא־יֹאכַ֤ל הָעָם֙ עַד־בֹּא֔וֹ כִּי־הוּא֙ יְבָרֵ֣ךְ הַזֶּ֔בַח אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יֹאכְל֣וּ הַקְּרֻאִ֑ים וְעַתָּ֣ה עֲל֔וּ כִּי־אֹת֥וֹ כְהַיּ֖וֹם תִּמְצְא֥וּן אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: “As soon as you enter the town, you will find him before he goes up to the shrine to eat.”—“The people will not eat until he comes; for he must first bless the sacrifice and only then will the guests eat.”—“Go up at once, for you will find him right away!”
Transliteration: khevoakhem haiyr khen timetseun otvo veterem yaaleh havamatah leekhol khiy lo-yokhal haam ad-vovo khiy-hu yevarekhe hazevach acharey-khen yokhelu hakeruiym veatah alu khiy-otvo khehayyvom timetseun otvo

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ הָעִ֑יר הֵ֗מָּה בָּאִים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֔יר וְהִנֵּ֤ה שְׁמוּאֵל֙ יֹצֵ֣א לִקְרָאתָ֔ם לַעֲל֖וֹת הַבָּמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: So they went up to the town; and as they were entering the town, Samuel came out toward them, on his way up to the shrine.
Transliteration: vayaalu haiyr hemah vaiym vetvokhe haiyr vehineh shemuel yotse likeratam laalvot havamah {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֔ה גָּלָ֖ה אֶת־אֹ֣זֶן שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל י֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד לִפְנֵ֥י בֽוֹא־שָׁא֖וּל לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Now the day before Saul came, G<small>OD</small> had revealed the following to Samuel:
Transliteration: vayhovah galah et-ozen shemuel yvom echad lifeney vvo-shaul lemor

Hebrew: כָּעֵ֣ת <small>׀</small> מָחָ֡ר אֶשְׁלַח֩ אֵלֶ֨יךָ אִ֜ישׁ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֗ן וּמְשַׁחְתּ֤וֹ לְנָגִיד֙ עַל־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֶת־עַמִּ֖י מִיַּ֣ד פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים כִּ֤י רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־עַמִּ֔י כִּ֛י בָּ֥אָה צַעֲקָת֖וֹ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: “At this time tomorrow, I will send a man to you from the territory of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him ruler of My people Israel. He will deliver My people from the hands of the Philistines; for I have taken note of My people, their outcry has come to Me.”
Transliteration: khaet <small></small> machar eshelach eleykha iysh meerets vineyamin umeshachetvo lenagiyd al-amiy yisherael vehvoshiya et-amiy miyad felishetiym khiy raiytiy et-amiy khiy vaah tsaakatvo elay

Hebrew: וּשְׁמוּאֵ֖ל רָאָ֣ה אֶת־שָׁא֑וּל וַיהֹוָ֣ה עָנָ֔הוּ הִנֵּ֤ה הָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣רְתִּי אֵלֶ֔יךָ זֶ֖ה יַעְצֹ֥ר בְּעַמִּֽי׃
Translated: As soon as Samuel saw Saul, G<small>OD</small> declared to him, “This is the man that I told you would govern My people.”
Transliteration: ushemuel raah et-shaul vayhovah anahu hineh haiysh asher amaretiy eleykha zeh yaetsor veamiy

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֥שׁ שָׁא֛וּל אֶת־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל בְּת֣וֹךְ הַשָּׁ֑עַר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י אֵי־זֶ֖ה בֵּ֥ית הָרֹאֶֽה׃
Translated: Saul approached Samuel inside the gate and said to him, “Tell me, please, where is the house of the seer?”
Transliteration: vayigash shaul et-shemuel vetvokhe hashaar vayomer hagiydah-na liy ey-zeh veyt haroeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל אֶת־שָׁא֗וּל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אָנֹכִ֣י הָרֹאֶ֔ה עֲלֵ֤ה לְפָנַי֙ הַבָּמָ֔ה וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֥ם עִמִּ֖י הַיּ֑וֹם וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֣יךָ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּֽלְבָבְךָ֖ אַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃
Translated: And Samuel answered Saul, “I am the seer. Go up ahead of me to the shrine, for you shall eat with me today; and in the morning I will let you go, after telling you whatever may be on your mind.
Transliteration: vayaan shemuel et-shaul vayomer anokhiy haroeh aleh lefanay havamah vaakhaletem imiy hayyvom veshilachetiykha vavoker vekhol asher vilevavekha agiyd lakhe

Hebrew: וְלָאֲתֹנ֞וֹת הָאֹבְד֣וֹת לְךָ֗ הַיּוֹם֙ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת הַיָּמִ֔ים אַל־תָּ֧שֶׂם אֶֽת־לִבְּךָ֛ לָהֶ֖ם כִּ֣י נִמְצָ֑אוּ וּלְמִי֙ כׇּל־חֶמְדַּ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הֲל֣וֹא לְךָ֔ וּלְכֹ֖ל בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: As for your donkeys that strayed three days ago, do not concern yourself about them, for they have been found. And for whom is all Israel yearning, if not for you and all your ancestral house?”
Transliteration: velaatonvot haovedvot lekha hayyvom sheloshet hayamiym al-tashem et-livekha lahem khiy nimetsau ulemiy khׇl-chemedat yisherael halvo lekha ulekhol veyt aviykha {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן שָׁא֜וּל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲל֨וֹא בֶן־יְמִינִ֤י אָנֹ֙כִי֙ מִקְּטַנֵּי֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִשְׁפַּחְתִּי֙ הַצְּעִרָ֔ה מִכׇּֽל־מִשְׁפְּח֖וֹת שִׁבְטֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן וְלָ֙מָּה֙ דִּבַּ֣רְתָּ אֵלַ֔י כַּדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Saul replied, “But I am only a Benjaminite, from the smallest of the tribes of Israel, and my clan is the least of all the clans of the tribe of Benjamin! Why do you say such things to me?”
Transliteration: vayaan shaul vayomer halvo ven-yemiyniy anokhiy miketaney shivetey yisherael umishefachetiy hatseirah mikhׇl-mishefechvot shivetey vineyamin velamah divareta elay khadavar hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶת־שָׁא֣וּל וְאֶֽת־נַעֲר֔וֹ וַיְבִיאֵ֖ם לִשְׁכָּ֑תָה וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֤ם מָקוֹם֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הַקְּרוּאִ֔ים וְהֵ֖מָּה כִּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ם אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the hall, and gave them a place at the head of the guests, who numbered about thirty.
Transliteration: vayikach shemuel et-shaul veet-naarvo vayeviyem lishekhatah vayiten lahem makvom verosh hakeruiym vehemah khisheloshim iysh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ לַטַּבָּ֔ח תְּנָה֙ אֶת־הַמָּנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָ֑ךְ אֲשֶׁר֙ אָמַ֣רְתִּי אֵלֶ֔יךָ שִׂ֥ים אֹתָ֖הּ עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion that I gave you and told you to set aside.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel latavach tenah et-hamanah asher natatiy lakhe asher amaretiy eleykha shiym otah imakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רֶם הַ֠טַּבָּ֠ח אֶת־הַשּׁ֨וֹק וְהֶעָלֶ֜יהָ וַיָּ֣שֶׂם ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י שָׁא֗וּל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הִנֵּ֤ה הַנִּשְׁאָר֙ שִׂים־לְפָנֶ֣יךָֽ אֱכֹ֔ל כִּ֧י לַמּוֹעֵ֛ד שָֽׁמוּר־לְךָ֥ לֵאמֹ֖ר הָעָ֣ם ׀ קָרָ֑אתִי וַיֹּ֧אכַל שָׁא֛וּל עִם־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: The cook lifted up the thigh and what was on it, and set it before Saul. And [Samuel] said, “What has been reserved is set before you. Eat; it has been kept for you for this occasion, when I said I was inviting the people.” So Saul ate with Samuel that day.
Transliteration: vayarem hatavach et-hashvok vehealeyha vayashem lifeney shaul vayomer hineh hanishear shiym-lefaneykha ekhol khiy lamvoed shamur-lekha lemor haam karatiy vayokhal shaul im-shemuel vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֥וּ מֵהַבָּמָ֖ה הָעִ֑יר וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר עִם־שָׁא֖וּל עַל־הַגָּֽג׃
Translated: They then descended from the shrine to the town, and [Samuel] talked with Saul on the roof.
Transliteration: vayeredu mehavamah haiyr vayedaver im-shaul al-hagag

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֗מוּ וַיְהִ֞י כַּעֲל֤וֹת הַשַּׁ֙חַר֙ וַיִּקְרָ֨א שְׁמוּאֵ֤ל אֶל־שָׁאוּל֙ (הגג) [הַגָּ֣גָה] לֵאמֹ֔ר ק֖וּמָה וַאֲשַׁלְּחֶ֑ךָּ וַיָּ֣קׇם שָׁא֗וּל וַיֵּצְא֧וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֛ם ה֥וּא וּשְׁמוּאֵ֖ל הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: Early, at the break of day, Samuel called to Saul on the roof. He said, “Get up, and I will send you off.” Saul arose, and the two of them, Samuel and he, went outside.
Transliteration: vayashekhimu vayehiy khaalvot hashachar vayikera shemuel el-shaul (hgg) [hagagah] lemor kumah vaashalechekha vayakׇm shaul vayetseu sheneyhem hu ushemuel hachutsah

Hebrew: הֵ֗מָּה יֽוֹרְדִים֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הָעִ֔יר וּשְׁמוּאֵ֞ל אָמַ֣ר אֶל־שָׁא֗וּל אֱמֹ֥ר לַנַּ֛עַר וְיַעֲבֹ֥ר לְפָנֵ֖ינוּ וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֑ר וְאַתָּה֙ עֲמֹ֣ד כַּיּ֔וֹם וְאַשְׁמִיעֲךָ֖ אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: As they were walking toward the end of the town, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to walk ahead of us”—and he walked ahead—“but you stop here a moment and I will make known to you the word of God.”
Transliteration: hemah yvorediym viketseh haiyr ushemuel amar el-shaul emor lanaar veyaavor lefaneynu vayaavor veatah amod khayyvom veashemiyakha et-devar Elohim {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל אֶת־פַּ֥ךְ הַשֶּׁ֛מֶן וַיִּצֹ֥ק עַל־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ וַיִּשָּׁקֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הֲל֗וֹא כִּֽי־מְשָׁחֲךָ֧ יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לְנָגִֽיד׃
Translated: Samuel took a flask of oil and poured some on Saul’s head and kissed him, and said, “G<small>OD</small> herewith anoints you ruler over this people—God’s own.
Transliteration: vayikach shemuel et-fakhe hashemen vayitsok al-roshvo vayishakehu vayomer halvo khiy-meshachakha yehovah al-nachalatvo lenagiyd

Hebrew: בְּלֶכְתְּךָ֤ הַיּוֹם֙ מֵֽעִמָּדִ֔י וּמָצָ֩אתָ֩ שְׁנֵ֨י אֲנָשִׁ֜ים עִם־קְבֻרַ֥ת רָחֵ֛ל בִּגְב֥וּל בִּנְיָמִ֖ן בְּצֶלְצַ֑ח וְאָמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֗יךָ נִמְצְא֤וּ הָאֲתֹנוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָלַ֣כְתָּ לְבַקֵּ֔שׁ וְהִנֵּ֨ה נָטַ֤שׁ אָבִ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י הָאֲתֹנ֔וֹת וְדָאַ֤ג לָכֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לִבְנִֽי׃
Translated: When you leave me today, you will meet two men near the tomb of Rachel in the territory of Benjamin, at Zelzah, and they will tell you that the donkeys you set out to look for have been found, and that your father has stopped being concerned about the donkeys and is worrying about you, saying: ‘What shall I do about my son?’
Transliteration: velekhetekha hayyvom meimadiy umatsata sheney anashiym im-kevurat rachel vigevul vineyamin vetseletsach veameru eleykha nimetseu haatonvot asher halakheta levakesh vehineh natash aviykha et-diverey haatonvot vedaag lakhem lemor mah eesheh liveniy

Hebrew: וְחָלַפְתָּ֨ מִשָּׁ֜ם וָהָ֗לְאָה וּבָ֙אתָ֙ עַד־אֵל֣וֹן תָּב֔וֹר וּמְצָא֤וּךָ שָּׁם֙ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֔ים עֹלִ֥ים אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל אֶחָ֞ד נֹשֵׂ֣א ׀ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה גְדָיִ֗ים וְאֶחָד֙ נֹשֵׂ֗א שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ כִּכְּר֣וֹת לֶ֔חֶם וְאֶחָ֖ד נֹשֵׂ֥א נֵבֶל־יָֽיִן׃
Translated: You shall pass on from there until you come to the terebinth of Tabor. There you will be met by three men making a pilgrimage to God at Bethel. One will be carrying three kids, another will be carrying three loaves of bread, and the third will be carrying a jar of wine.
Transliteration: vechalafeta misham vahaleah uvata ad-elvon tavvor umetsaukha sham sheloshah anashiym oliym el-haElohim veyt-el echad noshe sheloshah gedayiym veechad noshe sheloshet khikhervot lechem veechad noshe nevel-yayiin

Hebrew: וְשָׁאֲל֥וּ לְךָ֖ לְשָׁל֑וֹם וְנָתְנ֤וּ לְךָ֙ שְׁתֵּי־לֶ֔חֶם וְלָקַחְתָּ֖ מִיָּדָֽם׃
Translated: They will greet you and offer you two loaves of bread, which you shall accept.
Transliteration: veshaalu lekha leshalvom venatenu lekha shetey-lechem velakacheta miyadam

Hebrew: אַ֣חַר כֵּ֗ן תָּבוֹא֙ גִּבְעַ֣ת הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם נְצִבֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וִיהִי֩ כְבֹאֲךָ֨ שָׁ֜ם הָעִ֗יר וּפָגַעְתָּ֞ חֶ֤בֶל נְבִאִים֙ יֹרְדִ֣ים מֵהַבָּמָ֔ה וְלִפְנֵיהֶ֞ם נֵ֤בֶל וְתֹף֙ וְחָלִ֣יל וְכִנּ֔וֹר וְהֵ֖מָּה מִֽתְנַבְּאִֽים׃
Translated: After that, you are to go on to the Hill of God, where the Philistine prefects reside. There, as you enter the town, you will encounter a band of prophets coming down from the shrine, preceded by lyres, hand-drums, flutes, and harps, and they will be speaking in ecstasy.
Transliteration: achar khen tavvo giveat haElohim asher-sham netsivey felishetiym viyhiy khevoakha sham haiyr ufagaeta chevel neviiym yorediym mehavamah velifeneyhem nevel vetof vechaliyl vekhinvor vehemah mitenaveiym

Hebrew: וְצָלְחָ֤ה עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהִתְנַבִּ֖יתָ עִמָּ֑ם וְנֶהְפַּכְתָּ֖ לְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵֽר׃
Translated: The spirit of G<small>OD</small> will grip you, and you will speak in ecstasy along with them; you will become a different person.
Transliteration: vetsalechah aleykha rucha yehovah vehitenaviyta imam venehefakheta leiysh acher

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּ֥י (תבאינה) [תָבֹ֛אנָה] הָאֹת֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה לָ֑ךְ עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּמְצָ֣א יָדֶ֔ךָ כִּ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And once these signs have happened to you, act when the occasion arises, for God is with you.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy (tvynh) [tavonah] haotvot haeleh lakhe asheh lekha asher timetsa yadekha khiy haElohim imakhe

Hebrew: וְיָרַדְתָּ֣ לְפָנַי֮ הַגִּלְגָּל֒ וְהִנֵּ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ יֹרֵ֣ד אֵלֶ֔יךָ לְהַעֲל֣וֹת עֹל֔וֹת לִזְבֹּ֖חַ זִבְחֵ֣י שְׁלָמִ֑ים שִׁבְעַ֨ת יָמִ֤ים תּוֹחֵל֙ עַד־בּוֹאִ֣י אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְהוֹדַעְתִּ֣י לְךָ֔ אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: After that, you are to go down to Gilgal ahead of me, and I will come down to you to present burnt offerings and offer sacrifices of well-being. Wait seven days until I come to you and instruct you what you are to do next.”
Transliteration: veyaradeta lefanay hagilegal vehineh anokhiy yored eleykha lehaalvot olvot lizevocha zivechey shelamiym shiveat yamiym tvochel ad-vvoiy eleykha vehvodaetiy lekha et asher taasheh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כְּהַפְנֹת֤וֹ שִׁכְמוֹ֙ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ מֵעִ֣ם שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיַּהֲפׇךְ־ל֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵ֣ב אַחֵ֑ר וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ כׇּל־הָאֹת֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: As [Saul] turned around to leave Samuel, God gave him another heart; and all those signs were fulfilled that same day.
Transliteration: vehayah khehafenotvo shikhemvo lalekhet meim shemuel vayahafׇkhe-lvo Elohim lev acher vayavou khׇl-haotvot haeleh vayyvom hahu {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ שָׁם֙ הַגִּבְעָ֔תָה וְהִנֵּ֥ה חֶבֶל־נְבִאִ֖ים לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַתִּצְלַ֤ח עָלָיו֙ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּתְנַבֵּ֖א בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: And when they came there, to the Hill, he saw a band of prophets coming toward him. Thereupon the spirit of God gripped him, and he spoke in ecstasy among them.
Transliteration: vayavou sham hagiveatah vehineh chevel-neviiym likeratvo vatitselach alayv rucha Elohim vayitenave vetvokham

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כׇּל־יֽוֹדְעוֹ֙ מֵאִתְּמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם וַיִּרְא֕וּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה עִם־נְבִאִ֖ים נִבָּ֑א {ס} וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הָעָ֜ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֗הוּ מַה־זֶּה֙ הָיָ֣ה לְבֶן־קִ֔ישׁ הֲגַ֥ם שָׁא֖וּל בַּנְּבִיאִֽים׃
Translated: When all who knew him previously saw him speaking in ecstasy together with the prophets, the people said to one another, “What’s happened to the son of Kish? Is Saul too among the prophets?”
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-yvodevo meitemvol shileshom vayireu vehineh im-neviiym niva {s} vayomer haam iysh el-reehu mah-zeh hayah leven-kiysh hagam shaul vaneviyiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן אִ֥ישׁ מִשָּׁ֛ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר וּמִ֣י אֲבִיהֶ֑ם עַל־כֵּן֙ הָיְתָ֣ה לְמָשָׁ֔ל הֲגַ֥ם שָׁא֖וּל בַּנְּבִאִֽים׃
Translated: But another fellow there spoke up and said, “And who are their fathers?” Thus the proverb arose: “Is Saul too among the prophets?”
Transliteration: vayaan iysh misham vayomer umiy aviyhem al-khen hayetah lemashal hagam shaul vaneviiym

Hebrew: וַיְכַל֙ מֵֽהִתְנַבּ֔וֹת וַיָּבֹ֖א הַבָּמָֽה׃
Translated: And when he stopped speaking in ecstasy, he entered the shrine.
Transliteration: vayekhal mehitenavvot vayavo havamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ דּ֨וֹד שָׁא֥וּל אֵלָ֛יו וְאֶֽל־נַעֲר֖וֹ אָ֣ן הֲלַכְתֶּ֑ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְבַקֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲתֹנ֔וֹת וַנִּרְאֶ֣ה כִי־אַ֔יִן וַנָּב֖וֹא אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: Saul’s uncle asked him and his servant, “Where did you go?” “To look for the donkeys,” he replied. “And when we saw that they were not to be found, we went to Samuel.”
Transliteration: vayomer dvod shaul elayv veel-naarvo an halakhetem vayomer levakesh et-haatonvot vanireeh khiy-ayiin vanavvo el-shemuel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר דּ֣וֹד שָׁא֑וּל הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א לִ֔י מָה־אָמַ֥ר לָכֶ֖ם שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Tell me,” said Saul’s uncle, “what did Samuel say to you?”
Transliteration: vayomer dvod shaul hagiydah-na liy mah-amar lakhem shemuel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־דּוֹד֔וֹ הַגֵּ֤ד הִגִּיד֙ לָ֔נוּ כִּ֥י נִמְצְא֖וּ הָאֲתֹנ֑וֹת וְאֶת־דְּבַ֤ר הַמְּלוּכָה֙ לֹא־הִגִּ֣יד ל֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֥ר שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Saul answered his uncle, “He just told us that the donkeys had been found.” But he did not tell him anything of what Samuel had said about the kingship.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-dvodvo haged higiyd lanu khiy nimetseu haatonvot veet-devar hamelukhah lo-higiyd lvo asher amar shemuel {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּצְעֵ֤ק שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה הַמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: Samuel summoned the people to G<small>OD</small> at Mizpah
Transliteration: vayatseek shemuel et-haam el-yehovah hamitsefah

Hebrew:
וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל {פ}
כֹּֽה־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אָנֹכִ֛י הֶעֱלֵ֥יתִי אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וָאַצִּ֤יל אֶתְכֶם֙ מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרַ֔יִם וּמִיַּד֙ כׇּל־הַמַּמְלָכ֔וֹת הַלֹּחֲצִ֖ים אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: and said to them, “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: ‘I brought Israel out of Egypt, and I delivered you from the hands of the Egyptians and of all the kingdoms that oppressed you.’
Transliteration:
vayomer el-veney yisherael {f}
khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael anokhiy heeleytiy et-yisherael mimitserayiim vaatsiyl etekhem miyad mitserayiim umiyad khׇl-hamamelakhvot halochatsiym etekhem

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֨ם הַיּ֜וֹם מְאַסְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁר־ה֨וּא מוֹשִׁ֣יעַ לָכֶם֮ מִכׇּל־רָעוֹתֵיכֶ֣ם וְצָרֹתֵיכֶם֒ וַתֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ כִּי־מֶ֖לֶךְ תָּשִׂ֣ים עָלֵ֑ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה הִֽתְיַצְּבוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶ֖ם וּלְאַלְפֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: But today you have rejected your God who delivered you from all your troubles and calamities. For you said, ‘No, set up a king over us!’ Now station yourselves before G<small>OD</small>, by your tribes and clans.”
Transliteration: veatem hayyvom measetem et-eloheykhem asher-hu mvoshiya lakhem mikhׇl-ravoteykhem vetsaroteykhem vatomeru lvo khiy-melekhe tashiym aleynu veatah hiteyatsevu lifeney yehovah leshiveteykhem ulealefeykhem

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֣ב שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת כׇּל־שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּלָּכֵ֖ד שֵׁ֥בֶט בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: Samuel brought forward each of the tribes of Israel, and the lot indicated the tribe of Benjamin.
Transliteration: vayakerev shemuel et khׇl-shivetey yisherael vayilakhed shevet vineyamin

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־שֵׁ֤בֶט בִּנְיָמִן֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ו וַתִּלָּכֵ֖ד מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַמַּטְרִ֑י וַיִּלָּכֵד֙ שָׁא֣וּל בֶּן־קִ֔ישׁ וַיְבַקְשֻׁ֖הוּ וְלֹ֥א נִמְצָֽא׃
Translated: Then Samuel brought forward the tribe of Benjamin by its clans, and the clan of the Matrites was indicated; and then Saul son of Kish was indicated. But when they looked for him, he was not to be found.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-shevet vineyamin lemishefechotav vatilakhed mishefachat hamateriy vayilakhed shaul ven-kiysh vayevakeshuhu velo nimetsa

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאֲלוּ־עוֹד֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה הֲבָ֥א ע֖וֹד הֲלֹ֣ם אִ֑ישׁ {ס} וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנֵּה־ה֥וּא נֶחְבָּ֖א אֶל־הַכֵּלִֽים׃
Translated: They inquired of G<small>OD</small> again, “Has anyone else come here?” And G<small>OD</small> replied, “Yes; he is hiding among the baggage.”
Transliteration: vayishealu-vod vayhovah hava vod halom iysh {s} vayomer yehovah hineh-hu necheva el-hakheliym

Hebrew: וַיָּרֻ֙צוּ֙ וַיִּקָּחֻ֣הוּ מִשָּׁ֔ם וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֖ב בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעָ֑ם וַיִּגְבַּהּ֙ מִכׇּל־הָעָ֔ם מִשִּׁכְמ֖וֹ וָמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: So they ran over and brought him from there; and when he took his place among the people, he stood a head taller than all the people.
Transliteration: vayarutsu vayikachuhu misham vayiteyatsev vetvokhe haam vayigevah mikhׇl-haam mishikhemvo vamaelah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם הַרְּאִיתֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַר־בּ֣וֹ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין כָּמֹ֖הוּ בְּכׇל־הָעָ֑ם וַיָּרִ֧עוּ כׇל־הָעָ֛ם וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ יְחִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: And Samuel said to the people, “Do you see the one whom G<small>OD</small> has chosen? There is none like him among all the people.” And all the people acclaimed him, shouting, “Long live the king!”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-khׇl-haam hareiytem asher vachar-vvo yehovah khiy eyn khamohu vekhׇl-haam vayariu khׇl-haam vayomeru yechiy hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל אֶל־הָעָ֗ם אֵ֚ת מִשְׁפַּ֣ט הַמְּלֻכָ֔ה וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב בַּסֵּ֔פֶר וַיַּנַּ֖ח לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְשַׁלַּ֧ח שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אִ֥ישׁ לְבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Samuel expounded to the people the rules of the monarchy, and recorded them in a document that he deposited before G<small>OD</small>. Samuel then sent the people back to their homes.
Transliteration: vayedaver shemuel el-haam et mishefat hamelukhah vayikhetov vasefer vayanach lifeney yehovah vayeshalach shemuel et-khׇl-haam iysh leveytvo

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם־שָׁא֔וּל הָלַ֥ךְ לְבֵית֖וֹ גִּבְעָ֑תָה וַיֵּלְכ֣וּ עִמּ֔וֹ הַחַ֕יִל אֲשֶׁר־נָגַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּלִבָּֽם׃
Translated: Saul also went home to Gibeah, accompanied by upstanding men whose hearts God had touched.
Transliteration: vegam-shaul halakhe leveytvo giveatah vayelekhu imvo hachayiil asher-naga Elohim velivam

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י בְלִיַּ֣עַל אָמְר֗וּ מַה־יֹּשִׁעֵ֙נוּ֙ זֶ֔ה וַיִּבְזֻ֕הוּ וְלֹא־הֵבִ֥יאוּ ל֖וֹ מִנְחָ֑ה וַיְהִ֖י כְּמַחֲרִֽישׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: But some scoundrels said, “How can this fellow save us?” So they scorned him and brought him no gift. But he pretended not to mind.
Transliteration: uveney veliyaal ameru mah-yoshienu zeh vayivezuhu velo-heviyu lvo minechah vayehiy khemachariysh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַל נָחָשׁ֙ הָעַמּוֹנִ֔י וַיִּ֖חַן עַל־יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֤י יָבֵישׁ֙ אֶל־נָחָ֔שׁ כְּרׇת־לָ֥נוּ בְרִ֖ית וְנַעַבְדֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: Nahash the Ammonite marched up and besieged Jabesh-gilead. All the people of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Make a pact with us, and we will serve you.”
Transliteration: vayaal nachash haamvoniy vayichan al-yaveysh gilead vayomeru khׇl-aneshey yaveysh el-nachash kherׇt-lanu veriyt venaavedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם נָחָשׁ֙ הָעַמּוֹנִ֔י בְּזֹאת֙ אֶכְרֹ֣ת לָכֶ֔ם בִּנְק֥וֹר לָכֶ֖ם כׇּל־עֵ֣ין יָמִ֑ין וְשַׂמְתִּ֥יהָ חֶרְפָּ֖ה עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But Nahash the Ammonite answered them, “I will make a pact with you on this condition, that every man’s right eye be gouged out; I will make this a humiliation for all Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem nachash haamvoniy vezot ekherot lakhem vinekvor lakhem khׇl-eyn yamiyn veshametiyha cherefah al-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֜יו זִקְנֵ֣י יָבֵ֗ישׁ הֶ֤רֶף לָ֙נוּ֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים וְנִשְׁלְחָה֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים בְּכֹ֖ל גְּב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאִם־אֵ֥ין מוֹשִׁ֛יעַ אֹתָ֖נוּ וְיָצָ֥אנוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: The elders of Jabesh said to him, “Give us seven days’ respite, so that we may send messengers throughout the territory of Israel; if no one comes to our aid, we will surrender to you.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv zikeney yaveysh heref lanu shiveat yamiym venishelechah maleakhiym vekhol gevul yisherael veim-eyn mvoshiya otanu veyatsanu eleykha

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ הַמַּלְאָכִים֙ גִּבְעַ֣ת שָׁא֔וּל וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ הַדְּבָרִ֖ים בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיִּשְׂא֧וּ כׇל־הָעָ֛ם אֶת־קוֹלָ֖ם וַיִּבְכּֽוּ׃
Translated: When the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul and gave this report in the hearing of the people, all the people broke into weeping.
Transliteration: vayavou hamaleakhiym giveat shaul vayedaveru hadevariym veׇzeney haam vayisheu khׇl-haam et-kvolam vayivekhu

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה שָׁא֗וּל בָּ֣א אַחֲרֵ֤י הַבָּקָר֙ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל מַה־לָּעָ֖ם כִּ֣י יִבְכּ֑וּ וַ֨יְסַפְּרוּ־ל֔וֹ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י אַנְשֵׁ֥י יָבֵֽישׁ׃
Translated: Saul was just coming from the field driving the cattle; and Saul asked, “Why are the people crying?” And they told him about the situation of the inhabitants of Jabesh.
Transliteration: vehineh shaul va acharey havakar min-hashadeh vayomer shaul mah-laam khiy yivekhu vayesaferu-lvo et-diverey aneshey yaveysh

Hebrew: וַתִּצְלַ֤ח רֽוּחַ־אֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־שָׁא֔וּל (בשמעו) [כְּשׇׁמְע֖וֹ] אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיִּ֥חַר אַפּ֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When he heard these things, the spirit of God gripped Saul and his anger blazed up.
Transliteration: vatitselach rucha-Elohim al-shaul (vshmv) [kheshׇmevo] et-hadevariym haeleh vayichar afvo meod

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ צֶ֨מֶד בָּקָ֜ר וַֽיְנַתְּחֵ֗הוּ וַיְשַׁלַּ֞ח בְּכׇל־גְּב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ בְּיַ֣ד הַמַּלְאָכִ֣ים <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֒ אֲשֶׁר֩ אֵינֶ֨נּוּ יֹצֵ֜א אַחֲרֵ֤י שָׁאוּל֙ וְאַחַ֣ר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל כֹּ֥ה יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה לִבְקָר֑וֹ וַיִּפֹּ֤ל פַּֽחַד־יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־הָעָ֔ם וַיֵּצְא֖וּ כְּאִ֥ישׁ אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: He took a yoke of oxen and cut them into pieces, which he sent by messengers throughout the territory of Israel, with the warning, “Thus shall be done to the cattle of anyone who does not follow Saul and Samuel into battle!” Terror from G<small>OD</small> fell upon the people, and they came out united.
Transliteration: vayikach tsemed vakar vayenatechehu vayeshalach vekhׇl-gevul yisherael veyad hamaleakhiym <small></small> lemor asher eynenu yotse acharey shaul veachar shemuel khoh eiasheh livekarvo vayifol fachad-yehovah al-haam vayetseu kheiysh echad

Hebrew: וַֽיִּפְקְדֵ֖ם בְּבָ֑זֶק וַיִּהְי֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אֶ֔לֶף וְאִ֥ישׁ יְהוּדָ֖ה שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: [Saul] mustered them in Bezek: the Israelites numbered 300,000, and Judah’s contingent 30,000.
Transliteration: vayifekedem vevazek vayiheyu veney-yisherael shelosh mevot elef veiysh yehudah sheloshiym alef

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ לַמַּלְאָכִ֣ים הַבָּאִ֗ים כֹּ֤ה תֹֽאמְרוּן֙ לְאִישׁ֙ יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֔ד מָחָ֛ר תִּֽהְיֶֽה־לָכֶ֥ם תְּשׁוּעָ֖ה (בחם) [כְּחֹ֣ם] הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ הַמַּלְאָכִ֗ים וַיַּגִּ֛ידוּ לְאַנְשֵׁ֥י יָבֵ֖ישׁ וַיִּשְׂמָֽחוּ׃
Translated: The messengers who had come were told, “Thus shall you speak to Jabesh-gilead’s side: Tomorrow, when the sun grows hot, you shall be saved.” When the messengers came and told this to the representatives of Jabesh, they rejoiced.
Transliteration: vayomeru lamaleakhiym havaiym khoh tomerun leiysh yaveysh gilead machar tiheyeh-lakhem teshuah (vchm) [khechom] hashamesh vayavou hamaleakhiym vayagiydu leaneshey yaveysh vayishemachu

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י יָבֵ֔ישׁ מָחָ֖ר נֵצֵ֣א אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם לָ֔נוּ כְּכׇל־הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The representatives of Jabesh then told [the Ammonites], “Tomorrow we will surrender to you, and you can do to us whatever you please.”
Transliteration: vayomeru aneshey yaveysh machar netse aleykhem vaashiytem lanu khekhׇl-hatvov veeyneykhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֗ת וַיָּ֨שֶׂם שָׁא֣וּל אֶת־הָעָם֮ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה רָאשִׁים֒ וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ בְתוֹךְ־הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֙ בְּאַשְׁמֹ֣רֶת הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּכּ֥וּ אֶת־עַמּ֖וֹן עַד־חֹ֣ם הַיּ֑וֹם וַיְהִ֤י הַנִּשְׁאָרִים֙ וַיָּפֻ֔צוּ וְלֹ֥א נִשְׁאֲרוּ־בָ֖ם שְׁנַ֥יִם יָֽחַד׃
Translated: The next day, Saul divided the troops into three columns; at the morning watch they entered the camp and struck down the Ammonites until the day grew hot. The survivors scattered; no two were left together.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayashem shaul et-haam sheloshah rashiym vayavou vetvokhe-hamachaneh veashemoret havoker vayakhu et-amvon ad-chom hayyvom vayehiy hanisheariym vayafutsu velo nishearu-vam shenayiim yachad

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָעָם֙ אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל מִ֣י הָאֹמֵ֔ר שָׁא֖וּל יִמְלֹ֣ךְ עָלֵ֑ינוּ תְּנ֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וּנְמִיתֵֽם׃
Translated: The people then said to Samuel, “Who was it said, ‘Shall Saul be king over us?’ Hand over those involved—and we will put them to death!”
Transliteration: vayomer haam el-shemuel miy haomer shaul yimelokhe aleynu tenu haanashiym unemiytem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל לֹא־יוּמַ֥ת אִ֖ישׁ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֥י הַיּ֛וֹם עָשָֽׂה־יְהֹוָ֥ה תְּשׁוּעָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But Saul replied, “Nobody shall be put to death this day! For this day G<small>OD</small> has brought victory to Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul lo-yumat iysh vayyvom hazeh khiy hayyvom ashah-yehovah teshuah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם לְכ֖וּ וְנֵלְכָ֣ה הַגִּלְגָּ֑ל וּנְחַדֵּ֥שׁ שָׁ֖ם הַמְּלוּכָֽה׃
Translated: Samuel said to the people, “Come, let us go to Gilgal and there inaugurate the monarchy.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-haam lekhu venelekhah hagilegal unechadesh sham hamelukhah

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֨וּ כׇל־הָעָ֜ם הַגִּלְגָּ֗ל וַיַּמְלִ֩כוּ֩ שָׁ֨ם אֶת־שָׁא֜וּל לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ בַּגִּלְגָּ֔ל וַיִּזְבְּחוּ־שָׁ֛ם זְבָחִ֥ים שְׁלָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׂמַ֨ח שָׁ֥ם שָׁא֛וּל וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־מְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: So all the people went to Gilgal, and there at Gilgal they declared Saul king before G<small>OD</small>. They offered sacrifices of well-being there before G<small>OD</small>; and Saul and everyone connected with Israel held a great celebration there.
Transliteration: vayelekhu khׇl-haam hagilegal vayamelikhu sham et-shaul lifeney yehovah vagilegal vayizevechu-sham zevachiym shelamiym lifeney yehovah vayishemach sham shaul vekhׇl-aneshey yisherael ad-meod {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הִנֵּה֙ שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי בְקֹֽלְכֶ֔ם לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם לִ֑י וָאַמְלִ֥יךְ עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then Samuel said to all Israel, “I have yielded to you in all you have asked of me and have set a king over you.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-khׇl-yisherael hineh shamaetiy vekolekhem lekhol asher-amaretem liy vaameliykhe aleykhem melekhe

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה הִנֵּ֥ה הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ ׀ מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ לִפְנֵיכֶ֗ם וַֽאֲנִי֙ זָקַ֣נְתִּי וָשַׂ֔בְתִּי וּבָנַ֖י הִנָּ֣ם אִתְּכֶ֑ם וַֽאֲנִי֙ הִתְהַלַּ֣כְתִּי לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם מִנְּעֻרַ֖י עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Henceforth the king will be your leader.
“As for me, I have grown old and gray—but my sons are still with you—and I have been your leader from my youth to this day.
Transliteration: veatah hineh hamelekhe mitehalekhe lifeneykhem vaaniy zakanetiy vashavetiy uvanay hinam itekhem vaaniy hitehalakhetiy lifeneykhem mineuray ad-hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י עֲנ֣וּ בִי֩ נֶ֨גֶד יְהֹוָ֜ה וְנֶ֣גֶד מְשִׁיח֗וֹ אֶת־שׁוֹר֩ <small>׀</small> מִ֨י לָקַ֜חְתִּי וַחֲמ֧וֹר מִ֣י לָקַ֗חְתִּי וְאֶת־מִ֤י עָשַׁ֙קְתִּי֙ אֶת־מִ֣י רַצּ֔וֹתִי וּמִיַּד־מִי֙ לָקַ֣חְתִּי כֹ֔פֶר וְאַעְלִ֥ים עֵינַ֖י בּ֑וֹ וְאָשִׁ֖יב לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Here I am! Testify against me, in the presence of G<small>OD</small> and in the presence of this anointed one: Whose ox have I taken, or whose donkey have I taken? Whom have I defrauded or whom have I robbed? From whom have I taken a bribe to look the other way? I will return it to you.”
Transliteration: hineniy anu viy neged yehovah veneged meshiychvo et-shvor <small></small> miy lakachetiy vachamvor miy lakachetiy veet-miy ashaketiy et-miy ratsvotiy umiyad-miy lakachetiy khofer veaeliym eynay vvo veashiyv lakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ לֹ֥א עֲשַׁקְתָּ֖נוּ וְלֹ֣א רַצּוֹתָ֑נוּ וְלֹא־לָקַ֥חְתָּ מִיַּד־אִ֖ישׁ מְאֽוּמָה׃
Translated: They responded, “You have not defrauded us, and you have not robbed us, and you have taken nothing from anyone.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lo ashaketanu velo ratsvotanu velo-lakacheta miyad-iysh meumah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם עֵ֧ד יְהֹוָ֣ה בָּכֶ֗ם וְעֵ֤ד מְשִׁיחוֹ֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֧א מְצָאתֶ֛ם בְּיָדִ֖י מְא֑וּמָה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר עֵֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: He said to them, “G<small>OD</small> then is witness, and this anointed one is witness, to your admission this day that you have found nothing in my possession.” They responded, “[God is] witness indeed!”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem ed yehovah vakhem veed meshiychvo hayyvom hazeh khiy lo metsatem veyadiy meumah vayomer ed {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל אֶל־הָעָ֑ם יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וַאֲשֶׁ֧ר הֶעֱלָ֛ה אֶת־אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Samuel said to the people, “G<small>OD</small> [is witness]—who appointed Moses and Aaron and who brought your ancestors out of the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-haam yehovah asher ashah et-mosheh veet-aharon vaasher heelah et-avoteykhem meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִֽתְיַצְּב֛וּ וְאִשָּׁפְטָ֥ה אִתְּכֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־צִדְק֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה אִתְּכֶ֖ם וְאֶת־אֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Come, stand before G<small>OD</small> while I cite against you all the kindnesses that G<small>OD</small> has done to you and your ancestors.
Transliteration: veatah hiteyatsevu veishafetah itekhem lifeney yehovah et khׇl-tsidekvot yehovah asher-ashah itekhem veet-avvoteykhem

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיִּזְעֲק֤וּ אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיּוֹצִ֤יאוּ אֶת־אֲבֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וַיֹּשִׁב֖וּם בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “When Jacob came to Egypt, … your ancestors cried out to G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> sent Moses and Aaron, who brought your ancestors out of Egypt and settled them in this place.
Transliteration: khaasher-va yaakov mitserayiim vayizeaku avvoteykhem el-yehovah vayishelach yehovah et-mosheh veet-aharon vayyvotsiyu et-avoteykhem mimitserayiim vayoshivum vamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁכְּח֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּמְכֹּ֣ר אֹתָ֡ם בְּיַ֣ד סִֽיסְרָא֩ שַׂר־צְבָ֨א חָצ֜וֹר וּבְיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וּבְיַד֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֔ב וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ בָּֽם׃
Translated: But they forgot the E<small>TERNAL</small> their God; so they were delivered into the hands of Sisera the military commander of Hazor, into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the king of Moab; and these made war upon them.
Transliteration: vayishekhechu et-yehovah eloheyhem vayimekhor otam veyad siysera shar-tseva chatsvor uveyad-felishetiym uveyad melekhe mvoav vayilachamu vam

Hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֤וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ (ויאמר) [וַיֹּֽאמְר֣וּ] חָטָ֔אנוּ כִּ֤י עָזַ֙בְנוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַנַּעֲבֹ֥ד אֶת־הַבְּעָלִ֖ים וְאֶת־הָעַשְׁתָּר֑וֹת וְעַתָּ֗ה הַצִּילֵ֛נוּ מִיַּ֥ד אֹיְבֵ֖ינוּ וְנַעַבְדֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: They cried to G<small>OD</small>, ‘We are guilty, for we have forsaken G<small>OD</small> and worshiped the Baalim and Ashtaroth. Oh, deliver us from our enemies and we will serve You.’
Transliteration: vayizeaku el-yehovah (vymr) [vayomeru] chatanu khiy azavenu et-yehovah vanaavod et-havealiym veet-haashetarvot veatah hatsiylenu miyad oyeveynu venaavedekha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יְרֻבַּ֣עַל וְאֶת־בְּדָ֔ן וְאֶת־יִפְתָּ֖ח וְאֶת־שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַיַּצֵּ֨ל אֶתְכֶ֜ם מִיַּ֤ד אֹֽיְבֵיכֶם֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב וַתֵּשְׁב֖וּ בֶּֽטַח׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> sent Jerubbaal and Bedan and Jephthah and Samuel, and delivered you from the enemies around you; and you dwelt in security.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehovah et-yeruvaal veet-vedan veet-yifetach veet-shemuel vayatsel etekhem miyad oyeveykhem misaviyv vateshevu vetach

Hebrew: וַתִּרְא֗וּ כִּֽי־נָחָ֞שׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ בְּנֵי־עַמּוֹן֮ בָּ֣א עֲלֵיכֶם֒ וַתֹּ֣אמְרוּ לִ֔י לֹ֕א כִּי־מֶ֖לֶךְ יִמְלֹ֣ךְ עָלֵ֑ינוּ וַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם מַלְכְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: But when you saw that Nahash king of the Ammonites was advancing against you, you said to me, ‘No, we must have a king reigning over us’—though the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God is your King.
Transliteration: vatireu khiy-nachash melekhe veney-amvon va aleykhem vatomeru liy lo khiy-melekhe yimelokhe aleynu vayhovah eloheykhem malekhekhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִנֵּ֥ה הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּחַרְתֶּ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁאֶלְתֶּ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: “Well, G<small>OD</small> has set a king over you! Here is the king that you have chosen, that you have asked for.
Transliteration: veatah hineh hamelekhe asher vecharetem asher sheeletem vehineh natan yehovah aleykhem melekhe

Hebrew: אִם־תִּֽירְא֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ וּשְׁמַעְתֶּ֣ם בְּקוֹל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א תַמְר֖וּ אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וִהְיִתֶ֣ם גַּם־אַתֶּ֗ם וְגַם־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָלַ֣ךְ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם אַחַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “If you will revere, worship, and obey G<small>OD</small>—and not flout G<small>OD</small>’s command—if both you and the king who reigns over you follow the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, [well and good].
Transliteration: im-tiyreu et-yehovah vaavadetem otvo ushemaetem vekvolvo velo tameru et-fiy yehovah viheyitem gam-atem vegam-hamelekhe asher malakhe aleykhem achar yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמְעוּ֙ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמְרִיתֶ֖ם אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיְתָ֧ה יַד־יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּכֶ֖ם וּבַאֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: But if you do not obey G<small>OD</small>—and you flout G<small>OD</small>’s command—G<small>OD</small>’s hand will strike you as it did your ancestors.
Transliteration: veim-lo tishemeu vekvol yehovah umeriytem et-fiy yehovah vehayetah yad-yehovah vakhem uvaavoteykhem

Hebrew: גַּם־עַתָּה֙ הִתְיַצְּב֣וּ וּרְא֔וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עֹשֶׂ֖ה לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “Now stand by and see the marvelous thing that G<small>OD</small> will do before your eyes.
Transliteration: gam-atah hiteyatsevu ureu et-hadavar hagadvol hazeh asher yehovah osheh leeyneykhem

Hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא קְצִיר־חִטִּים֙ הַיּ֔וֹם אֶקְרָא֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיִתֵּ֥ן קֹל֖וֹת וּמָטָ֑ר וּדְע֣וּ וּרְא֗וּ כִּֽי־רָעַתְכֶ֤ם רַבָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֲשִׂיתֶם֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לִשְׁא֥וֹל לָכֶ֖ם מֶֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: It is the season of the wheat harvest. I will pray to G<small>OD</small>—who will send thunder and rain; then you will take thought and realize what a wicked thing you did in G<small>OD</small>’s sight when you asked for a king.”
Transliteration: halvo ketsiyr-chitiym hayyvom ekera el-yehovah veyiten kolvot umatar udeu ureu khiy-raatekhem ravah asher ashiytem veeyney yehovah lishevol lakhem melekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה קֹלֹ֥ת וּמָטָ֖ר בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיִּירָ֨א כׇל־הָעָ֥ם מְאֹ֛ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: Samuel prayed to G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> sent thunder and rain that day, and the people stood in awe of G<small>OD</small> and of Samuel.
Transliteration: vayikera shemuel el-yehovah vayiten yehovah kolot umatar vayyvom hahu vayiyra khׇl-haam meod et-yehovah veet-shemuel

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ כׇל־הָעָ֜ם אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל הִתְפַּלֵּ֧ל בְּעַד־עֲבָדֶ֛יךָ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וְאַל־נָמ֑וּת כִּֽי־יָסַ֤פְנוּ עַל־כׇּל־חַטֹּאתֵ֙ינוּ֙ רָעָ֔ה לִשְׁאֹ֥ל לָ֖נוּ מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The people all said to Samuel, “Intercede for your servants with the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God that we may not die, for we have added to all our sins the wickedness of asking for a king.”
Transliteration: vayomeru khׇl-haam el-shemuel hitefalel vead-avadeykha el-yehovah eloheykha veal-namut khiy-yasafenu al-khׇl-chatoteynu raah lisheol lanu melekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֤ל אֶל־הָעָם֙ אַל־תִּירָ֔אוּ אַתֶּ֣ם עֲשִׂיתֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָרָעָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את אַ֗ךְ אַל־תָּס֙וּרוּ֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶֽם׃
Translated: But Samuel said to the people, “Have no fear. You have, indeed, done all those wicked things. Do not, however, turn away from G<small>OD</small>, but serve G<small>OD</small> with all your heart.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-haam al-tiyrau atem ashiytem et khׇl-haraah hazot akhe al-tasuru meacharey yehovah vaavadetem et-yehovah vekhׇl-levavekhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֖א תָּס֑וּרוּ כִּ֣י ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַתֹּ֗הוּ אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יוֹעִ֛ילוּ וְלֹ֥א יַצִּ֖ילוּ כִּי־תֹ֥הוּ הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: Do not turn away to follow worthless things, which can neither profit nor save but are worthless.
Transliteration: velo tasuru khiy acharey hatohu asher lo-yvoiylu velo yatsiylu khiy-tohu hemah

Hebrew: כִּ֠י לֹֽא־יִטֹּ֤שׁ יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ בַּעֲב֖וּר שְׁמ֣וֹ הַגָּד֑וֹל כִּ֚י הוֹאִ֣יל יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֶתְכֶ֛ם ל֖וֹ לְעָֽם׃
Translated: For the sake of God’s great name, G<small>OD</small> will never abandon this people, seeing that G<small>OD</small> undertook to make you a covenanted people.
Transliteration: khiy lo-yitosh yehovah et-amvo vaavur shemvo hagadvol khiy hvoiyl yehovah laashvot etekhem lvo leam

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם אָנֹכִ֗י חָלִ֤ילָה לִּי֙ מֵחֲטֹ֣א לַיהֹוָ֔ה מֵחֲדֹ֖ל לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל בַּעַדְכֶ֑ם וְהוֹרֵיתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה וְהַיְשָׁרָֽה׃
Translated: “As for me, far be it from me to sin against G<small>OD</small> and refrain from praying for you; and I will continue to instruct you in the practice of what is good and right.
Transliteration: gam anokhiy chaliylah liy mechato layhovah mechadol lehitefalel vaadekhem vehvoreytiy etekhem vederekhe hatvovah vehayesharah

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ ׀ יְר֣אוּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֥ם אֹת֛וֹ בֶּאֱמֶ֖ת בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י רְא֔וּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־הִגְדִּ֖ל עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: Above all, you must revere G<small>OD</small> and serve faithfully with all your heart; and consider how grandly you have been dealt with.
Transliteration: akhe yeru et-yehovah vaavadetem otvo veemet vekhׇl-levavekhem khiy reu et asher-higedil imakhem

Hebrew: וְאִם־הָרֵ֖עַ תָּרֵ֑עוּ גַּם־אַתֶּ֥ם גַּֽם־מַלְכְּכֶ֖ם תִּסָּפֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: For if you persist in your wrongdoing, both you and your king will be swept away.”
Transliteration: veim-harea tareu gam-atem gam-malekhekhem tisafu {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שָׁנָ֖ה שָׁא֣וּל בְּמׇלְכ֑וֹ וּשְׁתֵּ֣י שָׁנִ֔ים מָלַ֖ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Saul was … years old when he became king, and he reigned over Israel two years.
Transliteration: ven-shanah shaul vemׇlekhvo ushetey shaniym malakhe al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּבְחַר־ל֨וֹ שָׁא֜וּל שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֮ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיִּהְי֨וּ עִם־שָׁא֜וּל אַלְפַּ֗יִם בְּמִכְמָשׂ֙ וּבְהַ֣ר בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל וְאֶ֗לֶף הָיוּ֙ עִם־י֣וֹנָתָ֔ן בְּגִבְעַ֖ת בִּנְיָמִ֑ין וְיֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם שִׁלַּ֖ח אִ֥ישׁ לְאֹהָלָֽיו׃
Translated: Saul picked 3,000 Israelites, of whom 2,000 were with Saul in Michmas and in the hill country of Bethel, and 1,000 with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin; the rest of the troops he sent back to their homes.
Transliteration: vayivechar-lvo shaul sheloshet alafiym miyisherael vayiheyu im-shaul alefayiim vemikhemash uvehar veyt-el veelef hayu im-yvonatan vegiveat vineyamiyn veyeter haam shilach iysh leohalayv

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ יוֹנָתָ֗ן אֵ֣ת נְצִ֤יב פְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּגֶ֔בַע וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֖וּ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וְשָׁאוּל֩ תָּקַ֨ע בַּשּׁוֹפָ֤ר בְּכׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יִשְׁמְע֖וּ הָעִבְרִֽים׃
Translated: Jonathan struck down the Philistine prefect in Geba; and the Philistines heard about it. Saul had the ram’s horn sounded throughout the land, saying, “Let the Hebrews hear.”
Transliteration: vayakhe yvonatan et netsiyv felishetiym asher vegeva vayishemeu felishetiym veshaul taka vashvofar vekhׇl-haarets lemor yishemeu haiveriym

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֞ל שָׁמְע֣וּ לֵאמֹ֗ר הִכָּ֤ה שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־נְצִ֣יב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְגַם־נִבְאַ֥שׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיִּצָּעֲק֥וּ הָעָ֛ם אַחֲרֵ֥י שָׁא֖וּל הַגִּלְגָּֽל׃
Translated: When all Israel heard that Saul had struck down the Philistine prefect, and that Israel had incurred the wrath of the Philistines, all the people rallied to Saul at Gilgal.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael shameu lemor hikhah shaul et-netsiyv felishetiym vegam-niveash yisherael vafelishetiym vayitsaaku haam acharey shaul hagilegal

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֞ים נֶאֶסְפ֣וּ ׀ לְהִלָּחֵ֣ם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים אֶ֤לֶף רֶ֙כֶב֙ וְשֵׁ֤שֶׁת אֲלָפִים֙ פָּרָשִׁ֔ים וְעָ֕ם כַּח֛וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־שְׂפַֽת־הַיָּ֖ם לָרֹ֑ב וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְמִכְמָ֔שׂ קִדְמַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית אָֽוֶן׃
Translated: The Philistines, in turn, gathered to attack Israel: 30,000 chariots and 6,000 riders, and troops as numerous as the sands of the seashore. They marched up and encamped at Michmas, east of Beth-aven.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym neesefu lehilachem im-yisherael sheloshiym elef rekhev vesheshet alafiym farashiym veam khachvol asher al-shefat-hayam larov vayaalu vayachanu vemikhemash kidemat veyt aven

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל רָאוּ֙ כִּ֣י צַר־ל֔וֹ כִּ֥י נִגַּ֖שׂ הָעָ֑ם וַיִּֽתְחַבְּא֣וּ הָעָ֗ם בַּמְּעָר֤וֹת וּבַֽחֲוָחִים֙ וּבַסְּלָעִ֔ים וּבַצְּרִחִ֖ים וּבַבֹּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: When Israel’s side saw that they were in trouble—for the troops were hard pressed—the people hid in caves, among thorns, among rocks, in tunnels, and in cisterns.
Transliteration: veiysh yisherael rau khiy tsar-lvo khiy nigash haam vayitechaveu haam vamearvot uvachavachiym uvaselaiym uvatserichiym uvavorvot

Hebrew: וְעִבְרִ֗ים עָֽבְרוּ֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן אֶ֥רֶץ גָּ֖ד וְגִלְעָ֑ד וְשָׁאוּל֙ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ בַגִּלְגָּ֔ל וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם חָֽרְד֥וּ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: Some Hebrews crossed the Jordan, [to] the territory of Gad and Gilead. Saul was still at Gilgal, and the rest of the people rallied to him in alarm.
Transliteration: veiveriym averu et-hayareden erets gad vegilead veshaul vodenu vagilegal vekhׇl-haam charedu acharayv

Hebrew: (וייחל) [וַיּ֣וֹחֶל ׀] שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים לַמּוֹעֵד֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וְלֹא־בָ֥א שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל הַגִּלְגָּ֑ל וַיָּ֥פֶץ הָעָ֖ם מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: He waited seven days, the time that Samuel [had set]. But when Samuel failed to come to Gilgal, and the people began to scatter,
Transliteration: (vyychl) [vayyvochel ] shiveat yamiym lamvoed asher shemuel velo-va shemuel hagilegal vayafets haam mealayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל הַגִּ֣שׁוּ אֵלַ֔י הָעֹלָ֖ה וְהַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים וַיַּ֖עַל הָעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Saul said, “Bring me the burnt offering and the sacrifice of well-being”; and he presented the burnt offering.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul hagishu elay haolah vehashelamiym vayaal haolah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּכַלֹּתוֹ֙ לְהַעֲל֣וֹת הָעֹלָ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל בָּ֑א וַיֵּצֵ֥א שָׁא֛וּל לִקְרָאת֖וֹ לְבָרְכֽוֹ׃
Translated: He had just finished presenting the burnt offering when Samuel arrived; and Saul went out to meet him and welcome him.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalotvo lehaalvot haolah vehineh shemuel va vayetse shaul likeratvo levarekhvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֡וּל כִּֽי־רָאִ֩יתִי֩ כִֽי־נָפַ֨ץ הָעָ֜ם מֵעָלַ֗י וְאַתָּה֙ לֹֽא־בָ֙אתָ֙ לְמוֹעֵ֣ד הַיָּמִ֔ים וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים נֶאֱסָפִ֥ים מִכְמָֽשׂ׃
Translated: But Samuel said, “What have you done?” Saul replied, “I saw the people leaving me and scattering; you had not come at the appointed time, and the Philistines had gathered at Michmas.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel meh ashiyta vayomer shaul khiy-raiytiy khiy-nafats haam mealay veatah lo-vata lemvoed hayamiym ufelishetiym neesafiym mikhemash

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר עַ֠תָּ֠ה יֵרְד֨וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֤ים אֵלַי֙ הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל וּפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֣א חִלִּ֑יתִי וָֽאֶתְאַפַּ֔ק וָאַעֲלֶ֖ה הָעֹלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: I thought the Philistines would march down against me at Gilgal before I had entreated G<small>OD</small>, so I forced myself to present the burnt offering.”
Transliteration: vaomar atah eiredu felishetiym elay hagilegal ufeney yehovah lo chiliytiy vaeteafak vaaaleh haolah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל אֶל־שָׁא֖וּל נִסְכָּ֑לְתָּ לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֗רְתָּ אֶת־מִצְוַ֞ת יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔ךְ כִּ֣י עַתָּ֗ה הֵכִ֨ין יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶת־מַֽמְלַכְתְּךָ֛ אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Samuel answered Saul, “You acted foolishly in not keeping the commandment that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God laid upon you! Otherwise G<small>OD</small> would have established your dynasty over Israel forever.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-shaul nisekhaleta lo shamareta et-mitsevat yehovah eloheykha asher tsivakhe khiy atah hekhiyn yehovah et-mamelakhetekha el-yisherael ad-volam

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה מַמְלַכְתְּךָ֣ לֹֽא־תָק֑וּם בִּקֵּשׁ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה ל֜וֹ אִ֣ישׁ כִּלְבָב֗וֹ וַיְצַוֵּ֨הוּ יְהֹוָ֤ה לְנָגִיד֙ עַל־עַמּ֔וֹ כִּ֚י לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔רְתָּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶֽׁר־צִוְּךָ֖ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: But now your dynasty will not endure. G<small>OD</small> will seek out a man with a more willing heart, and G<small>OD</small> will appoint him ruler over this covenanted people, because you did not abide by what G<small>OD</small> had commanded you.”
Transliteration: veatah mamelakhetekha lo-takum vikesh yehovah lvo iysh khilevavvo vayetsavehu yehovah lenagiyd al-amvo khiy lo shamareta et asher-tsivekha yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל וַיַּ֛עַל מִן־הַגִּלְגָּ֖ל גִּבְעַ֣ת בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וַיִּפְקֹ֣ד שָׁא֗וּל אֶת־הָעָם֙ הַנִּמְצְאִ֣ים עִמּ֔וֹ כְּשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Samuel arose and went up from Gilgal to Gibeah of Benjamin. Saul numbered the troops who remained with him—about 600 strong.
Transliteration: vayakׇm shemuel vayaal min-hagilegal giveat vineyamin vayifekod shaul et-haam hanimetseiym imvo kheshesh mevot iysh

Hebrew: וְשָׁא֞וּל וְיוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנ֗וֹ וְהָעָם֙ הַנִּמְצָ֣א עִמָּ֔ם יֹשְׁבִ֖ים בְּגֶ֣בַע בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים חָנ֥וּ בְמִכְמָֽשׂ׃
Translated: Saul and his son Jonathan, and the troops who remained with them, stayed in Geba of Benjamin, while the Philistines were encamped at Michmas.
Transliteration: veshaul veyvonatan venvo vehaam hanimetsa imam yosheviym vegeva vineyamin ufelishetiym chanu vemikhemash

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֧א הַמַּשְׁחִ֛ית מִמַּחֲנֵ֥ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה רָאשִׁ֑ים הָרֹ֨אשׁ אֶחָ֥ד יִפְנֶ֛ה אֶל־דֶּ֥רֶךְ עׇפְרָ֖ה אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ שׁוּעָֽל׃
Translated: The raiders came out of the Philistine camp in three columns: One column headed for the Ophrah road that leads to the district of Shual,
Transliteration: vayetse hamashechiyt mimachaneh felishetiym sheloshah rashiym harosh echad yifeneh el-derekhe ׇferah el-erets shual

Hebrew: וְהָרֹ֤אשׁ אֶחָד֙ יִפְנֶ֔ה דֶּ֖רֶךְ בֵּ֣ית חֹר֑וֹן וְהָרֹ֨אשׁ אֶחָ֤ד יִפְנֶה֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַגְּב֔וּל הַנִּשְׁקָ֛ף עַל־גֵּ֥י הַצְּבֹעִ֖ים הַמִּדְבָּֽרָה׃ {ס}
Translated: another column headed for the Beth-horon road, and the third column headed for the border road that overlooks the valley of Zeboim toward the desert.
Transliteration: veharosh echad yifeneh derekhe veyt chorvon veharosh echad yifeneh derekhe hagevul hanishekaf al-gey hatsevoiym hamidevarah {s}

Hebrew: וְחָרָשׁ֙ לֹ֣א יִמָּצֵ֔א בְּכֹ֖ל אֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־[אָמְר֣וּ] (אמר) פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים פֶּ֚ן יַעֲשׂ֣וּ הָעִבְרִ֔ים חֶ֖רֶב א֥וֹ חֲנִֽית׃
Translated: No smith was to be found in all the land of Israel, for the Philistines were afraid that the Hebrews would make swords or spears.
Transliteration: vecharash lo yimatse vekhol erets yisherael khiy-[ameru] (mr) felishetiym fen yaashu haiveriym cherev vo chaniyt

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֥וּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים לִ֠לְט֠וֹשׁ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־מַחֲרַשְׁתּ֤וֹ וְאֶת־אֵתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־קַרְדֻּמּ֔וֹ וְאֵ֖ת מַחֲרֵשָׁתֽוֹ׃
Translated: So all the Israelites had to go down to the Philistines to have their plowshares, their mattocks, axes, and colters sharpened.
Transliteration: vayeredu khׇl-yisherael hafelishetiym liletvosh iysh et-macharashetvo veet-etvo veet-karedumvo veet machareshatvo

Hebrew: וְֽהָיְתָ֞ה הַפְּצִ֣ירָה פִ֗ים לַמַּֽחֲרֵשֹׁת֙ וְלָ֣אֵתִ֔ים וְלִשְׁלֹ֥שׁ קִלְּשׁ֖וֹן וּלְהַקַּרְדֻּמִּ֑ים וּלְהַצִּ֖יב הַדָּרְבָֽן׃
Translated: The charge for sharpening was a pim for plowshares, mattocks, three-pronged forks, and axes, and for setting the goads.
Transliteration: vehayetah hafetsiyrah fiym lamachareshot velaetiym velishelosh kileshvon ulehakaredumiym ulehatsiyv hadarevan

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בְּי֣וֹם מִלְחֶ֔מֶת וְלֹ֨א נִמְצָ֜א חֶ֤רֶב וַֽחֲנִית֙ בְּיַ֣ד כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶת־שָׁא֖וּל וְאֶת־יוֹנָתָ֑ן וַתִּמָּצֵ֣א לְשָׁא֔וּל וּלְיוֹנָתָ֖ן בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thus on the day of the battle, no sword or spear was to be found in the possession of any of the troops with Saul and Jonathan; only Saul and Jonathan had them.
Transliteration: vehayah veyvom milechemet velo nimetsa cherev vachaniyt veyad khׇl-haam asher et-shaul veet-yvonatan vatimatse leshaul uleyvonatan venvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ מַצַּ֣ב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אֶֽל־מַעֲבַ֖ר מִכְמָֽשׂ׃ {ס}
Translated: Now the Philistine garrison had marched out to the pass of Michmas.
Transliteration: vayetse matsav felishetiym el-maavar mikhemash {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֗וֹם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹנָתָ֤ן בֶּן־שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־הַנַּ֙עַר֙ נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֔יו לְכָ֗ה וְנַעְבְּרָה֙ אֶל־מַצַּ֣ב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵעֵ֣בֶר הַלָּ֑ז וּלְאָבִ֖יו לֹ֥א הִגִּֽיד׃
Translated: One day, Jonathan son of Saul said to the attendant who carried his arms, “Come, let us cross over to the Philistine garrison on the other side”; but he did not tell his father.
Transliteration: vayehiy hayyvom vayomer yvonatan ven-shaul el-hanaar noshe khelayv lekhah venaeverah el-matsav felishetiym asher meever halaz uleaviyv lo higiyd

Hebrew: וְשָׁא֗וּל יוֹשֵׁב֙ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַגִּבְעָ֔ה תַּ֥חַת הָרִמּ֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּמִגְר֑וֹן וְהָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֔וֹ כְּשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Now Saul was staying on the outskirts of Gibeah, under the pomegranate tree at Migron, and the troops with him numbered about 600.
Transliteration: veshaul yvoshev viketseh hagiveah tachat harimvon asher vemigervon vehaam asher imvo kheshesh mevot iysh

Hebrew: וַאֲחִיָּ֣ה בֶן־אֲחִט֡וּב אֲחִ֡י אִיכָב֣וֹד ׀ בֶּן־פִּֽינְחָ֨ס בֶּן־עֵלִ֜י כֹּהֵ֧ן ׀ יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּשִׁל֖וֹ נֹשֵׂ֣א אֵפ֑וֹד וְהָעָם֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔ע כִּ֥י הָלַ֖ךְ יוֹנָתָֽן׃
Translated: Ahijah son of Ahitub brother of Ichabod son of Phinehas son of Eli, the priest of G<small>OD</small> at Shiloh, was there bearing an ephod.—The troops did not know that Jonathan had gone.
Transliteration: vaachiyah ven-achituv achiy iykhavvod ven-fiynechas ven-eliy khohen yehovah veshilvo noshe efvod vehaam lo yada khiy halakhe yvonatan

Hebrew: וּבֵ֣ין הַֽמַּעְבְּר֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֨ר בִּקֵּ֤שׁ יֽוֹנָתָן֙ לַעֲבֹר֙ עַל־מַצַּ֣ב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים שֵׁן־הַסֶּ֤לַע מֵהָעֵ֙בֶר֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וְשֵׁן־הַסֶּ֥לַע מֵהָעֵ֖בֶר מִזֶּ֑ה וְשֵׁ֤ם הָאֶחָד֙ בּוֹצֵ֔ץ וְשֵׁ֥ם הָאֶחָ֖ד סֶֽנֶּה׃
Translated: At the crossing by which Jonathan sought to reach the Philistine garrison, there was a rocky crag on one side, and another rocky crag on the other, the one called Bozez and the other Seneh.
Transliteration: uveyn hamaevervot asher vikesh yvonatan laavor al-matsav felishetiym shen-hasela mehaever mizeh veshen-hasela mehaever mizeh veshem haechad vvotsets veshem haechad seneh

Hebrew: הַשֵּׁ֧ן הָאֶחָ֛ד מָצ֥וּק מִצָּפ֖וֹן מ֣וּל מִכְמָ֑שׂ וְהָאֶחָ֥ד מִנֶּ֖גֶב מ֥וּל גָּֽבַע׃ {ס}
Translated: One crag was located on the north, near Michmas, and the other on the south, near Geba.
Transliteration: hashen haechad matsuk mitsafvon mul mikhemash vehaechad minegev mul gava {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹנָתָ֜ן אֶל־הַנַּ֣עַר ׀ נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֗יו לְכָה֙ וְנַעְבְּרָ֗ה אֶל־מַצַּב֙ הָעֲרֵלִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אוּלַ֛י יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לָ֑נוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין לַֽיהֹוָה֙ מַעְצ֔וֹר לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ בְּרַ֖ב א֥וֹ בִמְעָֽט׃
Translated: Jonathan said to the attendant who carried his arms, “Come, let us cross over to the outpost of those uncircumcised fellows. Perhaps G<small>OD</small> will act in our behalf, for nothing prevents G<small>OD</small> from winning a victory by many or by few.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan el-hanaar noshe khelayv lekhah venaeverah el-matsav haareliym haeleh ulay yaasheh yehovah lanu khiy eyn layhovah maetsvor lehvoshiya verav vo vimeat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֔יו עֲשֵׂ֖ה כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ נְטֵ֣ה לָ֔ךְ הִנְנִ֥י עִמְּךָ֖ כִּלְבָבֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: His arms-bearer answered him, “Do whatever you like. You go first, I am with you, whatever you decide.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo noshe khelayv asheh khׇl-asher vilevavekha neteh lakhe hineniy imekha khilevavekha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן הִנֵּ֛ה אֲנַ֥חְנוּ עֹבְרִ֖ים אֶל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְנִגְלִ֖ינוּ אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Jonathan said, “We’ll cross over to those men and let them see us.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan hineh anachenu overiym el-haanashiym venigeliynu aleyhem

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֤ה יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ אֵלֵ֔ינוּ דֹּ֕מּוּ עַד־הַגִּיעֵ֖נוּ אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְעָמַ֣דְנוּ תַחְתֵּ֔ינוּ וְלֹ֥א נַעֲלֶ֖ה אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: If they say to us, ‘Wait until we get to you,’ then we’ll stay where we are, and not go up to them.
Transliteration: im-khoh yomeru eleynu domu ad-hagiyenu aleykhem veamadenu tacheteynu velo naaleh aleyhem

Hebrew: וְאִם־כֹּ֨ה יֹאמְר֜וּ עֲל֤וּ עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ וְעָלִ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־נְתָנָ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיָדֵ֑נוּ וְזֶה־לָּ֖נוּ הָאֽוֹת׃
Translated: But if they say, ‘Come up to us,’ then we will go up, for G<small>OD</small> is delivering them into our hands. That shall be our sign.”
Transliteration: veim-khoh yomeru alu aleynu vealiynu khiy-netanam yehovah veyadenu vezeh-lanu havot

Hebrew: וַיִּגָּל֣וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אֶל־מַצַּ֖ב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים הִנֵּ֤ה עִבְרִים֙ יֹֽצְאִ֔ים מִן־הַחֹרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִתְחַבְּאוּ־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: They both showed themselves to the Philistine outpost and the Philistines said, “Look, some Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they have been hiding.”
Transliteration: vayigalu sheneyhem el-matsav felishetiym vayomeru felishetiym hineh iveriym yotseiym min-hachoriym asher hitechaveu-sham

Hebrew:
וַיַּעֲנוּ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י הַמַּצָּבָ֜ה אֶת־יוֹנָתָ֣ן ׀ וְאֶת־נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֗יו וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ עֲל֣וּ אֵלֵ֔ינוּ וְנוֹדִ֥יעָה אֶתְכֶ֖ם דָּבָ֑ר {פ}
וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹנָתָ֜ן אֶל־נֹשֵׂ֤א כֵלָיו֙ עֲלֵ֣ה אַחֲרַ֔י כִּֽי־נְתָנָ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַ֥ד יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The men of the outpost shouted to Jonathan and his arms-bearer, “Come up to us, and we’ll teach you a lesson.” Then Jonathan said to his arms-bearer, “Follow me, for G<small>OD</small> will deliver them into the hands of Israel.”
Transliteration:
vayaanu aneshey hamatsavah et-yvonatan veet-noshe khelayv vayomeru alu eleynu venvodiyah etekhem davar {f}
vayomer yvonatan el-noshe khelayv aleh acharay khiy-netanam yehovah veyad yisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל יוֹנָתָ֗ן עַל־יָדָיו֙ וְעַל־רַגְלָ֔יו וְנֹשֵׂ֥א כֵלָ֖יו אַחֲרָ֑יו וַֽיִּפְּלוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יוֹנָתָ֔ן וְנֹשֵׂ֥א כֵלָ֖יו מְמוֹתֵ֥ת אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: And Jonathan clambered up on his hands and feet, his arms-bearer behind him; [the Philistines] fell before Jonathan, and his arms-bearer finished them off behind him.
Transliteration: vayaal yvonatan al-yadayv veal-ragelayv venoshe khelayv acharayv vayifelu lifeney yvonatan venoshe khelayv memvotet acharayv

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֞י הַמַּכָּ֣ה הָרִאשֹׁנָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֧ה יוֹנָתָ֛ן וְנֹשֵׂ֥א כֵלָ֖יו כְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים אִ֑ישׁ כְּבַחֲצִ֥י מַעֲנָ֖ה צֶ֥מֶד שָׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: The initial attack that Jonathan and his arms-bearer made accounted for some twenty men, within a space about half a furrow long [in] an acre of land.
Transliteration: vatehiy hamakhah harishonah asher hikhah yvonatan venoshe khelayv kheesheriym iysh khevachatsiy maanah tsemed shadeh

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי֩ חֲרָדָ֨ה בַמַּחֲנֶ֤ה בַשָּׂדֶה֙ וּבְכׇל־הָעָ֔ם הַמַּצָּב֙ וְהַמַּשְׁחִ֔ית חָרְד֖וּ גַּם־הֵ֑מָּה וַתִּרְגַּ֣ז הָאָ֔רֶץ וַתְּהִ֖י לְחֶרְדַּ֥ת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Terror broke out among all the troops both in the camp [and] in the field; the outposts and the raiders were also terrified. The very earth quaked, and a terror from God ensued.
Transliteration: vatehiy charadah vamachaneh vashadeh uvekhׇl-haam hamatsav vehamashechiyt charedu gam-hemah vatiregaz haarets vatehiy lecheredat Elohim

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ הַצֹּפִים֙ לְשָׁא֔וּל בְּגִבְעַ֖ת בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וְהִנֵּ֧ה הֶהָמ֛וֹן נָמ֖וֹג וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ וַהֲלֹֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Saul’s scouts in Gibeah of Benjamin saw that the multitude was scattering in all directions.
Transliteration: vayireu hatsofiym leshaul vegiveat vineyamin vehineh hehamvon namvog vayelekhe vahalom {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֗וּל לָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ פִּקְדוּ־נָ֣א וּרְא֔וּ מִ֖י הָלַ֣ךְ מֵעִמָּ֑נוּ וַֽיִּפְקְד֔וּ וְהִנֵּ֛ה אֵ֥ין יוֹנָתָ֖ן וְנֹשֵׂ֥א כֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: And Saul said to the troops with him, “Take a count and see who has left us.” They took a count and found that Jonathan and his arms-bearer were missing.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul laam asher itvo fikedu-na ureu miy halakhe meimanu vayifekedu vehineh eyn yvonatan venoshe khelayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שָׁאוּל֙ לַֽאֲחִיָּ֔ה הַגִּ֖ישָׁה אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּֽי־הָיָ֞ה אֲר֧וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thereupon Saul said to Ahijah, “Bring the Ark of God here”; for the Ark of God was at the time among the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul laachiyah hagiyshah arvon haElohim khiy-hayah arvon haElohim vayyvom hahu uveney yisherael

Hebrew:
וַיְהִ֗י עַ֣ד דִּבֶּ֤ר שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהֶהָמ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ הָל֖וֹךְ וָרָ֑ב {פ}
וַיֹּ֧אמֶר שָׁא֛וּל אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֱסֹ֥ף יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But while Saul was speaking to the priest, the confusion in the Philistine camp kept increasing; and Saul said to the priest, “Withdraw your hand.”
Transliteration:
vayehiy ad diver shaul el-hakhohen vehehamvon asher vemachaneh felishetiym vayelekhe halvokhe varav {f}
vayomer shaul el-hakhohen esof yadekha

Hebrew: וַיִּזָּעֵ֣ק שָׁא֗וּל וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה הָיְתָ֜ה חֶ֤רֶב אִישׁ֙ בְּרֵעֵ֔הוּ מְהוּמָ֖ה גְּדוֹלָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Saul and the troops with him assembled and rushed into battle; they found [the Philistines] in very great confusion, every man’s sword turned against his fellow.
Transliteration: vayizaek shaul vekhׇl-haam asher itvo vayavou ad-hamilechamah vehineh hayetah cherev iysh vereehu mehumah gedvolah meod

Hebrew: וְהָעִבְרִ֗ים הָי֤וּ לַפְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ כְּאֶתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשׁ֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָל֥וּ עִמָּ֛ם בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה סָבִ֑יב וְגַם־הֵ֗מָּה לִֽהְיוֹת֙ עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִם־שָׁא֖וּל וְיוֹנָתָֽן׃
Translated: And the Hebrews who had previously sided with the Philistines, who had come up with them in the army [from] round about—they too joined the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.
Transliteration: vehaiveriym hayu lafelishetiym kheetemvol shileshvom asher alu imam vamachaneh saviyv vegam-hemah liheyvot im-yisherael asher im-shaul veyvonatan

Hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל הַמִּֽתְחַבְּאִ֤ים בְּהַר־אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ שָֽׁמְע֔וּ כִּי־נָ֖סוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַֽיַּדְבְּק֥וּ גַם־הֵ֛מָּה אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: When all of the others on Israel’s side who were hiding in the hill country of Ephraim heard that the Philistines were fleeing, they too pursued them in battle.
Transliteration: vekhol iysh yisherael hamitechaveiym vehar-eferayiim shameu khiy-nasu felishetiym vayadeveku gam-hemah achareyhem vamilechamah

Hebrew: וַיּ֧וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהַ֨מִּלְחָמָ֔ה עָבְרָ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Thus GOD brought victory to Israel that day.
The fighting passed beyond Beth-aven.
Transliteration: vayyvosha yehovah vayyvom hahu et-yisherael vehamilechamah averah et-veyt aven

Hebrew: וְאִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל נִגַּ֖שׂ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיֹּ֩אֶל֩ שָׁא֨וּל אֶת־הָעָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר אָר֣וּר הָ֠אִ֠ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יֹ֨אכַל לֶ֜חֶם עַד־הָעֶ֗רֶב וְנִקַּמְתִּי֙ מֵאֹ֣יְבַ֔י וְלֹא־טָעַ֥ם כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לָֽחֶם׃ {ס}
Translated: Israel’s force was distressed that day. For Saul had laid an oath upon the troops: “Cursed be anyone who eats any food before night falls and I take revenge on my enemies.” So none of the troops ate anything.
Transliteration: veiysh-yisherael nigash vayyvom hahu vayoel shaul et-haam lemor arur haiysh asher-yokhal lechem ad-haerev venikametiy meoyevay velo-taam khׇl-haam lachem {s}

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּ֣אוּ בַיָּ֑עַר וַיְהִ֥י דְבַ֖שׁ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Everybody came to a stack of beehives where some honey had spilled on the ground.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haarets vau vayaar vayehiy devash al-feney hashadeh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הָעָם֙ אֶל־הַיַּ֔עַר וְהִנֵּ֖ה הֵ֣לֶךְ דְּבָ֑שׁ וְאֵין־מַשִּׂ֤יג יָדוֹ֙ אֶל־פִּ֔יו כִּֽי־יָרֵ֥א הָעָ֖ם אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָֽה׃
Translated: When the troops came to the beehives and found the flow of honey there, no one put his hand to his mouth, for the troops feared the oath.
Transliteration: vayavo haam el-hayaar vehineh helekhe devash veeyn-mashiyg yadvo el-fiyv khiy-yare haam et-hashevuah

Hebrew: וְיוֹנָתָ֣ן לֹא־שָׁמַ֗ע בְּהַשְׁבִּ֣יעַ אָבִיו֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶת־קְצֵ֤ה הַמַּטֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָד֔וֹ וַיִּטְבֹּ֥ל אוֹתָ֖הּ בְּיַעְרַ֣ת הַדְּבָ֑שׁ וַיָּ֤שֶׁב יָדוֹ֙ אֶל־פִּ֔יו (ותראנה) [וַתָּאֹ֖רְנָה] עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: Jonathan, however, had not heard his father adjure the troops. So he put out the stick he had with him, dipped it into the beehive of honey, and brought his hand back to his mouth; and his eyes lit up.
Transliteration: veyvonatan lo-shama vehasheviya aviyv et-haam vayishelach et-ketseh hamateh asher veyadvo vayitevol votah veyaerat hadevash vayashev yadvo el-fiyv (vtrnh) [vataorenah] eynayv

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ אִ֨ישׁ מֵהָעָ֜ם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַשְׁבֵּ֩עַ֩ הִשְׁבִּ֨יעַ אָבִ֤יךָ אֶת־הָעָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אָר֥וּר הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יֹ֥אכַל לֶ֖חֶם הַיּ֑וֹם וַיָּ֖עַף הָעָֽם׃
Translated: At this one of the soldiers spoke up, “Your father adjured the troops: ‘Cursed be anyone who eats anything this day.’ And so the troops are faint.”
Transliteration: vayaan iysh mehaam vayomer hashevea hisheviya aviykha et-haam lemor arur haiysh asher-yokhal lechem hayyvom vayaaf haam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יֽוֹנָתָ֔ן עָכַ֥ר אָבִ֖י אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ רְאוּ־נָא֙ כִּי־אֹ֣רוּ עֵינַ֔י כִּ֣י טָעַ֔מְתִּי מְעַ֖ט דְּבַ֥שׁ הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Jonathan answered, “My father has brought trouble on the people. See for yourselves how my eyes lit up when I tasted that bit of honey.
Transliteration: vayomer yvonatan akhar aviy et-haarets reu-na khiy-oru eynay khiy taametiy meat devash hazeh

Hebrew: אַ֗ף כִּ֡י לוּא֩ אָכֹ֨ל אָכַ֤ל הַיּוֹם֙ הָעָ֔ם מִשְּׁלַ֥ל אֹיְבָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָצָ֑א כִּ֥י עַתָּ֛ה לֹא־רָבְתָ֥ה מַכָּ֖ה בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: If only the troops had eaten today of spoil captured from the enemy, the defeat of the Philistines would have been greater still!”
Transliteration: af khiy lu akhol akhal hayyvom haam mishelal oyevayv asher matsa khiy atah lo-ravetah makhah vafelishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֞וּ בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים מִמִּכְמָ֖שׂ אַיָּלֹ֑נָה וַיָּ֥עַף הָעָ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: They struck down the Philistines that day from Michmas to Aijalon, and the troops were famished.
Transliteration: vayakhu vayyvom hahu vafelishetiym mimikhemash ayalonah vayaaf haam meod

Hebrew: (ויעש) [וַיַּ֤עַט] הָעָם֙ אֶל־[הַשָּׁלָ֔ל] (שלל) וַיִּקְח֨וּ צֹ֧אן וּבָקָ֛ר וּבְנֵ֥י בָקָ֖ר וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ־אָ֑רְצָה וַיֹּ֥אכַל הָעָ֖ם עַל־הַדָּֽם׃
Translated: The troops pounced on the spoil; they took the sheep and cows and calves and slaughtered them on the ground, and the troops ate with the blood.
Transliteration: (vysh) [vayaat] haam el-[hashalal] (shll) vayikechu tson uvakar uveney vakar vayishechatu-aretsah vayokhal haam al-hadam

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֤ידוּ לְשָׁאוּל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֥ה הָעָ֛ם חֹטִ֥אים לַיהֹוָ֖ה לֶאֱכֹ֣ל עַל־הַדָּ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר בְּגַדְתֶּ֔ם גֹּלּוּ־אֵלַ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם אֶ֥בֶן גְּדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: When it was reported to Saul that the troops were sinning against G<small>OD</small>, eating with the blood, he said, “You have acted faithlessly. Roll a large stone over to me today.”
Transliteration: vayagiydu leshaul lemor hineh haam chotiym layhovah leekhol al-hadam vayomer vegadetem golu-elay hayyvom even gedvolah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֣וּל פֻּ֣צוּ בָעָ֡ם וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֣ם לָהֶ֡ם הַגִּ֣ישׁוּ אֵלַי֩ אִ֨ישׁ שׁוֹר֜וֹ וְאִ֣ישׁ שְׂיֵ֗הוּ וּשְׁחַטְתֶּ֤ם בָּזֶה֙ וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֔ם וְלֹא־תֶחֶטְא֥וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה לֶאֱכֹ֣ל אֶל־הַדָּ֑ם וַיַּגִּ֨שׁוּ כׇל־הָעָ֜ם אִ֣ישׁ שׁוֹר֧וֹ בְיָד֛וֹ הַלַּ֖יְלָה וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: And Saul ordered, “Spread out among the troops and tell them that everyone must bring me his ox or his sheep and slaughter it here, and then eat. You must not sin against G<small>OD</small> and eat with the blood.” Every one of the troops brought his own ox with him that night and slaughtered it there.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul futsu vaam vaamaretem lahem hagiyshu elay iysh shvorvo veiysh sheeihu ushechatetem vazeh vaakhaletem velo-techeteu layhovah leekhol el-hadam vayagishu khׇl-haam iysh shvorvo veyadvo halayelah vayishechatu-sham

Hebrew: וַיִּ֧בֶן שָׁא֛וּל מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַיהֹוָ֑ה אֹת֣וֹ הֵחֵ֔ל לִבְנ֥וֹת מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus Saul set up an altar to G<small>OD</small>; it was the first altar he erected to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayiven shaul mizevecha layhovah otvo hechel livenvot mizevecha layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֡וּל נֵרְדָ֣ה אַחֲרֵי֩ פְלִשְׁתִּ֨ים ׀ לַ֜יְלָה וְֽנָבֹ֥זָה בָהֶ֣ם ׀ עַד־א֣וֹר הַבֹּ֗קֶר וְלֹֽא־נַשְׁאֵ֤ר בָּהֶם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כׇּל־הַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ עֲשֵׂ֑ה {ס} וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן נִקְרְבָ֥ה הֲלֹ֖ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Saul said, “Let us go down after the Philistines by night and plunder among them until the light of morning; and let us not leave a single survivor among them.” “Do whatever you please,” they replied. But the priest said, “Let us approach God here.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul neredah acharey felishetiym layelah venavozah vahem ad-vor havoker velo-nasheer vahem iysh vayomeru khׇl-hatvov veeyneykha asheh {s} vayomer hakhohen nikerevah halom el-haElohim

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל שָׁאוּל֙ בֵּֽאלֹהִ֔ים הַֽאֵרֵד֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים הֲתִתְּנֵ֖ם בְּיַ֣ד יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֥א עָנָ֖הוּ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: So Saul inquired of God, “Shall I go down after the Philistines? Will You deliver them into the hands of Israel?” But this time [God] did not respond to him.
Transliteration: vayisheal shaul velohiym haered acharey felishetiym hatitenem veyad yisherael velo anahu vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל גֹּ֣שֽׁוּ הֲלֹ֔ם כֹּ֖ל פִּנּ֣וֹת הָעָ֑ם וּדְע֣וּ וּרְא֔וּ בַּמָּ֗ה הָ֥יְתָ֛ה הַחַטָּ֥את הַזֹּ֖את הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Then Saul said, “Come forward, all chief officers of the troops, and find out how this guilt was incurred today.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul goshu halom khol finvot haam udeu ureu vamah hayetah hachatat hazot hayyvom

Hebrew: כִּ֣י חַי־יְהֹוָ֗ה הַמּוֹשִׁ֙יעַ֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֧י אִם־יֶשְׁנ֛וֹ בְּיוֹנָתָ֥ן בְּנִ֖י כִּ֣י מ֣וֹת יָמ֑וּת וְאֵ֥ין עֹנֵ֖הוּ מִכׇּל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: For as G<small>OD</small> lives who brings victory to Israel, even if it was through my son Jonathan, he shall be put to death!” Not one soldier answered him.
Transliteration: khiy chay-yehovah hamvoshiya et-yisherael khiy im-yeshenvo veyvonatan veniy khiy mvot yamut veeyn onehu mikhׇl-haam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אַתֶּם֙ תִּֽהְיוּ֙ לְעֵ֣בֶר אֶחָ֔ד וַֽאֲנִי֙ וְיוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנִ֔י נִהְיֶ֖ה לְעֵ֣בֶר אֶחָ֑ד וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ הָעָם֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל הַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ עֲשֵֽׂה׃ {ס}
Translated: And he said to all the Israelites, “You stand on one side, and my son Jonathan and I shall stand on the other.” The troops said to Saul, “Do as you please.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-khׇl-yisherael atem tiheyu leever echad vaaniy veyvonatan veniy niheyeh leever echad vayomeru haam el-shaul hatvov veeyneykha asheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֗וּל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הָ֣בָה תָמִ֑ים וַיִּלָּכֵ֧ד יוֹנָתָ֛ן וְשָׁא֖וּל וְהָעָ֥ם יָצָֽאוּ׃
Translated: Saul then said to G<small>OD</small>, the God of Israel, “Show Thammim.” Jonathan and Saul were indicated by lot, and the troops were cleared.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-yehovah elohey yisherael havah tamiym vayilakhed yvonatan veshaul vehaam yatsau

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל הַפִּ֕ילוּ בֵּינִ֕י וּבֵ֖ין יוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנִ֑י וַיִּלָּכֵ֖ד יוֹנָתָֽן׃
Translated: And Saul said, “Cast the lots between my son and me”; and Jonathan was indicated.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul hafiylu veyniy uveyn yvonatan veniy vayilakhed yvonatan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־י֣וֹנָתָ֔ן הַגִּ֥ידָה לִּ֖י מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָה וַיַּגֶּד־ל֣וֹ יוֹנָתָ֗ן וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ טָעֹ֨ם טָעַ֜מְתִּי בִּקְצֵ֨ה הַמַּטֶּ֧ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָדִ֛י מְעַ֥ט דְּבַ֖שׁ הִנְנִ֥י אָמֽוּת׃ {ס}
Translated: Saul said to Jonathan, “Tell me, what have you done?” And Jonathan told him, “I only tasted a bit of honey with the tip of the stick in my hand. I am ready to die.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-yvonatan hagiydah liy meh ashiytah vayaged-lvo yvonatan vayomer taom taametiy viketseh hamateh asher-veyadiy meat devash hineniy amut {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל כֹּה־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְכֹ֣ה יוֹסִ֑ף כִּי־מ֥וֹת תָּמ֖וּת יוֹנָתָֽן׃
Translated: Saul said, “Thus and more may God do: You shall be put to death, Jonathan!”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul khoh-yaasheh Elohim vekhoh yvosif khiy-mvot tamut yvonatan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הָעָ֜ם אֶל־שָׁא֗וּל הֲֽיוֹנָתָ֤ן ׀ יָמוּת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָ֠שָׂ֠ה הַיְשׁוּעָ֨ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֣ה הַזֹּאת֮ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל֒ חָלִ֗ילָה חַי־יְהֹוָה֙ אִם־יִפֹּ֞ל מִשַּׂעֲרַ֤ת רֹאשׁוֹ֙ אַ֔רְצָה כִּֽי־עִם־אֱלֹהִ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ה הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּפְדּ֥וּ הָעָ֛ם אֶת־יוֹנָתָ֖ן וְלֹא־מֵֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: But the troops said to Saul, “Shall Jonathan die, after bringing this great victory to Israel? Never! As G<small>OD</small> lives, not a hair of his head shall fall to the ground! For he brought this day to pass with the help of God.” Thus the troops saved Jonathan and he did not die.
Transliteration: vayomer haam el-shaul hayvonatan yamut asher ashah hayeshuah hagedvolah hazot veyisherael chaliylah chay-yehovah im-yifol mishaarat roshvo aretsah khiy-im-Elohim ashah hayyvom hazeh vayifedu haam et-yvonatan velo-met {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל שָׁא֔וּל מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים הָלְכ֥וּ לִמְקוֹמָֽם׃
Translated: Saul broke off his pursuit of the Philistines, and the Philistines returned to their homes.
Transliteration: vayaal shaul meacharey felishetiym ufelishetiym halekhu limekvomam

Hebrew: וְשָׁא֛וּל לָכַ֥ד הַמְּלוּכָ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּלָּ֣חֶם סָבִ֣יב ׀ בְּֽכׇל־אֹיְבָ֡יו בְּמוֹאָ֣ב ׀ וּבִבְנֵֽי־עַמּ֨וֹן וּבֶאֱד֜וֹם וּבְמַלְכֵ֤י צוֹבָה֙ וּבַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּבְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יִפְנֶ֖ה יַרְשִֽׁיעַ׃
