Translated: After Saul had secured his kingship over Israel, he waged war on every side against all his enemies: against the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, the Philistines, and the kings of Zobah; and wherever he turned he routed [them].
Transliteration: veshaul lakhad hamelukhah al-yisherael vayilachem saviyv vekhׇl-oyevayv vemvoav uviveney-amvon uveedvom uvemalekhey tsvovah uvafelishetiym uvekhol asher-yifeneh yareshiya

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ חַ֔יִל וַיַּ֖ךְ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיַּצֵּ֥ל אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֥ד שֹׁסֵֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: He was triumphant, defeating the Amalekites and saving Israel from those who plundered it.
Transliteration: vayaash chayiil vayakhe et-amalek vayatsel et-yisherael miyad shosehu {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל יוֹנָתָ֥ן וְיִשְׁוִ֖י וּמַלְכִּישׁ֑וּעַ וְשֵׁם֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתָ֔יו שֵׁ֤ם הַבְּכִירָה֙ מֵרַ֔ב וְשֵׁ֥ם הַקְּטַנָּ֖ה מִיכַֽל׃
Translated: Saul’s sons were: Jonathan, Ishvi, and Malchi-shua; and the names of his two daughters were Merab, the older, and Michal, the younger.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney shaul yvonatan veyisheviy umalekhiyshua veshem shetey venotayv shem havekhiyrah merav veshem haketanah miykhal

Hebrew: וְשֵׁם֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת שָׁא֔וּל אֲחִינֹ֖עַם בַּת־אֲחִימָ֑עַץ וְשֵׁ֤ם שַׂר־צְבָאוֹ֙ אֲבִינֵ֔ר בֶּן־נֵ֖ר דּ֥וֹד שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: The name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam daughter of Ahimaaz; and the name of his army commander was Abiner son of Saul’s uncle Ner.
Transliteration: veshem eshet shaul achiynoam vat-achiymaats veshem shar-tsevavo aviyner ven-ner dvod shaul

Hebrew: וְקִ֧ישׁ אֲבִֽי־שָׁא֛וּל וְנֵ֥ר אֲבִֽי־אַבְנֵ֖ר בֶּן־אֲבִיאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Kish, Saul’s father, and Ner, Abner’s father, were sons of Abiel.
Transliteration: vekiysh aviy-shaul vener aviy-avener ven-aviyel {s}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ חֲזָקָ֣ה עַל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י שָׁא֑וּל וְרָאָ֨ה שָׁא֜וּל כׇּל־אִ֤ישׁ גִּבּוֹר֙ וְכׇל־בֶּן־חַ֔יִל וַיַּאַסְפֵ֖הוּ אֵלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: There was bitter war against the Philistines all the days of Saul; and whenever Saul noticed any stalwart man or warrior, he would take him into his service.
Transliteration: vatehiy hamilechamah chazakah al-felishetiym khol yemey shaul veraah shaul khׇl-iysh givvor vekhׇl-ven-chayiil vayaasefehu elayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל אֹתִ֨י שָׁלַ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ לִמְשׇׁחֳךָ֣ לְמֶ֔לֶךְ עַל־עַמּ֖וֹ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְעַתָּ֣ה שְׁמַ֔ע לְק֖וֹל דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Samuel said to Saul, “I am the one G<small>OD</small> sent to anoint you king over Israel—God’s people. Therefore, listen to G<small>OD</small>’s command!
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-shaul otiy shalach yehovah limeshׇchokha lemelekhe al-amvo al-yisherael veatah shema lekvol diverey yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת פָּקַ֕דְתִּי אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה עֲמָלֵ֖ק לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֥ם לוֹ֙ בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ בַּעֲלֹת֖וֹ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: I am exacting the penalty for what Amalek did to Israel, for the assault he made upon them on the road, on their way up from Egypt.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah tsevavot fakadetiy et asher-ashah amalek leyisherael asher-sham lvo vaderekhe vaalotvo mimitserayiim

Hebrew: עַתָּה֩ לֵ֨ךְ וְהִכִּיתָ֜ה אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֗ק וְהַֽחֲרַמְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ל עָלָ֑יו וְהֵמַתָּ֞ה מֵאִ֣ישׁ עַד־אִשָּׁ֗ה מֵֽעֹלֵל֙ וְעַד־יוֹנֵ֔ק מִשּׁ֣וֹר וְעַד־שֶׂ֔ה מִגָּמָ֖ל וְעַד־חֲמֽוֹר׃ {ס}
Translated: Now go, attack Amalek, and proscribe all that belongs to him. Spare no one, but kill alike men and women, infants and sucklings, oxen and sheep, camels and donkeys!”
Transliteration: atah lekhe vehikhiytah et-amalek vehacharametem et-khׇl-asher-lvo velo tachemol alayv vehematah meiysh ad-ishah meolel vead-yvonek mishvor vead-sheh migamal vead-chamvor {s}

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁמַּ֤ע שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַֽיִּפְקְדֵם֙ בַּטְּלָאִ֔ים מָאתַ֥יִם אֶ֖לֶף רַגְלִ֑י וַעֲשֶׂ֥רֶת אֲלָפִ֖ים אֶת־אִ֥ישׁ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Saul mustered the troops and enrolled them at Telaim: 200,000 men on foot, and 10,000 as Judah’s contingent.
Transliteration: vayeshama shaul et-haam vayifekedem vatelaiym matayiim elef rageliy vaasheret alafiym et-iysh yehudah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א שָׁא֖וּל עַד־עִ֣יר עֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיָּ֖רֶב בַּנָּֽחַל׃
Translated: Then Saul advanced as far as the city of Amalek and lay in wait in the wadi.
Transliteration: vayavo shaul ad-iyr amalek vayarev vanachal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֣וּל אֶֽל־הַקֵּינִ֡י לְכוּ֩ סֻּ֨רוּ רְד֜וּ מִתּ֣וֹךְ עֲמָלֵקִ֗י פֶּן־אֹֽסִפְךָ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וְאַתָּ֞ה עָשִׂ֤יתָֽה חֶ֙סֶד֙ עִם־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בַּעֲלוֹתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּ֥סַר קֵינִ֖י מִתּ֥וֹךְ עֲמָלֵֽק׃
Translated: Saul said to the Kenites, “Come, withdraw at once from among the Amalekites, that I may not destroy you along with them; for you showed kindness to all the Israelites when they left Egypt.” So the Kenites withdrew from among the Amalekites.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-hakeyniy lekhu suru redu mitvokhe amalekiy fen-osifekha imvo veatah ashiytah chesed im-khׇl-veney yisherael vaalvotam mimitserayiim vayasar keyniy mitvokhe amalek

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥ךְ שָׁא֖וּל אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֑ק מֵֽחֲוִילָה֙ בּוֹאֲךָ֣ שׁ֔וּר אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Saul destroyed Amalek from Havilah all the way to Shur, which is close to Egypt,
Transliteration: vayakhe shaul et-amalek mechaviylah vvoakha shur asher al-feney mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפֹּ֛שׂ אֶת־אֲגַ֥ג מֶלֶךְ־עֲמָלֵ֖ק חָ֑י וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם הֶחֱרִ֥ים לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: and he captured King Agag of Amalek alive. He proscribed all the people, putting them to the sword;
Transliteration: vayitefosh et-agag melekhe-amalek chay veet-khׇl-haam hecheriym lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וַיַּחְמֹל֩ שָׁא֨וּל וְהָעָ֜ם עַל־אֲגָ֗ג וְעַל־מֵיטַ֣ב הַצֹּאן֩ וְהַבָּקָ֨ר וְהַמִּשְׁנִ֤ים וְעַל־הַכָּרִים֙ וְעַל־כׇּל־הַטּ֔וֹב וְלֹ֥א אָב֖וּ הַחֲרִימָ֑ם וְכׇל־הַמְּלָאכָ֛ה נְמִבְזָ֥ה וְנָמֵ֖ס אֹתָ֥הּ הֶחֱרִֽימוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: but Saul and the troops spared Agag and the best of the sheep, the oxen, the second-born, the lambs, and all else that was of value. They would not proscribe them; they proscribed only what was cheap and worthless.
Transliteration: vayachemol shaul vehaam al-agag veal-meytav hatson vehavakar vehamisheniym veal-hakhariym veal-khׇl-hatvov velo avu hachariymam vekhׇl-hamelakhah nemivezah venames otah hecheriymu {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> then came to Samuel:
Transliteration: vayehiy devar-yehovah el-shemuel lemor

Hebrew: נִחַ֗מְתִּי כִּֽי־הִמְלַ֤כְתִּי אֶת־שָׁאוּל֙ לְמֶ֔לֶךְ כִּי־שָׁב֙ מֵֽאַחֲרַ֔י וְאֶת־דְּבָרַ֖י לֹ֣א הֵקִ֑ים וַיִּ֙חַר֙ לִשְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיִּזְעַ֥ק אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה כׇּל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated: “I regret that I made Saul king, for he has turned away from Me and has not carried out My commands.” Samuel was distressed and he entreated G<small>OD</small> all night long.
Transliteration: nichametiy khiy-himelakhetiy et-shaul lemelekhe khiy-shav meacharay veet-devaray lo hekiym vayichar lishemuel vayizeak el-yehovah khׇl-halayelah

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֧ם שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל לִקְרַ֥את שָׁא֖וּל בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַיֻּגַּ֨ד לִשְׁמוּאֵ֜ל לֵאמֹ֗ר בָּֽא־שָׁא֤וּל הַכַּרְמֶ֙לָה֙ וְהִנֵּ֨ה מַצִּ֥יב לוֹ֙ יָ֔ד וַיִּסֹּב֙ וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֔ר וַיֵּ֖רֶד הַגִּלְגָּֽל׃
Translated: Early in the morning Samuel went to meet Saul. Samuel was told, “Saul went to Carmel, where he erected a monument for himself; then he left and went on down to Gilgal.”
Transliteration: vayashekhem shemuel likerat shaul vavoker vayugad lishemuel lemor va-shaul hakharemelah vehineh matsiyv lvo yad vayisov vayaavor vayered hagilegal

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל אֶל־שָׁא֑וּל וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ שָׁא֗וּל בָּר֤וּךְ אַתָּה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה הֲקִימֹ֖תִי אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When Samuel came to Saul, Saul said to him, “Blessed are you of G<small>OD</small>! I have fulfilled G<small>OD</small>’s command.”
Transliteration: vayavo shemuel el-shaul vayomer lvo shaul varukhe atah layhovah hakiymotiy et-devar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וּמֶ֛ה קֽוֹל־הַצֹּ֥אן הַזֶּ֖ה בְּאׇזְנָ֑י וְק֣וֹל הַבָּקָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃
Translated: “Then what,” demanded Samuel, “is this bleating of sheep in my ears, and the lowing of oxen that I hear?”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel umeh kvol-hatson hazeh veׇzenay vekvol havakar asher anokhiy shomea

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל מֵעֲמָלֵקִ֣י הֱבִיא֗וּם אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָמַ֤ל הָעָם֙ עַל־מֵיטַ֤ב הַצֹּאן֙ וְהַבָּקָ֔ר לְמַ֥עַן זְבֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְאֶת־הַיּוֹתֵ֖ר הֶחֱרַֽמְנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Saul answered, “They were brought from the Amalekites, for the troops spared the choicest of the sheep and oxen for sacrificing to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God. And we proscribed the rest.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul meamalekiy heviyum asher chamal haam al-meytav hatson vehavakar lemaan zevocha layhovah eloheykha veet-hayyvoter hecheramenu {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל הֶ֚רֶף וְאַגִּ֣ידָה לְּךָ֔ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלַ֖י הַלָּ֑יְלָה (ויאמרו) [וַיֹּ֥אמֶר] ל֖וֹ דַּבֵּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Samuel said to Saul, “Stop! Let me tell you what G<small>OD</small> said to me last night!” “Speak,” he replied.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-shaul heref veagiydah lekha et asher diver yehovah elay halayelah (vymrv) [vayomer] lvo daver {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל הֲל֗וֹא אִם־קָטֹ֤ן אַתָּה֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ רֹ֛אשׁ שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אָ֑תָּה וַיִּמְשָׁחֲךָ֧ יְהֹוָ֛ה לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And Samuel said, “You may look small to yourself, but you are the head of the tribes of Israel. G<small>OD</small> anointed you king over Israel,
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel halvo im-katon atah veeyneykha rosh shivetey yisherael atah vayimeshachakha yehovah lemelekhe al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלָחֲךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּדָ֑רֶךְ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֵ֣ךְ וְהַחֲרַמְתָּ֞ה אֶת־הַֽחַטָּאִים֙ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֔ק וְנִלְחַמְתָּ֣ ב֔וֹ עַ֥ד כַּלּוֹתָ֖ם אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and G<small>OD</small> sent you on a mission, saying, ‘Go and proscribe the sinful Amalekites; make war on them until you have exterminated them.’
Transliteration: vayishelachakha yehovah vedarekhe vayomer lekhe vehacharametah et-hachataiym et-amalek venilechameta vvo ad khalvotam otam

Hebrew: וְלָ֥מָּה לֹֽא־שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתַּ֙עַט֙ אֶל־הַשָּׁלָ֔ל וַתַּ֥עַשׂ הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Why did you disobey G<small>OD</small> and swoop down on the spoil in defiance of G<small>OD</small>’s will?”
Transliteration: velamah lo-shamaeta vekvol yehovah vataat el-hashalal vataash hara veeyney yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֔ה וָאֵלֵ֕ךְ בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־שְׁלָחַ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאָבִ֗יא אֶת־אֲגַג֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמָלֵ֔ק וְאֶת־עֲמָלֵ֖ק הֶחֱרַֽמְתִּי׃
Translated: Saul said to Samuel, “But I did obey G<small>OD</small>! I performed the mission on which G<small>OD</small> sent me: I captured King Agag of Amalek, and I proscribed Amalek,
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-shemuel asher shamaetiy vekvol yehovah vaelekhe vaderekhe asher-shelachaniy yehovah vaaviy et-agag melekhe amalek veet-amalek hecherametiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח הָעָ֧ם מֵהַשָּׁלָ֛ל צֹ֥אן וּבָקָ֖ר רֵאשִׁ֣ית הַחֵ֑רֶם לִזְבֹּ֛חַ לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בַּגִּלְגָּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: and the troops took from the spoil some sheep and oxen—the best of what had been proscribed—to sacrifice to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God at Gilgal.”
Transliteration: vayikach haam mehashalal tson uvakar reshiyt hacherem lizevocha layhovah eloheykha vagilegal {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל הַחֵ֤פֶץ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בְּעֹל֣וֹת וּזְבָחִ֔ים כִּשְׁמֹ֖עַ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה הִנֵּ֤ה שְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ מִזֶּ֣בַח ט֔וֹב לְהַקְשִׁ֖יב מֵחֵ֥לֶב אֵילִֽים׃
Translated:
But Samuel said:
“Does GOD delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices
As much as in obedience to GOD’s command?
Surely, obedience is better than sacrifice,
Compliance than the fat of rams.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel hachefets layhovah veolvot uzevachiym khishemoa vekvol yehovah hineh shemoa mizevach tvov lehakeshiyv mechelev eyliym

Hebrew: כִּ֤י חַטַּאת־קֶ֙סֶם֙ מֶ֔רִי וְאָ֥וֶן וּתְרָפִ֖ים הַפְצַ֑ר יַ֗עַן מָאַ֙סְתָּ֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּמְאָסְךָ֖ מִמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
For rebellion is like the sin of divination,
Defiance, like the iniquity of oracle idols.
Because you rejected GOD’s command,
[God] has rejected you as king.”
Transliteration: khiy chatat-kesem meriy veaven uterafiym hafetsar yaan maaseta et-devar yehovah vayimeasekha mimelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֤וּל אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵל֙ חָטָ֔אתִי כִּֽי־עָבַ֥רְתִּי אֶת־פִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְאֶת־דְּבָרֶ֑יךָ כִּ֤י יָרֵ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וָאֶשְׁמַ֖ע בְּקוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Saul said to Samuel, “I did wrong to transgress G<small>OD</small>’s command and your instructions; but I was afraid of the troops and I yielded to them.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-shemuel chatatiy khiy-avaretiy et-fiy-yehovah veet-devareykha khiy yaretiy et-haam vaeshema vekvolam

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה שָׂ֥א נָ֖א אֶת־חַטָּאתִ֑י וְשׁ֣וּב עִמִּ֔י וְאֶֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Please, forgive my offense and come back with me, and I will bow low to G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: veatah sha na et-chatatiy veshuv imiy veeshetachaveh layhovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל לֹ֥א אָשׁ֖וּב עִמָּ֑ךְ כִּ֤י מָאַ֙סְתָּה֙ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּמְאָסְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִֽהְי֥וֹת מֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: But Samuel said to Saul, “I will not go back with you; for you have rejected G<small>OD</small>’s command, and G<small>OD</small> has rejected you as king over Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-shaul lo ashuv imakhe khiy maasetah et-devar yehovah vayimeasekha yehovah miheyvot melekhe al-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּסֹּ֥ב שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל לָלֶ֑כֶת וַיַּחֲזֵ֥ק בִּכְנַף־מְעִיל֖וֹ וַיִּקָּרַֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: As Samuel turned to leave, Saul seized the corner of his robe, and it tore.
Transliteration: vayisov shemuel lalekhet vayachazek vikhenaf-meiylvo vayikara {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל קָרַ֨ע יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶֽת־מַמְלְכ֧וּת יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מֵעָלֶ֖יךָ הַיּ֑וֹם וּנְתָנָ֕הּ לְרֵעֲךָ֖ הַטּ֥וֹב מִמֶּֽךָּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And Samuel said to him, “G<small>OD</small> has this day torn the kingship over Israel away from you and has given it to another who is worthier than you.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv shemuel kara yehovah et-mamelekhut yisherael mealeykha hayyvom unetanah lereakha hatvov mimekha {s}

Hebrew: וְגַם֙ נֵ֣צַח יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א יְשַׁקֵּ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יִנָּחֵ֑ם כִּ֣י לֹ֥א אָדָ֛ם ה֖וּא לְהִנָּחֵֽם׃
Translated: Moreover, the Glory of Israel does not deceive or have a change of heart, for [God] is not human to have a change of heart.”
Transliteration: vegam netsach yisherael lo yeshaker velo yinachem khiy lo adam hu lehinachem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חָטָ֔אתִי עַתָּ֗ה כַּבְּדֵ֥נִי נָ֛א נֶ֥גֶד זִקְנֵֽי־עַמִּ֖י וְנֶ֣גֶד יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשׁ֣וּב עִמִּ֔י וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֵ֖יתִי לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: But [Saul] pleaded, “I did wrong. Please, honor me in the presence of the elders of my people and in the presence of Israel, and come back with me until I have bowed low to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God.”
Transliteration: vayomer chatatiy atah khavedeniy na neged zikeney-amiy veneged yisherael veshuv imiy vehishetachaveytiy layhovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שׇׁב שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל אַחֲרֵ֣י שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ שָׁא֖וּל לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: So Samuel followed Saul back, and Saul bowed low to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayashׇv shemuel acharey shaul vayishetachu shaul layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל הַגִּ֤ישׁוּ אֵלַי֙ אֶת־אֲגַג֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמָלֵ֔ק וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אֵלָ֔יו אֲגַ֖ג מַעֲדַנֹּ֑ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲגָ֔ג אָכֵ֖ן סָ֥ר מַר־הַמָּֽוֶת׃ {ס}
Translated: Samuel said, “Bring forward to me King Agag of Amalek.” Agag approached him with faltering steps; and Agag said, “Ah, bitter death is at hand!”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel hagiyshu elay et-agag melekhe amalek vayelekhe elayv agag maadanot vayomer agag akhen sar mar-hamavet {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר שִׁכְּלָ֤ה נָשִׁים֙ חַרְבֶּ֔ךָ כֵּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ל מִנָּשִׁ֖ים אִמֶּ֑ךָ וַיְשַׁסֵּ֨ף שְׁמוּאֵ֧ל אֶת־אֲגָ֛ג לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּגִּלְגָּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Samuel said:
“As your sword has bereaved women,
So shall your mother be bereaved among women.”
And Samuel cut Agag down before GOD at Gilgal.
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel khaasher shikhelah nashiym charevekha khen-tishekhal minashiym imekha vayeshasef shemuel et-agag lifeney yehovah vagilegal {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל הָרָמָ֑תָה וְשָׁא֛וּל עָלָ֥ה אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ גִּבְעַ֥ת שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: Samuel then departed for Ramah, and Saul went up to his home at Gibeah of Saul.
Transliteration: vayelekhe shemuel haramatah veshaul alah el-veytvo giveat shaul

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָסַ֨ף שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל לִרְא֤וֹת אֶת־שָׁאוּל֙ עַד־י֣וֹם מוֹת֔וֹ כִּֽי־הִתְאַבֵּ֥ל שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל אֶל־שָׁא֑וּל וַיהֹוָ֣ה נִחָ֔ם כִּֽי־הִמְלִ֥יךְ אֶת־שָׁא֖וּל עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Samuel never saw Saul again to the day of his death. But Samuel grieved over Saul, because G<small>OD</small> regretted having made Saul king over Israel.
Transliteration: velo-yasaf shemuel lirevot et-shaul ad-yvom mvotvo khiy-hiteavel shemuel el-shaul vayhovah nicham khiy-himeliykhe et-shaul al-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל עַד־מָתַי֙ אַתָּה֙ מִתְאַבֵּ֣ל אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וַאֲנִ֣י מְאַסְתִּ֔יו מִמְּלֹ֖ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מַלֵּ֨א קַרְנְךָ֜ שֶׁ֗מֶן וְלֵ֤ךְ אֶֽשְׁלָחֲךָ֙ אֶל־יִשַׁ֣י בֵּֽית־הַלַּחְמִ֔י כִּֽי־רָאִ֧יתִי בְּבָנָ֛יו לִ֖י מֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to Samuel, “How long will you grieve over Saul, since I have rejected him as king over Israel? Fill your horn with oil and set out; I am sending you to Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have decided on one of his sons to be king.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-shemuel ad-matay atah miteavel el-shaul vaaniy measetiyv mimelokhe al-yisherael male karenekha shemen velekhe eshelachakha el-yishay veyt-halachemiy khiy-raiytiy vevanayv liy melekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֵ֣יךְ אֵלֵ֔ךְ וְשָׁמַ֥ע שָׁא֖וּל וַהֲרָגָ֑נִי וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה עֶגְלַ֤ת בָּקָר֙ תִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ לִזְבֹּ֥חַ לַיהֹוָ֖ה בָּֽאתִי׃
Translated: Samuel replied, “How can I go? If Saul hears of it, he will kill me.” G<small>OD</small> answered, “Take a heifer with you, and say, ‘I have come to sacrifice to G<small>OD</small>.’
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel eykhe elekhe veshama shaul vaharaganiy vayomer yehovah egelat vakar tikach veyadekha veamareta lizevocha layhovah vatiy

Hebrew: וְקָרָ֥אתָ לְיִשַׁ֖י בַּזָּ֑בַח וְאָנֹכִ֗י אוֹדִֽיעֲךָ֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וּמָשַׁחְתָּ֣ לִ֔י אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־אֹמַ֖ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Invite Jesse to the sacrificial feast, and then I will make known to you what you shall do; you shall anoint for Me the one I point out to you.”
Transliteration: vekarata leyishay vazavach veanokhiy vodiyakha et asher-taasheh umashacheta liy et asher-omar eleykha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל אֵ֚ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א בֵּ֣ית לָ֑חֶם וַיֶּחֶרְד֞וּ זִקְנֵ֤י הָעִיר֙ לִקְרָאת֔וֹ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שָׁלֹ֥ם בּוֹאֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Samuel did what G<small>OD</small> commanded. When he came to Bethlehem, the elders of the city went out in alarm to meet him and said, “Do you come on a peaceful errand?”
Transliteration: vayaash shemuel et asher diver yehovah vayavo veyt lachem vayecheredu zikeney haiyr likeratvo vayomer shalom vvoekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ שָׁל֗וֹם לִזְבֹּ֤חַ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בָּ֔אתִי הִֽתְקַדְּשׁ֔וּ וּבָאתֶ֥ם אִתִּ֖י בַּזָּ֑בַח וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ אֶת־יִשַׁי֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֔יו וַיִּקְרָ֥א לָהֶ֖ם לַזָּֽבַח׃
Translated: “Yes,” he replied, “I have come to sacrifice to G<small>OD</small>. Purify yourselves and join me in the sacrificial feast.” He also instructed Jesse and his sons to purify themselves and invited them to the sacrificial feast.
Transliteration: vayomer shalvom lizevocha layhovah vatiy hitekadeshu uvatem itiy vazavach vayekadesh et-yishay veet-vanayv vayikera lahem lazavach

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בְּבוֹאָ֔ם וַיַּ֖רְא אֶת־אֱלִיאָ֑ב וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַ֛ךְ נֶ֥גֶד יְהֹוָ֖ה מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: When they arrived and he saw Eliab, he thought: “Surely G<small>OD</small>’s anointed stands here.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vevvoam vayare et-eliyav vayomer akhe neged yehovah meshiychvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵ֗ל אַל־תַּבֵּ֧ט אֶל־מַרְאֵ֛הוּ וְאֶל־גְּבֹ֥הַּ קוֹמָת֖וֹ כִּ֣י מְאַסְתִּ֑יהוּ כִּ֣י ׀ לֹ֗א אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִרְאֶה֙ הָאָדָ֔ם כִּ֤י הָאָדָם֙ יִרְאֶ֣ה לַעֵינַ֔יִם וַיהֹוָ֖ה יִרְאֶ֥ה לַלֵּבָֽב׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> said to Samuel, “Pay no attention to his appearance or his stature, for I have rejected him. For [G<small>OD</small> sees] not as humans see; humans see only what is visible, but G<small>OD</small> sees into the heart.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-shemuel al-tavet el-mareehu veel-gevoha kvomatvo khiy measetiyhu khiy lo asher yireeh haadam khiy haadam yireeh laeynayiim vayhovah yireeh lalevav

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א יִשַׁי֙ אֶל־אֲבִ֣ינָדָ֔ב וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֣י שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֕אמֶר גַּם־בָּזֶ֖ה לֹא־בָחַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then Jesse called Abinadab and had him pass before Samuel; but he said, “G<small>OD</small> has not chosen this one either.”
Transliteration: vayikera yishay el-aviynadav vayaavirehu lifeney shemuel vayomer gam-vazeh lo-vachar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֵ֥ר יִשַׁ֖י שַׁמָּ֑ה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר גַּם־בָּזֶ֖ה לֹא־בָחַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Next Jesse presented Shammah; and again he said, “G<small>OD</small> has not chosen this one either.”
Transliteration: vayaaver yishay shamah vayomer gam-vazeh lo-vachar yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֵ֥ר יִשַׁ֛י שִׁבְעַ֥ת בָּנָ֖יו לִפְנֵ֣י שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־יִשַׁ֔י לֹא־בָחַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Thus Jesse presented seven of his sons before Samuel, and Samuel said to Jesse, “G<small>OD</small> has not chosen any of these.”
Transliteration: vayaaver yishay shiveat vanayv lifeney shemuel vayomer shemuel el-yishay lo-vachar yehovah vaeleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֣ל אֶל־יִשַׁי֮ הֲתַ֣מּוּ הַנְּעָרִים֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר ע֚וֹד שָׁאַ֣ר הַקָּטָ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֥ה רֹעֶ֖ה בַּצֹּ֑אן וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֤ל אֶל־יִשַׁי֙ שִׁלְחָ֣ה וְקָחֶ֔נּוּ כִּ֥י לֹֽא־נָסֹ֖ב עַד־בֹּא֥וֹ פֹֽה׃
Translated: Then Samuel asked Jesse, “Are these all the boys you have?” He replied, “There is still the youngest; he is tending the flock.” And Samuel said to Jesse, “Send someone to bring him, for we will not sit down to eat until he gets here.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-yishay hatamu haneariym vayomer vod shaar hakatan vehineh roeh vatson vayomer shemuel el-yishay shilechah vekachenu khiy lo-nasov ad-vovo foh

Hebrew:
וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח וַיְבִיאֵ֙הוּ֙ וְה֣וּא אַדְמוֹנִ֔י עִם־יְפֵ֥ה עֵינַ֖יִם וְט֣וֹב רֹ֑אִי {פ}
וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה ק֥וּם מְשָׁחֵ֖הוּ כִּי־זֶ֥ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: So they sent and brought him. He was ruddy-cheeked, bright-eyed, and handsome. And G<small>OD</small> said, “Rise and anoint him, for this is the one.”
Transliteration:
vayishelach vayeviyehu vehu ademvoniy im-yefeh eynayiim vetvov roiy {f}
vayomer yehovah kum meshachehu khiy-zeh hu

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח שְׁמוּאֵ֜ל אֶת־קֶ֣רֶן הַשֶּׁ֗מֶן וַיִּמְשַׁ֣ח אֹתוֹ֮ בְּקֶ֣רֶב אֶחָיו֒ וַתִּצְלַ֤ח רֽוּחַ־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד מֵהַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וָמָ֑עְלָה וַיָּ֣קׇם שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ הָרָמָֽתָה׃
Translated: Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the presence of his brothers; and the spirit of G<small>OD</small> gripped David from that day on. Samuel then set out for Ramah.
Transliteration: vayikach shemuel et-keren hashemen vayimeshach otvo vekerev echayv vatitselach rucha-yehovah el-david mehayyvom hahu vamaelah vayakׇm shemuel vayelekhe haramatah

Hebrew: וְר֧וּחַ יְהֹוָ֛ה סָ֖רָה מֵעִ֣ם שָׁא֑וּל וּבִעֲתַ֥תּוּ רֽוּחַ־רָעָ֖ה מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Now the spirit of G<small>OD</small> had departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from G<small>OD</small> began to terrify him.
Transliteration: verucha yehovah sarah meim shaul uviatatu rucha-raah meet yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ עַבְדֵֽי־שָׁא֖וּל אֵלָ֑יו הִנֵּה־נָ֧א רוּחַ־אֱלֹהִ֛ים רָעָ֖ה מְבַעִתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Saul’s courtiers said to him, “An evil spirit of God is terrifying you.
Transliteration: vayomeru avedey-shaul elayv hineh-na rucha-Elohim raah mevaitekha

Hebrew: יֹֽאמַר־נָ֤א אֲדֹנֵ֙נוּ֙ עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ יְבַקְשׁ֕וּ אִ֕ישׁ יֹדֵ֖עַ מְנַגֵּ֣ן בַּכִּנּ֑וֹר וְהָיָ֗ה בִּֽהְי֨וֹת עָלֶ֤יךָ רֽוּחַ־אֱלֹהִים֙ רָעָ֔ה וְנִגֵּ֥ן בְּיָד֖וֹ וְט֥וֹב לָֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: Let our lord give the order [and] the courtiers in attendance on you will look for someone who is skilled at playing the lyre; whenever the evil spirit of God comes over you, he will play it and you will feel better.”
Transliteration: yomar-na adonenu avadeykha lefaneykha yevakeshu iysh yodea menagen vakhinvor vehayah viheyvot aleykha rucha-Elohim raah venigen veyadvo vetvov lakhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר שָׁא֖וּל אֶל־עֲבָדָ֑יו רְאוּ־נָ֣א לִ֗י אִ֚ישׁ מֵיטִ֣יב לְנַגֵּ֔ן וַהֲבִיאוֹתֶ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: So Saul said to his courtiers, “Find me someone who can play well and bring him to me.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-avadayv reu-na liy iysh meytiyv lenagen vahaviyvotem elay

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ אֶחָ֨ד מֵהַנְּעָרִ֜ים וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֨ה רָאִ֜יתִי בֵּ֣ן לְיִשַׁי֮ בֵּ֣ית הַלַּחְמִי֒ יֹדֵ֣עַ נַ֠גֵּ֠ן וְגִבּ֨וֹר חַ֜יִל וְאִ֧ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֛ה וּנְב֥וֹן דָּבָ֖ר וְאִ֣ישׁ תֹּ֑אַר וַיהֹוָ֖ה עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: One of the attendants spoke up, “I have observed a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite who is skilled in music; he is a stalwart fellow and a warrior, sensible in speech, and handsome in appearance—and G<small>OD</small> is with him.”
Transliteration: vayaan echad mehaneariym vayomer hineh raiytiy ven leyishay veyt halachemiy yodea nagen vegivvor chayiil veiysh milechamah unevvon davar veiysh toar vayhovah imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח שָׁא֛וּל מַלְאָכִ֖ים אֶל־יִשָׁ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁלְחָ֥ה אֵלַ֛י אֶת־דָּוִ֥ד בִּנְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: Whereupon Saul sent messengers to Jesse to say, “Send me your son David, who is with the flock.”
Transliteration: vayishelach shaul maleakhiym el-yishay vayomer shilechah elay et-david vinekha asher vatson

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח יִשַׁ֜י חֲמ֥וֹר לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְנֹ֣אד יַ֔יִן וּגְדִ֥י עִזִּ֖ים אֶחָ֑ד וַיִּשְׁלַ֛ח בְּיַד־דָּוִ֥ד בְּנ֖וֹ אֶל־שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: Jesse took a donkey [laden with] bread, a skin of wine, and a kid, and sent them to Saul by his son David.
Transliteration: vayikach yishay chamvor lechem venod yayiin ugediy iziym echad vayishelach veyad-david venvo el-shaul

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א דָוִד֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד לְפָנָ֑יו וַיֶּאֱהָבֵ֣הֽוּ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיְהִי־ל֖וֹ נֹשֵׂ֥א כֵלִֽים׃
Translated: So David came to Saul and entered his service; [Saul] took a strong liking to him and made him one of his arms-bearers.
Transliteration: vayavo david el-shaul vayaamod lefanayv vayeehavehu meod vayehiy-lvo noshe kheliym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח שָׁא֔וּל אֶל־יִשַׁ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר יַעֲמׇד־נָ֤א דָוִד֙ לְפָנַ֔י כִּי־מָ֥צָא חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: Saul sent word to Jesse, “Let David remain in my service, for I am pleased with him.”
Transliteration: vayishelach shaul el-yishay lemor yaamׇd-na david lefanay khiy-matsa chen veeynay

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בִּֽהְי֤וֹת רֽוּחַ־אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וְלָקַ֥ח דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־הַכִּנּ֖וֹר וְנִגֵּ֣ן בְּיָד֑וֹ וְרָוַ֤ח לְשָׁאוּל֙ וְט֣וֹב ל֔וֹ וְסָ֥רָה מֵעָלָ֖יו ר֥וּחַ הָרָעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Whenever the [evil] spirit of God came upon Saul, David would take the lyre and play it; Saul would find relief and feel better, and the evil spirit would leave him.
Transliteration: vehayah viheyvot rucha-Elohim el-shaul velakach david et-hakhinvor venigen veyadvo veravach leshaul vetvov lvo vesarah mealayv rucha haraah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּאַסְפ֨וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֤ים אֶת־מַֽחֲנֵיהֶם֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַיֵּאָ֣סְפ֔וּ שֹׂכֹ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִֽיהוּדָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֛וּ בֵּין־שׂוֹכֹ֥ה וּבֵין־עֲזֵקָ֖ה בְּאֶ֥פֶס דַּמִּֽים׃
Translated: The Philistines assembled their forces for battle; they massed at Socoh of Judah, and encamped at Ephes-dammim, between Socoh and Azekah.
Transliteration: vayaasefu felishetiym et-machaneyhem lamilechamah vayeasefu shokhoh asher liyhudah vayachanu veyn-shvokhoh uveyn-azekah veefes damiym

Hebrew: וְשָׁא֤וּל וְאִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נֶֽאֶסְפ֔וּ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעֵ֣מֶק הָאֵלָ֑ה וַיַּעַרְכ֥וּ מִלְחָמָ֖ה לִקְרַ֥את פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Saul and the rest of Israel’s side massed and encamped in the valley of Elah. They drew up their line of battle against the Philistines,
Transliteration: veshaul veiysh-yisherael neesefu vayachanu veemek haelah vayaarekhu milechamah likerat felishetiym

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֞ים עֹמְדִ֤ים אֶל־הָהָר֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עֹמְדִ֥ים אֶל־הָהָ֖ר מִזֶּ֑ה וְהַגַּ֖יְא בֵּינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: with the Philistines stationed on one hill and Israel stationed on the opposite hill; the ravine was between them.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym omediym el-hahar mizeh veyisherael omediym el-hahar mizeh vehagaye veyneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א אִֽישׁ־הַבֵּנַ֙יִם֙ מִמַּחֲנ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים גׇּלְיָ֥ת שְׁמ֖וֹ מִגַּ֑ת גׇּבְה֕וֹ שֵׁ֥שׁ אַמּ֖וֹת וָזָֽרֶת׃
Translated: A champion of the Philistine forces stepped forward; his name was Goliath of Gath, and he was six cubits and a span tall.
Transliteration: vayetse iysh-havenayiim mimachanvot felishetiym gׇleyat shemvo migat gׇvehvo shesh amvot vazaret

Hebrew: וְכ֤וֹבַע נְחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ עַל־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וְשִׁרְי֥וֹן קַשְׂקַשִּׂ֖ים ה֣וּא לָב֑וּשׁ וּמִשְׁקַל֙ הַשִּׁרְי֔וֹן חֲמֵשֶׁת־אֲלָפִ֥ים שְׁקָלִ֖ים נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: He had a bronze helmet on his head, and wore a breastplate of scale armor, a bronze breastplate weighing five thousand shekels.
Transliteration: vekhvova nechoshet al-roshvo veshireyvon kashekashiym hu lavush umishekal hashireyvon chameshet-alafiym shekaliym nechoshet

Hebrew: וּמִצְחַ֥ת נְחֹ֖שֶׁת עַל־רַגְלָ֑יו וְכִיד֥וֹן נְחֹ֖שֶׁת בֵּ֥ין כְּתֵפָֽיו׃
Translated: He had bronze greaves on his legs, and a bronze javelin [slung] from his shoulders.
Transliteration: umitsechat nechoshet al-ragelayv vekhiydvon nechoshet veyn khetefayv

Hebrew: (וחץ) [וְעֵ֣ץ] חֲנִית֗וֹ כִּמְנוֹר֙ אֹֽרְגִ֔ים וְלַהֶ֣בֶת חֲנִית֔וֹ שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת שְׁקָלִ֖ים בַּרְזֶ֑ל וְנֹשֵׂ֥א הַצִּנָּ֖ה הֹלֵ֥ךְ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: The shaft of his spear was like a weaver’s bar, and the iron head of his spear weighed six hundred shekels; and the shield-bearer marched in front of him.
Transliteration: (vchts) [veets] chaniytvo khimenvor oregiym velahevet chaniytvo shesh-mevot shekaliym varezel venoshe hatsinah holekhe lefanayv

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֗ד וַיִּקְרָא֙ אֶל־מַעַרְכֹ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם לָ֥מָּה תֵצְא֖וּ לַעֲרֹ֣ךְ מִלְחָמָ֑ה הֲל֧וֹא אָנֹכִ֣י הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֗י וְאַתֶּם֙ עֲבָדִ֣ים לְשָׁא֔וּל בְּרוּ־לָכֶ֥ם אִ֖ישׁ וְיֵרֵ֥ד אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: He stopped and called out to the ranks of Israel and he said to them, “Why should you come out to engage in battle? I am the Philistine [champion], and you are Saul’s servants. Choose your man and let him come down against me.
Transliteration: vayaamod vayikera el-maarekhot yisherael vayomer lahem lamah tetseu laarokhe milechamah halvo anokhiy hafelishetiy veatem avadiym leshaul veru-lakhem iysh veeired elay

Hebrew: אִם־יוּכַ֞ל לְהִלָּחֵ֤ם אִתִּי֙ וְהִכָּ֔נִי וְהָיִ֥ינוּ לָכֶ֖ם לַעֲבָדִ֑ים וְאִם־אֲנִ֤י אֽוּכַל־לוֹ֙ וְהִכִּיתִ֔יו וִהְיִ֤יתֶם לָ֙נוּ֙ לַעֲבָדִ֔ים וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֖ם אֹתָֽנוּ׃
Translated: If he bests me in combat and kills me, we will become your slaves; but if I best him and kill him, you shall be our slaves and serve us.”
Transliteration: im-yukhal lehilachem itiy vehikhaniy vehayiynu lakhem laavadiym veim-aniy ukhal-lvo vehikhiytiyv viheyiytem lanu laavadiym vaavadetem otanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י אֲנִ֗י חֵרַ֛פְתִּי אֶת־מַעַרְכ֥וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה תְּנוּ־לִ֣י אִ֔ישׁ וְנִֽלָּחֲמָ֖ה יָֽחַד׃
Translated: And the Philistine ended, “So I now defy the ranks of Israel. Get me a man and let’s fight it out!”
Transliteration: vayomer hafelishetiy aniy cherafetiy et-maarekhvot yisherael hayyvom hazeh tenu-liy iysh venilachamah yachad

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע שָׁאוּל֙ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֵּחַ֥תּוּ וַיִּֽרְא֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: When Saul and all Israel heard these words of the Philistine, they were dismayed and terror-stricken.
Transliteration: vayishema shaul vekhׇl-yisherael et-diverey hafelishetiy haeleh vayechatu vayireu meod {f}

Hebrew: וְדָוִד֩ בֶּן־אִ֨ישׁ אֶפְרָתִ֜י הַזֶּ֗ה מִבֵּ֥ית לֶ֙חֶם֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה וּשְׁמ֣וֹ יִשַׁ֔י וְל֖וֹ שְׁמֹנָ֣ה בָנִ֑ים וְהָאִישׁ֙ בִּימֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל זָקֵ֖ן בָּ֥א בַאֲנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: David was the son of a certain Ephrathite of Bethlehem in Judah whose name was Jesse. He had eight sons, and in the days of Saul the man was already old, advanced in years.
Transliteration: vedavid ven-iysh eferatiy hazeh miveyt lechem yehudah ushemvo yishay velvo shemonah vaniym vehaiysh viymey shaul zaken va vaanashiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת בְּנֵֽי־יִשַׁי֙ הַגְּדֹלִ֔ים הָלְכ֥וּ אַחֲרֵֽי־שָׁא֖וּל לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְשֵׁ֣ם ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת בָּנָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָֽלְכוּ֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה אֱלִיאָ֣ב הַבְּכ֗וֹר וּמִשְׁנֵ֙הוּ֙ אֲבִ֣ינָדָ֔ב וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁ֖י שַׁמָּֽה׃
Translated: The three oldest sons of Jesse had left and gone with Saul to the war. The names of his three sons who had gone to the war were Eliab the first-born, the next Abinadab, and the third Shammah;
Transliteration: vayelekhu sheloshet veney-yishay hagedoliym halekhu acharey-shaul lamilechamah veshem sheloshet vanayv asher halekhu vamilechamah eliyav havekhvor umishenehu aviynadav vehashelishiy shamah

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֖ד ה֣וּא הַקָּטָ֑ן וּשְׁלֹשָׁה֙ הַגְּדֹלִ֔ים הָלְכ֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י שָׁאֽוּל׃ {ס}
Translated: and David was the youngest. The three oldest had followed Saul,
Transliteration: vedavid hu hakatan usheloshah hagedoliym halekhu acharey shaul {s}

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֛ד הֹלֵ֥ךְ וָשָׁ֖ב מֵעַ֣ל שָׁא֑וּל לִרְע֛וֹת אֶת־צֹ֥אן אָבִ֖יו בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: and David would go back and forth from attending on Saul to shepherd his father’s flock at Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vedavid holekhe vashav meal shaul lirevot et-tson aviyv veyt lachem

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֥שׁ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם וְהַעֲרֵ֑ב וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֖ב אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated: The Philistine stepped forward morning and evening and took his stand for forty days.
Transliteration: vayigash hafelishetiy hashekhem vehaarev vayiteyatsev arevaiym yvom {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִשַׁ֜י לְדָוִ֣ד בְּנ֗וֹ קַח־נָ֤א לְאַחֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵיפַ֤ת הַקָּלִיא֙ הַזֶּ֔ה וַעֲשָׂרָ֥ה לֶ֖חֶם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהָרֵ֥ץ הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה לְאַחֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Jesse said to his son David, “Take an ephah of this parched corn and these ten loaves of bread for your brothers, and carry them quickly to your brothers in camp.
Transliteration: vayomer yishay ledavid venvo kach-na leacheykha eyfat hakaliy hazeh vaasharah lechem hazeh veharets hamachaneh leacheykha

Hebrew: וְ֠אֵ֠ת עֲשֶׂ֜רֶת חֲרִצֵ֤י הֶחָלָב֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה תָּבִ֖יא לְשַׂר־הָאָ֑לֶף וְאֶת־אַחֶ֙יךָ֙ תִּפְקֹ֣ד לְשָׁל֔וֹם וְאֶת־עֲרֻבָּתָ֖ם תִּקָּֽח׃
Translated: Take these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand. Find out how your brothers are and bring some token from them.”
Transliteration: veet asheret charitsey hechalav haeleh taviy leshar-haalef veet-acheykha tifekod leshalvom veet-aruvatam tikach

Hebrew: וְשָׁא֤וּל וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּעֵ֖מֶק הָאֵלָ֑ה נִלְחָמִ֖ים עִם־פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Saul and the brothers and everyone else on Israel’s side were in the valley of Elah, in the war against the Philistines.
Transliteration: veshaul vehemah vekhׇl-iysh yisherael veemek haelah nilechamiym im-felishetiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם דָּוִ֜ד בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּטֹּ֤שׁ אֶת־הַצֹּאן֙ עַל־שֹׁמֵ֔ר וַיִּשָּׂ֣א וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ יִשָׁ֑י וַיָּבֹא֙ הַמַּעְגָּ֔לָה וְהַחַ֗יִל הַיֹּצֵא֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֣עֲרָכָ֔ה וְהֵרֵ֖עוּ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Early next morning, David left someone in charge of the flock, took [the provisions], and set out, as his father Jesse had instructed him. He reached the barricade as the army was going out to the battle lines shouting the war cry.
Transliteration: vayashekhem david vavoker vayitosh et-hatson al-shomer vayisha vayelekhe khaasher tsivahu yishay vayavo hamaegalah vehachayiil hayotse el-hamaarakhah vehereu vamilechamah

Hebrew: וַתַּעֲרֹ֤ךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים מַעֲרָכָ֖ה לִקְרַ֥את מַעֲרָכָֽה׃
Translated: Israel and the Philistines drew up their battle lines opposite each other.
Transliteration: vataarokhe yisherael ufelishetiym maarakhah likerat maarakhah

Hebrew: וַיִּטֹּשׁ֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶת־הַכֵּלִ֜ים מֵעָלָ֗יו עַל־יַד֙ שׁוֹמֵ֣ר הַכֵּלִ֔ים וַיָּ֖רׇץ הַמַּעֲרָכָ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֕א וַיִּשְׁאַ֥ל לְאֶחָ֖יו לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: David left his baggage with the man in charge of the baggage and ran toward the battle line and went to greet his brothers.
Transliteration: vayitosh david et-hakheliym mealayv al-yad shvomer hakheliym vayarׇts hamaarakhah vayavo vayisheal leechayv leshalvom

Hebrew: וְה֣וּא ׀ מְדַבֵּ֣ר עִמָּ֗ם וְהִנֵּ֣ה אִ֣ישׁ הַבֵּנַ֡יִם עוֹלֶ֞ה גׇּלְיָת֩ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֨י שְׁמ֤וֹ מִגַּת֙ (ממערות) [מִמַּעַרְכ֣וֹת] פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר כַּדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: While he was talking to them, the champion, whose name was Goliath, the Philistine of Gath, stepped forward from the Philistine ranks and spoke the same words as before; and David heard him.
Transliteration: vehu medaver imam vehineh iysh havenayiim voleh gׇleyat hafelishetiy shemvo migat (mmrvt) [mimaarekhvot] felishetiym vayedaver khadevariym haeleh vayishema david

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּרְאוֹתָ֖ם אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיָּנֻ֙סוּ֙ מִפָּנָ֔יו וַיִּֽירְא֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When everyone on Israel’s side saw the man, they fled in terror.
Transliteration: vekhol iysh yisherael virevotam et-haiysh vayanusu mifanayv vayiyreu meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הַרְּאִיתֶם֙ הָאִ֤ישׁ הָֽעֹלֶה֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֛י לְחָרֵ֥ף אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֹלֶ֑ה וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה הָאִ֨ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַכֶּ֜נּוּ יַעְשְׁרֶ֥נּוּ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ ׀ עֹ֣שֶׁר גָּד֗וֹל וְאֶת־בִּתּוֹ֙ יִתֶּן־ל֔וֹ וְאֵת֙ בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יו יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה חׇפְשִׁ֖י בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: And on Israel’s side they were saying, “Do you see that man coming out? He comes out to defy Israel! The one who kills him will be rewarded by the king with great riches; he’ll also give him his daughter in marriage and grant exemption to his father’s house in Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer iysh yisherael hareiytem haiysh haoleh hazeh khiy lecharef et-yisherael oleh vehayah haiysh asher-yakhenu yaesherenu hamelekhe osher gadvol veet-vitvo yiten-lvo veet veyt aviyv yaasheh chׇfeshiy veyisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗ד אֶֽל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֞ים הָעֹמְדִ֣ים עִמּוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֗ה לָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַכֶּה֙ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֣י הַלָּ֔ז וְהֵסִ֥יר חֶרְפָּ֖ה מֵעַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֣י מִ֗י הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֤י הֶעָרֵל֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֣י חֵרֵ֔ף מַעַרְכ֖וֹת אֱלֹהִ֥ים חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: David asked the men standing near him, “What’ll be done for the one who kills that Philistine and removes the disgrace from Israel? Who is that uncircumcised Philistine that he dares defy the ranks of the living God?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-haanashiym haomediym imvo lemor mah-yeasheh laiysh asher yakheh et-hafelishetiy halaz vehesiyr cherefah meal yisherael khiy miy hafelishetiy hearel hazeh khiy cheref maarekhvot Elohim chayiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הָעָ֔ם כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֣ה יֵעָשֶׂ֔ה לָאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַכֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The troops told him in the same words what would be done for the one who killed him.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo haam khadavar hazeh lemor khoh eiasheh laiysh asher yakhenu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אֱלִיאָב֙ אָחִ֣יו הַגָּד֔וֹל בְּדַבְּר֖וֹ אֶל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַיִּֽחַר־אַף֩ אֱלִיאָ֨ב בְּדָוִ֜ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ לָמָּה־זֶּ֣ה יָרַ֗דְתָּ וְעַל־מִ֨י נָטַ֜שְׁתָּ מְעַ֨ט הַצֹּ֤אן הָהֵ֙נָּה֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר אֲנִ֧י יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶת־זְדֹנְךָ֗ וְאֵת֙ רֹ֣עַ לְבָבֶ֔ךָ כִּ֗י לְמַ֛עַן רְא֥וֹת הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה יָרָֽדְתָּ׃
Translated: When Eliab, his oldest brother, heard him speaking to the men, Eliab became angry with David and said, “Why did you come down here, and with whom did you leave those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your impudence and your impertinence: you came down to watch the fighting!”
Transliteration: vayishema eliyav achiyv hagadvol vedavervo el-haanashiym vayichar-af eliyav vedavid vayomer lamah-zeh yaradeta veal-miy natasheta meat hatson hahenah vamidevar aniy yadaetiy et-zedonekha veet roa levavekha khiy lemaan revot hamilechamah yaradeta

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד מֶ֥ה עָשִׂ֖יתִי עָ֑תָּה הֲל֖וֹא דָּבָ֥ר הֽוּא׃
Translated: But David replied, “What have I done now? I was only asking!”
Transliteration: vayomer david meh ashiytiy atah halvo davar hu

Hebrew: וַיִּסֹּ֤ב מֵֽאֶצְלוֹ֙ אֶל־מ֣וּל אַחֵ֔ר וַיֹּ֖אמֶר כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיְשִׁבֻ֤הוּ הָעָם֙ דָּבָ֔ר כַּדָּבָ֖ר הָרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: And he turned away from him toward someone else; he asked the same question, and the troops gave him the same answer as before.
Transliteration: vayisov meetselvo el-mul acher vayomer khadavar hazeh vayeshivuhu haam davar khadavar harishvon

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּֽׁמְעוּ֙ הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר דָּוִ֑ד וַיַּגִּ֥דוּ לִפְנֵֽי־שָׁא֖וּל וַיִּקָּחֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: The things David said were overheard and were reported to Saul, who had him brought over.
Transliteration: vayishameu hadevariym asher diver david vayagidu lifeney-shaul vayikachehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל אַל־יִפֹּ֥ל לֵב־אָדָ֖ם עָלָ֑יו עַבְדְּךָ֣ יֵלֵ֔ךְ וְנִלְחַ֖ם עִם־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֥י הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: David said to Saul, “Let no man’s courage fail him. Your servant will go and fight that Philistine!”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-shaul al-yifol lev-adam alayv avedekha eilekhe venilecham im-hafelishetiy hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד לֹ֤א תוּכַל֙ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אֶל־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֣י הַזֶּ֔ה לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם עִמּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־נַ֣עַר אַ֔תָּה וְה֛וּא אִ֥ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֖ה מִנְּעֻרָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: But Saul said to David, “You cannot go to that Philistine and fight him; you are only a boy, and he has been a warrior from his youth!”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-david lo tukhal lalekhet el-hafelishetiy hazeh lehilachem imvo khiy-naar atah vehu iysh milechamah mineurayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל רֹעֶ֨ה הָיָ֧ה עַבְדְּךָ֛ לְאָבִ֖יו בַּצֹּ֑אן וּבָ֤א הָאֲרִי֙ וְאֶת־הַדּ֔וֹב וְנָשָׂ֥א שֶׂ֖ה מֵהָעֵֽדֶר׃
Translated: David replied to Saul, “Your servant has been tending his father’s sheep, and if a lion or a bear came and carried off an animal from the flock,
Transliteration: vayomer david el-shaul roeh hayah avedekha leaviyv vatson uva haariy veet-hadvov venasha sheh mehaeder

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֧אתִי אַחֲרָ֛יו וְהִכִּתִ֖יו וְהִצַּ֣לְתִּי מִפִּ֑יו וַיָּ֣קׇם עָלַ֔י וְהֶחֱזַ֙קְתִּי֙ בִּזְקָנ֔וֹ וְהִכִּתִ֖יו וַהֲמִיתִּֽיו׃
Translated: I would go after it and fight it and rescue it from its mouth. And if it attacked me, I would seize it by the beard and strike it down and kill it.
Transliteration: veyatsatiy acharayv vehikhitiyv vehitsaletiy mifiyv vayakׇm alay vehechezaketiy vizekanvo vehikhitiyv vahamiytiyv

Hebrew: גַּ֧ם אֶֽת־הָאֲרִ֛י גַּם־הַדֹּ֖ב הִכָּ֣ה עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֨י הֶעָרֵ֤ל הַזֶּה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֣י חֵרֵ֔ף מַעַרְכֹ֖ת אֱלֹהִ֥ים חַיִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Your servant has killed both lion and bear; and that uncircumcised Philistine shall end up like one of them, for he has defied the ranks of the living God.
Transliteration: gam et-haariy gam-hadov hikhah avedekha vehayah hafelishetiy hearel hazeh kheachad mehem khiy cheref maarekhot Elohim chayiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֮ דָּוִד֒ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּלַ֜נִי מִיַּ֤ד הָֽאֲרִי֙ וּמִיַּ֣ד הַדֹּ֔ב ה֣וּא יַצִּילֵ֔נִי מִיַּ֥ד הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י הַזֶּ֑ה {ס} וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֤וּל אֶל־דָּוִד֙ לֵ֔ךְ וַיהֹוָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small>,” David went on, “who saved me from lion and bear will also save me from that Philistine.” “Then go,” Saul said to David, “and may G<small>OD</small> be with you!”
Transliteration: vayomer david yehovah asher hitsilaniy miyad haariy umiyad hadov hu yatsiyleniy miyad hafelishetiy hazeh {s} vayomer shaul el-david lekhe vayhovah yiheyeh imakhe

Hebrew: וַיַּלְבֵּ֨שׁ שָׁא֤וּל אֶת־דָּוִד֙ מַדָּ֔יו וְנָתַ֛ן ק֥וֹבַע נְחֹ֖שֶׁת עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיַּלְבֵּ֥שׁ אֹת֖וֹ שִׁרְיֽוֹן׃
Translated: Saul clothed David in his own garment; he placed a bronze helmet on his head and fastened a breastplate on him.
Transliteration: vayalevesh shaul et-david madayv venatan kvova nechoshet al-roshvo vayalevesh otvo shireyvon

Hebrew: וַיַּחְגֹּ֣ר דָּוִ֣ד אֶת־חַ֠רְבּ֠וֹ מֵעַ֨ל לְמַדָּ֜יו וַיֹּ֣אֶל לָלֶכֶת֮ כִּ֣י לֹֽא־נִסָּה֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־שָׁא֗וּל לֹ֥א אוּכַ֛ל לָלֶ֥כֶת בָּאֵ֖לֶּה כִּ֣י לֹ֣א נִסִּ֑יתִי וַיְסִרֵ֥ם דָּוִ֖ד מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: David girded his sword over his garment. Then he tried to walk; but he was not used to it. And David said to Saul, “I cannot walk in these, for I am not used to them.” So David took them off.
Transliteration: vayachegor david et-charevvo meal lemadayv vayoel lalekhet khiy lo-nisah vayomer david el-shaul lo ukhal lalekhet vaeleh khiy lo nisiytiy vayesirem david mealayv

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מַקְל֜וֹ בְּיָד֗וֹ וַיִּבְחַר־ל֣וֹ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה חַלֻּקֵֽי־אֲבָנִ֣ים <small>׀</small> מִן־הַנַּ֡חַל וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹ֠תָ֠ם בִּכְלִ֨י הָרֹעִ֧ים אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וּבַיַּלְק֖וּט וְקַלְע֣וֹ בְיָד֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֖שׁ אֶל־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּֽי׃
Translated: He took his stick, picked a few smooth stones from the wadi, put them in the pocket of his shepherd’s bag and, sling in hand, he went toward the Philistine.
Transliteration: vayikach makelvo veyadvo vayivechar-lvo chamishah chalukey-avaniym <small></small> min-hanachal vayashem otam vikheliy haroiym asher-lvo uvayalekut vekalevo veyadvo vayigash el-hafelishetiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י הֹלֵ֥ךְ וְקָרֵ֖ב אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וְהָאִ֛ישׁ נֹשֵׂ֥א הַצִּנָּ֖ה לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: The Philistine, meanwhile, was coming closer to David, preceded by his shield-bearer.
Transliteration: vayelekhe hafelishetiy holekhe vekarev el-david vehaiysh noshe hatsinah lefanayv

Hebrew: וַיַּבֵּ֧ט הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֛י וַיִּרְאֶ֥ה אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד וַיִּבְזֵ֑הוּ כִּֽי־הָיָ֣ה נַ֔עַר וְאַדְמֹנִ֖י עִם־יְפֵ֥ה מַרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: When the Philistine caught sight of David, he scorned him, for he was but a lad, ruddy and handsome.
Transliteration: vayavet hafelishetiy vayireeh et-david vayivezehu khiy-hayah naar veademoniy im-yefeh mareeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד הֲכֶ֣לֶב אָנֹ֔כִי כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה בָֽא־אֵלַ֖י בַּמַּקְל֑וֹת וַיְקַלֵּ֧ל הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֛י אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד בֵּאלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: And the Philistine called out to David, “Am I a dog that you come against me with sticks?” The Philistine cursed David by his gods;
Transliteration: vayomer hafelishetiy el-david hakhelev anokhiy khiy-atah va-elay vamakelvot vayekalel hafelishetiy et-david velohayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד לְכָ֣ה אֵלַ֔י וְאֶתְּנָה֙ אֶת־בְּשָׂ֣רְךָ֔ לְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and the Philistine said to David, “Come here, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the sky and the beasts of the field.”
Transliteration: vayomer hafelishetiy el-david lekhah elay veetenah et-vesharekha levof hashamayiim ulevehemat hashadeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י אַתָּה֙ בָּ֣א אֵלַ֔י בְּחֶ֖רֶב וּבַחֲנִ֣ית וּבְכִיד֑וֹן וְאָנֹכִ֣י בָֽא־אֵלֶ֗יךָ בְּשֵׁם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֛י מַעַרְכ֥וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר חֵרַֽפְתָּ׃
Translated: David replied to the Philistine, “You come against me with sword and spear and javelin; but I come against you in the name of G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of the ranks of Israel, whom you have defied.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-hafelishetiy atah va elay vecherev uvachaniyt uvekhiydvon veanokhiy va-eleykha veshem yehovah tsevavot elohey maarekhvot yisherael asher cherafeta

Hebrew: הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֡ה יְסַגֶּרְךָ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה בְּיָדִ֜י וְהִכִּיתִ֗ךָ וַהֲסִרֹתִ֤י אֶת־רֹֽאשְׁךָ֙ מֵעָלֶ֔יךָ וְנָ֨תַתִּ֜י פֶּ֣גֶר מַחֲנֵ֤ה פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה לְע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְחַיַּ֣ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיֵֽדְעוּ֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֛י יֵ֥שׁ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: This very day G<small>OD</small> will deliver you into my hands. I will kill you and cut off your head; and I will give the carcasses of the Philistine camp to the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth. All the earth shall know that there is a God in Israel.
Transliteration: hayyvom hazeh yesagerekha yehovah veyadiy vehikhiytikha vahasirotiy et-roshekha mealeykha venatatiy feger machaneh felishetiym hayyvom hazeh levof hashamayiim ulechayat haarets veeideu khׇl-haarets khiy eish Elohim leyisherael

Hebrew: וְיֵֽדְעוּ֙ כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה כִּי־לֹ֛א בְּחֶ֥רֶב וּבַחֲנִ֖ית יְהוֹשִׁ֣יעַ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י לַֽיהֹוָה֙ הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְנָתַ֥ן אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּיָדֵֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And this whole assembly shall know that G<small>OD</small> can give victory without sword or spear. For the battle is G<small>OD</small>’s, and you will be delivered into our hands.”
Transliteration: veeideu khׇl-hakahal hazeh khiy-lo vecherev uvachaniyt yehvoshiya yehovah khiy layhovah hamilechamah venatan etekhem veyadenu {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּי־קָ֣ם הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ וַיִּקְרַ֖ב לִקְרַ֣את דָּוִ֑ד וַיְמַהֵ֣ר דָּוִ֔ד וַיָּ֥רׇץ הַמַּעֲרָכָ֖ה לִקְרַ֥את הַפְּלִשְׁתִּֽי׃
Translated: When the Philistine began to advance toward him again, David quickly ran up to the battle line to face the Philistine.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-kam hafelishetiy vayelekhe vayikerav likerat david vayemaher david vayarׇts hamaarakhah likerat hafelishetiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶת־יָד֜וֹ אֶל־הַכֶּ֗לִי וַיִּקַּ֨ח מִשָּׁ֥ם אֶ֙בֶן֙ וַיְקַלַּ֔ע וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י אֶל־מִצְח֑וֹ וַתִּטְבַּ֤ע הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ בְּמִצְח֔וֹ וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־פָּנָ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: David put his hand into the bag; he took out a stone and slung it. It struck the Philistine in the forehead; the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell face down on the ground.
Transliteration: vayishelach david et-yadvo el-hakheliy vayikach misham even vayekala vayakhe et-hafelishetiy el-mitsechvo vatiteva haeven vemitsechvo vayifol al-fanayv aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֶּחֱזַ֨ק דָּוִ֤ד מִן־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי֙ בַּקֶּ֣לַע וּבָאֶ֔בֶן וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י וַיְמִתֵ֑הוּ וְחֶ֖רֶב אֵ֥ין בְּיַד־דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Thus David bested the Philistine with sling and stone; he struck him down and killed him. David had no sword;
Transliteration: vayechezak david min-hafelishetiy vakela uvaeven vayakhe et-hafelishetiy vayemitehu vecherev eyn veyad-david

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רׇץ דָּ֠וִ֠ד וַיַּעֲמֹ֨ד אֶל־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֜י וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־חַ֠רְבּ֠וֹ וַֽיִּשְׁלְפָ֤הּ מִתַּעְרָהּ֙ וַיְמֹ֣תְתֵ֔הוּ וַיִּכְרׇת־בָּ֖הּ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיִּרְא֧וּ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֛ים כִּי־מֵ֥ת גִּבּוֹרָ֖ם וַיָּנֻֽסוּ׃
Translated:
so David ran up and stood over the Philistine, grasped his sword and pulled it from its sheath; and with it he dispatched him and cut off his head.
When the Philistines saw that their warrior was dead, they ran.
Transliteration: vayarׇts david vayaamod el-hafelishetiy vayikach et-charevvo vayishelefah mitaerah vayemotetehu vayikherׇt-vah et-roshvo vayireu hafelishetiym khiy-met givvoram vayanusu

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֣מוּ אַנְשֵׁי֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל וִיהוּדָ֜ה וַיָּרִ֗עוּ וַֽיִּרְדְּפוּ֙ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים עַד־בּוֹאֲךָ֣ גַ֔יְא וְעַ֖ד שַׁעֲרֵ֣י עֶקְר֑וֹן וַֽיִּפְּל֞וּ חַֽלְלֵ֤י פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ שַׁעֲרַ֔יִם וְעַד־גַּ֖ת וְעַד־עֶקְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: The men of Israel and Judah rose up with a war cry and they pursued the Philistines all the way to Gai and up to the gates of Ekron; the Philistines fell mortally wounded along the road to Shaaraim up to Gath and Ekron.
Transliteration: vayakumu aneshey yisherael viyhudah vayariu vayiredefu et-hafelishetiym ad-vvoakha gaye vead shaarey ekervon vayifelu chaleley felishetiym vederekhe shaarayiim vead-gat vead-ekervon

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִדְּלֹ֖ק אַחֲרֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיָּשֹׁ֖סּוּ אֶת־מַחֲנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then the Israelites returned from chasing the Philistines and looted their camp.
Transliteration: vayashuvu veney yisherael midelok acharey felishetiym vayashosu et-machaneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח דָּוִד֙ אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י וַיְבִאֵ֖הוּ יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְאֶת־כֵּלָ֖יו שָׂ֥ם בְּאׇהֳלֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: David took the head of the Philistine and brought it to Jerusalem; and he put his weapons in his own tent.
Transliteration: vayikach david et-rosh hafelishetiy vayeviehu yerushala͏im veet-khelayv sham veׇholvo {s}

Hebrew: וְכִרְא֨וֹת שָׁא֜וּל אֶת־דָּוִ֗ד יֹצֵא֙ לִקְרַ֣את הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י אָמַ֗ר אֶל־אַבְנֵר֙ שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֔א בֶּן־מִי־זֶ֥ה הַנַּ֖עַר אַבְנֵ֑ר וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְנֵ֔ר חֵֽי־נַפְשְׁךָ֥ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אִם־יָדָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: When Saul saw David going out to assault the Philistine, he asked his army commander Abner, “Whose son is that young man, Abner?” And Abner replied, “By your life, Your Majesty, I do not know.”
Transliteration: vekhirevot shaul et-david yotse likerat hafelishetiy amar el-avener shar hatsava ven-miy-zeh hanaar avener vayomer avener chey-nafeshekha hamelekhe im-yadaetiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ שְׁאַ֣ל אַתָּ֔ה בֶּן־מִי־זֶ֖ה הָעָֽלֶם׃ {ס}
Translated: “Then find out whose son that young fellow is,” the king ordered.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe sheal atah ven-miy-zeh haalem {s}

Hebrew: וּכְשׁ֣וּב דָּוִ֗ד מֵֽהַכּוֹת֙ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ אַבְנֵ֔ר וַיְבִאֵ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֣י שָׁא֑וּל וְרֹ֥אשׁ הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: So when David returned after killing the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him to Saul, with the head of the Philistine still in his hand.
Transliteration: ukheshuv david mehakhvot et-hafelishetiy vayikach otvo avener vayeviehu lifeney shaul verosh hafelishetiy veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ שָׁא֔וּל בֶּן־מִ֥י אַתָּ֖ה הַנָּ֑עַר וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד בֶּֽן־עַבְדְּךָ֥ יִשַׁ֖י בֵּ֥ית הַלַּחְמִֽי׃
Translated: Saul said to him, “Whose son are you, young man?” And David answered, “The son of your servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv shaul ven-miy atah hanaar vayomer david ven-avedekha yishay veyt halachemiy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּכַלֹּתוֹ֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וְנֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן נִקְשְׁרָ֖ה בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ דָּוִ֑ד (ויאהבו) [וַיֶּֽאֱהָבֵ֥הוּ] יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן כְּנַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: When [David] finished speaking with Saul, Jonathan’s soul became bound up with the soul of David; Jonathan loved David as himself.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalotvo ledaver el-shaul venefesh yehvonatan nikesherah venefesh david (vyhvv) [vayeehavehu] yehvonatan khenafeshvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּחֵ֥הוּ שָׁא֖וּל בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וְלֹ֣א נְתָנ֔וֹ לָשׁ֖וּב בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Saul took him [into his service] that day and would not let him return to his father’s house.—
Transliteration: vayikachehu shaul vayyvom hahu velo netanvo lashuv veyt aviyv

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֧ת יְהוֹנָתָ֛ן וְדָוִ֖ד בְּרִ֑ית בְּאַהֲבָת֥וֹ אֹת֖וֹ כְּנַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: Jonathan and David made a pact, because [Jonathan] loved him as himself.
Transliteration: vayikherot yehvonatan vedavid veriyt veahavatvo otvo khenafeshvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּשֵּׁ֣ט יְהוֹנָתָ֗ן אֶֽת־הַמְּעִיל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖הוּ לְדָוִ֑ד וּמַדָּ֕יו וְעַד־חַרְבּ֥וֹ וְעַד־קַשְׁתּ֖וֹ וְעַד־חֲגֹרֽוֹ׃
Translated: Jonathan took off the cloak and tunic he was wearing and gave them to David, together with his sword, bow, and belt.
Transliteration: vayitefashet yehvonatan et-hameiyl asher alayv vayitenehu ledavid umadayv vead-charevvo vead-kashetvo vead-chagorvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א דָוִ֜ד בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁלָחֶ֤נּוּ שָׁאוּל֙ יַשְׂכִּ֔יל וַיְשִׂמֵ֣הוּ שָׁא֔וּל עַ֖ל אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיִּיטַב֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־הָעָ֔ם וְגַ֕ם בְּעֵינֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֥י שָׁאֽוּל׃ {פ}
Translated: David went out [with the troops], and he was successful in every mission on which Saul sent him, and Saul put him in command of all the soldiers; this pleased all the troops and Saul’s courtiers as well.
Transliteration: vayetse david vekhol asher yishelachenu shaul yashekhiyl vayeshimehu shaul al aneshey hamilechamah vayiytav veeyney khׇl-haam vegam veeyney avedey shaul {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בְּבוֹאָ֗ם בְּשׁ֤וּב דָּוִד֙ מֵהַכּ֣וֹת אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔י וַתֵּצֶ֨אנָה הַנָּשִׁ֜ים מִכׇּל־עָרֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ (לשור) [לָשִׁ֣יר] וְהַמְּחֹל֔וֹת לִקְרַ֖את שָׁא֣וּל הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ בְּתֻפִּ֥ים בְּשִׂמְחָ֖ה וּבְשָׁלִשִֽׁים׃
Translated: When the [troops] came home [and] David returned from killing the Philistine, the women of all the towns of Israel came out singing and dancing to greet King Saul with hand-drums, shouting, and sistrums.
Transliteration: vayehiy vevvoam veshuv david mehakhvot et-hafelishetiy vatetsenah hanashiym mikhׇl-arey yisherael (lshvr) [lashiyr] vehamecholvot likerat shaul hamelekhe vetufiym veshimechah uveshalishiym

Hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲנֶ֛ינָה הַנָּשִׁ֥ים הַֽמְשַׂחֲק֖וֹת וַתֹּאמַ֑רְןָ הִכָּ֤ה שָׁאוּל֙ בַּאֲלָפָ֔ו וְדָוִ֖ד בְּרִבְבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
The women sang as they danced, and they chanted:
Saul has slain his thousands;
David, his tens of thousands!
Transliteration: vataaneynah hanashiym hameshachakvot vatomarena hikhah shaul vaalafav vedavid verivevotayv

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨חַר לְשָׁא֜וּל מְאֹ֗ד וַיֵּ֤רַע בְּעֵינָיו֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר נָתְנ֤וּ לְדָוִד֙ רְבָב֔וֹת וְלִ֥י נָתְנ֖וּ הָאֲלָפִ֑ים וְע֥וֹד ל֖וֹ אַ֥ךְ הַמְּלוּכָֽה׃
Translated: Saul was much distressed and greatly vexed about the matter. For he said, “To David they have given tens of thousands, and to me they have given thousands. All that he lacks is the kingship!”
Transliteration: vayichar leshaul meod vayera veeynayv hadavar hazeh vayomer natenu ledavid revavvot veliy natenu haalafiym vevod lvo akhe hamelukhah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י שָׁא֖וּל (עון) [עוֹיֵ֣ן] אֶת־דָּוִ֑ד מֵֽהַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וָהָֽלְאָה׃ {ס}
Translated: From that day on Saul kept a jealous eye on David.
Transliteration: vayehiy shaul (vn) [voein] et-david mehayyvom hahu vahaleah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֗ת וַתִּצְלַ֣ח ר֩וּחַ֩ אֱלֹהִ֨ים <small>׀</small> רָעָ֤ה <small>׀</small> אֶל־שָׁאוּל֙ וַיִּתְנַבֵּ֣א בְתוֹךְ־הַבַּ֔יִת וְדָוִ֛ד מְנַגֵּ֥ן בְּיָד֖וֹ כְּי֣וֹם <small>׀</small> בְּי֑וֹם וְהַחֲנִ֖ית בְּיַד־שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: The next day an evil spirit of God gripped Saul and he began to rave in the house, while David was playing [the lyre], as he did daily. Saul had a spear in his hand,
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vatitselach rucha Elohim <small></small> raah <small></small> el-shaul vayitenave vetvokhe-havayiit vedavid menagen veyadvo kheyvom <small></small> veyvom vehachaniyt veyad-shaul

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤טֶל שָׁאוּל֙ אֶֽת־הַחֲנִ֔ית וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַכֶּ֥ה בְדָוִ֖ד וּבַקִּ֑יר וַיִּסֹּ֥ב דָּוִ֛ד מִפָּנָ֖יו פַּעֲמָֽיִם׃
Translated: and Saul threw the spear, thinking to pin David to the wall. But David eluded him twice.
Transliteration: vayatel shaul et-hachaniyt vayomer akheh vedavid uvakiyr vayisov david mifanayv faamayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּרָ֥א שָׁא֖וּל מִלִּפְנֵ֣י דָוִ֑ד כִּֽי־הָיָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וּמֵעִ֥ם שָׁא֖וּל סָֽר׃
Translated: Saul was afraid of David, for G<small>OD</small> was with him and had turned away from Saul.
Transliteration: vayira shaul milifeney david khiy-hayah yehovah imvo umeim shaul sar

Hebrew: וַיְסִרֵ֤הוּ שָׁאוּל֙ מֵֽעִמּ֔וֹ וַיְשִׂמֵ֥הוּ ל֖וֹ שַׂר־אָ֑לֶף וַיֵּצֵ֥א וַיָּבֹ֖א לִפְנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: So Saul removed him from his presence and appointed him chief of a thousand, to march at the head of the troops.
Transliteration: vayesirehu shaul meimvo vayeshimehu lvo shar-alef vayetse vayavo lifeney haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דָוִ֛ד לְכׇל־דְּרָכָ֖ו מַשְׂכִּ֑יל וַיהֹוָ֖ה עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David was successful in all his undertakings, for G<small>OD</small> was with him;
Transliteration: vayehiy david lekhׇl-derakhav mashekhiyl vayhovah imvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא שָׁא֔וּל אֲשֶׁר־ה֖וּא מַשְׂכִּ֣יל מְאֹ֑ד וַיָּ֖גׇר מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: and when Saul saw that he was successful, he dreaded him.
Transliteration: vayare shaul asher-hu mashekhiyl meod vayagׇr mifanayv

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה אֹהֵ֖ב אֶת־דָּוִ֑ד כִּי־ה֛וּא יוֹצֵ֥א וָבָ֖א לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: All Israel and Judah loved David, for he marched at their head.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael viyhudah ohev et-david khiy-hu yvotse vava lifeneyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד הִנֵּה֩ בִתִּ֨י הַגְּדוֹלָ֤ה מֵרַב֙ אֹתָהּ֙ אֶתֶּן־לְךָ֣ לְאִשָּׁ֔ה אַ֚ךְ הֱיֵה־לִ֣י לְבֶן־חַ֔יִל וְהִלָּחֵ֖ם מִלְחֲמ֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשָׁא֣וּל אָמַ֗ר אַל־תְּהִ֤י יָדִי֙ בּ֔וֹ וּתְהִי־ב֖וֹ יַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Saul said to David, “Here is my older daughter, Merab; I will give her to you in marriage; in return, you be my warrior and fight G<small>OD</small>’s battles.” Saul thought: “Let not my hand strike him; let the hand of the Philistines strike him.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-david hineh vitiy hagedvolah merav otah eten-lekha leishah akhe heeih-liy leven-chayiil vehilachem milechamvot yehovah veshaul amar al-tehiy yadiy vvo utehiy-vvo yad-felishetiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־שָׁא֗וּל מִ֤י אָֽנֹכִי֙ וּמִ֣י חַיַּ֔י מִשְׁפַּ֥חַת אָבִ֖י בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּי־אֶהְיֶ֥ה חָתָ֖ן לַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: David replied to Saul, “Who am I and what is my life—my father’s family in Israel—that I should become Your Majesty’s son-in-law?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-shaul miy anokhiy umiy chayay mishefachat aviy veyisherael khiy-eheyeh chatan lamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֵ֛ת תֵּ֛ת אֶת־מֵרַ֥ב בַּת־שָׁא֖וּל לְדָוִ֑ד וְהִ֧יא נִתְּנָ֛ה לְעַדְרִיאֵ֥ל הַמְּחֹלָתִ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: But at the time that Merab, daughter of Saul, should have been given to David, she was given in marriage to Adriel the Meholathite.
Transliteration: vayehiy veet tet et-merav vat-shaul ledavid vehiy nitenah leaderiyel hamecholatiy leishah

Hebrew: וַתֶּאֱהַ֛ב מִיכַ֥ל בַּת־שָׁא֖וּל אֶת־דָּוִ֑ד וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ לְשָׁא֔וּל וַיִּשַׁ֥ר הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: Now Michal daughter of Saul had fallen in love with David; and when this was reported to Saul, he was pleased.
Transliteration: vateehav miykhal vat-shaul et-david vayagidu leshaul vayishar hadavar veeynayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל אֶתְּנֶ֤נָּה לּוֹ֙ וּתְהִי־ל֣וֹ לְמוֹקֵ֔שׁ וּתְהִי־ב֖וֹ יַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד בִּשְׁתַּ֛יִם תִּתְחַתֵּ֥ן בִּ֖י הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Saul thought: “I will give her to him, and she can serve as a snare for him, so that the Philistines may kill him.” So Saul said to David, “You can become my son-in-law even now through the second one.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul etenenah lvo utehiy-lvo lemvokesh utehiy-vvo yad-felishetiym vayomer shaul el-david vishetayiim titechaten viy hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ו שָׁא֜וּל אֶת־עֲבָדָ֗ו דַּבְּר֨וּ אֶל־דָּוִ֤ד בַּלָּט֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֨ה חָפֵ֤ץ בְּךָ֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֖יו אֲהֵב֑וּךָ וְעַתָּ֖ה הִתְחַתֵּ֥ן בַּמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: And Saul instructed his courtiers to say to David privately, “The king is fond of you and all his courtiers like you. So why not become the king’s son-in-law?”
Transliteration: vayetsav shaul et-avadav daveru el-david valat lemor hineh chafets vekha hamelekhe vekhׇl-avadayv ahevukha veatah hitechaten vamelekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיְדַבְּר֞וּ עַבְדֵ֤י שָׁאוּל֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗ד הַֽנְקַלָּ֤ה בְעֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ הִתְחַתֵּ֣ן בַּמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאָנֹכִ֖י אִֽישׁ־רָ֥שׁ וְנִקְלֶֽה׃
Translated: When the king’s courtiers repeated these words to David, David replied, “Do you think that becoming the son-in-law of a king is a small matter, when I am but a poor man of no consequence?”
Transliteration: vayedaveru avedey shaul veׇzeney david et-hadevariym haeleh vayomer david hanekalah veeyneykhem hitechaten vamelekhe veanokhiy iysh-rash venikeleh

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֜דוּ עַבְדֵ֥י שָׁא֛וּל ל֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה דִּבֶּ֥ר דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Saul’s courtiers reported to him, “This is what David answered.”
Transliteration: vayagidu avedey shaul lvo lemor khadevariym haeleh diver david

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל כֹּה־תֹאמְר֣וּ לְדָוִ֗ד אֵֽין־חֵ֤פֶץ לַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּמֹ֔הַר כִּ֗י בְּמֵאָה֙ עׇרְל֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים לְהִנָּקֵ֖ם בְּאֹיְבֵ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְשָׁא֣וּל חָשַׁ֔ב לְהַפִּ֥יל אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד בְּיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: And Saul said, “Say this to David: ‘The king desires no other bride-price than the foreskins of a hundred Philistines, as vengeance on the king’s enemies.’”—Saul intended to bring about David’s death at the hands of the Philistines.—
Transliteration: vayomer shaul khoh-tomeru ledavid eyn-chefets lamelekhe vemohar khiy vemeah ׇrelvot felishetiym lehinakem veoyevey hamelekhe veshaul chashav lehafiyl et-david veyad-felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֨דוּ עֲבָדָ֤יו לְדָוִד֙ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיִּשַׁ֤ר הַדָּבָר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד לְהִתְחַתֵּ֖ן בַּמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְלֹ֥א מָלְא֖וּ הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: When his courtiers told this to David, David was pleased with the idea of becoming the king’s son-in-law. Before the time had expired,
Transliteration: vayagidu avadayv ledavid et-hadevariym haeleh vayishar hadavar veeyney david lehitechaten vamelekhe velo maleu hayamiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם דָּוִ֜ד וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ ׀ ה֣וּא וַאֲנָשָׁ֗יו וַיַּ֣ךְ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים֮ מָאתַ֣יִם אִישׁ֒ וַיָּבֵ֤א דָוִד֙ אֶת־עׇרְלֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם וַיְמַלְא֣וּם לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְהִתְחַתֵּ֖ן בַּמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ שָׁא֛וּל אֶת־מִיכַ֥ל בִּתּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: David went out with his men and killed two hundred Philistines; David brought their foreskins and they were counted out for the king, that he might become the king’s son-in-law. Saul then gave him his daughter Michal in marriage.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david vayelekhe hu vaanashayv vayakhe vafelishetiym matayiim iysh vayave david et-ׇreloteyhem vayemaleum lamelekhe lehitechaten vamelekhe vayiten-lvo shaul et-miykhal vitvo leishah {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא שָׁאוּל֙ וַיֵּ֔דַע כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עִם־דָּוִ֑ד וּמִיכַ֥ל בַּת־שָׁא֖וּל אֲהֵבַֽתְהוּ׃
Translated: When Saul realized that G<small>OD</small> was with David and that Michal daughter of Saul loved him,
Transliteration: vayare shaul vayeda khiy yehovah im-david umiykhal vat-shaul ahevatehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אסֶף שָׁא֗וּל לֵרֹ֛א מִפְּנֵ֥י דָוִ֖ד ע֑וֹד וַיְהִ֥י שָׁא֛וּל אֹיֵ֥ב אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Saul grew still more afraid of David; and Saul was David’s enemy ever after.
Transliteration: vayosef shaul lero mifeney david vod vayehiy shaul oeiv et-david khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֖וּ שָׂרֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיְהִ֣י ׀ מִדֵּ֣י צֵאתָ֗ם שָׂכַ֤ל דָּוִד֙ מִכֹּל֙ עַבְדֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל וַיִּיקַ֥ר שְׁמ֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: The Philistine chiefs marched out [to battle]; and every time they marched out, David was more successful than all the other officers of Saul. His reputation soared.
Transliteration: vayetseu sharey felishetiym vayehiy midey tsetam shakhal david mikhol avedey shaul vayiykar shemvo meod {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר שָׁא֗וּל אֶל־יוֹנָתָ֤ן בְּנוֹ֙ וְאֶל־כׇּל־עֲבָדָ֔יו לְהָמִ֖ית אֶת־דָּוִ֑ד וִיהֽוֹנָתָן֙ בֶּן־שָׁא֔וּל חָפֵ֥ץ בְּדָוִ֖ד מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Saul urged his son Jonathan and all his courtiers to kill David. But Saul’s son Jonathan was very fond of David,
Transliteration: vayedaver shaul el-yvonatan venvo veel-khׇl-avadayv lehamiyt et-david viyhvonatan ven-shaul chafets vedavid meod

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֤ד יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ לְדָוִ֣ד לֵאמֹ֔ר מְבַקֵּ֛שׁ שָׁא֥וּל אָבִ֖י לַהֲמִיתֶ֑ךָ וְעַתָּה֙ הִשָּׁמֶר־נָ֣א בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֥ בַסֵּ֖תֶר וְנַחְבֵּֽאתָ׃
Translated: and Jonathan told David, “My father Saul is bent on killing you. Be on your guard tomorrow morning; get to a secret place and remain in hiding.
Transliteration: vayaged yehvonatan ledavid lemor mevakesh shaul aviy lahamiytekha veatah hishamer-na vavoker veyashaveta vaseter venacheveta

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֨י אֵצֵ֜א וְעָמַדְתִּ֣י לְיַד־אָבִ֗י בַּשָּׂדֶה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתָּ֣ה שָׁ֔ם וַאֲנִ֕י אֲדַבֵּ֥ר בְּךָ֖ אֶל־אָבִ֑י וְרָאִ֥יתִי מָ֖ה וְהִגַּ֥דְתִּי לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: I will go out and stand next to my father in the field where you will be, and I will speak to my father about you. If I learn anything, I will tell you.”
Transliteration: vaaniy etse veamadetiy leyad-aviy vashadeh asher atah sham vaaniy adaver vekha el-aviy veraiytiy mah vehigadetiy lakhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יְהוֹנָתָ֤ן בְּדָוִד֙ ט֔וֹב אֶל־שָׁא֖וּל אָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵ֠לָ֠יו אַל־יֶחֱטָ֨א הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ בְּעַבְדּ֣וֹ בְדָוִ֗ד כִּ֣י ל֤וֹא חָטָא֙ לָ֔ךְ וְכִ֥י מַעֲשָׂ֖יו טוֹב־לְךָ֥ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: So Jonathan spoke well of David to his father Saul. He said to him, “Let not Your Majesty wrong his servant David, for he has not wronged you; indeed, all his actions have been very much to your advantage.
Transliteration: vayedaver yehvonatan vedavid tvov el-shaul aviyv vayomer elayv al-yecheta hamelekhe veavedvo vedavid khiy lvo chata lakhe vekhiy maashayv tvov-lekha meod

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שֶׂם֩ אֶת־נַפְשׁ֨וֹ בְכַפּ֜וֹ וַיַּ֣ךְ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֗י וַיַּ֨עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֜ה תְּשׁוּעָ֤ה גְדוֹלָה֙ לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רָאִ֖יתָ וַתִּשְׂמָ֑ח וְלָ֤מָּה תֶֽחֱטָא֙ בְּדָ֣ם נָקִ֔י לְהָמִ֥ית אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד חִנָּֽם׃
Translated: He took his life in his hands and killed the Philistine, and G<small>OD</small> wrought a great victory for all Israel. You saw it and rejoiced. Why then should you incur the guilt of shedding an innocent’s blood, killing David without cause?”
Transliteration: vayashem et-nafeshvo vekhafvo vayakhe et-hafelishetiy vayaash yehovah teshuah gedvolah lekhׇl-yisherael raiyta vatishemach velamah techeta vedam nakiy lehamiyt et-david chinam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע שָׁא֖וּל בְּק֣וֹל יְהוֹנָתָ֑ן וַיִּשָּׁבַ֣ע שָׁא֔וּל חַי־יְהֹוָ֖ה אִם־יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: Saul heeded Jonathan’s plea, and Saul swore, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, he shall not be put to death!”
Transliteration: vayishema shaul vekvol yehvonatan vayishava shaul chay-yehovah im-yumat

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א יְהוֹנָתָן֙ לְדָוִ֔ד וַיַּגֶּד־לוֹ֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיָּבֵ֨א יְהוֹנָתָ֤ן אֶת־דָּוִד֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וַיְהִ֥י לְפָנָ֖יו כְּאֶתְמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: Jonathan called David, and Jonathan told him all this. Then Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he served him as before.
Transliteration: vayikera yehvonatan ledavid vayaged-lvo yehvonatan et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh vayave yehvonatan et-david el-shaul vayehiy lefanayv kheetemvol shileshvom {s}

Hebrew: וַתּ֥וֹסֶף הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה לִֽהְי֑וֹת וַיֵּצֵ֨א דָוִ֜ד וַיִּלָּ֣חֶם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיַּ֤ךְ בָּהֶם֙ מַכָּ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: Fighting broke out again. David went out and fought the Philistines. He inflicted a great defeat upon them and they fled before him.
Transliteration: vatvosef hamilechamah liheyvot vayetse david vayilachem vafelishetiym vayakhe vahem makhah gedvolah vayanusu mifanayv

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי֩ ר֨וּחַ יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> רָעָה֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וְהוּא֙ בְּבֵית֣וֹ יֹשֵׁ֔ב וַחֲנִית֖וֹ בְּיָד֑וֹ וְדָוִ֖ד מְנַגֵּ֥ן בְּיָֽד׃
Translated: Then an evil spirit of G<small>OD</small> came upon Saul while he was sitting in his house with his spear in his hand, and David was playing [the lyre].
Transliteration: vatehiy rucha yehovah <small></small> raah el-shaul vehu veveytvo yoshev vachaniytvo veyadvo vedavid menagen veyad

Hebrew: וַיְבַקֵּ֨שׁ שָׁא֜וּל לְהַכּ֤וֹת בַּֽחֲנִית֙ בְּדָוִ֣ד וּבַקִּ֔יר וַיִּפְטַר֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶֽת־הַחֲנִ֖ית בַּקִּ֑יר וְדָוִ֛ד נָ֥ס וַיִּמָּלֵ֖ט בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated:
Saul tried to pin David to the wall with the spear, but he eluded Saul, so that he drove the spear into the wall. David fled and got away.
That night
Transliteration: vayevakesh shaul lehakhvot vachaniyt vedavid uvakiyr vayifetar mifeney shaul vayakhe et-hachaniyt vakiyr vedavid nas vayimalet valayelah hu {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ שָׁא֨וּל מַלְאָכִ֜ים אֶל־בֵּ֤ית דָּוִד֙ לְשׇׁמְר֔וֹ וְלַהֲמִית֖וֹ בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַתַּגֵּ֣ד לְדָוִ֗ד מִיכַ֤ל אִשְׁתּוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אִם־אֵ֨ינְךָ֜ מְמַלֵּ֤ט אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה מָחָ֖ר אַתָּ֥ה מוּמָֽת׃
Translated: Saul sent messengers to David’s home to keep watch on him and to kill him in the morning. But David’s wife Michal told him, “Unless you run for your life tonight, you will be killed tomorrow.”
Transliteration: vayishelach shaul maleakhiym el-veyt david leshׇmervo velahamiytvo vavoker vataged ledavid miykhal ishetvo lemor im-eynekha memalet et-nafeshekha halayelah machar atah mumat

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֧רֶד מִיכַ֛ל אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד בְּעַ֣ד הַחַלּ֑וֹן וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ וַיִּבְרַ֖ח וַיִּמָּלֵֽט׃
Translated: Michal let David down from the window and he escaped and fled.
Transliteration: vatored miykhal et-david vead hachalvon vayelekhe vayiverach vayimalet

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֨ח מִיכַ֜ל אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֗ים וַתָּ֙שֶׂם֙ אֶל־הַמִּטָּ֔ה וְאֵת֙ כְּבִ֣יר הָעִזִּ֔ים שָׂ֖מָה מְרַאֲשֹׁתָ֑יו וַתְּכַ֖ס בַּבָּֽגֶד׃ {ס}
Translated: Michal then took the oracle idol, laid it on the bed, and covered it with a cloth; and at its head she put a net of goat’s hair.
Transliteration: vatikach miykhal et-haterafiym vatashem el-hamitah veet kheviyr haiziym shamah meraashotayv vatekhas vavaged {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח שָׁא֛וּל מַלְאָכִ֖ים לָקַ֣חַת אֶת־דָּוִ֑ד וַתֹּ֖אמֶר חֹלֶ֥ה הֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: Saul sent messengers to seize David; but she said, “He is sick.”
Transliteration: vayishelach shaul maleakhiym lakachat et-david vatomer choleh hu {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר הַעֲל֨וּ אֹת֧וֹ בַמִּטָּ֛ה אֵלַ֖י לַהֲמִתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Saul, however, sent back the messengers to see David for themselves. “Bring him up to me in the bed,” he ordered, “that he may be put to death.”
Transliteration: vayishelach shaul et-hamaleakhiym lirevot et-david lemor haalu otvo vamitah elay lahamitvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַתְּרָפִ֖ים אֶל־הַמִּטָּ֑ה וּכְבִ֥יר הָעִזִּ֖ים מְרַאֲשֹׁתָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: When the messengers came, they found the oracle idol in the bed, with the net of goat’s hair at its head.
Transliteration: vayavou hamaleakhiym vehineh haterafiym el-hamitah ukheviyr haiziym meraashotayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל אֶל־מִיכַ֗ל לָ֤מָּה כָּ֙כָה֙ רִמִּיתִ֔נִי וַתְּשַׁלְּחִ֥י אֶת־אֹיְבִ֖י וַיִּמָּלֵ֑ט וַתֹּ֤אמֶר מִיכַל֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל הוּא־אָמַ֥ר אֵלַ֛י שַׁלְּחִ֖נִי לָמָ֥ה אֲמִיתֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Saul said to Michal, “Why did you play that trick on me and let my enemy get away safely?” “Because,” Michal answered Saul, “he said to me: ‘Help me get away or I’ll kill you.’”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-miykhal lamah khakhah rimiytiniy vateshalechiy et-oyeviy vayimalet vatomer miykhal el-shaul hu-amar elay shalechiniy lamah amiytekhe

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֨ד בָּרַ֜ח וַיִּמָּלֵ֗ט וַיָּבֹ֤א אֶל־שְׁמוּאֵל֙ הָרָמָ֔תָה וַיַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָֽשָׂה־ל֖וֹ שָׁא֑וּל וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ הוּא֙ וּשְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ (בנוית) [בְּנָיֽוֹת]׃
Translated: David made good his escape, and he came to Samuel at Ramah and told him all that Saul had done to him. He and Samuel went and stayed at Naioth.
Transliteration: vedavid varach vayimalet vayavo el-shemuel haramatah vayaged-lvo et khׇl-asher ashah-lvo shaul vayelekhe hu ushemuel vayeshevu (vnvyt) [venayvot]

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְשָׁא֖וּל לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֣ה דָוִ֔ד (בנוית) [בְּנָי֖וֹת] בָּרָמָֽה׃
Translated: Saul was told that David was at Naioth in Ramah,
Transliteration: vayugad leshaul lemor hineh david (vnvyt) [venayvot] varamah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח שָׁא֣וּל מַלְאָכִים֮ לָקַ֣חַת אֶת־דָּוִד֒ וַיַּ֗רְא אֶֽת־לַהֲקַ֤ת הַנְּבִיאִים֙ נִבְּאִ֔ים וּשְׁמוּאֵ֕ל עֹמֵ֥ד נִצָּ֖ב עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַתְּהִ֞י עַֽל־מַלְאֲכֵ֤י שָׁאוּל֙ ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ גַּם־הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: and Saul sent messengers to seize David. They saw a band of prophets speaking in ecstasy, with Samuel standing by as their leader; and the spirit of God came upon Saul’s messengers and they too began to speak in ecstasy.
Transliteration: vayishelach shaul maleakhiym lakachat et-david vayare et-lahakat haneviyiym niveiym ushemuel omed nitsav aleyhem vatehiy al-maleakhey shaul rucha Elohim vayitenaveu gam-hemah

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ לְשָׁא֗וּל וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ מַלְאָכִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ גַּם־הֵ֑מָּה {ס} וַיֹּ֣סֶף שָׁא֗וּל וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ מַלְאָכִ֣ים שְׁלִשִׁ֔ים וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ גַּם־הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: When Saul was told about this, he sent other messengers; but they too spoke in ecstasy. Saul sent a third group of messengers; and they also spoke in ecstasy.
Transliteration: vayagidu leshaul vayishelach maleakhiym acheriym vayitenaveu gam-hemah {s} vayosef shaul vayishelach maleakhiym shelishiym vayitenaveu gam-hemah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ גַּם־ה֜וּא הָרָמָ֗תָה וַיָּבֹא֙ עַד־בּ֤וֹר הַגָּדוֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשֶּׂ֔כוּ וַיִּשְׁאַ֣ל וַיֹּ֔אמֶר אֵיפֹ֥ה שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל וְדָוִ֑ד וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֖ה (בנוית) [בְּנָי֥וֹת] בָּרָמָֽה׃
Translated: So he himself went to Ramah. When he came to the great cistern at Secu, he asked, “Where are Samuel and David?” and was told that they were at Naioth in Ramah.
Transliteration: vayelekhe gam-hu haramatah vayavo ad-vvor hagadvol asher vashekhu vayisheal vayomer eyfoh shemuel vedavid vayomer hineh (vnvyt) [venayvot] varamah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ שָׁ֔ם אֶל־[נָי֖וֹת] (נוית) בָּרָמָ֑ה וַתְּהִי֩ עָלָ֨יו גַּם־ה֜וּא ר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֗ים וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ הָלוֹךְ֙ וַיִּתְנַבֵּ֔א עַד־בֹּא֖וֹ (בנוית) [בְּנָי֥וֹת] בָּרָמָֽה׃
Translated: He was on his way there, to Naioth in Ramah, when the spirit of God came upon him too; and he walked on, speaking in ecstasy, until he reached Naioth in Ramah.
Transliteration: vayelekhe sham el-[nayvot] (nvyt) varamah vatehiy alayv gam-hu rucha Elohim vayelekhe halvokhe vayitenave ad-vovo (vnvyt) [venayvot] varamah

Hebrew: וַיִּפְשַׁ֨ט גַּם־ה֜וּא בְּגָדָ֗יו וַיִּתְנַבֵּ֤א גַם־הוּא֙ לִפְנֵ֣י שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיִּפֹּ֣ל עָרֹ֔ם כׇּל־הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וְכׇל־הַלָּ֑יְלָה עַל־כֵּן֙ יֹֽאמְר֔וּ הֲגַ֥ם שָׁא֖וּל בַּנְּבִיאִֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then he too stripped off his clothes and he too spoke in ecstasy before Samuel; and he lay naked all that day and all night. That is why people say, “Is Saul too among the prophets?”
Transliteration: vayifeshat gam-hu vegadayv vayitenave gam-hu lifeney shemuel vayifol arom khׇl-hayyvom hahu vekhׇl-halayelah al-khen yomeru hagam shaul vaneviyim {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֣ח דָּוִ֔ד (מנוות) [מִנָּי֖וֹת] בָּרָמָ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֞א וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוֹנָתָ֗ן מֶ֤ה עָשִׂ֙יתִי֙ מֶֽה־עֲוֺנִ֤י וּמֶֽה־חַטָּאתִי֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ כִּ֥י מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: David fled from Naioth in Ramah; he came to Jonathan and said, “What have I done, what is my crime and my guilt against your father, that he seeks my life?”
Transliteration: vayiverach david (mnvvt) [minayvot] varamah vayavo vayomer lifeney yehvonatan meh ashiytiy meh-avoniy umeh-chatatiy lifeney aviykha khiy mevakesh et-nafeshiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֣וֹ חָלִ֘ילָה֮ לֹ֣א תָמוּת֒ הִנֵּ֡ה (לו עשה) [לֹֽא־יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה] אָבִ֜י דָּבָ֣ר גָּד֗וֹל א֚וֹ דָּבָ֣ר קָטֹ֔ן וְלֹ֥א יִגְלֶ֖ה אֶת־אׇזְנִ֑י וּמַדּ֩וּעַ֩ יַסְתִּ֨יר אָבִ֥י מִמֶּ֛נִּי אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה אֵ֥ין זֹֽאת׃
Translated: He replied, “Heaven forbid! You shall not die. My father does not do anything, great or small, without disclosing it to me; why should my father conceal this matter from me? It cannot be!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo chaliylah lo tamut hineh (lv shh) [lo-yaasheh] aviy davar gadvol vo davar katon velo yigeleh et-ׇzeniy umadua yasetiyr aviy mimeniy et-hadavar hazeh eyn zot

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֨ע ע֜וֹד דָּוִ֗ד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יָדֹ֨עַ יָדַ֜ע אָבִ֗יךָ כִּֽי־מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ וַיֹּ֛אמֶר אַל־יֵֽדַע־זֹ֥את יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן פֶּן־יֵעָצֵ֑ב וְאוּלָ֗ם חַי־יְהֹוָה֙ וְחֵ֣י נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ כִּ֣י כְפֶ֔שַׂע בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵ֥ין הַמָּֽוֶת׃
Translated: David swore further, “Your father knows well that you are fond of me and has decided: Jonathan must not learn of this or he will be grieved. But, as G<small>OD</small> lives and as you live, there is only a step between me and death.”
Transliteration: vayishava vod david vayomer yadoa yada aviykha khiy-matsatiy chen veeyneykha vayomer al-eida-zot yehvonatan fen-eiatsev veulam chay-yehovah vechey nafeshekha khiy khefesha veyniy uveyn hamavet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד מַה־תֹּאמַ֥ר נַפְשְׁךָ֖ וְאֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: Jonathan said to David, “Whatever you want, I will do it for you.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan el-david mah-tomar nafeshekha veeesheh-lakhe {f}
