Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־יְהוֹנָתָ֗ן הִֽנֵּה־חֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ מָחָ֔ר וְאָנֹכִ֛י יָשֹׁב־אֵשֵׁ֥ב עִם־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֶאֱכ֑וֹל וְשִׁלַּחְתַּ֙נִי֙ וְנִסְתַּרְתִּ֣י בַשָּׂדֶ֔ה עַ֖ד הָעֶ֥רֶב הַשְּׁלִשִֽׁית׃
Translated: David said to Jonathan, “Tomorrow is the new moon, and I am to sit with the king at the meal. Instead, let me go and I will hide in the countryside until the third evening.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-yehvonatan hineh-chodesh machar veanokhiy yashov-eshev im-hamelekhe leekhvol veshilachetaniy venisetaretiy vashadeh ad haerev hashelishiyt

Hebrew: אִם־פָּקֹ֥ד יִפְקְדֵ֖נִי אָבִ֑יךָ וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ נִשְׁאֹל֩ נִשְׁאַ֨ל מִמֶּ֤נִּי דָוִד֙ לָרוּץ֙ בֵּֽית־לֶ֣חֶם עִיר֔וֹ כִּ֣י זֶ֧בַח הַיָּמִ֛ים שָׁ֖ם לְכׇל־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָֽה׃
Translated: If your father notes my absence, you say, ‘David asked my permission to run down to his home town, Bethlehem, for the whole family has its annual sacrifice there.’
Transliteration: im-fakod yifekedeniy aviykha veamareta nisheol nisheal mimeniy david laruts veyt-lechem iyrvo khiy zevach hayamiym sham lekhׇl-hamishefachah

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֥ה יֹאמַ֛ר ט֖וֹב שָׁל֣וֹם לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְאִם־חָרֹ֤ה יֶחֱרֶה֙ ל֔וֹ דַּ֕ע כִּֽי־כָלְתָ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ה מֵעִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If he says ‘Good,’ your servant is safe; but if his anger flares up, know that he is resolved to do [me] harm.
Transliteration: im-khoh yomar tvov shalvom leavedekha veim-charoh yechereh lvo da khiy-khaletah haraah meimvo

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָֽ חֶ֙סֶד֙ עַל־עַבְדֶּ֔ךָ כִּ֚י בִּבְרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה הֵבֵ֥אתָ אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֖ עִמָּ֑ךְ וְאִם־יֶשׁ־בִּ֤י עָוֺן֙ הֲמִיתֵ֣נִי אַ֔תָּה וְעַד־אָבִ֖יךָ לָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה תְבִיאֵֽנִי׃ {פ}
Translated: Deal faithfully with your servant, since you have taken your servant into a covenant of G<small>OD</small> with you. And if I am guilty, kill me yourself, but don’t make me go back to your father.”
Transliteration: veashiyta chesed al-avedekha khiy viveriyt yehovah heveta et-avedekha imakhe veim-yesh-viy avon hamiyteniy atah vead-aviykha lamah-zeh teviyeniy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן חָלִ֣ילָה לָּ֑ךְ כִּ֣י ׀ אִם־יָדֹ֣עַ אֵדַ֗ע כִּֽי־כָלְתָ֨ה הָרָעָ֜ה מֵעִ֤ם אָבִי֙ לָב֣וֹא עָלֶ֔יךָ וְלֹ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ אַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Jonathan replied, “Don’t talk like that! If I learn that my father has resolved to kill you, I will surely tell you about it.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan chaliylah lakhe khiy im-yadoa eda khiy-khaletah haraah meim aviy lavvo aleykha velo otah agiyd lakhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן מִ֖י יַגִּ֣יד לִ֑י א֛וֹ מַה־יַּעַנְךָ֥ אָבִ֖יךָ קָשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: David said to Jonathan, “Who will tell me if your father answers you harshly?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-yehvonatan miy yagiyd liy vo mah-yaanekha aviykha kashah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוֹנָתָן֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד לְכָ֖ה וְנֵצֵ֣א הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיֵּצְא֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Jonathan said to David, “Let us go into the open”; and they both went out into the open.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan el-david lekhah venetse hashadeh vayetseu sheneyhem hashadeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹנָתָ֜ן אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כִּֽי־אֶחְקֹ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֗י כָּעֵ֤ת <small>׀</small> מָחָר֙ הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֔ית וְהִנֵּה־ט֖וֹב אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וְלֹא־אָז֙ אֶשְׁלַ֣ח אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְגָלִ֖יתִי אֶת־אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Then Jonathan said to David, “By the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel! I will sound out my father at this time tomorrow, [or] on the third day; and if [his response] is favorable for David, I will send a message to you at once and disclose it to you.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan el-david yehovah elohey yisherael khiy-echekor et-aviy khaet <small></small> machar hashelishiyt vehineh-tvov el-david velo-az eshelach eleykha vegaliytiy et-ׇzenekha

Hebrew: כֹּה־יַעֲשֶׂה֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לִיהוֹנָתָ֜ן וְכֹ֣ה יֹסִ֗יף כִּֽי־יֵיטִ֨ב אֶל־אָבִ֤י אֶת־הָרָעָה֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ וְגָלִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־אׇזְנֶ֔ךָ וְשִׁלַּחְתִּ֖יךָ וְהָלַכְתָּ֣ לְשָׁל֑וֹם וִיהִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה עִם־אָבִֽי׃
Translated: But if my father intends to do you harm, may G<small>OD</small> do thus to Jonathan and more if I do [not] disclose it to you and send you off to escape unharmed. May G<small>OD</small> be with you—as [God] was formerly with my father.
Transliteration: khoh-yaasheh yehovah liyhvonatan vekhoh yosiyf khiy-eiytiv el-aviy et-haraah aleykha vegaliytiy et-ׇzenekha veshilachetiykha vehalakheta leshalvom viyhiy yehovah imakhe khaasher hayah im-aviy

Hebrew: וְלֹ֖א אִם־עוֹדֶ֣נִּי חָ֑י וְלֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֧ה עִמָּדִ֛י חֶ֥סֶד יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א אָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Nor shall you fail to show me G<small>OD</small>’s faithfulness, while I am alive; nor, when I am dead,
Transliteration: velo im-vodeniy chay velo-taasheh imadiy chesed yehovah velo amut

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תַכְרִ֧ית אֶֽת־חַסְדְּךָ֛ מֵעִ֥ם בֵּיתִ֖י עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וְלֹ֗א בְּהַכְרִ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־אֹיְבֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד אִ֕ישׁ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: shall you ever discontinue your faithfulness to my house—not even after G<small>OD</small> has wiped out every one of David’s enemies from the face of the earth.
Transliteration: velo-takheriyt et-chasedekha meim veytiy ad-volam velo vehakherit yehovah et-oyevey david iysh meal feney haadamah

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֥ת יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן עִם־בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֑ד וּבִקֵּ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה מִיַּ֖ד אֹיְבֵ֥י דָוִֽד׃
Translated: Thus has Jonathan covenanted with the house of David; and may G<small>OD</small> requite the enemies of David!”
Transliteration: vayikherot yehvonatan im-veyt david uvikesh yehovah miyad oyevey david

Hebrew: וַיּ֤וֹסֶף יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ לְהַשְׁבִּ֣יעַ אֶת־דָּוִ֔ד בְּאַהֲבָת֖וֹ אֹת֑וֹ כִּֽי־אַהֲבַ֥ת נַפְשׁ֖וֹ אֲהֵבֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Jonathan, out of his love for David, adjured him again, for he loved him as himself.
Transliteration: vayyvosef yehvonatan lehasheviya et-david veahavatvo otvo khiy-ahavat nafeshvo ahevvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר־ל֥וֹ יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן מָחָ֣ר חֹ֑דֶשׁ וְנִפְקַ֕דְתָּ כִּ֥י יִפָּקֵ֖ד מוֹשָׁבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Jonathan said to him, “Tomorrow will be the new moon; and you will be missed when your seat remains vacant.
Transliteration: vayomer-lvo yehvonatan machar chodesh venifekadeta khiy yifaked mvoshavekha

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּ֙ תֵּרֵ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר־נִסְתַּ֥רְתָּ שָּׁ֖ם בְּי֣וֹם הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְיָ֣שַׁבְתָּ֔ אֵ֖צֶל הָאֶ֥בֶן הָאָֽזֶל׃
Translated: So the day after tomorrow, go down all the way to the place where you hid the other time, and stay close to the Ezel stone.
Transliteration: veshilasheta tered meod uvata el-hamakvom asher-nisetareta sham veyvom hamaasheh veyashaveta etsel haeven haazel

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֕י שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת הַחִצִּ֖ים צִדָּ֣הֿ אוֹרֶ֑ה לְשַֽׁלַּֽח־לִ֖י לְמַטָּרָֽה׃
Translated: Now I will shoot three arrows to one side of it, as though I were shooting at a mark,
Transliteration: vaaniy sheloshet hachitsiym tsidahֿ voreh leshalach-liy lematarah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ אֶשְׁלַ֣ח אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר לֵ֖ךְ מְצָ֣א אֶת־הַחִצִּ֑ים אִם־אָמֹר֩ אֹמַ֨ר לַנַּ֜עַר הִנֵּ֥ה הַחִצִּ֣ים ׀ מִמְּךָ֣ וָהֵ֗נָּה קָחֶ֧נּוּ ׀ וָבֹ֛אָה כִּי־שָׁל֥וֹם לְךָ֛ וְאֵ֥ין דָּבָ֖ר חַי־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and I will order the boy to go and find the arrows. If I call to the boy, ‘Hey! the arrows are on this side of you,’ be reassured and come, for you are safe and there is no danger—as G<small>OD</small> lives!
Transliteration: vehineh eshelach et-hanaar lekhe metsa et-hachitsiym im-amor omar lanaar hineh hachitsiym mimekha vahenah kachenu vavoah khiy-shalvom lekha veeyn davar chay-yehovah

Hebrew: וְאִם־כֹּ֤ה אֹמַר֙ לָעֶ֔לֶם הִנֵּ֥ה הַחִצִּ֖ים מִמְּךָ֣ וָהָ֑לְאָה לֵ֕ךְ כִּ֥י שִֽׁלַּחֲךָ֖ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But if, instead, I call to the lad, ‘Hey! the arrows are beyond you,’ then leave, for G<small>OD</small> has sent you away.
Transliteration: veim-khoh omar laelem hineh hachitsiym mimekha vahaleah lekhe khiy shilachakha yehovah

Hebrew: וְהַ֨דָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְנוּ אֲנִ֣י וָאָ֑תָּה הִנֵּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינְךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: As for the promise we made to each other, may G<small>OD</small> be [witness] between you and me forever.”
Transliteration: vehadavar asher divarenu aniy vaatah hineh yehovah veyniy uveynekha ad-volam {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּסָּתֵ֥ר דָּוִ֖ד בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיְהִ֣י הַחֹ֔דֶשׁ וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ (על) [אֶל־]הַלֶּ֖חֶם לֶאֱכֽוֹל׃
Translated: David hid in the field. The new moon came, and the king sat down to partake of the meal.
Transliteration: vayisater david vashadeh vayehiy hachodesh vayeshev hamelekhe (l) [el-]halechem leekhvol

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב הַ֠מֶּ֠לֶךְ עַל־מ֨וֹשָׁב֜וֹ כְּפַ֣עַם ׀ בְּפַ֗עַם אֶל־מוֹשַׁב֙ הַקִּ֔יר וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אַבְנֵ֖ר מִצַּ֣ד שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּפָּקֵ֖ד מְק֥וֹם דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: When the king took his usual place on the seat by the wall, Jonathan rose and Abner sat down at Saul’s side; but David’s place remained vacant.
Transliteration: vayeshev hamelekhe al-mvoshavvo khefaam vefaam el-mvoshav hakiyr vayakׇm yehvonatan vayeshev avener mitsad shaul vayifaked mekvom david

Hebrew: וְלֹא־דִבֶּ֥ר שָׁא֛וּל מְא֖וּמָה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא כִּ֤י אָמַר֙ מִקְרֶ֣ה ה֔וּא בִּלְתִּ֥י טָה֛וֹר ה֖וּא כִּי־לֹ֥א טָהֽוֹר׃ {ס}
Translated: That day, however, Saul said nothing. “It’s accidental,” he thought. “He must be impure and not yet purified.”
Transliteration: velo-diver shaul meumah vayyvom hahu khiy amar mikereh hu viletiy tahvor hu khiy-lo tahvor {s}

Hebrew:
וַיְהִ֗י מִֽמׇּחֳרַ֤ת הַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וַיִּפָּקֵ֖ד מְק֣וֹם דָּוִ֑ד {פ}
וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנ֔וֹ מַדּ֜וּעַ לֹא־בָ֧א בֶן־יִשַׁ֛י גַּם־תְּמ֥וֹל גַּם־הַיּ֖וֹם אֶל־הַלָּֽחֶם׃
Translated: But on the day after the new moon, the second day, David’s place was vacant again. So Saul said to his son Jonathan, “Why didn’t the son of Jesse come to the meal yesterday or today?”
Transliteration:
vayehiy mimׇchorat hachodesh hasheniy vayifaked mekvom david {f}
vayomer shaul el-yehvonatan venvo madua lo-va ven-yishay gam-temvol gam-hayyvom el-halachem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן אֶת־שָׁא֑וּל נִשְׁאֹ֨ל נִשְׁאַ֥ל דָּוִ֛ד מֵעִמָּדִ֖י עַד־בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: Jonathan answered Saul, “David begged leave of me to go to Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vayaan yehvonatan et-shaul nisheol nisheal david meimadiy ad-veyt lachem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר שַׁלְּחֵ֣נִי נָ֡א כִּ֣י זֶ֩בַח֩ מִשְׁפָּחָ֨ה לָ֜נוּ בָּעִ֗יר וְה֤וּא צִוָּה־לִי֙ אָחִ֔י וְעַתָּ֗ה אִם־מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ אִמָּ֥לְטָה נָּ֖א וְאֶרְאֶ֣ה אֶת־אֶחָ֑י עַל־כֵּ֣ן לֹא־בָ֔א אֶל־שֻׁלְחַ֖ן הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: He said, ‘Please let me go, for we are going to have a family feast in our town and my brother has summoned me to it. Do me a favor, let me slip away to see my kin.’ That is why he has not come to the king’s table.”
Transliteration: vayomer shalecheniy na khiy zevach mishefachah lanu vaiyr vehu tsivah-liy achiy veatah im-matsatiy chen veeyneykha imaletah na veereeh et-echay al-khen lo-va el-shulechan hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף שָׁאוּל֙ בִּיה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ בֶּֽן־נַעֲוַ֖ת הַמַּרְדּ֑וּת הֲל֣וֹא יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־בֹחֵ֤ר אַתָּה֙ לְבֶן־יִשַׁ֔י לְבׇ֨שְׁתְּךָ֔ וּלְבֹ֖שֶׁת עֶרְוַ֥ת אִמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Saul flew into a rage against Jonathan. “You son of a perverse, rebellious woman!” he shouted. “I know that you side with the son of Jesse—to your shame, and to the shame of your mother’s nakedness!
Transliteration: vayichar-af shaul viyhvonatan vayomer lvo ven-naavat hamaredut halvo yadaetiy khiy-vocher atah leven-yishay levׇshetekha ulevoshet erevat imekha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־הַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר בֶּן־יִשַׁי֙ חַ֣י עַל־הָאֲדָמָ֔ה לֹ֥א תִכּ֖וֹן אַתָּ֣ה וּמַלְכוּתֶ֑ךָ וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁלַ֨ח וְקַ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ אֵלַ֔י כִּ֥י בֶן־מָ֖וֶת הֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: For as long as the son of Jesse lives on earth, neither you nor your kingship will be secure. Now then, have him brought to me, for he is marked for death.”
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-hayamiym asher ven-yishay chay al-haadamah lo tikhvon atah umalekhutekha veatah shelach vekach otvo elay khiy ven-mavet hu {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַן֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן אֶת־שָׁא֖וּל אָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו לָ֥מָּה יוּמַ֖ת מֶ֥ה עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: But Jonathan spoke up and said to his father, “Why should he be put to death? What has he done?”
Transliteration: vayaan yehvonatan et-shaul aviyv vayomer elayv lamah yumat meh ashah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨טֶל שָׁא֧וּל אֶֽת־הַחֲנִ֛ית עָלָ֖יו לְהַכֹּת֑וֹ וַיֵּ֙דַע֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן כִּי־כָ֥לָה הִ֛יא מֵעִ֥ם אָבִ֖יו לְהָמִ֥ית אֶת־דָּוִֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: At that, Saul threw his spear at him to strike him down; and Jonathan realized that his father was determined to do away with David.
Transliteration: vayatel shaul et-hachaniyt alayv lehakhotvo vayeda yehvonatan khiy-khalah hiy meim aviyv lehamiyt et-david {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧קׇם יְהוֹנָתָ֛ן מֵעִ֥ם הַשֻּׁלְחָ֖ן בׇּחֳרִי־אָ֑ף וְלֹֽא־אָכַ֞ל בְּיוֹם־הַחֹ֤דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִי֙ לֶ֔חֶם כִּ֤י נֶעְצַב֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד כִּ֥י הִכְלִמ֖וֹ אָבִֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: Jonathan rose from the table in a rage. He ate no food on the second day of the new moon, because he was grieved about David, and because his father had humiliated him.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yehvonatan meim hashulechan vׇchoriy-af velo-akhal veyvom-hachodesh hasheniy lechem khiy neetsav el-david khiy hikhelimvo aviyv {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֵּצֵ֧א יְהוֹנָתָ֛ן הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לְמוֹעֵ֣ד דָּוִ֑ד וְנַ֥עַר קָטֹ֖ן עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: In the morning, Jonathan went out into the open for the meeting with David, accompanied by a young boy.
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vayetse yehvonatan hashadeh lemvoed david venaar katon imvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְנַֽעֲר֔וֹ רֻ֗ץ מְצָ֥א נָא֙ אֶת־הַ֣חִצִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מוֹרֶ֑ה הַנַּ֣עַר רָ֔ץ וְהוּא־יָרָ֥ה הַחֵ֖צִי לְהַעֲבִרֽוֹ׃
Translated: He said to the boy, “Run ahead and find the arrows that I shoot.” And as the boy ran, he shot the arrows past him.
Transliteration: vayomer lenaarvo ruts metsa na et-hachitsiym asher anokhiy mvoreh hanaar rats vehu-yarah hachetsiy lehaavirvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הַנַּ֙עַר֙ עַד־מְק֣וֹם הַחֵ֔צִי אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָרָ֖ה יְהוֹנָתָ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֨א יְהוֹנָתָ֜ן אַחֲרֵ֤י הַנַּ֙עַר֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר הֲל֥וֹא הַחֵ֖צִי מִמְּךָ֥ וָהָֽלְאָה׃
Translated: When the boy came to the place where the arrows shot by Jonathan had fallen, Jonathan called out to the boy, “Hey, the arrows are beyond you!”
Transliteration: vayavo hanaar ad-mekvom hachetsiy asher yarah yehvonatan vayikera yehvonatan acharey hanaar vayomer halvo hachetsiy mimekha vahaleah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַנַּ֔עַר מְהֵרָ֥ה ח֖וּשָׁה אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֑ד וַיְלַקֵּ֞ט נַ֤עַר יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ אֶת־[הַ֣חִצִּ֔ים] (החצי) וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated: And Jonathan called after the boy, “Quick, hurry up. Don’t stop!” So Jonathan’s boy gathered the arrows and came back to his master.—
Transliteration: vayikera yehvonatan acharey hanaar meherah chushah al-taamod vayelaket naar yehvonatan et-[hachitsiym] (hchtsy) vayavo el-adonayv

Hebrew: וְהַנַּ֖עַר לֹא־יָדַ֣ע מְא֑וּמָה אַ֤ךְ יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ וְדָוִ֔ד יָדְע֖וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: The boy suspected nothing; only Jonathan and David knew the arrangement.—
Transliteration: vehanaar lo-yada meumah akhe yehvonatan vedavid yadeu et-hadavar {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ אֶת־כֵּלָ֔יו אֶל־הַנַּ֖עַר אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ לֵ֖ךְ הָבֵ֥יא הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: Jonathan handed the gear to his boy and told him, “Take these back to the town.”
Transliteration: vayiten yehvonatan et-khelayv el-hanaar asher-lvo vayomer lvo lekhe havey haiyr

Hebrew: הַנַּ֘עַר֮ בָּא֒ וְדָוִ֗ד קָ֚ם מֵאֵ֣צֶל הַנֶּ֔גֶב וַיִּפֹּ֨ל לְאַפָּ֥יו אַ֛רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ פְּעָמִ֑ים וַֽיִּשְּׁק֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֗הוּ וַיִּבְכּוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־רֵעֵ֔הוּ עַד־דָּוִ֖ד הִגְדִּֽיל׃
Translated: When the boy got there, David emerged from his concealment at the Negeb. He flung himself face down on the ground and bowed low three times. They kissed each other and wept together; David wept the longer.
Transliteration: hanaar va vedavid kam meetsel hanegev vayifol leafayv aretsah vayishetachu shalosh feamiym vayisheku iysh et-reehu vayivekhu iysh et-reehu ad-david higediyl

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהוֹנָתָ֛ן לְדָוִ֖ד לֵ֣ךְ לְשָׁל֑וֹם אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨עְנוּ שְׁנֵ֜ינוּ אֲנַ֗חְנוּ בְּשֵׁ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָ֞ה יִהְיֶ֣ה ׀ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֗ךָ וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעִ֛י וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Jonathan said to David, “Go in peace! For we two have sworn to each other in the name of G<small>OD</small>: ‘May G<small>OD</small> be [witness] between you and me, and between your offspring and mine, forever!’”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvonatan ledavid lekhe leshalvom asher nishevaenu sheneynu anachenu veshem yehovah lemor yehovah yiheyeh veyniy uveynekha uveyn zareiy uveyn zareakha ad-volam {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וִיהוֹנָתָ֖ן בָּ֥א הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: David then went his way, and Jonathan returned to the town.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayelakhe viyhvonatan va haiyr

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א דָוִד֙ נֹ֔בֶה אֶל־אֲחִימֶ֖לֶךְ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וַיֶּחֱרַ֨ד אֲחִימֶ֜לֶךְ לִקְרַ֣את דָּוִ֗ד וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ מַדּ֤וּעַ אַתָּה֙ לְבַדֶּ֔ךָ וְאִ֖ישׁ אֵ֥ין אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: David went to the priest Ahimelech at Nob. Ahimelech came out in alarm to meet David, and he said to him, “Why are you alone? Not a soul is with you!”
Transliteration: vayavo david noveh el-achiymelekhe hakhohen vayecherad achiymelekhe likerat david vayomer lvo madua atah levadekha veiysh eyn itakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד לַאֲחִימֶ֣לֶךְ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן הַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ צִוַּ֣נִי דָבָר֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י אִ֣ישׁ אַל־יֵ֧דַע מְא֛וּמָה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אָנֹכִ֥י שֹׁלֵחֲךָ֖ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֑ךָ וְאֶת־הַנְּעָרִ֣ים יוֹדַ֔עְתִּי אֶל־מְק֥וֹם פְּלֹנִ֖י אַלְמוֹנִֽי׃
Translated: David answered the priest Ahimelech, “The king has ordered me on a mission, and he said to me, ‘Absolutely no one must know anything about the mission on which I am sending you and for which I have given you orders.’ So I have directed [my] young men to such and such a place.
Transliteration: vayomer david laachiymelekhe hakhohen hamelekhe tsivaniy davar vayomer elay iysh al-eida meumah et-hadavar asher-anokhiy sholechakha vaasher tsiviytikha veet-haneariym yvodaetiy el-mekvom feloniy alemvoniy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה מַה־יֵּ֧שׁ תַּחַת־יָדְךָ֛ חֲמִשָּׁה־לֶ֖חֶם תְּנָ֣ה בְיָדִ֑י א֖וֹ הַנִּמְצָֽא׃
Translated: Now then, what have you got on hand? Any loaves of bread? Let me have them—or whatever is available.”
Transliteration: veatah mah-yesh tachat-yadekha chamishah-lechem tenah veyadiy vo hanimetsa

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־דָּוִד֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר אֵֽין־לֶ֥חֶם חֹ֖ל אֶל־תַּ֣חַת יָדִ֑י כִּֽי־אִם־לֶ֤חֶם קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יֵ֔שׁ אִם־נִשְׁמְר֥וּ הַנְּעָרִ֖ים אַ֥ךְ מֵאִשָּֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: The priest answered David, “I have no ordinary bread on hand; there is only consecrated bread—provided the young men have kept away from women.”
Transliteration: vayaan hakhohen et-david vayomer eyn-lechem chol el-tachat yadiy khiy-im-lechem kodesh eish im-nishemeru haneariym akhe meishah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶת־הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ כִּ֣י אִם־אִשָּׁ֤ה עֲצֻֽרָה־לָ֙נוּ֙ כִּתְמ֣וֹל שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם בְּצֵאתִ֕י וַיִּהְי֥וּ כְלֵֽי־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְהוּא֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ חֹ֔ל וְאַ֕ף כִּ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם יִקְדַּ֥שׁ בַּכֶּֽלִי׃
Translated: In reply to the priest, David said, “I assure you that women have been kept from us, as always. Whenever I went on a mission, even if the journey was a common one, the vessels of the young men were consecrated; all the more then may consecrated food be put into their vessels today.”
Transliteration: vayaan david et-hakhohen vayomer lvo khiy im-ishah atsurah-lanu khitemvol shileshom vetsetiy vayiheyu kheley-haneariym kodesh vehu derekhe chol veaf khiy hayyvom yikedash vakheliy

Hebrew: וַיִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן קֹ֑דֶשׁ כִּי֩ לֹא־הָ֨יָה שָׁ֜ם לֶ֗חֶם כִּֽי־אִם־לֶ֤חֶם הַפָּנִים֙ הַמּֽוּסָרִים֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לָשׂוּם֙ לֶ֣חֶם חֹ֔ם בְּי֖וֹם הִלָּֽקְחֽוֹ׃
Translated: So the priest gave him consecrated bread, because there was none there except the bread of display, which had been removed from G<small>OD</small>’s presence to be replaced by warm bread as soon as it was taken away.—
Transliteration: vayiten-lvo hakhohen kodesh khiy lo-hayah sham lechem khiy-im-lechem hafaniym hamusariym milifeney yehovah lashum lechem chom veyvom hilakechvo

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֡ם אִישׁ֩ מֵעַבְדֵ֨י שָׁא֜וּל בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא נֶעְצָר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וּשְׁמ֖וֹ דֹּאֵ֣ג הָאֲדֹמִ֑י אַבִּ֥יר הָרֹעִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְשָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: Now one of Saul’s officials was there that day, detained before G<small>OD</small>; his name was Doeg the Edomite, Saul’s chief herdsman.
Transliteration: vesham iysh meavedey shaul vayyvom hahu neetsar lifeney yehovah ushemvo doeg haadomiy aviyr haroiym asher leshaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ לַאֲחִימֶ֔לֶךְ וְאִ֛ין יֶשׁ־פֹּ֥ה תַֽחַת־יָדְךָ֖ חֲנִ֣ית אוֹ־חָ֑רֶב כִּ֣י גַם־חַרְבִּ֤י וְגַם־כֵּלַי֙ לֹא־לָקַ֣חְתִּי בְיָדִ֔י כִּֽי־הָיָ֥ה דְבַר־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ נָחֽוּץ׃ {ס}
Translated: David said to Ahimelech, “Haven’t you got a spear or sword on hand? I didn’t take my sword or any of my weapons with me, because the king’s mission was urgent.”
Transliteration: vayomer david laachiymelekhe veiyn yesh-foh tachat-yadekha chaniyt vo-charev khiy gam-chareviy vegam-khelay lo-lakachetiy veyadiy khiy-hayah devar-hamelekhe nachuts {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן חֶ֩רֶב֩ גׇּלְיָ֨ת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֜י אֲשֶׁר־הִכִּ֣יתָ ׀ בְּעֵ֣מֶק הָאֵלָ֗ה הִנֵּה־הִ֞יא לוּטָ֣ה בַשִּׂמְלָה֮ אַחֲרֵ֣י הָאֵפוֹד֒ אִם־אֹתָ֤הּ תִּֽקַּח־לְךָ֙ קָ֔ח כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין אַחֶ֛רֶת זוּלָתָ֖הּ בָּזֶ֑ה {ס} וַיֹּ֧אמֶר דָּוִ֛ד אֵ֥ין כָּמ֖וֹהָ תְּנֶ֥נָּה לִּֽי׃
Translated: The priest said, “There is the sword of Goliath the Philistine whom you slew in the valley of Elah; it is over there, wrapped in a cloth, behind the ephod. If you want to take that one, take it, for there is none here but that one.” David replied, “There is none like it; give it to me.”
Transliteration: vayomer hakhohen cherev gׇleyat hafelishetiy asher-hikhiyta veemek haelah hineh-hiy lutah vashimelah acharey haefvod im-otah tikach-lekha kach khiy eyn acheret zulatah vazeh {s} vayomer david eyn khamvoha tenenah liy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם דָּוִ֔ד וַיִּבְרַ֥ח בַּיּוֹם־הַה֖וּא מִפְּנֵ֣י שָׁא֑וּל וַיָּבֹ֕א אֶל־אָכִ֖ישׁ מֶ֥לֶךְ גַּֽת׃
Translated: That day David continued on his flight from Saul and he came to King Achish of Gath.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david vayiverach vayyvom-hahu mifeney shaul vayavo el-akhiysh melekhe gat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ עַבְדֵ֤י אָכִישׁ֙ אֵלָ֔יו הֲלוֹא־זֶ֥ה דָוִ֖ד מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאָ֑רֶץ הֲל֣וֹא לָזֶ֗ה יַעֲנ֤וּ בַמְּחֹלוֹת֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִכָּ֤ה שָׁאוּל֙ בַּאֲלָפָ֔ו וְדָוִ֖ד בְּרִבְבֹתָֽו׃
Translated:
The courtiers of Achish said to him, “Why, that’s David, king of the land! That’s the one of whom they sing as they dance:
Saul has slain his thousands;
David, his tens of thousands.”
Transliteration: vayomeru avedey akhiysh elayv halvo-zeh david melekhe haarets halvo lazeh yaanu vamecholvot lemor hikhah shaul vaalafav vedavid verivevotav

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שֶׂם דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בִּלְבָב֑וֹ וַיִּרָ֣א מְאֹ֔ד מִפְּנֵ֖י אָכִ֥ישׁ מֶלֶךְ־גַּֽת׃
Translated: These words worried David and he became very much afraid of King Achish of Gath.
Transliteration: vayashem david et-hadevariym haeleh vilevavvo vayira meod mifeney akhiysh melekhe-gat

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁנּ֤וֹ אֶת־טַעְמוֹ֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּתְהֹלֵ֖ל בְּיָדָ֑ם וַיְתָו֙ עַל־דַּלְת֣וֹת הַשַּׁ֔עַר וַיּ֥וֹרֶד רִיר֖וֹ אֶל־זְקָנֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: So he concealed his good sense from them; he feigned madness for their benefit. He scratched marks on the doors of the gate and let his saliva run down his beard.
Transliteration: vayeshanvo et-taemvo veeyneyhem vayiteholel veyadam vayetav al-daletvot hashaar vayyvored riyrvo el-zekanvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אָכִ֖ישׁ אֶל־עֲבָדָ֑יו הִנֵּ֤ה תִרְאוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִשְׁתַּגֵּ֔עַ לָ֛מָּה תָּבִ֥יאוּ אֹת֖וֹ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: And Achish said to his courtiers, “You see the man is raving; why bring him to me?
Transliteration: vayomer akhiysh el-avadayv hineh tireu iysh mishetagea lamah taviyu otvo elay

Hebrew: חֲסַ֤ר מְשֻׁגָּעִים֙ אָ֔נִי כִּֽי־הֲבֵאתֶ֣ם אֶת־זֶ֔ה לְהִשְׁתַּגֵּ֖עַ עָלָ֑י הֲזֶ֖ה יָב֥וֹא אֶל־בֵּיתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: Do I lack madmen that you have brought this one to rave for me? Should he enter my house?”
Transliteration: chasar meshugaiym aniy khiy-havetem et-zeh lehishetagea alay hazeh yavvo el-veytiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִד֙ מִשָּׁ֔ם וַיִּמָּלֵ֖ט אֶל־מְעָרַ֣ת עֲדֻלָּ֑ם וַיִּשְׁמְע֤וּ אֶחָיו֙ וְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יו וַיֵּרְד֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: David departed from there and escaped to the cave of Adullam; and when his brothers and all his father’s house heard, they joined him down there.
Transliteration: vayelekhe david misham vayimalet el-mearat adulam vayishemeu echayv vekhׇl-veyt aviyv vayeredu elayv shamah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְקַבְּצ֣וּ אֵ֠לָ֠יו כׇּל־אִ֨ישׁ מָצ֜וֹק וְכׇל־אִ֨ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־ל֤וֹ נֹשֶׁא֙ וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ מַר־נֶ֔פֶשׁ וַיְהִ֥י עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לְשָׂ֑ר וַיִּהְי֣וּ עִמּ֔וֹ כְּאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Everyone who was in straits and everyone who was in debt and everyone who was desperate joined him, and he became their leader; there were about four hundred men with him.
Transliteration: vayitekavetsu elayv khׇl-iysh matsvok vekhׇl-iysh asher-lvo noshe vekhׇl-iysh mar-nefesh vayehiy aleyhem leshar vayiheyu imvo kheareva mevot iysh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ דָּוִ֛ד מִשָּׁ֖ם מִצְפֵּ֣ה מוֹאָ֑ב וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֗ב יֵֽצֵא־נָ֞א אָבִ֤י וְאִמִּי֙ אִתְּכֶ֔ם עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֵדַ֔ע מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֖י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: David went from there to Mizpeh of Moab, and he said to the king of Moab, “Let my father and mother come [and stay] with you, until I know what God will do for me.”
Transliteration: vayelekhe david misham mitsefeh mvoav vayomer el-melekhe mvoav eitse-na aviy veimiy itekhem ad asher eda mah-yaasheh-liy Elohim

Hebrew: וַיַּנְחֵ֕ם אֶת־פְּנֵ֖י מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֑ב וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ עִמּ֔וֹ כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י הֱיוֹת־דָּוִ֖ד בַּמְּצוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: So he led them to the king of Moab, and they stayed with him as long as David remained in the stronghold.
Transliteration: vayanechem et-feney melekhe mvoav vayeshevu imvo khׇl-yemey heyvot-david vametsudah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ גָּ֨ד הַנָּבִ֜יא אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד לֹ֤א תֵשֵׁב֙ בַּמְּצוּדָ֔ה לֵ֥ךְ וּבָֽאתָ־לְּךָ֖ אֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֔ד וַיָּבֹ֖א יַ֥עַר חָֽרֶת׃ {ס}
Translated: But the prophet Gad said to David, “Do not stay in the stronghold; go at once to the territory of Judah.” So David left and went to the forest of Hereth.
Transliteration: vayomer gad hanaviy el-david lo teshev vametsudah lekhe uvata-lekha erets yehudah vayelekhe david vayavo yaar charet {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע שָׁא֔וּל כִּ֚י נוֹדַ֣ע דָּוִ֔ד וַאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וְשָׁאוּל֩ יוֹשֵׁ֨ב בַּגִּבְעָ֜ה תַּֽחַת־הָאֶ֤שֶׁל בָּֽרָמָה֙ וַחֲנִית֣וֹ בְיָד֔וֹ וְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֖יו נִצָּבִ֥ים עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: When Saul heard that David and the men with him had been located—Saul was then in Gibeah, sitting under the tamarisk tree on the height, spear in hand, with all his courtiers in attendance upon him—
Transliteration: vayishema shaul khiy nvoda david vaanashiym asher itvo veshaul yvoshev vagiveah tachat-haeshel varamah vachaniytvo veyadvo vekhׇl-avadayv nitsaviym alayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֗וּל לַֽעֲבָדָיו֙ הַנִּצָּבִ֣ים עָלָ֔יו שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֖א בְּנֵ֣י יְמִינִ֑י גַּם־לְכֻלְּכֶ֗ם יִתֵּ֤ן בֶּן־יִשַׁי֙ שָׂד֣וֹת וּכְרָמִ֔ים לְכֻלְּכֶ֣ם יָשִׂ֔ים שָׂרֵ֥י אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Saul said to the courtiers standing about him, “Listen, Benjaminites! Will the son of Jesse give fields and vineyards to every one of you? And will he make all of you captains of thousands or captains of hundreds?
Transliteration: vayomer shaul laavadayv hanitsaviym alayv shimeu-na veney yemiyniy gam-lekhulekhem yiten ven-yishay shadvot ukheramiym lekhulekhem yashiym sharey alafiym vesharey mevot

Hebrew: כִּי֩ קְשַׁרְתֶּ֨ם כֻּלְּכֶ֜ם עָלַ֗י וְאֵין־גֹּלֶ֤ה אֶת־אׇזְנִי֙ בִּכְרׇת־בְּנִ֣י עִם־בֶּן־יִשַׁ֔י וְאֵין־חֹלֶ֥ה מִכֶּ֛ם עָלַ֖י וְגֹלֶ֣ה אֶת־אׇזְנִ֑י כִּ֣י הֵקִים֩ בְּנִ֨י אֶת־עַבְדִּ֥י עָלַ֛י לְאֹרֵ֖ב כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Is that why all of you have conspired against me? For no one informs me when my own son makes a pact with the son of Jesse; no one is concerned for me and no one informs me when my own son has set my servant in ambush against me, as is now the case.”
Transliteration: khiy kesharetem khulekhem alay veeyn-goleh et-ׇzeniy vikherׇt-veniy im-ven-yishay veeyn-choleh mikhem alay vegoleh et-ׇzeniy khiy hekiym veniy et-avediy alay leorev khayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַן דֹּאֵ֣ג הָאֲדֹמִ֗י וְה֛וּא נִצָּ֥ב עַל־עַבְדֵֽי־שָׁא֖וּל וַיֹּאמַ֑ר רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־בֶּן־יִשַׁ֔י בָּ֣א נֹ֔בֶה אֶל־אֲחִימֶ֖לֶךְ בֶּן־אֲחִטֽוּב׃
Translated: Doeg the Edomite, who was standing among the courtiers of Saul, spoke up: “I saw the son of Jesse come to Ahimelech son of Ahitub at Nob.
Transliteration: vayaan doeg haadomiy vehu nitsav al-avedey-shaul vayomar raiytiy et-ven-yishay va noveh el-achiymelekhe ven-achituv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַל־לוֹ֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְצֵידָ֖ה נָ֣תַן ל֑וֹ וְאֵ֗ת חֶ֛רֶב גׇּלְיָ֥ת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י נָ֥תַן לֽוֹ׃
Translated: He inquired of G<small>OD</small> on his behalf and gave him provisions; he also gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.”
Transliteration: vayisheal-lvo vayhovah vetseydah natan lvo veet cherev gׇleyat hafelishetiy natan lvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ לִקְרֹא֩ אֶת־אֲחִימֶ֨לֶךְ בֶּן־אֲחִיט֜וּב הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית אָבִ֛יו הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּנֹ֑ב וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ כֻלָּ֖ם אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Thereupon the king sent for the priest Ahimelech son of Ahitub and for all the priests belonging to his father’s house at Nob. They all came to the king,
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe likero et-achiymelekhe ven-achiytuv hakhohen veet khׇl-veyt aviyv hakhohaniym asher venov vayavou khulam el-hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל שְֽׁמַֽע־נָ֖א בֶּן־אֲחִיט֑וּב וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנְנִ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: and Saul said, “Listen to me, son of Ahitub.” “Yes, my lord,” he replied.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul shema-na ven-achiytuv vayomer hineniy adoniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָו֙ שָׁא֔וּל לָ֚מָּה קְשַׁרְתֶּ֣ם עָלַ֔י אַתָּ֖ה וּבֶן־יִשָׁ֑י בְּתִתְּךָ֨ ל֜וֹ לֶ֣חֶם וְחֶ֗רֶב וְשָׁא֥וֹל לוֹ֙ בֵּֽאלֹהִ֔ים לָק֥וּם אֵלַ֛י לְאֹרֵ֖ב כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And Saul said to him, “Why have you and the son of Jesse conspired against me? You gave him food and a sword, and inquired of God for him—that he may rise in ambush against me, as is now the case.”
Transliteration: vayomer elav shaul lamah kesharetem alay atah uven-yishay vetitekha lvo lechem vecherev veshavol lvo velohiym lakum elay leorev khayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן אֲחִימֶ֛לֶךְ אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר וּמִ֤י בְכׇל־עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ כְּדָוִ֣ד נֶאֱמָ֔ן וַחֲתַ֥ן הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְסָ֥ר אֶל־מִשְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ךָ וְנִכְבָּ֥ד בְּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Ahimelech replied to the king, “But who is there among all your courtiers as trusted as David, son-in-law of Your Majesty and obedient to your bidding, and esteemed in your household?
Transliteration: vayaan achiymelekhe et-hamelekhe vayomar umiy vekhׇl-avadeykha khedavid neeman vachatan hamelekhe vesar el-mishemaetekha venikhevad veveytekha

Hebrew: הַיּ֧וֹם הַחִלֹּ֛תִי (לשאול) [לִשְׁאׇל־]ל֥וֹ בֵאלֹהִ֖ים חָלִ֣ילָה לִּ֑י אַל־יָשֵׂם֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ בְּעַבְדּ֤וֹ דָבָר֙ בְּכׇל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔י כִּ֠י לֹֽא־יָדַ֤ע עַבְדְּךָ֙ בְּכׇל־זֹ֔את דָּבָ֥ר קָטֹ֖ן א֥וֹ גָדֽוֹל׃
Translated: This is the first time that I inquired of God for him; I have done no wrong. Let not Your Majesty find fault with his servant [or] with any of my father’s house; for your servant knew nothing whatever about all this.”
Transliteration: hayyvom hachilotiy (lshvl) [lisheׇl-]lvo velohiym chaliylah liy al-yashem hamelekhe veavedvo davar vekhׇl-veyt aviy khiy lo-yada avedekha vekhׇl-zot davar katon vo gadvol

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ מ֥וֹת תָּמ֖וּת אֲחִימֶ֑לֶךְ אַתָּ֖ה וְכׇל־בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translated: But the king said, “You shall die, Ahimelech, you and all your father’s house.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe mvot tamut achiymelekhe atah vekhׇl-veyt aviykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ לָרָצִים֩ הַנִּצָּבִ֨ים עָלָ֜יו סֹ֥בּוּ וְהָמִ֣יתוּ ׀ כֹּהֲנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּ֤י גַם־יָדָם֙ עִם־דָּוִ֔ד וְכִ֤י יָֽדְעוּ֙ כִּֽי־בֹרֵ֣חַֽ ה֔וּא וְלֹ֥א גָל֖וּ אֶת־[אׇזְנִ֑י] (אזנו) וְלֹֽא־אָב֞וּ עַבְדֵ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לִשְׁלֹ֣חַ אֶת־יָדָ֔ם לִפְגֹ֖עַ בְּכֹהֲנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And the king commanded the guards standing by, “Turn about and kill the priests of G<small>OD</small>, for they are in league with David; they knew he was running away and they did not inform me.” But the king’s servants would not raise a hand to strike down the priests of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe laratsiym hanitsaviym alayv sovu vehamiytu khohaney yehovah khiy gam-yadam im-david vekhiy yadeu khiy-vorecha hu velo galu et-[ׇzeniy] (znv) velo-avu avedey hamelekhe lishelocha et-yadam lifegoa vekhohaney yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ (לדויג) [לְדוֹאֵ֔ג] סֹ֣ב אַתָּ֔ה וּפְגַ֖ע בַּכֹּהֲנִ֑ים וַיִּסֹּ֞ב (דויג) [דּוֹאֵ֣ג] הָאֲדֹמִ֗י וַיִּפְגַּע־הוּא֙ בַּכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וַיָּ֣מֶת ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא שְׁמֹנִ֤ים וַֽחֲמִשָּׁה֙ אִ֔ישׁ נֹשֵׂ֖א אֵפ֥וֹד בָּֽד׃
Translated: Thereupon the king said to Doeg, “You, Doeg, go and strike down the priests.” And Doeg the Edomite went and struck down the priests himself; that day, he killed eighty-five of those who wore the linen ephod.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe (ldvyg) [ledvoeg] sov atah ufega vakhohaniym vayisov (dvyg) [dvoeg] haadomiy vayifega-hu vakhohaniym vayamet vayyvom hahu shemoniym vachamishah iysh noshe efvod vad

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת נֹ֤ב עִיר־הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ הִכָּ֣ה לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב מֵאִישׁ֙ וְעַד־אִשָּׁ֔ה מֵֽעוֹלֵ֖ל וְעַד־יוֹנֵ֑ק וְשׁ֧וֹר וַחֲמ֛וֹר וָשֶׂ֖ה לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: He put Nob, the town of the priests, to the sword: men and women, children and infants, oxen, donkeys, and sheep—[all] to the sword.
Transliteration: veet nov iyr-hakhohaniym hikhah lefiy-cherev meiysh vead-ishah mevolel vead-yvonek veshvor vachamvor vasheh lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּלֵ֣ט בֵּן־אֶחָ֗ד לַאֲחִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ בֶּן־אֲחִט֔וּב וּשְׁמ֖וֹ אֶבְיָתָ֑ר וַיִּבְרַ֖ח אַחֲרֵ֥י דָוִֽד׃
Translated: But one son of Ahimelech son of Ahitub escaped—his name was Abiathar—and he fled to David.
Transliteration: vayimalet ven-echad laachiymelekhe ven-achituv ushemvo eveyatar vayiverach acharey david

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֥ד אֶבְיָתָ֖ר לְדָוִ֑ד כִּ֚י הָרַ֣ג שָׁא֔וּל אֵ֖ת כֹּהֲנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When Abiathar told David that Saul had killed the priests of G<small>OD</small>,
Transliteration: vayaged eveyatar ledavid khiy harag shaul et khohaney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד לְאֶבְיָתָ֗ר יָדַ֜עְתִּי בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ כִּֽי־שָׁם֙ (דויג) [דּוֹאֵ֣ג] הָאֲדֹמִ֔י כִּֽי־הַגֵּ֥ד יַגִּ֖יד לְשָׁא֑וּל אָנֹכִ֣י סַבֹּ֔תִי בְּכׇל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translated: David said to Abiathar, “I knew that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would tell Saul. I am to blame for all the deaths in your father’s house.
Transliteration: vayomer david leeveyatar yadaetiy vayyvom hahu khiy-sham (dvyg) [dvoeg] haadomiy khiy-haged yagiyd leshaul anokhiy savotiy vekhׇl-nefesh veyt aviykha

Hebrew: שְׁבָ֤ה אִתִּי֙ אַל־תִּירָ֔א כִּ֛י אֲשֶׁר־יְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אֶת־נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ כִּֽי־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת אַתָּ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Stay with me; do not be afraid; for whoever seeks your life must seek my life also. It will be my care to guard you.”
Transliteration: shevah itiy al-tiyra khiy asher-yevakesh et-nafeshiy yevakesh et-nafeshekha khiy-mishemeret atah imadiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֥דוּ לְדָוִ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֤ה פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ נִלְחָמִ֣ים בִּקְעִילָ֔ה וְהֵ֖מָּה שֹׁסִ֥ים אֶת־הַגֳּרָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: David was told: “The Philistines are raiding Keilah and plundering the threshing floors.”
Transliteration: vayagidu ledavid lemor hineh felishetiym nilechamiym vikeiylah vehemah shosiym et-hagoranvot

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֨ל דָּוִ֤ד בַּֽיהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַאֵלֵ֣ךְ וְהִכֵּ֔יתִי בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה {ס} וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד לֵ֚ךְ וְהִכִּ֣יתָ בַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְהוֹשַׁעְתָּ֖ אֶת־קְעִילָֽה׃
Translated: David consulted G<small>OD</small>, “Shall I go and attack those Philistines?” And G<small>OD</small> said to David, “Go; attack the Philistines and you will save Keilah.”
Transliteration: vayisheal david vayhovah lemor haelekhe vehikheytiy vafelishetiym haeleh {s} vayomer yehovah el-david lekhe vehikhiyta vafelishetiym vehvoshaeta et-keiylah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י דָוִד֙ אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּ֨ה אֲנַ֥חְנוּ פֹ֛ה בִּיהוּדָ֖ה יְרֵאִ֑ים וְאַף֙ כִּֽי־נֵלֵ֣ךְ קְעִלָ֔ה אֶל־מַעַרְכ֖וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: But David’s men said to him, “Look, we are afraid here in Judah, how much more if we go to Keilah against the forces of the Philistines!”
Transliteration: vayomeru aneshey david elayv hineh anachenu foh viyhudah yereiym veaf khiy-nelekhe keilah el-maarekhvot felishetiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיּ֨וֹסֶף ע֤וֹד דָּוִד֙ לִשְׁא֣וֹל בַּיהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֖הוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר ק֚וּם רֵ֣ד קְעִילָ֔ה כִּי־אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֛ן אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: So David consulted G<small>OD</small> again, and G<small>OD</small> answered him, “March down at once to Keilah, for I am going to deliver the Philistines into your hands.”
Transliteration: vayyvosef vod david lishevol vayhovah vayaanehu yehovah vayomer kum red keiylah khiy-aniy noten et-felishetiym veyadekha

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִד֩ וַאֲנָשָׁ֨ו קְעִילָ֜ה וַיִּלָּ֣חֶם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיִּנְהַג֙ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּ֥ךְ בָּהֶ֖ם מַכָּ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣שַׁע דָּוִ֔ד אֵ֖ת יֹשְׁבֵ֥י קְעִילָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: David and his men went to Keilah and fought against the Philistines; he drove off their cattle and inflicted a severe defeat on them. Thus David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
Transliteration: vayelekhe david vaanashav keiylah vayilachem vafelishetiym vayinehag et-mikeneyhem vayakhe vahem makhah gedvolah vayosha david et yoshevey keiylah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּ֠בְרֹ֠חַ אֶבְיָתָ֧ר בֶּן־אֲחִימֶ֛לֶךְ אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד קְעִילָ֑ה אֵפ֖וֹד יָרַ֥ד בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: When Abiathar son of Ahimelech fled to David at Keilah, he brought down an ephod with him.
Transliteration: vayehiy viverocha eveyatar ven-achiymelekhe el-david keiylah efvod yarad veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְשָׁא֔וּל כִּי־בָ֥א דָוִ֖ד קְעִילָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֗וּל נִכַּ֨ר אֹת֤וֹ אֱלֹהִים֙ בְּיָדִ֔י כִּ֚י נִסְגַּ֣ר לָב֔וֹא בְּעִ֖יר דְּלָתַ֥יִם וּבְרִֽיחַ׃
Translated: Saul was told that David had come to Keilah, and Saul thought, “God has delivered him into my hands, for he has shut himself in by entering a town with gates and bars.”
Transliteration: vayugad leshaul khiy-va david keiylah vayomer shaul nikhar otvo Elohim veyadiy khiy nisegar lavvo veiyr delatayiim uveriycha

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁמַּ֥ע שָׁא֛וּל אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה לָרֶ֣דֶת קְעִילָ֔ה לָצ֥וּר אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד וְאֶל־אֲנָשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: Saul summoned all the troops for war, to go down to Keilah and besiege David and his men.
Transliteration: vayeshama shaul et-khׇl-haam lamilechamah laredet keiylah latsur el-david veel-anashayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣דַע דָּוִ֔ד כִּ֣י עָלָ֔יו שָׁא֖וּל מַחֲרִ֣ישׁ הָרָעָ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֶבְיָתָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן הַגִּ֖ישָׁה הָאֵפֽוֹד׃ {ס}
Translated: When David learned that Saul was planning to harm him, he told the priest Abiathar to bring the ephod forward.
Transliteration: vayeda david khiy alayv shaul machariysh haraah vayomer el-eveyatar hakhohen hagiyshah haefvod {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ דָּוִד֒ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שָׁמֹ֤עַ שָׁמַע֙ עַבְדְּךָ֔ כִּֽי־מְבַקֵּ֥שׁ שָׁא֖וּל לָב֣וֹא אֶל־קְעִילָ֑ה לְשַׁחֵ֥ת לָעִ֖יר בַּעֲבוּרִֽי׃
Translated: And David said, “O E<small>TERNAL</small> God of Israel, Your servant has heard that Saul intends to come to Keilah and destroy the town because of me.
Transliteration: vayomer david yehovah elohey yisherael shamoa shama avedekha khiy-mevakesh shaul lavvo el-keiylah leshachet laiyr vaavuriy

Hebrew: הֲיַסְגִּרֻ֣נִי בַעֲלֵי֩ קְעִילָ֨ה בְיָד֜וֹ הֲיֵרֵ֣ד שָׁא֗וּל כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ שָׁמַ֣ע עַבְדֶּ֔ךָ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַגֶּד־נָ֖א לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ {ס} וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה יֵרֵֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: Will the citizens of Keilah deliver me into his hands? Will Saul come down, as Your servant has heard? O E<small>TERNAL</small> God of Israel, tell Your servant!” And G<small>OD</small> said, “He will.”
Transliteration: hayasegiruniy vaaley keiylah veyadvo haeired shaul khaasher shama avedekha yehovah elohey yisherael haged-na leavedekha {s} vayomer yehovah eired {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד הֲיַסְגִּ֜רוּ בַּעֲלֵ֧י קְעִילָ֛ה אֹתִ֥י וְאֶת־אֲנָשַׁ֖י בְּיַד־שָׁא֑וּל וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה יַסְגִּֽירוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: David continued, “Will the citizens of Keilah deliver me and my men into Saul’s hands?” And G<small>OD</small> answered, “They will.”
Transliteration: vayomer david hayasegiru vaaley keiylah otiy veet-anashay veyad-shaul vayomer yehovah yasegiyru {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ דָּוִ֨ד וַאֲנָשָׁ֜יו כְּשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת אִ֗ישׁ וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ מִקְּעִלָ֔ה וַיִּֽתְהַלְּכ֖וּ בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתְהַלָּ֑כוּ וּלְשָׁא֣וּל הֻגַּ֗ד כִּֽי־נִמְלַ֤ט דָּוִד֙ מִקְּעִילָ֔ה וַיֶּחְדַּ֖ל לָצֵֽאת׃
Translated: So David and his men, about six hundred in number, left Keilah at once and moved about wherever they could. And when Saul was told that David had got away from Keilah, he did not set out.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david vaanashayv kheshesh-mevot iysh vayetseu mikeilah vayitehalekhu vaasher yitehalakhu uleshaul hugad khiy-nimelat david mikeiylah vayechedal latset

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨שֶׁב דָּוִ֤ד בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ בַּמְּצָד֔וֹת וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בָּהָ֖ר בְּמִדְבַּר־זִ֑יף וַיְבַקְשֵׁ֤הוּ שָׁאוּל֙ כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֔ים וְלֹֽא־נְתָנ֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: David was staying in the strongholds of the wilderness [of Judah]; he stayed in the hill country, in the wilderness of Ziph. Saul searched for him constantly, but God did not deliver him into his hands.
Transliteration: vayeshev david vamidevar vametsadvot vayeshev vahar vemidevar-ziyf vayevakeshehu shaul khׇl-hayamiym velo-netanvo Elohim veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא דָּוִ֔ד כִּֽי־יָצָ֥א שָׁא֖וּל לְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אֶת־נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְדָוִ֥ד בְּמִדְבַּר־זִ֖יף בַּחֹֽרְשָׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: David was once at Horesh in the wilderness of Ziph, when David learned that Saul had come out to seek his life.
Transliteration: vayare david khiy-yatsa shaul levakesh et-nafeshvo vedavid vemidevar-ziyf vachoreshah {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן בֶּן־שָׁא֔וּל וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד חֹ֑רְשָׁה וַיְחַזֵּ֥ק אֶת־יָד֖וֹ בֵּאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: And Saul’s son Jonathan came to David at Horesh and encouraged him in [the name of] God.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yehvonatan ven-shaul vayelekhe el-david choreshah vayechazek et-yadvo velohiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו אַל־תִּירָ֗א כִּ֠י לֹ֤א תִֽמְצָאֲךָ֙ יַ֚ד שָׁא֣וּל אָבִ֔י וְאַתָּה֙ תִּמְלֹ֣ךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָנֹכִ֖י אֶהְיֶה־לְּךָ֣ לְמִשְׁנֶ֑ה וְגַם־שָׁא֥וּל אָבִ֖י יֹדֵ֥עַ כֵּֽן׃
Translated: He said to him, “Do not be afraid: the hand of my father Saul will never touch you. You are going to be king over Israel and I shall be second to you; and even my father Saul knows this is so.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv al-tiyra khiy lo timetsaakha yad shaul aviy veatah timelokhe al-yisherael veanokhiy eheyeh-lekha lemisheneh vegam-shaul aviy yodea khen

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרְת֧וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֛ם בְּרִ֖ית לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב דָּוִד֙ בַּחֹ֔רְשָׁה וִיהוֹנָתָ֖ן הָלַ֥ךְ לְבֵיתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: And the two of them entered into a pact before G<small>OD</small>. David remained in Horesh, and Jonathan went home.
Transliteration: vayikheretu sheneyhem veriyt lifeney yehovah vayeshev david vachoreshah viyhvonatan halakhe leveytvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֤וּ זִפִים֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל הַגִּבְעָ֖תָה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲל֣וֹא דָ֠וִ֠ד מִסְתַּתֵּ֨ר עִמָּ֤נוּ בַמְּצָדוֹת֙ בַּחֹ֔רְשָׁה בְּגִבְעַת֙ הַחֲכִילָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִימִ֥ין הַיְשִׁימֽוֹן׃
Translated: Some Ziphites went up to Saul in Gibeah and said, “David is hiding among us in the strongholds of Horesh, at the hill of Hachilah south of Jeshimon.
Transliteration: vayaalu zifiym el-shaul hagiveatah lemor halvo david misetater imanu vametsadvot vachoreshah vegiveat hachakhiylah asher miymiyn hayeshiymvon

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה לְכׇל־אַוַּ֨ת נַפְשְׁךָ֥ הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ לָרֶ֖דֶת רֵ֑ד וְלָ֥נוּ הַסְגִּיר֖וֹ בְּיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: So if Your Majesty has the desire to come down, come down, and it will be our task to deliver him into Your Majesty’s hands.”
Transliteration: veatah lekhׇl-avat nafeshekha hamelekhe laredet red velanu hasegiyrvo veyad hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל בְּרוּכִ֥ים אַתֶּ֖ם לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֥י חֲמַלְתֶּ֖ם עָלָֽי׃
Translated: And Saul replied, “May you be blessed of G<small>OD</small> for the compassion you have shown me!
Transliteration: vayomer shaul verukhiym atem layhovah khiy chamaletem alay

Hebrew: לְכוּ־נָ֞א הָכִ֣ינוּ ע֗וֹד וּדְע֤וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־מְקוֹמוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה רַגְל֔וֹ מִ֥י רָאָ֖הוּ שָׁ֑ם כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י עָר֥וֹם יַעְרִ֖ם הֽוּא׃
Translated: Go now and prepare further. Look around and learn what places he sets foot on [and] who has seen him there, for I have been told he is very cunning.
Transliteration: lekhu-na hakhiynu vod udeu ureu et-mekvomvo asher tiheyeh ragelvo miy raahu sham khiy amar elay arvom yaerim hu

Hebrew: וּרְא֣וּ וּדְע֗וּ מִכֹּ֤ל הַמַּֽחֲבֹאִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתְחַבֵּ֣א שָׁ֔ם וְשַׁבְתֶּ֤ם אֵלַי֙ אֶל־נָכ֔וֹן וְהָלַכְתִּ֖י אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְהָיָה֙ אִם־יֶשְׁנ֣וֹ בָאָ֔רֶץ וְחִפַּשְׂתִּ֣י אֹת֔וֹ בְּכֹ֖ל אַלְפֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Look around and learn in which of all his hiding places he has been hiding, and return to me when you are certain. I will then go with you, and if he is in the region, I will search him out among all the clans of Judah.”
Transliteration: ureu udeu mikhol hamachavoiym asher yitechave sham veshavetem elay el-nakhvon vehalakhetiy itekhem vehayah im-yeshenvo vaarets vechifashetiy otvo vekhol alefey yehudah

Hebrew: וַיָּק֛וּמוּ וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ זִ֖יפָה לִפְנֵ֣י שָׁא֑וּל וְדָוִ֨ד וַאֲנָשָׁ֜יו בְּמִדְבַּ֤ר מָעוֹן֙ בָּעֲרָבָ֔ה אֶ֖ל יְמִ֥ין הַיְשִׁימֽוֹן׃
Translated: They left at once for Ziph, ahead of Saul; David and his men were then in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah, to the south of Jeshimon.
Transliteration: vayakumu vayelekhu ziyfah lifeney shaul vedavid vaanashayv vemidevar mavon vaaravah el yemiyn hayeshiymvon

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ שָׁא֣וּל וַאֲנָשָׁיו֮ לְבַקֵּשׁ֒ וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ לְדָוִ֔ד וַיֵּ֣רֶד הַסֶּ֔לַע וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר מָע֑וֹן וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע שָׁא֔וּל וַיִּרְדֹּ֥ף אַחֲרֵֽי־דָוִ֖ד מִדְבַּ֥ר מָעֽוֹן׃
Translated: When Saul and his men came to search, David was told about it; and he went down to the rocky region and stayed in the wilderness of Maon. On hearing this, Saul pursued David in the wilderness of Maon.
Transliteration: vayelekhe shaul vaanashayv levakesh vayagidu ledavid vayered hasela vayeshev vemidevar mavon vayishema shaul vayiredof acharey-david midevar mavon

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ שָׁא֜וּל מִצַּ֤ד הָהָר֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וְדָוִ֧ד וַאֲנָשָׁ֛יו מִצַּ֥ד הָהָ֖ר מִזֶּ֑ה וַיְהִ֨י דָוִ֜ד נֶחְפָּ֤ז לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל וְשָׁא֣וּל וַאֲנָשָׁ֗יו עֹ֥טְרִ֛ים אֶל־דָּוִ֥ד וְאֶל־אֲנָשָׁ֖יו לְתׇפְשָֽׂם׃
Translated: Saul was making his way along one side of a hill, and David and his men were on the other side of the hill. David was trying hard to elude Saul, and Saul and his men were trying to encircle David and his men and capture them,
Transliteration: vayelekhe shaul mitsad hahar mizeh vedavid vaanashayv mitsad hahar mizeh vayehiy david nechefaz lalekhet mifeney shaul veshaul vaanashayv oteriym el-david veel-anashayv letׇfesham

Hebrew: וּמַלְאָ֣ךְ בָּ֔א אֶל־שָׁא֖וּל לֵאמֹ֑ר מַהֲרָ֣ה וְלֵ֔כָה כִּֽי־פָשְׁט֥וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: when a messenger came and told Saul, “Come quickly, for the Philistines have invaded the land.”
Transliteration: umaleakhe va el-shaul lemor maharah velekhah khiy-fashetu felishetiym al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שׇׁב שָׁא֗וּל מִרְדֹף֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ לִקְרַ֣את פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֗ן קָֽרְאוּ֙ לַמָּק֣וֹם הַה֔וּא סֶ֖לַע הַֽמַּחְלְקֽוֹת׃
Translated: Saul gave up his pursuit of David and went to meet the Philistines. That is why that place came to be called the Rock of Separation.
Transliteration: vayashׇv shaul miredof acharey david vayelekhe likerat felishetiym al-khen kareu lamakvom hahu sela hamachelekvot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל דָּוִ֖ד מִשָּׁ֑ם וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בִּמְצָד֥וֹת עֵֽין־גֶּֽדִי׃ {ס}
Translated: David went from there and stayed in the wildernesses of En-gedi.
Transliteration: vayaal david misham vayeshev vimetsadvot eyn-gediy {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ שָׁ֣ב שָׁא֔וּל מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּגִּ֤דוּ לוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנֵּ֣ה דָוִ֔ד בְּמִדְבַּ֖ר עֵ֥ין גֶּֽדִי׃ {ס}
Translated: When Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, he was told that David was in the wilderness of En-gedi.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher shav shaul meacharey felishetiym vayagidu lvo lemor hineh david vemidevar eyn gediy {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח שָׁא֗וּל שְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֛ים אִ֥ישׁ בָּח֖וּר מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ לְבַקֵּ֤שׁ אֶת־דָּוִד֙ וַאֲנָשָׁ֔יו עַל־פְּנֵ֖י צוּרֵ֥י הַיְּעֵלִֽים׃
Translated: So Saul took three thousand of the best troops from all Israel and went in search of David and his men in the direction of the rocks of the wild goats;
Transliteration: vayikach shaul sheloshet alafiym iysh vachur mikhׇl-yisherael vayelekhe levakesh et-david vaanashayv al-feney tsurey hayeeliym

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠א אֶל־גִּדְר֨וֹת הַצֹּ֤אן עַל־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ וְשָׁ֣ם מְעָרָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֥א שָׁא֖וּל לְהָסֵ֣ךְ אֶת־רַגְלָ֑יו וְדָוִד֙ וַאֲנָשָׁ֔יו בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַמְּעָרָ֖ה יֹשְׁבִֽים׃
Translated: and he came to the sheepfolds along the way. There was a cave there, and Saul went in to relieve himself. Now David and his men were sitting in the back of the cave.
Transliteration: vayavo el-gidervot hatson al-haderekhe vesham mearah vayavo shaul lehasekhe et-ragelayv vedavid vaanashayv veyarekhetey hamearah yosheviym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י דָוִ֜ד אֵלָ֗יו הִנֵּ֨ה הַיּ֜וֹם אֲֽשֶׁר־אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֵלֶ֗יךָ הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י נֹתֵ֤ן אֶת־[אֹֽיִבְךָ֙] (איביך) בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר יִטַ֣ב בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וַיָּ֣קׇם דָּוִ֗ד וַיִּכְרֹ֛ת אֶת־כְּנַֽף־הַמְּעִ֥יל אֲשֶׁר־לְשָׁא֖וּל בַּלָּֽט׃
Translated: David’s men said to him, “This is the day of which G<small>OD</small> said to you, ‘I will deliver your enemy into your hands; you can do with him as you please.’” David went and stealthily cut off the corner of Saul’s cloak.
Transliteration: vayomeru aneshey david elayv hineh hayyvom asher-amar yehovah eleykha hineh anokhiy noten et-[oyiivekha] (yvykh) veyadekha veashiyta lvo khaasher yitav veeyneykha vayakׇm david vayikherot et-khenaf-hameiyl asher-leshaul valat

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיַּ֥ךְ לֵב־דָּוִ֖ד אֹת֑וֹ עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּרַ֔ת אֶת־כָּנָ֖ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְשָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: But afterward David reproached himself for cutting off the corner of Saul’s cloak.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayakhe lev-david otvo al asher kharat et-khanaf asher leshaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לַאֲנָשָׁ֜יו חָלִ֧ילָה לִּ֣י מֵיְהֹוָ֗ה אִם־אֶעֱשֶׂה֩ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֨ר הַזֶּ֤ה לַֽאדֹנִי֙ לִמְשִׁ֣יחַ יְהֹוָ֔ה לִשְׁלֹ֥חַ יָדִ֖י בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־מְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: He said to his men, “G<small>OD</small> forbid that I should do such a thing to my lord—G<small>OD</small>’s anointed—that I should raise my hand against him; for he is G<small>OD</small>’s anointed.”
Transliteration: vayomer laanashayv chaliylah liy meyehovah im-eesheh et-hadavar hazeh ladoniy limeshiycha yehovah lishelocha yadiy vvo khiy-meshiycha yehovah hu

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁסַּ֨ע דָּוִ֤ד אֶת־אֲנָשָׁיו֙ בַּדְּבָרִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א נְתָנָ֖ם לָק֣וּם אֶל־שָׁא֑וּל וְשָׁא֛וּל קָ֥ם מֵהַמְּעָרָ֖ה וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
David rebuked his men and did not permit them to attack Saul.
Saul left the cave and started on his way.
Transliteration: vayeshasa david et-anashayv vadevariym velo netanam lakum el-shaul veshaul kam mehamearah vayelekhe vadarekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם דָּוִ֜ד אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן וַיֵּצֵא֙ (מן המערה) [מֵֽהַמְּעָרָ֔ה] וַיִּקְרָ֧א אַחֲרֵי־שָׁא֛וּל לֵאמֹ֖ר אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיַּבֵּ֤ט שָׁאוּל֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וַיִּקֹּ֨ד דָּוִ֥ד אַפַּ֛יִם אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then David also went out of the cave and called after Saul, “My lord king!” Saul looked around and David bowed low in homage, with his face to the ground.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david acharey-khen vayetse (mn hmrh) [mehamearah] vayikera acharey-shaul lemor adoniy hamelekhe vayavet shaul acharayv vayikod david afayiim aretsah vayishetachu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ לְשָׁא֔וּל לָ֧מָּה תִשְׁמַ֛ע אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י אָדָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֣ה דָוִ֔ד מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ רָעָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And David said to Saul, “Why do you listen to the people who say, ‘David is out to do you harm?’
Transliteration: vayomer david leshaul lamah tishema et-diverey adam lemor hineh david mevakesh raatekha

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֩ הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֜ה רָא֣וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־נְתָנְךָ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה <small>׀</small> הַיּ֤וֹם <small>׀</small> בְּיָדִי֙ בַּמְּעָרָ֔ה וְאָמַ֥ר לַהֲרָגְךָ֖ וַתָּ֣חׇס עָלֶ֑יךָ וָאֹמַ֗ר לֹֽא־אֶשְׁלַ֤ח יָדִי֙ בַּאדֹנִ֔י כִּֽי־מְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: You can see for yourself now that G<small>OD</small> delivered you into my hands in the cave today. And though I was urged to kill you, I showed you pity; for I said, ‘I will not raise a hand against my lord, since he is G<small>OD</small>’s anointed.’
Transliteration: hineh hayyvom hazeh rau eyneykha et asher-netanekha yehovah <small></small> hayyvom <small></small> veyadiy vamearah veamar laharagekha vatachׇs aleykha vaomar lo-eshelach yadiy vadoniy khiy-meshiycha yehovah hu

Hebrew: וְאָבִ֣י רְאֵ֔ה גַּ֗ם רְאֵ֛ה אֶת־כְּנַ֥ף מְעִֽילְךָ֖ בְּיָדִ֑י כִּ֡י בְּכׇרְתִי֩ אֶת־כְּנַ֨ף מְעִֽילְךָ֜ וְלֹ֣א הֲרַגְתִּ֗יךָ דַּ֤ע וּרְאֵה֙ כִּי֩ אֵ֨ין בְּיָדִ֜י רָעָ֤ה וָפֶ֙שַׁע֙ וְלֹא־חָטָ֣אתִי לָ֔ךְ וְאַתָּ֛ה צֹדֶ֥ה אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י לְקַחְתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Please, sir, take a close look at the corner of your cloak in my hand; for when I cut off the corner of your cloak, I did not kill you. You must see plainly that I have done nothing evil or rebellious, and I have never wronged you. Yet you are bent on taking my life.
Transliteration: veaviy reeh gam reeh et-khenaf meiylekha veyadiy khiy vekhׇretiy et-khenaf meiylekha velo haragetiykha da ureeh khiy eyn veyadiy raah vafesha velo-chatatiy lakhe veatah tsodeh et-nafeshiy lekachetah

Hebrew: יִשְׁפֹּ֤ט יְהֹוָה֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֔ךָ וּנְקָמַ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה מִמֶּ֑ךָּ וְיָדִ֖י לֹ֥א תִֽהְיֶה־בָּֽךְ׃
Translated: May G<small>OD</small> judge between you and me! And may G<small>OD</small> take vengeance upon you for me; but my hand will never touch you.
Transliteration: yishefot yehovah veyniy uveynekha unekamaniy yehovah mimekha veyadiy lo tiheyeh-vakhe

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יֹאמַ֗ר מְשַׁל֙ הַקַּדְמֹנִ֔י מֵרְשָׁעִ֖ים יֵ֣צֵא רֶ֑שַׁע וְיָדִ֖י לֹ֥א תִֽהְיֶה־בָּֽךְ׃
Translated: As the ancient proverb has it: ‘Wickedness comes from the wicked!’ My hand will never touch you.
Transliteration: khaasher yomar meshal hakademoniy mereshaiym eitse resha veyadiy lo tiheyeh-vakhe

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֨י מִ֤י יָצָא֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַחֲרֵ֥י מִ֖י אַתָּ֣ה רֹדֵ֑ף אַֽחֲרֵי֙ כֶּ֣לֶב מֵ֔ת אַחֲרֵ֖י פַּרְעֹ֥שׁ אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Against whom has the king of Israel come out? Whom are you pursuing? A dead dog? A single flea?
Transliteration: acharey miy yatsa melekhe yisherael acharey miy atah rodef acharey khelev met acharey fareosh echad

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְדַיָּ֔ן וְשָׁפַ֖ט בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְיֵ֙רֶא֙ וְיָרֵ֣ב אֶת־רִיבִ֔י וְיִשְׁפְּטֵ֖נִי מִיָּדֶֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: May G<small>OD</small> be arbiter and judge between you and me! May [God] take note and uphold my cause, and vindicate me against you.”
Transliteration: vehayah yehovah ledayan veshafat veyniy uveynekha veeire veyarev et-riyviy veyishefeteniy miyadekha {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּכַלּ֣וֹת דָּוִ֗ד לְדַבֵּ֞ר אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁא֔וּל הֲקֹלְךָ֥ זֶ֖ה בְּנִ֣י דָוִ֑ד וַיִּשָּׂ֥א שָׁא֛וּל קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
Translated: When David finished saying these things to Saul, Saul said, “Is that your voice, my son David?” And Saul broke down and wept.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot david ledaver et-hadevariym haeleh el-shaul vayomer shaul hakolekha zeh veniy david vayisha shaul kolvo vayevekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד צַדִּ֥יק אַתָּ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נִּי כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ גְּמַלְתַּ֣נִי הַטּוֹבָ֔ה וַאֲנִ֖י גְּמַלְתִּ֥יךָ הָרָעָֽה׃
Translated: He said to David, “You are right, not I; for you have treated me generously, but I have treated you badly.
Transliteration: vayomer el-david tsadiyk atah mimeniy khiy atah gemaletaniy hatvovah vaaniy gemaletiykha haraah

Hebrew: (ואת) [וְאַתָּה֙] הִגַּ֣דְתָּ הַיּ֔וֹם אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתָה אִתִּ֖י טוֹבָ֑ה אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר סִגְּרַ֧נִי יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיָדְךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א הֲרַגְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated: Yes, you have just revealed how generously you treated me, for G<small>OD</small> delivered me into your hands and you did not kill me.
Transliteration: (vt) [veatah] higadeta hayyvom et asher-ashiytah itiy tvovah et asher sigeraniy yehovah veyadekha velo haragetaniy

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִמְצָ֥א אִישׁ֙ אֶת־אֹ֣יְב֔וֹ וְשִׁלְּח֖וֹ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ טוֹבָ֑ה וַֽיהֹוָה֙ יְשַׁלֶּמְךָ֣ טוֹבָ֔ה תַּ֚חַת הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתָה לִֽי׃
Translated: If a man meets his enemy, does he let him go his way unharmed? Surely, G<small>OD</small> will reward you generously for what you have done for me this day.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yimetsa iysh et-oyevvo veshilechvo vederekhe tvovah vayhovah yeshalemekha tvovah tachat hayyvom hazeh asher ashiytah liy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הִנֵּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י מָלֹ֖ךְ תִּמְל֑וֹךְ וְקָ֙מָה֙ בְּיָ֣דְךָ֔ מַמְלֶ֖כֶת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: I know now that you will become king, and that the kingship over Israel will remain in your hands.
Transliteration: veatah hineh yadaetiy khiy malokhe timelvokhe vekamah veyadekha mamelekhet yisherael

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִשָּׁ֤בְעָה לִּי֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה אִם־תַּכְרִ֥ית אֶת־זַרְעִ֖י אַחֲרָ֑י וְאִם־תַּשְׁמִ֥יד אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י מִבֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
Translated: So swear to me by G<small>OD</small> that you will not destroy my descendants or wipe out my name from my father’s house.”
Transliteration: veatah hishaveah liy vayhovah im-takheriyt et-zareiy acharay veim-tashemiyd et-shemiy miveyt aviy

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֥ע דָּוִ֖ד לְשָׁא֑וּל וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ וְדָוִד֙ וַאֲנָשָׁ֔יו עָל֖וּ עַל־הַמְּצוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: David swore to Saul, Saul went home, and David and his men went up to the strongholds.
Transliteration: vayishava david leshaul vayelekhe shaul el-veytvo vedavid vaanashayv alu al-hametsudah {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַיִּקָּבְצ֤וּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיִּסְפְּדוּ־ל֔וֹ וַיִּקְבְּרֻ֥הוּ בְּבֵית֖וֹ בָּרָמָ֑ה וַיָּ֣קׇם דָּוִ֔ד וַיֵּ֖רֶד אֶל־מִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Samuel died, and all Israel gathered and made lament for him; and they buried him in Ramah, his home.
David went down to the wilderness of Paran.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shemuel vayikavetsu khׇl-yisherael vayisefedu-lvo vayikeveruhu veveytvo varamah vayakׇm david vayered el-midevar faran {f}

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ בְּמָע֜וֹן וּמַעֲשֵׂ֣הוּ בַכַּרְמֶ֗ל וְהָאִישׁ֙ גָּד֣וֹל מְאֹ֔ד וְל֛וֹ צֹ֥אן שְׁלֹשֶׁת־אֲלָפִ֖ים וְאֶ֣לֶף עִזִּ֑ים וַיְהִ֛י בִּגְזֹ֥ז אֶת־צֹאנ֖וֹ בַּכַּרְמֶֽל׃
Translated: There was a man in Maon whose possessions were in Carmel. The man was very wealthy; he owned three thousand sheep and a thousand goats. At the time, he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
Transliteration: veiysh vemavon umaashehu vakharemel vehaiysh gadvol meod velvo tson sheloshet-alafiym veelef iziym vayehiy vigezoz et-tsonvo vakharemel

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֤ם הָאִישׁ֙ נָבָ֔ל וְשֵׁ֥ם אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֲבִגָ֑יִל וְהָאִשָּׁ֤ה טֽוֹבַת־שֶׂ֙כֶל֙ וִ֣יפַת תֹּ֔אַר וְהָאִ֥ישׁ קָשֶׁ֛ה וְרַ֥ע מַעֲלָלִ֖ים וְה֥וּא (כלבו) [כָֽלִבִּֽי]׃
Translated: The man’s name was Nabal, and his wife’s name was Abigail. The woman was intelligent and beautiful, but the man, a Calebite, was harsh and an evildoer.
Transliteration: veshem haiysh naval veshem ishetvo avigayiil vehaishah tvovat-shekhel viyfat toar vehaiysh kasheh vera maalaliym vehu (khlvv) [khaliviy]

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע דָּוִ֖ד בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּי־גֹזֵ֥ז נָבָ֖ל אֶת־צֹאנֽוֹ׃
Translated: David was in the wilderness when he heard that Nabal was shearing his sheep.
Transliteration: vayishema david vamidevar khiy-gozez naval et-tsonvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח דָּוִ֖ד עֲשָׂרָ֣ה נְעָרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד לַנְּעָרִ֗ים עֲל֤וּ כַרְמֶ֙לָה֙ וּבָאתֶ֣ם אֶל־נָבָ֔ל וּשְׁאֶלְתֶּם־ל֥וֹ בִשְׁמִ֖י לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: David dispatched ten young men, and David instructed the young men, “Go up to Carmel. When you come to Nabal, greet him in my name.
Transliteration: vayishelach david asharah neariym vayomer david laneariym alu kharemelah uvatem el-naval usheeletem-lvo vishemiy leshalvom

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֥ם כֹּ֖ה לֶחָ֑י וְאַתָּ֤ה שָׁלוֹם֙ וּבֵיתְךָ֣ שָׁל֔וֹם וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֖ שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Say as follows: ‘To life! Greetings to you and to your household and to all that is yours!
Transliteration: vaamaretem khoh lechay veatah shalvom uveytekha shalvom vekhol asher-lekha shalvom

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה שָׁמַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י גֹזְזִ֖ים לָ֑ךְ עַתָּ֗ה הָרֹעִ֤ים אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֙ הָי֣וּ עִמָּ֔נוּ לֹ֣א הֶכְלַמְנ֗וּם וְלֹֽא־נִפְקַ֤ד לָהֶם֙ מְא֔וּמָה כׇּל־יְמֵ֖י הֱיוֹתָ֥ם בַּכַּרְמֶֽל׃
Translated: I hear that you are now doing your shearing. As you know, your shepherds have been with us; we did not harm them, and nothing of theirs was missing all the time they were in Carmel.
Transliteration: veatah shamaetiy khiy gozeziym lakhe atah haroiym asher-lekha hayu imanu lo hekhelamenum velo-nifekad lahem meumah khׇl-yemey heyvotam vakharemel

Hebrew: שְׁאַ֨ל אֶת־נְעָרֶ֜יךָ וְיַגִּ֣ידוּ לָ֗ךְ וְיִמְצְא֨וּ הַנְּעָרִ֥ים חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־עַל־י֥וֹם ט֖וֹב בָּ֑נוּ תְּנָה־נָּ֗א אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּמְצָ֤א יָֽדְךָ֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ וּלְבִנְךָ֖ לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: Ask your young men and they will tell you. So receive these young men graciously, for we have come on a festive occasion. Please give your servants and your son David whatever you can.’”
Transliteration: sheal et-neareykha veyagiydu lakhe veyimetseu haneariym chen veeyneykha khiy-al-yvom tvov vanu tenah-na et asher timetsa yadekha laavadeykha ulevinekha ledavid

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ נַעֲרֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד וַיְדַבְּר֧וּ אֶל־נָבָ֛ל כְּכׇל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בְּשֵׁ֣ם דָּוִ֑ד וַיָּנֽוּחוּ׃
Translated: David’s young men went and delivered this message to Nabal in the name of David. When they stopped speaking,
Transliteration: vayavou naarey david vayedaveru el-naval khekhׇl-hadevariym haeleh veshem david vayanuchu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן נָבָ֜ל אֶת־עַבְדֵ֤י דָוִד֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר מִ֥י דָוִ֖ד וּמִ֣י בֶן־יִשָׁ֑י הַיּוֹם֙ רַבּ֣וּ עֲבָדִ֔ים הַמִּתְפָּ֣רְצִ֔ים אִ֖ישׁ מִפְּנֵ֥י אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated: Nabal answered David’s servants, “Who is David? Who is the son of Jesse? There are many slaves nowadays who run away from their masters.
Transliteration: vayaan naval et-avedey david vayomer miy david umiy ven-yishay hayyvom ravu avadiym hamitefaretsiym iysh mifeney adonayv

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתִּ֤י אֶת־לַחְמִי֙ וְאֶת־מֵימַ֔י וְאֵת֙ טִבְחָתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר טָבַ֖חְתִּי לְגֹֽזְזָ֑י וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ לַאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי אֵ֥י מִזֶּ֖ה הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: Should I then take my bread and my water, and the meat that I slaughtered for my own shearers, and give them to men who come from I don’t know where?”
Transliteration: velakachetiy et-lachemiy veet-meymay veet tivechatiy asher tavachetiy legozezay venatatiy laanashiym asher lo yadaetiy ey mizeh hemah

Hebrew: וַיַּהַפְכ֥וּ נַעֲרֵֽי־דָוִ֖ד לְדַרְכָּ֑ם וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ וַיָּבֹ֔אוּ וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ ל֔וֹ כְּכֹ֖ל הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Thereupon David’s young men retraced their steps; and when they got back, they told him all this.
Transliteration: vayahafekhu naarey-david ledarekham vayashuvu vayavou vayagidu lvo khekhol hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ דָּוִ֨ד לַאֲנָשָׁ֜יו חִגְר֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־חַרְבּ֗וֹ וַֽיַּחְגְּרוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־חַרְבּ֔וֹ וַיַּחְגֹּ֥ר גַּם־דָּוִ֖ד אֶת־חַרְבּ֑וֹ וַֽיַּעֲל֣וּ ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י דָוִ֗ד כְּאַרְבַּ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ אִ֔ישׁ וּמָאתַ֖יִם יָשְׁב֥וּ עַל־הַכֵּלִֽים׃
Translated: And David said to his men, “Gird on your swords.” Each girded on his sword; David too girded on his sword. About four hundred of them went up after David, while two hundred remained with the baggage.
Transliteration: vayomer david laanashayv chigeru iysh et-charevvo vayachegeru iysh et-charevvo vayachegor gam-david et-charevvo vayaalu acharey david kheareva mevot iysh umatayiim yashevu al-hakheliym

Hebrew: וְלַאֲבִיגַ֙יִל֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת נָבָ֔ל הִגִּ֧יד נַֽעַר־אֶחָ֛ד מֵהַנְּעָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֣ה שָׁלַח֩ דָּוִ֨ד מַלְאָכִ֧ים <small>׀</small> מֵהַמִּדְבָּ֛ר לְבָרֵ֥ךְ אֶת־אֲדֹנֵ֖ינוּ וַיָּ֥עַט בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: One of [Nabal’s] young men told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, that David had sent messengers from the wilderness to greet their master, and that he had spurned them.
Transliteration: velaaviygayiil eshet naval higiyd naar-echad mehaneariym lemor hineh shalach david maleakhiym <small></small> mehamidevar levarekhe et-adoneynu vayaat vahem

Hebrew: וְהָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים טֹבִ֥ים לָ֖נוּ מְאֹ֑ד וְלֹ֤א הׇכְלַ֙מְנוּ֙ וְלֹֽא־פָקַ֣דְנֽוּ מְא֔וּמָה כׇּל־יְמֵי֙ הִתְהַלַּ֣כְנוּ אִתָּ֔ם בִּֽהְיוֹתֵ֖נוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: “But those involved had been very friendly to us; we were not harmed, nor did we miss anything all the time that we went about with them while we were in the open.
Transliteration: vehaanashiym toviym lanu meod velo hׇkhelamenu velo-fakadenu meumah khׇl-yemey hitehalakhenu itam viheyvotenu vashadeh

Hebrew: חוֹמָה֙ הָי֣וּ עָלֵ֔ינוּ גַּם־לַ֖יְלָה גַּם־יוֹמָ֑ם כׇּל־יְמֵ֛י הֱיוֹתֵ֥נוּ עִמָּ֖ם רֹעִ֥ים הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: They were a wall about us both by night and by day all the time that we were with them tending the flocks.
Transliteration: chvomah hayu aleynu gam-layelah gam-yvomam khׇl-yemey heyvotenu imam roiym hatson

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה דְּעִ֤י וּרְאִי֙ מַֽה־תַּעֲשִׂ֔י כִּֽי־כָלְתָ֧ה הָרָעָ֛ה אֶל־אֲדֹנֵ֖ינוּ וְעַ֣ל כׇּל־בֵּית֑וֹ וְהוּא֙ בֶּן־בְּלִיַּ֔עַל מִדַּבֵּ֖ר אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: So consider carefully what you should do, for harm threatens our master and all his household; he is such a nasty fellow that no one can speak to him.”
Transliteration: veatah deiy ureiy mah-taashiy khiy-khaletah haraah el-adoneynu veal khׇl-veytvo vehu ven-veliyaal midaver elayv

Hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵ֣ר (אבוגיל) [אֲבִיגַ֡יִל] וַתִּקַּח֩ מָאתַ֨יִם לֶ֜חֶם וּשְׁנַ֣יִם נִבְלֵי־יַ֗יִן וְחָמֵ֨שׁ צֹ֤אן (עשוות) [עֲשׂוּיוֹת֙] וְחָמֵ֤שׁ סְאִים֙ קָלִ֔י וּמֵאָ֥ה צִמֻּקִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם דְּבֵלִ֑ים וַתָּ֖שֶׂם עַל־הַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
Translated: Abigail quickly got together two hundred loaves of bread, two jars of wine, five dressed sheep, five seahs of parched corn, one hundred cakes of raisin, and two hundred cakes of pressed figs. She loaded them on donkeys,
Transliteration: vatemaher (vvgyl) [aviygayiil] vatikach matayiim lechem ushenayiim niveley-yayiin vechamesh tson (shvvt) [ashuyvot] vechamesh seiym kaliy umeah tsimukiym umatayiim develiym vatashem al-hachamoriym

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לִנְעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ עִבְר֣וּ לְפָנַ֔י הִנְנִ֖י אַחֲרֵיכֶ֣ם בָּאָ֑ה וּלְאִישָׁ֥הּ נָבָ֖ל לֹ֥א הִגִּֽידָה׃
Translated: and she told her young men, “Go on ahead of me, and I’ll follow you”; but she did not tell her husband Nabal.
Transliteration: vatomer lineareyha iveru lefanay hineniy achareykhem vaah uleiyshah naval lo higiydah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה הִ֣יא ׀ רֹכֶ֣בֶת עַֽל־הַחֲמ֗וֹר וְיֹרֶ֙דֶת֙ בְּסֵ֣תֶר הָהָ֔ר וְהִנֵּ֤ה דָוִד֙ וַאֲנָשָׁ֔יו יֹרְדִ֖ים לִקְרָאתָ֑הּ וַתִּפְגֹ֖שׁ אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: She was riding on the donkey and going down a trail on the hill, when David and his men appeared, coming down toward her; and she met them.—
Transliteration: vehayah hiy rokhevet al-hachamvor veyoredet veseter hahar vehineh david vaanashayv yorediym likeratah vatifegosh otam

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֣ד אָמַ֗ר אַךְ֩ לַשֶּׁ֨קֶר שָׁמַ֜רְתִּי אֶֽת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר לָזֶה֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְלֹא־נִפְקַ֥ד מִכׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ מְא֑וּמָה וַיָּשֶׁב־לִ֥י רָעָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: Now David had been saying, “It was all for nothing that I protected that fellow’s possessions in the wilderness, and that nothing he owned is missing. He has paid me back evil for good.
Transliteration: vedavid amar akhe lasheker shamaretiy et-khׇl-asher lazeh vamidevar velo-nifekad mikhׇl-asher-lvo meumah vayashev-liy raah tachat tvovah

Hebrew: כֹּה־יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים לְאֹיְבֵ֥י דָוִ֖ד וְכֹ֣ה יֹסִ֑יף אִם־אַשְׁאִ֧יר מִכׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ עַד־הַבֹּ֖קֶר מַשְׁתִּ֥ין בְּקִֽיר׃
Translated: May God do thus and more to the enemies of David if, by the light of morning, I leave a single male of his.”—
Transliteration: khoh-yaasheh Elohim leoyevey david vekhoh yosiyf im-asheiyr mikhׇl-asher-lvo ad-havoker mashetiyn vekiyr

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶא אֲבִיגַ֙יִל֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֔ד וַתְּמַהֵ֕ר וַתֵּ֖רֶד מֵעַ֣ל הַחֲמ֑וֹר וַתִּפֹּ֞ל לְאַפֵּ֤י דָוִד֙ עַל־פָּנֶ֔יהָ וַתִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: When Abigail saw David, she quickly dismounted from the donkey and threw herself face down before David, bowing to the ground.
Transliteration: vatere aviygayiil et-david vatemaher vatered meal hachamvor vatifol leafey david al-faneyha vatishetachu arets

Hebrew: וַתִּפֹּל֙ עַל־רַגְלָ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר בִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י הֶעָוֺ֑ן וּֽתְדַבֶּר־נָ֤א אֲמָֽתְךָ֙ בְּאׇזְנֶ֔יךָ וּשְׁמַ֕ע אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י אֲמָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Prostrate at his feet, she pleaded, “Let the blame be mine, my lord, but let your handmaid speak to you; hear your maid’s plea.
Transliteration: vatifol al-ragelayv vatomer viy-aniy adoniy heavon utedaver-na amatekha veׇzeneykha ushema et diverey amatekha

Hebrew: אַל־נָ֣א יָשִׂ֣ים אֲדֹנִ֣י <small>׀</small> אֶת־לִבּ֡וֹ אֶל־אִישׁ֩ הַבְּלִיַּ֨עַל הַזֶּ֜ה עַל־נָבָ֗ל כִּ֤י כִשְׁמוֹ֙ כֶּן־ה֔וּא נָבָ֣ל שְׁמ֔וֹ וּנְבָלָ֖ה עִמּ֑וֹ וַֽאֲנִי֙ אֲמָ֣תְךָ֔ לֹ֥א רָאִ֛יתִי אֶת־נַעֲרֵ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁלָֽחְתָּ׃
Translated:
Please, my lord, pay no attention to that wretched man—to Nabal. For he is just what his name says: His name means ‘boor’ and he is a boor.
“Your handmaid did not see the young men whom my lord sent.
Transliteration: al-na yashiym adoniy <small></small> et-livvo el-iysh haveliyaal hazeh al-naval khiy khishemvo khen-hu naval shemvo unevalah imvo vaaniy amatekha lo raiytiy et-naarey adoniy asher shalacheta

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה אֲדֹנִ֗י חַי־יְהֹוָ֤ה וְחֵֽי־נַפְשְׁךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר מְנָעֲךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ מִבּ֣וֹא בְדָמִ֔ים וְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ יָדְךָ֖ לָ֑ךְ וְעַתָּ֗ה יִֽהְי֤וּ כְנָבָל֙ אֹֽיְבֶ֔יךָ וְהַֽמְבַקְשִׁ֥ים אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י רָעָֽה׃
Translated: I swear, my lord, as G<small>OD</small> lives and as you live—G<small>OD</small> who has kept you from seeking redress by blood with your own hands—let your enemies and all who would harm my lord fare like Nabal!
Transliteration: veatah adoniy chay-yehovah vechey-nafeshekha asher menaakha yehovah mivvo vedamiym vehvoshea yadekha lakhe veatah yiheyu khenaval oyeveykha vehamevakeshiym el-adoniy raah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הַבְּרָכָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֥יא שִׁפְחָתְךָ֖ לַֽאדֹנִ֑י וְנִתְּנָה֙ לַנְּעָרִ֔ים הַמִּֽתְהַלְּכִ֖ים בְּרַגְלֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: Here is the present that your maidservant has brought to my lord; let it be given to the young men who are the followers of my lord.
Transliteration: veatah haverakhah hazot asher-heviy shifechatekha ladoniy venitenah laneariym hamitehalekhiym verageley adoniy

Hebrew: שָׂ֥א נָ֖א לְפֶ֣שַׁע אֲמָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֣י עָשֹֽׂה־יַעֲשֶׂה֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לַאדֹנִ֜י בַּ֣יִת נֶאֱמָ֗ן כִּֽי־מִלְחֲמ֤וֹת יְהֹוָה֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י נִלְחָ֔ם וְרָעָ֛ה לֹא־תִמָּצֵ֥א בְךָ֖ מִיָּמֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Please pardon your maid’s boldness. For G<small>OD</small> will grant my lord an enduring house, because my lord is fighting G<small>OD</small>’s battles and no wrong is ever to be found in you.
Transliteration: sha na lefesha amatekha khiy ashoh-yaasheh yehovah ladoniy vayiit neeman khiy-milechamvot yehovah adoniy nilecham veraah lo-timatse vekha miyameykha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קׇם אָדָם֙ לִרְדׇפְךָ֔ וּלְבַקֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְֽהָיְתָה֩ נֶ֨פֶשׁ אֲדֹנִ֜י צְרוּרָ֣ה ׀ בִּצְר֣וֹר הַחַיִּ֗ים אֵ֚ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְאֵ֨ת נֶ֤פֶשׁ אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ יְקַלְּעֶ֔נָּה בְּת֖וֹךְ כַּ֥ף הַקָּֽלַע׃
Translated: And if anyone sets out to pursue you and seek your life, the life of my lord will be bound up in the bundle of life in the care of G<small>OD</small>—who will fling away the lives of your enemies as from the hollow of a sling.
Transliteration: vayakׇm adam liredׇfekha ulevakesh et-nafeshekha vehayetah nefesh adoniy tserurah vitservor hachayiym et yehovah eloheykha veet nefesh oyeveykha yekaleenah vetvokhe khaf hakala

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֶת־הַטּוֹבָ֖ה עָלֶ֑יךָ וְצִוְּךָ֥ לְנָגִ֖יד עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And when G<small>OD</small> has accomplished for my lord all the good promised to you, and has appointed you ruler of Israel,
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yaasheh yehovah ladoniy khekhol asher-diver et-hatvovah aleykha vetsivekha lenagiyd al-yisherael

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א תִהְיֶ֣ה זֹ֣את ׀ לְךָ֡ לְפוּקָה֩ וּלְמִכְשׁ֨וֹל לֵ֜ב לַאדֹנִ֗י וְלִשְׁפׇּךְ־דָּם֙ חִנָּ֔ם וּלְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֲדֹנִ֖י ל֑וֹ וְהֵיטִ֤ב יְהֹוָה֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י וְזָכַרְתָּ֖ אֶת־אֲמָתֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: do not let this be a cause of stumbling and of faltering courage to my lord that you have shed blood needlessly and that my lord sought redress with his own hands. And when G<small>OD</small> has made my lord prosper, remember your maid.”
Transliteration: velo tiheyeh zot lekha lefukah ulemikheshvol lev ladoniy velishefׇkhe-dam chinam ulehvoshiya adoniy lvo veheytiv yehovah ladoniy vezakhareta et-amatekha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר דָּוִ֖ד לַאֲבִיגַ֑ל בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר שְׁלָחֵ֛ךְ הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לִקְרָאתִֽי׃
Translated: David said to Abigail, “Praised be G<small>OD</small>, the God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me!
Transliteration: vayomer david laaviygal varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael asher shelachekhe hayyvom hazeh likeratiy

Hebrew: וּבָר֥וּךְ טַעְמֵ֖ךְ וּבְרוּכָ֣ה אָ֑תְּ אֲשֶׁ֨ר כְּלִתִ֜נִי הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ מִבּ֣וֹא בְדָמִ֔ים וְהֹשֵׁ֥עַ יָדִ֖י לִֽי׃
Translated: And blessed be your prudence, and blessed be you yourself for restraining me from seeking redress in blood by my own hands.
Transliteration: uvarukhe taemekhe uverukhah ate asher khelitiniy hayyvom hazeh mivvo vedamiym vehoshea yadiy liy

Hebrew: וְאוּלָ֗ם חַי־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר מְנָעַ֔נִי מֵהָרַ֖ע אֹתָ֑ךְ כִּ֣י ׀ לוּלֵ֣י מִהַ֗רְתְּ (ותבאתי) [וַתָּבֹאת֙] לִקְרָאתִ֔י כִּ֣י אִם־נוֹתַ֧ר לְנָבָ֛ל עַד־א֥וֹר הַבֹּ֖קֶר מַשְׁתִּ֥ין בְּקִֽיר׃
Translated: For as sure as G<small>OD</small>, the God of Israel, lives—who has kept me from harming you—had you not come quickly to meet me, not a single male of Nabal’s line would have been left by daybreak.”
Transliteration: veulam chay-yehovah elohey yisherael asher menaaniy mehara otakhe khiy luley miharete (vtvty) [vatavot] likeratiy khiy im-nvotar lenaval ad-vor havoker mashetiyn vekiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח דָּוִד֙ מִיָּדָ֔הּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־הֵבִ֖יאָה ל֑וֹ וְלָ֣הּ אָמַ֗ר עֲלִ֤י לְשָׁלוֹם֙ לְבֵיתֵ֔ךְ רְאִי֙ שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי בְקוֹלֵ֔ךְ וָאֶשָּׂ֖א פָּנָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: David then accepted from her what she had brought him, and he said to her, “Go up to your home safely. See, I have heeded your plea and respected your wish.”
Transliteration: vayikach david miyadah et asher-heviyah lvo velah amar aliy leshalvom leveytekhe reiy shamaetiy vekvolekhe vaesha fanayiikhe

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֣א אֲבִיגַ֣יִל <small>׀</small> אֶל־נָבָ֡ל וְהִנֵּה־לוֹ֩ מִשְׁתֶּ֨ה בְּבֵית֜וֹ כְּמִשְׁתֵּ֣ה הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וְלֵ֤ב נָבָל֙ ט֣וֹב עָלָ֔יו וְה֥וּא שִׁכֹּ֖ר עַד־מְאֹ֑ד וְלֹא־הִגִּ֣ידָה לּ֗וֹ דָּבָ֥ר קָטֹ֛ן וְגָד֖וֹל עַד־א֥וֹר הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: When Abigail came home to Nabal, he was having a feast in his house, a feast fit for a king; Nabal was in a merry mood and very drunk, so she did not tell him anything at all until daybreak.
Transliteration: vatavo aviygayiil <small></small> el-naval vehineh-lvo misheteh veveytvo khemisheteh hamelekhe velev naval tvov alayv vehu shikhor ad-meod velo-higiydah lvo davar katon vegadvol ad-vor havoker

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֗קֶר בְּצֵ֤את הַיַּ֙יִן֙ מִנָּבָ֔ל וַתַּגֶּד־ל֣וֹ אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיָּ֤מׇת לִבּוֹ֙ בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ וְה֖וּא הָיָ֥ה לְאָֽבֶן׃
Translated: The next morning, when Nabal had slept off the wine, his wife told him everything that had happened; and his courage died within him, and he became like a stone.
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vetset hayayiin minaval vataged-lvo ishetvo et-hadevariym haeleh vayamׇt livvo vekirevvo vehu hayah leaven

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י כַּעֲשֶׂ֣רֶת הַיָּמִ֑ים וַיִּגֹּ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־נָבָ֖ל וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: About ten days later G<small>OD</small> struck Nabal and he died.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasheret hayamiym vayigof yehovah et-naval vayamot

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע דָּוִד֮ כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת נָבָל֒ וַיֹּ֡אמֶר בָּר֣וּךְ יְהֹוָ֡ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָב֩ אֶת־רִ֨יב חֶרְפָּתִ֜י מִיַּ֣ד נָבָ֗ל וְאֶת־עַבְדּוֹ֙ חָשַׂ֣ךְ מֵרָעָ֔ה וְאֵת֙ רָעַ֣ת נָבָ֔ל הֵשִׁ֥יב יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּרֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח דָּוִד֙ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר בַּאֲבִיגַ֔יִל לְקַחְתָּ֥הּ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated:
When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, “Praised be GOD who championed my cause against the insults of Nabal and held me back from wrongdoing; GOD has brought Nabal’s wrongdoing down on his own head.”
David sent messengers to propose marriage to Abigail, to take her as his wife.
Transliteration: vayishema david khiy met naval vayomer varukhe yehovah asher rav et-riyv cherefatiy miyad naval veet-avedvo chashakhe meraah veet raat naval heshiyv yehovah veroshvo vayishelach david vayedaver vaaviygayiil lekachetah lvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עַבְדֵ֥י דָוִ֛ד אֶל־אֲבִיגַ֖יִל הַכַּרְמֶ֑לָה וַיְדַבְּר֤וּ אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר דָּוִד֙ שְׁלָחָ֣נוּ אֵלַ֔יִךְ לְקַחְתֵּ֥ךְ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: When David’s servants came to Abigail at Carmel and told her that David had sent them to her to make her his wife,
Transliteration: vayavou avedey david el-aviygayiil hakharemelah vayedaveru eleyha lemor david shelachanu elayiikhe lekachetekhe lvo leishah

Hebrew: וַתָּ֕קׇם וַתִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַפַּ֖יִם אָ֑רְצָה וַתֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה אֲמָֽתְךָ֙ לְשִׁפְחָ֔ה לִרְחֹ֕ץ רַגְלֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: she immediately bowed low with her face to the ground and said, “Your handmaid is ready to be your maidservant, to wash the feet of my lord’s servants.”
Transliteration: vatakׇm vatishetachu afayiim aretsah vatomer hineh amatekha leshifechah lirechots rageley avedey adoniy

Hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵ֞ר וַתָּ֣קׇם אֲבִיגַ֗יִל וַתִּרְכַּב֙ עַֽל־הַחֲמ֔וֹר וְחָמֵשׁ֙ נַעֲרֹתֶ֔יהָ הַהֹלְכ֖וֹת לְרַגְלָ֑הּ וַתֵּ֗לֶךְ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ מַלְאֲכֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד וַתְּהִי־ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Then Abigail rose quickly and mounted a donkey, and with five of her maids in attendance she followed David’s messengers; and she became his wife.
Transliteration: vatemaher vatakׇm aviygayiil vatirekhav al-hachamvor vechamesh naaroteyha haholekhvot leragelah vatelekhe acharey maleakhey david vatehiy-lvo leishah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲחִינֹ֛עַם לָקַ֥ח דָּוִ֖ד מִֽיִּזְרְעֶ֑אל וַתִּהְיֶ֛יןָ גַּֽם־שְׁתֵּיהֶ֥ן ל֖וֹ לְנָשִֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: Now David had taken Ahinoam of Jezreel; so both of them became his wives.
Transliteration: veet-achiynoam lakach david miyizereel vatiheyeyna gam-sheteyhen lvo lenashiym {s}

Hebrew: וְשָׁא֗וּל נָתַ֛ן אֶת־מִיכַ֥ל בִּתּ֖וֹ אֵ֣שֶׁת דָּוִ֑ד לְפַלְטִ֥י בֶן־לַ֖יִשׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִגַּלִּֽים׃
Translated: Saul had given his daughter Michal, David’s wife, to Palti son of Laish from Gallim.
Transliteration: veshaul natan et-miykhal vitvo eshet david lefaletiy ven-layiish asher migaliym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ הַזִּפִים֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל הַגִּבְעָ֖תָה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲל֨וֹא דָוִ֤ד מִסְתַּתֵּר֙ בְּגִבְעַ֣ת הַחֲכִילָ֔ה עַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הַיְשִׁימֹֽן׃
Translated: The Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah and said, “David is hiding in the hill of Hachilah facing Jeshimon.”
Transliteration: vayavou hazifiym el-shaul hagiveatah lemor halvo david misetater vegiveat hachakhiylah al feney hayeshiymon

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם שָׁא֗וּל וַיֵּ֙רֶד֙ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־זִ֔יף וְאִתּ֛וֹ שְׁלֹשֶׁת־אֲלָפִ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ בְּחוּרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־דָּוִ֖ד בְּמִדְבַּר־זִֽיף׃
Translated: Saul went down at once to the wilderness of Ziph, together with three thousand of Israel’s best troops, to search for David in the wilderness of Ziph,
