Transliteration: vayakׇm shaul vayered el-midevar-ziyf veitvo sheloshet-alafiym iysh vechurey yisherael levakesh et-david vemidevar-ziyf

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨חַן שָׁא֜וּל בְּגִבְעַ֣ת הַחֲכִילָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֛ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיְשִׁימֹ֖ן עַל־הַדָּ֑רֶךְ וְדָוִד֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיַּ֕רְא כִּ֣י בָ֥א שָׁא֛וּל אַחֲרָ֖יו הַמִּדְבָּֽרָה׃
Translated: and Saul encamped on the hill of Hachilah that faces Jeshimon, by the road. When David, who was then living in the wilderness, learned that Saul had come after him into the wilderness,
Transliteration: vayichan shaul vegiveat hachakhiylah asher al-feney hayeshiymon al-hadarekhe vedavid yoshev vamidevar vayare khiy va shaul acharayv hamidevarah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח דָּוִ֖ד מְרַגְּלִ֑ים וַיֵּ֕דַע כִּי־בָ֥א שָׁא֖וּל אֶל־נָכֽוֹן׃
Translated: David sent out scouts and made sure that Saul had come.
Transliteration: vayishelach david merageliym vayeda khiy-va shaul el-nakhvon

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם דָּוִ֗ד וַיָּבֹא֮ אֶֽל־הַמָּקוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָנָה־שָׁ֣ם שָׁאוּל֒ וַיַּ֣רְא דָּוִ֗ד אֶת־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁכַב־שָׁ֣ם שָׁא֔וּל וְאַבְנֵ֥ר בֶּן־נֵ֖ר שַׂר־צְבָא֑וֹ וְשָׁאוּל֙ שֹׁכֵ֣ב בַּמַּעְגָּ֔ל וְהָעָ֖ם חֹנִ֥ים סְבִיבֹתָֽו׃
Translated: David went at once to the place where Saul had encamped, and David saw the spot where Saul and his army commander, Abner son of Ner, lay asleep. Saul lay asleep inside the barricade and the troops were posted around him.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david vayavo el-hamakvom asher chanah-sham shaul vayare david et-hamakvom asher shakhav-sham shaul veavener ven-ner shar-tsevavo veshaul shokhev vamaegal vehaam choniym seviyvotav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן דָּוִ֜ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ אֶל־אֲחִימֶ֣לֶךְ הַחִתִּ֗י וְאֶל־אֲבִישַׁ֨י בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֜ה אֲחִ֤י יוֹאָב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מִֽי־יֵרֵ֥ד אִתִּ֛י אֶל־שָׁא֖וּל אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִישַׁ֔י אֲנִ֖י אֵרֵ֥ד עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: David spoke up and asked Ahimelech the Hittite and Abishai son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, “Who will go down with me into the camp to Saul?” And Abishai answered, “I will go down with you.”
Transliteration: vayaan david vayomer el-achiymelekhe hachitiy veel-aviyshay ven-tseruyah achiy yvoav lemor miy-eired itiy el-shaul el-hamachaneh vayomer aviyshay aniy ered imakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ דָוִ֨ד וַאֲבִישַׁ֥י ׀ אֶל־הָעָם֮ לַ֒יְלָה֒ וְהִנֵּ֣ה שָׁא֗וּל שֹׁכֵ֤ב יָשֵׁן֙ בַּמַּעְגָּ֔ל וַחֲנִית֥וֹ מְעוּכָֽה־בָאָ֖רֶץ מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֑ו וְאַבְנֵ֣ר וְהָעָ֔ם שֹׁכְבִ֖ים סְבִיבֹתָֽו׃ {ס}
Translated: So David and Abishai approached the troops by night, and found Saul fast asleep inside the barricade, his spear stuck in the ground at his head, and Abner and the troops sleeping around him.
Transliteration: vayavo david vaaviyshay el-haam layelah vehineh shaul shokhev yashen vamaegal vachaniytvo meukhah-vaarets meraashotav veavener vehaam shokheviym seviyvotav {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲבִישַׁי֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד סִגַּ֨ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים הַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־אוֹיִבְךָ֖ בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְעַתָּה֩ אַכֶּ֨נּוּ נָ֜א בַּחֲנִ֤ית וּבָאָ֙רֶץ֙ פַּ֣עַם אַחַ֔ת וְלֹ֥א אֶשְׁנֶ֖ה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Abishai said to David, “God has delivered your enemy into your hands today. Let me pin him to the ground with a single thrust of the spear. I will not have to strike him twice.”
Transliteration: vayomer aviyshay el-david sigar Elohim hayyvom et-voyivekha veyadekha veatah akhenu na vachaniyt uvaarets faam achat velo esheneh lvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר דָּוִ֛ד אֶל־אֲבִישַׁ֖י אַל־תַּשְׁחִיתֵ֑הוּ כִּ֠י מִ֣י שָׁלַ֥ח יָד֛וֹ בִּמְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה וְנִקָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But David said to Abishai, “Don’t do him violence! No one can lay hands on G<small>OD</small>’s anointed with impunity.”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-aviyshay al-tashechiytehu khiy miy shalach yadvo vimeshiycha yehovah venikah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ חַי־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י אִם־יְהֹוָ֖ה יִגֳּפֶ֑נּוּ אֽוֹ־יוֹמ֤וֹ יָבוֹא֙ וָמֵ֔ת א֧וֹ בַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה יֵרֵ֖ד וְנִסְפָּֽה׃
Translated: And David went on, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, G<small>OD</small> will strike him down directly, or his time will come and he will die, or he will go down to battle and perish.
Transliteration: vayomer david chay-yehovah khiy im-yehovah yigofenu vo-yvomvo yavvo vamet vo vamilechamah eired venisefah

Hebrew: חָלִ֤ילָה לִּי֙ מֵיְהֹוָ֔ה מִשְּׁלֹ֥חַ יָדִ֖י בִּמְשִׁ֣יחַ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה קַח־נָ֨א אֶֽת־הַחֲנִ֜ית אֲשֶׁ֧ר מְרַאֲשֹׁתָ֛ו וְאֶת־צַפַּ֥חַת הַמַּ֖יִם וְנֵלְכָה־לָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> forbid that I should lay a hand on G<small>OD</small>’s anointed! Just take the spear and the water jar at his head and let’s be off.”
Transliteration: chaliylah liy meyehovah mishelocha yadiy vimeshiycha yehovah veatah kach-na et-hachaniyt asher meraashotav veet-tsafachat hamayiim venelekhah-lanu

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶֽת־הַחֲנִ֜ית וְאֶת־צַפַּ֤חַת הַמַּ֙יִם֙ מֵרַאֲשֹׁתֵ֣י שָׁא֔וּל וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֣ין רֹאֶה֩ וְאֵ֨ין יוֹדֵ֜עַ וְאֵ֣ין מֵקִ֗יץ כִּ֤י כֻלָּם֙ יְשֵׁנִ֔ים כִּ֚י תַּרְדֵּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה נָפְלָ֖ה עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So David took away the spear and the water jar at Saul’s head, and they left. No one saw or knew or woke up; all remained asleep; a deep sleep from G<small>OD</small> had fallen upon them.
Transliteration: vayikach david et-hachaniyt veet-tsafachat hamayiim meraashotey shaul vayelekhu lahem veeyn roeh veeyn yvodea veeyn mekiyts khiy khulam yesheniym khiy taredemat yehovah nafelah aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר דָּוִד֙ הָעֵ֔בֶר וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד עַל־רֹאשׁ־הָהָ֖ר מֵרָחֹ֑ק רַ֥ב הַמָּק֖וֹם בֵּינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: David crossed over to the other side and stood afar on top of a hill; there was considerable distance between them.
Transliteration: vayaavor david haever vayaamod al-rosh-hahar merachok rav hamakvom veyneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א דָוִ֜ד אֶל־הָעָ֗ם וְאֶל־אַבְנֵ֤ר בֶּן־נֵר֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲל֥וֹא תַעֲנֶ֖ה אַבְנֵ֑ר וַיַּ֤עַן אַבְנֵר֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר מִ֥י אַתָּ֖ה קָרָ֥אתָ אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: And David shouted to the troops and to Abner son of Ner, “Abner, aren’t you going to answer?” And Abner shouted back, “Who are you to shout at the king?”
Transliteration: vayikera david el-haam veel-avener ven-ner lemor halvo taaneh avener vayaan avener vayomer miy atah karata el-hamelekhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶל־אַבְנֵ֜ר הֲלוֹא־אִ֣ישׁ אַתָּ֗ה וּמִ֤י כָמ֙וֹךָ֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלָ֙מָּה֙ לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔רְתָּ אֶל־אֲדֹנֶ֖יךָ הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּי־בָא֙ אַחַ֣ד הָעָ֔ם לְהַשְׁחִ֖ית אֶת־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ אֲדֹנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And David answered Abner, “You are a man, aren’t you? And there is no one like you in Israel! So why didn’t you keep watch over your lord the king? For one of [our] troops came to do violence to your lord the king.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-avener halvo-iysh atah umiy khamvokha veyisherael velamah lo shamareta el-adoneykha hamelekhe khiy-va achad haam lehashechiyt et-hamelekhe adoneykha

Hebrew: לֹא־ט֞וֹב הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּה֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֒יתָ֒ חַי־יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּ֤י בְנֵֽי־מָ֙וֶת֙ אַתֶּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־שְׁמַרְתֶּ֛ם עַל־אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֖ם עַל־מְשִׁ֣יחַ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ רְאֵ֗ה אֵֽי־חֲנִ֥ית הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְאֶת־צַפַּ֥חַת הַמַּ֖יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר מְרַאֲשֹׁתָֽו׃
Translated: You have not given a good account of yourself! As G<small>OD</small> lives, you all deserve to die, because you did not keep watch over your lord, G<small>OD</small>’s anointed. Look around, where are the king’s spear and the water jar that were at his head?”
Transliteration: lo-tvov hadavar hazeh asher ashiyta chay-yehovah khiy veney-mavet atem asher lo-shemaretem al-adoneykhem al-meshiycha yehovah veatah reeh ey-chaniyt hamelekhe veet-tsafachat hamayiim asher meraashotav

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֤ר שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל דָּוִ֔ד וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הֲקֽוֹלְךָ֥ זֶ֖ה בְּנִ֣י דָוִ֑ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד קוֹלִ֖י אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Saul recognized David’s voice, and he asked, “Is that your voice, my son David?” And David replied, “It is, my lord king.”
Transliteration: vayakher shaul et-kvol david vayomer hakvolekha zeh veniy david vayomer david kvoliy adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֛ה אֲדֹנִ֥י רֹדֵ֖ף אַחֲרֵ֣י עַבְדּ֑וֹ כִּ֚י מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתִי וּמַה־בְּיָדִ֖י רָעָֽה׃
Translated: And he went on, “But why does my lord continue to pursue his servant? What have I done, and what wrong am I guilty of?
Transliteration: vayomer lamah zeh adoniy rodef acharey avedvo khiy meh ashiytiy umah-veyadiy raah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה יִֽשְׁמַֽע־נָא֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֣י עַבְדּ֑וֹ אִם־יְהֹוָ֞ה הֱסִֽיתְךָ֥ בִי֙ יָרַ֣ח מִנְחָ֔ה וְאִ֣ם ׀ בְּנֵ֣י הָאָדָ֗ם אֲרוּרִ֥ים הֵם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־גֵרְשׁ֣וּנִי הַיּ֗וֹם מֵהִסְתַּפֵּ֜חַ בְּנַחֲלַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֵ֥ךְ עֲבֹ֖ד אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: Now let my lord the king hear his servant out. If G<small>OD</small> has incited you against me, let an offering provide appeasement; but if it was other people, may they be accursed of G<small>OD</small>! For they have driven me out today, so that I cannot have a share in G<small>OD</small>’s possession, but am told, ‘Go and worship other gods.’
Transliteration: veatah yishema-na adoniy hamelekhe et diverey avedvo im-yehovah hesiytekha viy yarach minechah veim veney haadam aruriym hem lifeney yehovah khiy-gereshuniy hayyvom mehisetafecha venachalat yehovah lemor lekhe avod Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אַל־יִפֹּ֤ל דָּמִי֙ אַ֔רְצָה מִנֶּ֖גֶד פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־יָצָ֞א מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְבַקֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֣שׁ אֶחָ֔ד כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יִרְדֹּ֥ף הַקֹּרֵ֖א בֶּהָרִֽים׃
Translated: Oh, let my blood not fall to the ground, away from G<small>OD</small>’s presence! For the king of Israel has come out to seek a single flea—as if he were hunting a partridge in the hills.”
Transliteration: veatah al-yifol damiy aretsah mineged feney yehovah khiy-yatsa melekhe yisherael levakesh et-fareosh echad khaasher yiredof hakore vehariym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ שָׁא֨וּל חָטָ֜אתִי שׁ֣וּב בְּנִֽי־דָוִ֗ד כִּ֠י לֹֽא־אָרַ֤ע לְךָ֙ ע֔וֹד תַּ֠חַת אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָקְרָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֛י בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה הִנֵּ֥ה הִסְכַּ֛לְתִּי וָאֶשְׁגֶּ֖ה הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: And Saul answered, “I am in the wrong. Come back, my son David, for I will never harm you again, seeing how you have held my life precious this day. Yes, I have been a fool, and I have erred so very much.”
Transliteration: vayomer shaul chatatiy shuv veniy-david khiy lo-ara lekha vod tachat asher yakerah nafeshiy veeyneykha hayyvom hazeh hineh hisekhaletiy vaeshegeh hareveh meod

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן דָּוִד֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר הִנֵּ֖ה (החנית) [חֲנִ֣ית] הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְיַעֲבֹ֛ר אֶחָ֥ד מֵהַנְּעָרִ֖ים וְיִקָּחֶֽהָ׃
Translated: David replied, “Here is Your Majesty’s spear. Let one of the young men come over and get it.
Transliteration: vayaan david vayomer hineh (hchnyt) [chaniyt] hamelekhe veyaavor echad mehaneariym veyikacheha

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָה֙ יָשִׁ֣יב לָאִ֔ישׁ אֶת־צִדְקָת֖וֹ וְאֶת־אֱמֻנָת֑וֹ אֲשֶׁר֩ נְתָנְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> הַיּוֹם֙ בְּיָ֔ד וְלֹ֣א אָבִ֔יתִי לִשְׁלֹ֥חַ יָדִ֖י בִּמְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> will requite everyone for their right conduct and loyalty—for this day G<small>OD</small> delivered you into my hands and I would not raise a hand against G<small>OD</small>’s anointed.
Transliteration: vayhovah yashiyv laiysh et-tsidekatvo veet-emunatvo asher netanekha yehovah <small></small> hayyvom veyad velo aviytiy lishelocha yadiy vimeshiycha yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר גָּדְלָ֧ה נַפְשְׁךָ֛ הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה בְּעֵינָ֑י כֵּ֣ן תִּגְדַּ֤ל נַפְשִׁי֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיַצִּלֵ֖נִי מִכׇּל־צָרָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And just as I valued your life highly this day, so may G<small>OD</small> value my life and rescue me from all trouble.”
Transliteration: vehineh khaasher gadelah nafeshekha hayyvom hazeh veeynay khen tigedal nafeshiy veeyney yehovah veyatsileniy mikhׇl-tsarah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד בָּר֤וּךְ אַתָּה֙ בְּנִ֣י דָוִ֔ד גַּ֚ם עָשֹׂ֣ה תַעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְגַ֖ם יָכֹ֣ל תּוּכָ֑ל וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִד֙ לְדַרְכּ֔וֹ וְשָׁא֖וּל שָׁ֥ב לִמְקוֹמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Saul answered David, “May you be blessed, my son David. You shall achieve, and you shall prevail.”
David then went his way, and Saul returned home.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-david varukhe atah veniy david gam ashoh taasheh vegam yakhol tukhal vayelekhe david ledarekhvo veshaul shav limekvomvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־לִבּ֔וֹ עַתָּ֛ה אֶסָּפֶ֥ה יוֹם־אֶחָ֖ד בְּיַד־שָׁא֑וּל אֵֽין־לִ֨י ט֜וֹב כִּ֣י הִמָּלֵ֥ט אִמָּלֵ֣ט ׀ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וְנוֹאַ֨שׁ מִמֶּ֤נִּי שָׁאוּל֙ לְבַקְשֵׁ֤נִי עוֹד֙ בְּכׇל־גְּב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְנִמְלַטְתִּ֖י מִיָּדֽוֹ׃
Translated: David said to himself, “Someday I shall certainly perish at the hands of Saul. The best thing for me is to flee to the land of the Philistines; Saul will then give up hunting me throughout the territory of Israel, and I will escape him.”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-livvo atah esafeh yvom-echad veyad-shaul eyn-liy tvov khiy himalet imalet el-erets felishetiym venvoash mimeniy shaul levakesheniy vod vekhׇl-gevul yisherael venimelatetiy miyadvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם דָּוִ֔ד וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר ה֔וּא וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֑וֹ אֶל־אָכִ֥ישׁ בֶּן־מָע֖וֹךְ מֶ֥לֶךְ גַּֽת׃
Translated: So David and the six hundred men with him went and crossed over to King Achish son of Maoch of Gath.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david vayaavor hu veshesh-mevot iysh asher imvo el-akhiysh ven-mavokhe melekhe gat

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩שֶׁב֩ דָּוִ֨ד עִם־אָכִ֥ישׁ בְּגַ֛ת ה֥וּא וַאֲנָשָׁ֖יו אִ֣ישׁ וּבֵית֑וֹ דָּוִד֙ וּשְׁתֵּ֣י נָשָׁ֔יו אֲחִינֹ֙עַם֙ הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֔ת וַֽאֲבִיגַ֥יִל אֵֽשֶׁת־נָבָ֖ל הַֽכַּרְמְלִֽית׃
Translated: David and his men stayed with Achish in Gath, each with his family—David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelite and Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
Transliteration: vayeshev david im-akhiysh vegat hu vaanashayv iysh uveytvo david ushetey nashayv achiynoam hayizereelit vaaviygayiil eshet-naval hakharemeliyt

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְשָׁא֔וּל כִּֽי־בָרַ֥ח דָּוִ֖ד גַּ֑ת וְלֹא־[יָסַ֥ף] (יוסף) ע֖וֹד לְבַקְשֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: And when Saul was told that David had fled to Gath, he did not pursue him anymore.
Transliteration: vayugad leshaul khiy-varach david gat velo-[yasaf] (yvsf) vod levakeshvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־אָכִ֗ישׁ אִם־נָא֩ מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ יִתְּנוּ־לִ֣י מָק֗וֹם בְּאַחַ֛ת עָרֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְאֵ֣שְׁבָה שָּׁ֑ם וְלָ֨מָּה יֵשֵׁ֧ב עַבְדְּךָ֛ בְּעִ֥יר הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: David said to Achish, “If you please, let a place be granted me in one of the country towns where I can live; why should your servant remain with you in the royal city?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-akhiysh im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha yitenu-liy makvom veachat arey hashadeh veeshevah sham velamah eishev avedekha veiyr hamamelakhah imakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ אָכִ֛ישׁ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא אֶת־צִֽקְלָ֑ג לָכֵ֞ן הָיְתָ֤ה צִֽקְלַג֙ לְמַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: At that time Achish granted him Ziklag; that is how Ziklag came to belong to the kings of Judah, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vayiten-lvo akhiysh vayyvom hahu et-tsikelag lakhen hayetah tsikelag lemalekhey yehudah ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִסְפַּ֣ר הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יָשַׁ֥ב דָּוִ֖ד בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים יָמִ֖ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: The length of time that David lived in Philistine territory was a year and four months.
Transliteration: vayehiy misefar hayamiym asher-yashav david vishedeh felishetiym yamiym vearevaah chodashiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַל דָּוִד֙ וַאֲנָשָׁ֔יו וַֽיִּפְשְׁט֛וּ אֶל־הַגְּשׁוּרִ֥י (והגרזי) [וְהַגִּזְרִ֖י] וְהָעֲמָלֵקִ֑י כִּ֣י הֵ֜נָּה יֹשְׁב֤וֹת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מֵעוֹלָ֔ם בּוֹאֲךָ֥ שׁ֖וּרָה וְעַד־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: David and his men went up and raided the Geshurites, the Gizrites, and the Amalekites—who were the inhabitants of the region of Olam, all the way to Shur and to the land of Egypt.—
Transliteration: vayaal david vaanashayv vayifeshetu el-hageshuriy (vhgrzy) [vehagizeriy] vehaamalekiy khiy henah yoshevvot haarets asher mevolam vvoakha shurah vead-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהִכָּ֤ה דָוִד֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְלֹ֥א יְחַיֶּ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֑ה וְלָקַח֩ צֹ֨אן וּבָקָ֜ר וַחֲמֹרִ֤ים וּגְמַלִּים֙ וּבְגָדִ֔ים וַיָּ֖שׇׁב וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־אָכִֽישׁ׃
Translated: When David attacked a region, he would leave no man or woman alive; he would take flocks, herds, donkeys, camels, and clothing. When he returned and came to Achish,
Transliteration: vehikhah david et-haarets velo yechayeh iysh veishah velakach tson uvakar vachamoriym ugemaliym uvegadiym vayashׇv vayavo el-akhiysh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָכִ֔ישׁ אַל־פְּשַׁטְתֶּ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗ד עַל־נֶ֤גֶב יְהוּדָה֙ וְעַל־נֶ֣גֶב הַיְּרַחְמְאֵלִ֔י וְאֶל־נֶ֖גֶב הַקֵּינִֽי׃
Translated: Achish would ask, “Where did you raid today?” and David would reply, “The Negeb of Judah,” or “the Negeb of the Jerahmeelites,” or “the Negeb of the Kenites.”
Transliteration: vayomer akhiysh al-feshatetem hayyvom vayomer david al-negev yehudah veal-negev hayerachemeeliy veel-negev hakeyniy

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ וְאִשָּׁ֜ה לֹא־יְחַיֶּ֣ה דָוִ֗ד לְהָבִ֥יא גַת֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פֶּן־יַגִּ֥דוּ עָלֵ֖ינוּ לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּֽה־עָשָׂ֤ה דָוִד֙ וְכֹ֣ה מִשְׁפָּט֔וֹ כׇּ֨ל־הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָשַׁ֖ב בִּשְׂדֵ֥ה פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: David would leave no man or woman alive to be brought to Gath; for he thought, “They might tell about us: David did this.” Such was his practice as long as he stayed in the territory of the Philistines.
Transliteration: veiysh veishah lo-yechayeh david lehaviy gat lemor fen-yagidu aleynu lemor khoh-ashah david vekhoh mishefatvo khׇl-hayamiym asher yashav vishedeh felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּאֲמֵ֥ן אָכִ֖ישׁ בְּדָוִ֣ד לֵאמֹ֑ר הַבְאֵ֤שׁ הִבְאִישׁ֙ בְּעַמּ֣וֹ בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהָ֥יָה לִ֖י לְעֶ֥בֶד עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Achish trusted David. He thought: “He has aroused the wrath of his own people Israel, and so he will be my vassal forever.”
Transliteration: vayaamen akhiysh vedavid lemor haveesh hiveiysh veamvo veyisherael vehayah liy leeved volam {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם וַיִּקְבְּצ֨וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֤ים אֶת־מַֽחֲנֵיהֶם֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אָכִישׁ֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּדַ֗ע כִּ֤י אִתִּי֙ תֵּצֵ֣א בַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה אַתָּ֖ה וַאֲנָשֶֽׁיךָ׃
Translated: At that time the Philistines mustered their forces for war, to take the field against Israel. Achish said to David, “You know, of course, that you and your men must march out with my forces.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vayamiym hahem vayikevetsu felishetiym et-machaneyhem latsava lehilachem veyisherael vayomer akhiysh el-david yadoa teda khiy itiy tetse vamachaneh atah vaanasheykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־אָכִ֔ישׁ לָכֵן֙ אַתָּ֣ה תֵדַ֔ע אֵ֥ת אֲשֶֽׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אָכִישׁ֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד לָכֵ֗ן שֹׁמֵ֧ר לְרֹאשִׁ֛י אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֖ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: David answered Achish, “You surely know what your servant will do.” “In that case,” Achish replied to David, “I will appoint you my bodyguard for life.”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-akhiysh lakhen atah teda et asher-yaasheh avedekha vayomer akhiysh el-david lakhen shomer leroshiy ashiymekha khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: וּשְׁמוּאֵ֣ל מֵ֔ת וַיִּסְפְּדוּ־לוֹ֙ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּקְבְּרֻ֥הוּ בָרָמָ֖ה וּבְעִיר֑וֹ וְשָׁא֗וּל הֵסִ֛יר הָאֹב֥וֹת וְאֶת־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֖ים מֵהָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Now Samuel had died and all Israel made lament for him; and he was buried in his own town of Ramah. And Saul had forbidden [recourse to] ghosts and familiar spirits in the land.
Transliteration: ushemuel met vayisefedu-lvo khׇl-yisherael vayikeveruhu varamah uveiyrvo veshaul hesiyr haovvot veet-hayideoniym mehaarets

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְשׁוּנֵ֑ם וַיִּקְבֹּ֤ץ שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּגִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
Translated: The Philistines mustered and they marched to Shunem and encamped; and Saul gathered all Israel, and they encamped at Gilboa.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu felishetiym vayavou vayachanu veshunem vayikevots shaul et-khׇl-yisherael vayachanu vagilevoa

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא שָׁא֖וּל אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיִּרָ֕א וַיֶּחֱרַ֥ד לִבּ֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When Saul saw the Philistine force, his heart trembled with fear.
Transliteration: vayare shaul et-machaneh felishetiym vayira vayecherad livvo meod

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל שָׁאוּל֙ בַּיהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א עָנָ֖הוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה גַּ֧ם בַּחֲלֹמ֛וֹת גַּ֥ם בָּאוּרִ֖ים גַּ֥ם בַּנְּבִיאִֽם׃
Translated: And Saul inquired of G<small>OD</small>, but G<small>OD</small> did not answer him, either by dreams or by Urim or by prophets.
Transliteration: vayisheal shaul vayhovah velo anahu yehovah gam vachalomvot gam vauriym gam vaneviyim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר שָׁא֜וּל לַעֲבָדָ֗יו בַּקְּשׁוּ־לִי֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת בַּעֲלַת־א֔וֹב וְאֵלְכָ֥ה אֵלֶ֖יהָ וְאֶדְרְשָׁה־בָּ֑הּ וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ עֲבָדָיו֙ אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּ֛ה אֵ֥שֶׁת בַּעֲלַת־א֖וֹב בְּעֵ֥ין דּֽוֹר׃
Translated: Then Saul said to his courtiers, “Find me a woman who consults ghosts, so that I can go to her and inquire through her.” And his courtiers told him that there was a woman in En-dor who consulted ghosts.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul laavadayv vakeshu-liy eshet vaalat-vov veelekhah eleyha veedereshah-vah vayomeru avadayv elayv hineh eshet vaalat-vov veeyn dvor

Hebrew: וַיִּתְחַפֵּ֣שׂ שָׁא֗וּל וַיִּלְבַּשׁ֙ בְּגָדִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ ה֗וּא וּשְׁנֵ֤י אֲנָשִׁים֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה לָ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר (קסומי) [קׇסֳמִי־]נָ֥א לִי֙ בָּא֔וֹב וְהַ֣עֲלִי לִ֔י אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־אֹמַ֖ר אֵלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: Saul disguised himself; he put on different clothes and set out with two men. They came to the woman by night, and he said, “Please divine for me by a ghost. Bring up for me the one I shall name to you.”
Transliteration: vayitechafesh shaul vayilevash vegadiym acheriym vayelekhe hu usheney anashiym imvo vayavou el-haishah layelah vayomer (ksvmy) [kׇsomiy-]na liy vavov vehaaliy liy et asher-omar elayiikhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר הָאִשָּׁ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו הִנֵּ֨ה אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה שָׁא֔וּל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִכְרִ֛ית אֶת־הָאֹב֥וֹת וְאֶת־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֖י מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְלָמָ֥ה אַתָּ֛ה מִתְנַקֵּ֥שׁ בְּנַפְשִׁ֖י לַהֲמִיתֵֽנִי׃
Translated: But the woman answered him, “You know what Saul has done, how he has banned [the use of] ghosts and familiar spirits in the land. So why are you laying a trap for me, to get me killed?”
Transliteration: vatomer haishah elayv hineh atah yadaeta et asher-ashah shaul asher hikheriyt et-haovvot veet-hayideoniy min-haarets velamah atah mitenakesh venafeshiy lahamiyteniy

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁ֤בַֽע לָהּ֙ שָׁא֔וּל בַּיהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר חַי־יְהֹוָ֕ה אִֽם־יִקְּרֵ֥ךְ עָוֺ֖ן בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Saul swore to her by G<small>OD</small>: “As G<small>OD</small> lives, you won’t get into trouble over this.”
Transliteration: vayishava lah shaul vayhovah lemor chay-yehovah im-yikerekhe avon vadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָאִשָּׁ֔ה אֶת־מִ֖י אַעֲלֶה־לָּ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֶת־שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל הַֽעֲלִי־לִֽי׃
Translated: At that, the woman asked, “Whom shall I bring up for you?” He answered, “Bring up Samuel for me.”
Transliteration: vatomer haishah et-miy aaleh-lakhe vayomer et-shemuel haaliy-liy

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶא הָאִשָּׁה֙ אֶת־שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וַתִּזְעַ֖ק בְּק֣וֹל גָּד֑וֹל וַתֹּ֩אמֶר֩ הָאִשָּׁ֨ה אֶל־שָׁא֧וּל <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֛ר לָ֥מָּה רִמִּיתָ֖נִי וְאַתָּ֥ה שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: Then the woman recognized Samuel, and she shrieked loudly, and said to Saul, “Why have you deceived me? You are Saul!”
Transliteration: vatere haishah et-shemuel vatizeak vekvol gadvol vatomer haishah el-shaul <small></small> lemor lamah rimiytaniy veatah shaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָ֥הּ הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אַל־תִּֽירְאִ֖י כִּ֣י מָ֣ה רָאִ֑ית וַתֹּ֤אמֶר הָאִשָּׁה֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל אֱלֹהִ֥ים רָאִ֖יתִי עֹלִ֥ים מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: The king answered her, “Don’t be afraid. What do you see?” And the woman said to Saul, “I see a divine being coming up from the earth.”
Transliteration: vayomer lah hamelekhe al-tiyreiy khiy mah raiyt vatomer haishah el-shaul Elohim raiytiy oliym min-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַֽה־תׇּאֳר֔וֹ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר אִ֤ישׁ זָקֵן֙ עֹלֶ֔ה וְה֥וּא עֹטֶ֖ה מְעִ֑יל וַיֵּ֤דַע שָׁאוּל֙ כִּֽי־שְׁמוּאֵ֣ל ה֔וּא וַיִּקֹּ֥ד אַפַּ֛יִם אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: “What does he look like?” he asked her. “It is an old man coming up,” she said, “and he is wrapped in a robe.” Then Saul knew that it was Samuel; and he bowed low in homage with his face to the ground.
Transliteration: vayomer lah mah-tׇorvo vatomer iysh zaken oleh vehu oteh meiyl vayeda shaul khiy-shemuel hu vayikod afayiim aretsah vayishetachu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל לָ֥מָּה הִרְגַּזְתַּ֖נִי לְהַעֲל֣וֹת אֹתִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁ֠א֠וּל צַר־לִ֨י מְאֹ֜ד וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֣ים ׀ נִלְחָמִ֣ים בִּ֗י וֵאלֹהִ֞ים סָ֤ר מֵֽעָלַי֙ וְלֹא־עָנָ֣נִי ע֗וֹד גַּ֤ם בְּיַֽד־הַנְּבִיאִים֙ גַּם־בַּ֣חֲלֹמ֔וֹת וָאֶקְרָאֶ֣ה לְךָ֔ לְהוֹדִיעֵ֖נִי מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶֽׂה׃ {ס}
Translated: Samuel said to Saul, “Why have you disturbed me and brought me up?” And Saul answered, “I am greatly troubled. The Philistines are attacking me and God has turned away from me—and no longer answers me, either by prophets or in dreams. So I have called you to tell me what I am to do.”
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel el-shaul lamah hiregazetaniy lehaalvot otiy vayomer shaul tsar-liy meod ufelishetiym nilechamiym viy velohiym sar mealay velo-ananiy vod gam veyad-haneviyiym gam-vachalomvot vaekeraeh lekha lehvodiyeniy mah eesheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁמוּאֵ֔ל וְלָ֖מָּה תִּשְׁאָלֵ֑נִי וַיהֹוָ֛ה סָ֥ר מֵעָלֶ֖יךָ וַיְהִ֥י עָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Samuel said, “Why do you ask me, seeing that G<small>OD</small> has turned away from you and has become your adversary?
Transliteration: vayomer shemuel velamah tishealeniy vayhovah sar mealeykha vayehiy arekha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יְהֹוָה֙ ל֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר בְּיָדִ֑י וַיִּקְרַ֨ע יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־הַמַּמְלָכָה֙ מִיָּדֶ֔ךָ וַֽיִּתְּנָ֖הּ לְרֵעֲךָ֥ לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> has done what was foretold through me: G<small>OD</small> has torn the kingship out of your hands and has given it to your fellow, to David,
Transliteration: vayaash yehovah lvo khaasher diver veyadiy vayikera yehovah et-hamamelakhah miyadekha vayitenah lereakha ledavid

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־שָׁמַ֙עְתָּ֙ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־עָשִׂ֥יתָ חֲרוֹן־אַפּ֖וֹ בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק עַל־כֵּן֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה עָשָֽׂה־לְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: because you did not obey G<small>OD</small> and did not execute [God’s] wrath upon the Amalekites. That is why G<small>OD</small> has done this to you today.
Transliteration: khaasher lo-shamaeta vekvol yehovah velo-ashiyta charvon-afvo vaamalek al-khen hadavar hazeh ashah-lekha yehovah hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְיִתֵּ֣ן יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה גַּ֣ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל עִמְּךָ֙ בְּיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמָחָ֕ר אַתָּ֥ה וּבָנֶ֖יךָ עִמִּ֑י גַּ֚ם אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִתֵּ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Further, G<small>OD</small> will deliver the Israelites who are with you into the hands of the Philistines. Tomorrow you and your sons will be with me; and G<small>OD</small> will also deliver the Israelite forces into the hands of the Philistines.”
Transliteration: veyiten yehovah gam et-yisherael imekha veyad-felishetiym umachar atah uvaneykha imiy gam et-machaneh yisherael yiten yehovah veyad-felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֣ר שָׁא֗וּל וַיִּפֹּ֤ל מְלֹא־קֽוֹמָתוֹ֙ אַ֔רְצָה וַיִּרָ֥א מְאֹ֖ד מִדִּבְרֵ֣י שְׁמוּאֵ֑ל גַּם־כֹּ֙חַ֙ לֹא־הָ֣יָה ב֔וֹ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אָכַל֙ לֶ֔חֶם כׇּל־הַיּ֖וֹם וְכׇל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated: At once Saul flung himself prone on the ground, terrified by Samuel’s words. Besides, there was no strength in him, for he had not eaten anything all day and all night.
Transliteration: vayemaher shaul vayifol melo-kvomatvo aretsah vayira meod midiverey shemuel gam-khocha lo-hayah vvo khiy lo akhal lechem khׇl-hayyvom vekhׇl-halayelah

Hebrew: וַתָּב֤וֹא הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וַתֵּ֖רֶא כִּֽי־נִבְהַ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו הִנֵּ֨ה שָֽׁמְעָ֤ה שִׁפְחָֽתְךָ֙ בְּקוֹלֶ֔ךָ וָאָשִׂ֤ים נַפְשִׁי֙ בְּכַפִּ֔י וָֽאֶשְׁמַע֙ אֶת־דְּבָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: The woman went up to Saul and, seeing how greatly disturbed he was, she said to him, “Your handmaid listened to you; I took my life in my hands and heeded the request you made of me.
Transliteration: vatavvo haishah el-shaul vatere khiy-nivehal meod vatomer elayv hineh shameah shifechatekha vekvolekha vaashiym nafeshiy vekhafiy vaeshema et-devareykha asher divareta elay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁמַֽע־נָ֤א גַם־אַתָּה֙ בְּק֣וֹל שִׁפְחָתֶ֔ךָ וְאָשִׂ֧מָה לְפָנֶ֛יךָ פַּת־לֶ֖חֶם וֶאֱכ֑וֹל וִיהִ֤י בְךָ֙ כֹּ֔חַ כִּ֥י תֵלֵ֖ךְ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: So now you listen to me: Let me set before you a bit of food. Eat, and then you will have the strength to go on your way.”
Transliteration: veatah shema-na gam-atah vekvol shifechatekha veashimah lefaneykha fat-lechem veekhvol viyhiy vekha khocha khiy telekhe vadarekhe

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֗ן וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֹכַ֔ל וַיִּפְרְצוּ־ב֤וֹ עֲבָדָיו֙ וְגַם־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע לְקֹלָ֑ם וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ מֵֽהָאָ֔רֶץ וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב אֶל־הַמִּטָּֽה׃
Translated: He refused, saying, “I will not eat.” But when his courtiers as well as the woman urged him, he listened to them; he got up from the ground and sat on the bed.
Transliteration: vayemaen vayomer lo okhal vayiferetsu-vvo avadayv vegam-haishah vayishema lekolam vayakׇm mehaarets vayeshev el-hamitah

Hebrew: וְלָאִשָּׁ֤ה עֵֽגֶל־מַרְבֵּק֙ בַּבַּ֔יִת וַתְּמַהֵ֖ר וַתִּזְבָּחֵ֑הוּ וַתִּקַּח־קֶ֣מַח וַתָּ֔לָשׁ וַתֹּפֵ֖הוּ מַצּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The woman had a stall-fed calf in the house; she hastily slaughtered it, and took flour and kneaded it, and baked some unleavened cakes.
Transliteration: velaishah egel-marevek vavayiit vatemaher vatizevachehu vatikach-kemach vatalash vatofehu matsvot

Hebrew: וַתַּגֵּ֧שׁ לִפְנֵי־שָׁא֛וּל וְלִפְנֵ֥י עֲבָדָ֖יו וַיֹּאכֵ֑לוּ וַיָּקֻ֥מוּ וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הַהֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: She set this before Saul and his courtiers, and they ate. Then they rose and left the same night.
Transliteration: vatagesh lifeney-shaul velifeney avadayv vayokhelu vayakumu vayelekhu valayelah hahu {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּצ֧וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֛ים אֶת־כׇּל־מַחֲנֵיהֶ֖ם אֲפֵ֑קָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל חֹנִ֔ים בַּעַ֖יִן אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּיִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated: The Philistines mustered all their forces at Aphek, while Israel was encamping at the spring in Jezreel.
Transliteration: vayikevetsu felishetiym et-khׇl-machaneyhem afekah veyisherael choniym vaayiin asher veyizereel

Hebrew: וְסַרְנֵ֤י פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ עֹֽבְרִ֔ים לְמֵא֖וֹת וְלַאֲלָפִ֑ים וְדָוִ֣ד וַאֲנָשָׁ֗יו עֹ֥בְרִ֛ים בָּאַחֲרֹנָ֖ה עִם־אָכִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The Philistine lords came marching, each with his units of hundreds and of thousands; and David and his men came marching last, with Achish.
Transliteration: vesareney felishetiym overiym lemevot velaalafiym vedavid vaanashayv overiym vaacharonah im-akhiysh

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים מָ֖ה הָעִבְרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אָכִ֜ישׁ אֶל־שָׂרֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים הֲלוֹא־זֶ֨ה דָוִ֜ד עֶ֣בֶד ׀ שָׁא֣וּל מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֤ה אִתִּי֙ זֶ֤ה יָמִים֙ אוֹ־זֶ֣ה שָׁנִ֔ים וְלֹֽא־מָצָ֤אתִי בוֹ֙ מְא֔וּמָה מִיּ֥וֹם נׇפְל֖וֹ עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The Philistine officers asked, “Who are those Hebrews?” “Why, that’s David, the servant of King Saul of Israel,” Achish answered the Philistine officers. “He has been with me for a year or more, and I have found no fault in him from the day he defected until now.”
Transliteration: vayomeru sharey felishetiym mah haiveriym haeleh vayomer akhiysh el-sharey felishetiym halvo-zeh david eved shaul melekhe-yisherael asher hayah itiy zeh yamiym vo-zeh shaniym velo-matsatiy vvo meumah miyyvom nׇfelvo ad-hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְצְפ֨וּ עָלָ֜יו שָׂרֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לוֹ֩ שָׂרֵ֨י פְלִשְׁתִּ֜ים הָשֵׁ֣ב אֶת־הָאִ֗ישׁ וְיָשֹׁב֙ אֶל־מְקוֹמוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִפְקַדְתּ֣וֹ שָׁ֔ם וְלֹא־יֵרֵ֤ד עִמָּ֙נוּ֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְלֹא־יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֥נוּ לְשָׂטָ֖ן בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וּבַמֶּ֗ה יִתְרַצֶּ֥ה זֶה֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔יו הֲל֕וֹא בְּרָאשֵׁ֖י הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָהֵֽם׃
Translated: But the Philistine officers were angry with him; and the Philistine officers said to him, “Send the man back; let him go back to the place you assigned him. He shall not march down with us to the battle, or else he may become our adversary in battle. For with what could that fellow appease his master if not with the heads of those involved?
Transliteration: vayiketsefu alayv sharey felishetiym vayomeru lvo sharey felishetiym hashev et-haiysh veyashov el-mekvomvo asher hifekadetvo sham velo-eired imanu vamilechamah velo-yiheyeh-lanu leshatan vamilechamah uvameh yiteratseh zeh el-adonayv halvo verashey haanashiym hahem

Hebrew: הֲלוֹא־זֶ֣ה דָוִ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֧ר יַעֲנוּ־ל֛וֹ בַּמְּחֹל֖וֹת לֵאמֹ֑ר הִכָּ֤ה שָׁאוּל֙ בַּאֲלָפָ֔יו וְדָוִ֖ד בְּרִבְבֹתָֽו׃ {ס}
Translated:
Remember, he is the David of whom they sang as they danced:
Saul has slain his thousands;
David, his tens of thousands.”
Transliteration: halvo-zeh david asher yaanu-lvo vamecholvot lemor hikhah shaul vaalafayv vedavid verivevotav {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אָכִ֜ישׁ אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵ֠לָ֠יו חַי־יְהֹוָ֞ה כִּֽי־יָשָׁ֣ר אַתָּ֗ה וְט֣וֹב בְּ֠עֵינַ֠י צֵאתְךָ֨ וּבֹאֲךָ֤ אִתִּי֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה כִּ֠י לֹֽא־מָצָ֤אתִֽי בְךָ֙ רָעָ֔ה מִיּ֛וֹם בֹּאֲךָ֥ אֵלַ֖י עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וּבְעֵינֵ֥י הַסְּרָנִ֖ים לֹא־ט֥וֹב אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: Achish summoned David and said to him, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, you have been honest, and I would like to have you serve in my forces; for I have found no fault with you from the day you joined me until now. But you are not acceptable to the other lords.
Transliteration: vayikera akhiysh el-david vayomer elayv chay-yehovah khiy-yashar atah vetvov veeynay tsetekha uvoakha itiy vamachaneh khiy lo-matsatiy vekha raah miyyvom voakha elay ad-hayyvom hazeh uveeyney haseraniym lo-tvov atah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה שׁ֖וּב וְלֵ֣ךְ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם וְלֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה רָ֔ע בְּעֵינֵ֖י סַרְנֵ֥י פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: So go back in peace, and do nothing to displease the Philistine lords.”
Transliteration: veatah shuv velekhe veshalvom velo-taasheh ra veeyney sareney felishetiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־אָכִ֗ישׁ כִּ֣י מֶ֤ה עָשִׂ֙יתִי֙ וּמַה־מָּצָ֣אתָ בְעַבְדְּךָ֔ מִיּוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיִ֣יתִי לְפָנֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אָבוֹא֙ וְנִלְחַ֔מְתִּי בְּאֹיְבֵ֖י אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: David, however, said to Achish, “But what have I done, what fault have you found in your servant from the day I appeared before you to this day, that I should not go and fight against the enemies of my lord the king?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-akhiysh khiy meh ashiytiy umah-matsata veavedekha miyyvom asher hayiytiy lefaneykha ad hayyvom hazeh khiy lo avvo venilechametiy veoyevey adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן אָכִישׁ֮ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־דָּוִד֒ יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּ֣י ט֥וֹב אַתָּ֛ה בְּעֵינַ֖י כְּמַלְאַ֣ךְ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אַ֣ךְ שָׂרֵ֤י פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹא־יַעֲלֶ֥ה עִמָּ֖נוּ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Achish replied to David, “I know; you are as acceptable to me as an angel of God. But the Philistine officers have decided that you must not march out with us to the battle.
Transliteration: vayaan akhiysh vayomer el-david yadaetiy khiy tvov atah veeynay khemaleakhe Elohim akhe sharey felishetiym ameru lo-yaaleh imanu vamilechamah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הַשְׁכֵּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְעַבְדֵ֥י אֲדֹנֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ אִתָּ֑ךְ וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֣ם בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וְא֥וֹר לָכֶ֖ם וָלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: So rise early in the morning, you and your lord’s servants who came with you—rise early in the morning, and leave as soon as it is light.”
Transliteration: veatah hashekhem vavoker veavedey adoneykha asher-vau itakhe vehishekhametem vavoker vevor lakhem valekhu

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם דָּוִ֜ד ה֤וּא וַאֲנָשָׁיו֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת בַּבֹּ֔קֶר לָשׁ֖וּב אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים עָל֥וּ יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃ {ס}
Translated: Accordingly, David and his men rose early in the morning to leave, to return to the land of the Philistines, while the Philistines marched up to Jezreel.
Transliteration: vayashekhem david hu vaanashayv lalekhet vavoker lashuv el-erets felishetiym ufelishetiym alu yizereel {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בְּבֹ֨א דָוִ֧ד וַאֲנָשָׁ֛יו צִֽקְלַ֖ג בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י וַעֲמָלֵקִ֣י פָֽשְׁט֗וּ אֶל־נֶ֙גֶב֙ וְאֶל־צִ֣קְלַ֔ג וַיַּכּוּ֙ אֶת־צִ֣קְלַ֔ג וַיִּשְׂרְפ֥וּ אֹתָ֖הּ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: By the time David and his men arrived in Ziklag, on the third day, the Amalekites had made a raid into the Negeb and against Ziklag; they had stormed Ziklag and burned it down.
Transliteration: vayehiy vevo david vaanashayv tsikelag vayyvom hasheliyshiy vaamalekiy fashetu el-negev veel-tsikelag vayakhu et-tsikelag vayisherefu otah vaesh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבּ֨וּ אֶת־הַנָּשִׁ֤ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּהּ֙ מִקָּטֹ֣ן וְעַד־גָּד֔וֹל לֹ֥א הֵמִ֖יתוּ אִ֑ישׁ וַיִּֽנְהֲג֔וּ וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ לְדַרְכָּֽם׃
Translated: They had taken the women in it captive, low-born and high-born alike; they did not kill any, but carried them off and went their way.
Transliteration: vayishevu et-hanashiym asher-vah mikaton vead-gadvol lo hemiytu iysh vayinehagu vayelekhu ledarekham

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א דָוִ֤ד וַאֲנָשָׁיו֙ אֶל־הָעִ֔יר וְהִנֵּ֥ה שְׂרוּפָ֖ה בָּאֵ֑שׁ וּנְשֵׁיהֶ֛ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֥ם וּבְנֹתֵיהֶ֖ם נִשְׁבּֽוּ׃
Translated: When David and his men came to the town and found it burned down, and their wives and sons and daughters taken captive,
Transliteration: vayavo david vaanashayv el-haiyr vehineh sherufah vaesh unesheyhem uveneyhem uvenoteyhem nishevu

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א דָוִ֜ד וְהָעָ֧ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֛וֹ אֶת־קוֹלָ֖ם וַיִּבְכּ֑וּ עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֵין־בָּהֶ֛ם כֹּ֖חַ לִבְכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: David and the troops with him broke into tears, until they had no strength left for weeping.
Transliteration: vayisha david vehaam asher-itvo et-kvolam vayivekhu ad asher eyn-vahem khocha livekhvot

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֥י נְשֵׁי־דָוִ֖ד נִשְׁבּ֑וּ אֲחִינֹ֙עַם֙ הַיִּזְרְעֵלִ֔ית וַאֲבִיגַ֕יִל אֵ֖שֶׁת נָבָ֥ל הַֽכַּרְמְלִֽי׃
Translated: David’s two wives had been taken captive, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail wife of Nabal from Carmel.
Transliteration: ushetey neshey-david nishevu achiynoam hayizereeliyt vaaviygayiil eshet naval hakharemeliy

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֨צֶר לְדָוִ֜ד מְאֹ֗ד כִּֽי־אָמְר֤וּ הָעָם֙ לְסׇקְל֔וֹ כִּי־מָ֙רָה֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ עַל־בָּנָ֣ו וְעַל־בְּנֹתָ֑יו וַיִּתְחַזֵּ֣ק דָּוִ֔ד בַּיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
David was in great danger, for the troops threatened to stone him; for all the troops were embittered on account of their sons and daughters.
But David sought strength in the ETERNAL his God.
Transliteration: vatetser ledavid meod khiy-ameru haam lesׇkelvo khiy-marah nefesh khׇl-haam iysh al-vanav veal-venotayv vayitechazek david vayhovah elohayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗ד אֶל־אֶבְיָתָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ בֶּן־אֲחִימֶ֔לֶךְ הַגִּֽישָׁה־נָּ֥א לִ֖י הָאֵפ֑וֹד וַיַּגֵּ֧שׁ אֶבְיָתָ֛ר אֶת־הָאֵפ֖וֹד אֶל־דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: David said to the priest Abiathar son of Ahimelech, “Bring the ephod up to me.” When Abiathar brought up the ephod to David,
Transliteration: vayomer david el-eveyatar hakhohen ven-achiymelekhe hagiyshah-na liy haefvod vayagesh eveyatar et-haefvod el-david

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֨ל דָּוִ֤ד בַּֽיהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶרְדֹּ֛ף אַחֲרֵ֥י הַגְּדוּד־הַזֶּ֖ה הַאַשִּׂגֶ֑נּוּ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ רְדֹ֔ף כִּֽי־הַשֵּׂ֥ג תַּשִּׂ֖יג וְהַצֵּ֥ל תַּצִּֽיל׃
Translated: David inquired of G<small>OD</small>, “Shall I pursue those raiders? Will I overtake them?” The reply came, “Pursue, for you shall overtake and you shall rescue.”
Transliteration: vayisheal david vayhovah lemor eredof acharey hagedud-hazeh haashigenu vayomer lvo redof khiy-hasheg tashiyg vehatsel tatsiyl

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד ה֚וּא וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־נַ֣חַל הַבְּשׂ֑וֹר וְהַנּוֹתָרִ֖ים עָמָֽדוּ׃
Translated: So David and the six hundred men with him set out, and they came to the Wadi Besor, where a halt was made by those who were to be left behind.
Transliteration: vayelekhe david hu veshesh-mevot iysh asher itvo vayavou ad-nachal haveshvor vehanvotariym amadu

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדֹּ֣ף דָּוִ֔ד ה֖וּא וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֣וֹת אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ מָאתַ֣יִם אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּגְּר֔וּ מֵעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־נַ֥חַל הַבְּשֽׂוֹר׃
Translated: David continued the pursuit with four hundred men; two hundred men had halted, too faint to cross the Wadi Besor.
Transliteration: vayiredof david hu veareva-mevot iysh vayaamedu matayiim iysh asher figeru meavor et-nachal haveshvor

Hebrew: וַֽיִּמְצְא֤וּ אִישׁ־מִצְרִי֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיִּקְח֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּתְּנוּ־ל֥וֹ לֶ֙חֶם֙ וַיֹּ֔אכַל וַיַּשְׁקֻ֖הוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated: In the open country, they came upon an Egyptian—and brought him to David. They gave him food to eat and water to drink;
Transliteration: vayimetseu iysh-mitseriy vashadeh vayikechu otvo el-david vayitenu-lvo lechem vayokhal vayashekuhu mayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנוּ־לוֹ֩ פֶ֨לַח דְּבֵלָ֜ה וּשְׁנֵ֤י צִמֻּקִים֙ וַיֹּ֔אכַל וַתָּ֥שׇׁב רוּח֖וֹ אֵלָ֑יו כִּ֠י לֹא־אָ֤כַל לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְלֹא־שָׁ֣תָה מַ֔יִם שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה יָמִ֖ים וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה לֵילֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: he was also given a piece of pressed fig cake and two cakes of raisins. He ate and regained his strength, for he had eaten no food and drunk no water for three days and three nights.
Transliteration: vayitenu-lvo felach develah usheney tsimukiym vayokhal vatashׇv ruchvo elayv khiy lo-akhal lechem velo-shatah mayiim sheloshah yamiym usheloshah leylvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֤וֹ דָוִד֙ לְֽמִי־אַ֔תָּה וְאֵ֥י מִזֶּ֖ה אָ֑תָּה וַיֹּ֜אמֶר נַ֧עַר מִצְרִ֣י אָנֹ֗כִי עֶ֚בֶד לְאִ֣ישׁ עֲמָלֵקִ֔י וַיַּעַזְבֵ֧נִי אֲדֹנִ֛י כִּ֥י חָלִ֖יתִי הַיּ֥וֹם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Then David asked him, “To whom do you belong and where are you from?” “I am an Egyptian lad,” he answered, “the slave of an Amalekite. My master abandoned me when I fell ill three days ago.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo david lemiy-atah veey mizeh atah vayomer naar mitseriy anokhiy eved leiysh amalekiy vayaazeveniy adoniy khiy chaliytiy hayyvom sheloshah

Hebrew: אֲנַ֡חְנוּ פָּשַׁ֜טְנוּ נֶ֧גֶב הַכְּרֵתִ֛י וְעַל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִיהוּדָ֖ה וְעַל־נֶ֣גֶב כָּלֵ֑ב וְאֶת־צִֽקְלַ֖ג שָׂרַ֥פְנוּ בָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: We had raided the Negeb of the Cherethites, and [the Negeb] of Judah, and the Negeb of Caleb; we also burned down Ziklag.”
Transliteration: anachenu fashatenu negev hakheretiy veal-asher liyhudah veal-negev khalev veet-tsikelag sharafenu vaesh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ דָּוִ֔ד הֲתוֹרִדֵ֖נִי אֶל־הַגְּד֣וּד הַזֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֡אמֶר הִשָּׁ֩בְעָה֩ לִּ֨י בֵאלֹהִ֜ים אִם־תְּמִיתֵ֗נִי וְאִם־תַּסְגִּרֵ֙נִי֙ בְּיַד־אֲדֹנִ֔י וְאוֹרִֽדְךָ֖ אֶל־הַגְּד֥וּד הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And David said to him, “Can you lead me down to that band?” He replied, “Swear to me by God that you will not kill me or deliver me into my master’s hands, and I will lead you down to that band.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv david hatvorideniy el-hagedud hazeh vayomer hishaveah liy velohiym im-temiyteniy veim-tasegireniy veyad-adoniy vevoridekha el-hagedud hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣רִדֵ֔הוּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה נְטֻשִׁ֖ים עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֹכְלִ֤ים וְשֹׁתִים֙ וְחֹ֣גְגִ֔ים בְּכֹל֙ הַשָּׁלָ֣ל הַגָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָקְח֛וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וּמֵאֶ֥רֶץ יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: So he led him down, and there they were, scattered all over the ground, eating and drinking and making merry because of all the vast spoil they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.
Transliteration: vayoridehu vehineh netushiym al-feney khׇl-haarets okheliym veshotiym vechogegiym vekhol hashalal hagadvol asher lakechu meerets felishetiym umeerets yehudah

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֥ם דָּוִ֛ד מֵהַנֶּ֥שֶׁף וְעַד־הָעֶ֖רֶב לְמׇחֳרָתָ֑ם וְלֹא־נִמְלַ֤ט מֵהֶם֙ אִ֔ישׁ כִּי֩ אִם־אַרְבַּ֨ע מֵא֧וֹת אִֽישׁ־נַ֛עַר אֲשֶׁר־רָכְב֥וּ עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים וַיָּנֻֽסוּ׃
Translated: David attacked them from before dawn until the evening of the next day; none of them escaped, except four hundred young men who mounted camels and got away.
Transliteration: vayakhem david mehaneshef vead-haerev lemׇchoratam velo-nimelat mehem iysh khiy im-areva mevot iysh-naar asher-rakhevu al-hagemaliym vayanusu

Hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֣ל דָּוִ֔ד אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָקְח֖וּ עֲמָלֵ֑ק וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֥י נָשָׁ֖יו הִצִּ֥יל דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: David rescued everything the Amalekites had taken; David also rescued his two wives.
Transliteration: vayatsel david et khׇl-asher lakechu amalek veet-shetey nashayv hitsiyl david

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א נֶעְדַּר־לָ֠הֶ֠ם מִן־הַקָּטֹ֨ן וְעַד־הַגָּד֜וֹל וְעַד־בָּנִ֤ים וּבָנוֹת֙ וּמִשָּׁלָ֔ל וְעַ֛ד כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָקְח֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם הַכֹּ֖ל הֵשִׁ֥יב דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Nothing of theirs was missing—young or old, sons or daughters, spoil or anything else that had been carried off—David recovered everything.
Transliteration: velo needar-lahem min-hakaton vead-hagadvol vead-vaniym uvanvot umishalal vead khׇl-asher lakechu lahem hakhol heshiyv david

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח דָּוִ֔ד אֶת־כׇּל־הַצֹּ֖אן וְהַבָּקָ֑ר נָהֲג֗וּ לִפְנֵי֙ הַמִּקְנֶ֣ה הַה֔וּא וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ זֶ֖ה שְׁלַ֥ל דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: David took all the flocks and herds, which [the troops] drove ahead of the other livestock; and they declared, “This is David’s spoil.”
Transliteration: vayikach david et-khׇl-hatson vehavakar nahagu lifeney hamikeneh hahu vayomeru zeh shelal david

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א דָוִ֗ד אֶל־מָאתַ֨יִם הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים אֲשֶֽׁר־פִּגְּר֣וּ ׀ מִלֶּ֣כֶת ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י דָוִ֗ד וַיֹּֽשִׁיבֻם֙ בְּנַ֣חַל הַבְּשׂ֔וֹר וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ לִקְרַ֣את דָּוִ֔ד וְלִקְרַ֖את הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֤שׁ דָּוִד֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וַיִּשְׁאַ֥ל לָהֶ֖ם לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: When David reached the two hundred men who were too faint to follow David and who had been left at the Wadi Besor, they came out to welcome David and the troops with him; David came forward with the troops and greeted them.
Transliteration: vayavo david el-matayiim haanashiym asher-figeru milekhet acharey david vayoshiyvum venachal haveshvor vayetseu likerat david velikerat haam asher-itvo vayigash david et-haam vayisheal lahem leshalvom {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַן כׇּל־אִֽישׁ־רָ֣ע וּבְלִיַּ֗עַל מֵהָאֲנָשִׁים֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָלְכ֣וּ עִם־דָּוִד֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־הָלְכ֣וּ עִמִּ֔י לֹא־נִתֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֔ם מֵהַשָּׁלָ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִצַּ֑לְנוּ כִּֽי־אִם־אִ֤ישׁ אֶת־אִשְׁתּוֹ֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֔יו וְיִנְהֲג֖וּ וְיֵלֵֽכוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: But all the mean and churlish ones among the men who had accompanied David spoke up, “Since they did not accompany us, we will not give them any of the spoil that we seized—except that each may take his wife and children and go.”
Transliteration: vayaan khׇl-iysh-ra uveliyaal mehaanashiym asher halekhu im-david vayomeru yaan asher lo-halekhu imiy lo-niten lahem mehashalal asher hitsalenu khiy-im-iysh et-ishetvo veet-vanayv veyinehagu veeilekhu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד לֹא־תַעֲשׂ֥וּ כֵ֖ן אֶחָ֑י אֵ֠ת אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֥ה לָ֙נוּ֙ וַיִּשְׁמֹ֣ר אֹתָ֔נוּ וַיִּתֵּ֗ן אֶֽת־הַגְּד֛וּד הַבָּ֥א עָלֵ֖ינוּ בְּיָדֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: David, however, spoke up, “You must not do that, my brothers, in view of what G<small>OD</small> has granted us, guarding us and delivering into our hands the band that attacked us.
Transliteration: vayomer david lo-taashu khen echay et asher-natan yehovah lanu vayishemor otanu vayiten et-hagedud hava aleynu veyadenu

Hebrew: וּמִי֙ יִשְׁמַ֣ע לָכֶ֔ם לַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֞י כְּחֵ֣לֶק ׀ הַיֹּרֵ֣ד בַּמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וּֽכְחֵ֛לֶק הַיֹּשֵׁ֥ב עַל־הַכֵּלִ֖ים יַחְדָּ֥ו יַחֲלֹֽקוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: How could anyone agree with you in this matter? The share of those who remain with the baggage shall be the same as the share of those who go down to battle; they shall share alike.”
Transliteration: umiy yishema lakhem ladavar hazeh khiy khechelek hayored vamilechamah ukhechelek hayoshev al-hakheliym yachedav yachaloku {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מֵהַיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וָמָ֑עְלָה וַיְשִׂמֶ֜הָ לְחֹ֤ק וּלְמִשְׁפָּט֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So from that day on it was made a fixed rule for Israel, continuing to the present day.
Transliteration: vayehiy mehayyvom hahu vamaelah vayeshimeha lechok ulemishefat leyisherael ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א דָוִד֙ אֶל־צִ֣קְלַ֔ג וַיְשַׁלַּ֧ח מֵהַשָּׁלָ֛ל לְזִקְנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה לְרֵעֵ֣הוּ לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֤ה לָכֶם֙ בְּרָכָ֔ה מִשְּׁלַ֖ל אֹיְבֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: When David reached Ziklag, he sent some of the spoil to the elders of Judah [and] to his friends, saying, “This is a present for you from our spoil of G<small>OD</small>’s enemies.”
Transliteration: vayavo david el-tsikelag vayeshalach mehashalal lezikeney yehudah lereehu lemor hineh lakhem verakhah mishelal oyevey yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לַאֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּבֵֽית־אֵ֛ל {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּרָמֽוֹת־נֶ֖גֶב {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּיַתִּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: [He sent the spoil to the elders] in Bethel, Ramoth-negeb, and Jattir;
Transliteration: laasher veveyt-el {s} velaasher veramvot-negev {s} velaasher veyatir {s}

Hebrew: וְלַאֲשֶׁ֧ר בַּעֲרֹעֵ֛ר {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּשִֽׂפְמ֖וֹת {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאֶשְׁתְּמֹֽעַ׃ {ס}
Translated: in Aroer, Siphmoth, and Eshtemoa;
Transliteration: velaasher vaaroer {s} velaasher veshifemvot {s} velaasher veeshetemoa {s}

Hebrew: וְלַאֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּרָכָ֗ל {ס} וְלַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הַיְּרַחְמְאֵלִ֔י {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעָרֵ֥י הַקֵּינִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: in Racal, in the towns of the Jerahmeelites, and in the towns of the Kenites;
Transliteration: velaasher verakhal {s} velaasher vearey hayerachemeeliy {s} velaasher vearey hakeyniy {s}

Hebrew: וְלַאֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּחׇרְמָ֛ה {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבוֹר־עָשָׁ֖ן {ס} וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּעֲתָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: in Hormah, Bor-ashan, and Athach;
Transliteration: velaasher vechׇremah {s} velaasher vevvor-ashan {s} velaasher vaatakhe {s}

Hebrew: וְלַאֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וּֽלְכׇל־הַמְּקֹמ֛וֹת אֲשֶֽׁר־הִתְהַלֶּךְ־שָׁ֥ם דָּוִ֖ד ה֥וּא וַאֲנָשָֽׁיו׃ {פ}
Translated: and to those in Hebron—all the places where David and his men had roamed.
Transliteration: velaasher vechevervon ulekhׇl-hamekomvot asher-hitehalekhe-sham david hu vaanashayv {f}

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים נִלְחָמִ֣ים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּנֻ֜סוּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיִּפְּל֥וּ חֲלָלִ֖ים בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
Translated: The Philistines attacked Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and [many] fell on Mount Gilboa.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym nilechamiym veyisherael vayanusu aneshey yisherael mifeney felishetiym vayifelu chalaliym vehar hagilevoa

Hebrew: וַיַּדְבְּק֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אֶת־שָׁא֖וּל וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑יו וַיַּכּ֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים אֶת־יְהוֹנָתָ֧ן וְאֶת־אֲבִינָדָ֛ב וְאֶת־מַלְכִּישׁ֖וּעַ בְּנֵ֥י שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, sons of Saul.
Transliteration: vayadeveku felishetiym et-shaul veet-vanayv vayakhu felishetiym et-yehvonatan veet-aviynadav veet-malekhiyshua veney shaul

Hebrew: וַתִּכְבַּ֤ד הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ אֶל־שָׁא֔וּל וַיִּמְצָאֻ֥הוּ הַמּוֹרִ֖ים אֲנָשִׁ֣ים בַּקָּ֑שֶׁת וַיָּ֥חֶל מְאֹ֖ד מֵהַמּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated: The battle raged around Saul, and some of the archers hit him, and he was severely wounded by the archers.
Transliteration: vatikhevad hamilechamah el-shaul vayimetsauhu hamvoriym anashiym vakashet vayachel meod mehamvoriym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁאוּל֩ לְנֹשֵׂ֨א כֵלָ֜יו שְׁלֹ֥ף חַרְבְּךָ֣ ׀ וְדׇקְרֵ֣נִי בָ֗הּ פֶּן־יָ֠ב֠וֹאוּ הָעֲרֵלִ֨ים הָאֵ֤לֶּה וּדְקָרֻ֙נִי֙ וְהִתְעַלְּלוּ־בִ֔י וְלֹ֤א אָבָה֙ נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֔יו כִּ֥י יָרֵ֖א מְאֹ֑ד וַיִּקַּ֤ח שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־הַחֶ֔רֶב וַיִּפֹּ֖ל עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Saul said to his arms-bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through, so that the uncircumcised may not run me through and make sport of me.” But his arms-bearer, in his great awe, refused; whereupon Saul grasped the sword and fell upon it.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul lenoshe khelayv shelof charevekha vedׇkereniy vah fen-yavvou haareliym haeleh udekaruniy vehitealelu-viy velo avah noshe khelayv khiy yare meod vayikach shaul et-hacherev vayifol aleyha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא נֹשֵֽׂא־כֵלָ֖יו כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּפֹּ֥ל גַּם־ה֛וּא עַל־חַרְבּ֖וֹ וַיָּ֥מׇת עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When his arms-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died with him.
Transliteration: vayare noshe-khelayv khiy met shaul vayifol gam-hu al-charevvo vayamׇt imvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת שָׁא֡וּל וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת בָּנָיו֩ וְנֹשֵׂ֨א כֵלָ֜יו גַּ֧ם כׇּל־אֲנָשָׁ֛יו בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated: Thus Saul and his three sons and his arms-bearer, as well as all his men, died together on that day.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shaul usheloshet vanayv venoshe khelayv gam khׇl-anashayv vayyvom hahu yachedav

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֣וּ אַנְשֵֽׁי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל אֲשֶׁר־בְּעֵ֨בֶר הָעֵ֜מֶק וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן כִּי־נָ֙סוּ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְכִי־מֵ֖תוּ שָׁא֣וּל וּבָנָ֑יו וַיַּעַזְב֤וּ אֶת־הֶעָרִים֙ וַיָּנֻ֔סוּ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ בָּהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: And when the Israelite inhabitants on the other side of the valley and on the other side of the Jordan saw that the men of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned the towns and fled; the Philistines then came and occupied them.
Transliteration: vayireu aneshey-yisherael asher-veever haemek vaasher veever hayareden khiy-nasu aneshey yisherael vekhiy-metu shaul uvanayv vayaazevu et-heariym vayanusu vayavou felishetiym vayeshevu vahen {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים לְפַשֵּׁ֖ט אֶת־הַחֲלָלִ֑ים וַֽיִּמְצְא֤וּ אֶת־שָׁאוּל֙ וְאֶת־שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת בָּנָ֔יו נֹפְלִ֖ים בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
Translated: The next day the Philistines came to strip the slain, and they found Saul and his three sons lying on Mount Gilboa.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayavou felishetiym lefashet et-hachalaliym vayimetseu et-shaul veet-sheloshet vanayv nofeliym vehar hagilevoa

Hebrew: וַֽיִּכְרְתוּ֙ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וַיַּפְשִׁ֖טוּ אֶת־כֵּלָ֑יו וַיְשַׁלְּח֨וּ בְאֶֽרֶץ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֜ים סָבִ֗יב לְבַשֵּׂ֛ר בֵּ֥ית עֲצַבֵּיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: They cut off his head and stripped him of his armor, and they sent them throughout the land of the Philistines, to spread the news in the temples of their idols and among the people.
Transliteration: vayikheretu et-roshvo vayafeshitu et-khelayv vayeshalechu veerets-felishetiym saviyv levasher veyt atsaveyhem veet-haam

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֙ימוּ֙ אֶת־כֵּלָ֔יו בֵּ֖ית עַשְׁתָּר֑וֹת וְאֶת־גְּוִיָּתוֹ֙ תָּֽקְע֔וּ בְּחוֹמַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית שָֽׁן׃
Translated: They placed his armor in the temple of Ashtaroth, and they impaled his body on the wall of Beth-shan.
Transliteration: vayashiymu et-khelayv veyt ashetarvot veet-geviyatvo takeu vechvomat veyt shan

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו יֹשְׁבֵ֖י יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֑ד אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֥וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים לְשָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: When the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead heard about it—what the Philistines had done to Saul—
Transliteration: vayishemeu elayv yoshevey yaveysh gilead et asher-ashu felishetiym leshaul

Hebrew: וַיָּק֜וּמוּ כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ חַ֘יִל֮ וַיֵּלְכ֣וּ כׇל־הַלַּ֒יְלָה֒ וַיִּקְח֞וּ אֶת־גְּוִיַּ֣ת שָׁא֗וּל וְאֵת֙ גְּוִיֹּ֣ת בָּנָ֔יו מֵחוֹמַ֖ת בֵּ֣ית שָׁ֑ן וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ יָבֵ֔שָׁה וַיִּשְׂרְפ֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: the stalwarts among them set out and marched all night; they removed the bodies of Saul and his sons from the wall of Beth-shan and came to Jabesh and burned them there.
Transliteration: vayakumu khׇl-iysh chayiil vayelekhu khׇl-halayelah vayikechu et-geviyat shaul veet geviyot vanayv mechvomat veyt shan vayavou yaveshah vayisherefu otam sham

Hebrew: וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־עַצְמֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ תַחַת־הָאֶ֖שֶׁל בְּיָבֵ֑שָׁה וַיָּצֻ֖מוּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Then they took the bones and buried them under the tamarisk tree in Jabesh, and they fasted for seven days.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-atsemoteyhem vayikeveru tachat-haeshel veyaveshah vayatsumu shiveat yamiym {f}
